OQMKQZSa6zXeShTKdw1X9Q.text: Amazing beef pancakes and hand pulled beef noodle soup! Quick and courteous friendly staff.

-Z7IGg1NDx-IAy0AkSr2fQ.text: A nice concise menu that still had something for everyone. The dumplings were wonderful, fresh and full of flavor. It was fun to watch the noodles being made and even better to eat them! Reasonable prices and great staff made this a wonderful meal.

asZwPjHUTvTuqDFIZd1zmg.text: Was very excited to try this place, but it didn't wow me as much as I thought it would. The noodle pulling was definitely impressive although the pulled noodles had a harder texture than I preferred.  The popular beef noodle broth was not as hearty as I preferred but the brisket in the dish was excellent. We also ordered the beef friend rice and pork dumplings which were very flavorful. Next time I will try the knife shaved noodles for a softer and more doughier texture solely based on preference since the pulled noodles were harder than I liked.

3y39s4ExOLoaYuxClXzAMg.text: Exceptional Customer Sevice!! The food was presented beautifully and the taste was amazing! We will definitely be back!

9YfED8j1gMHgtwr45O6PKA.text: Best hand stretched noodles in town. Highly recommended. We had the beef noodle and spicy Winton.  Superb

IOYoZ_GDyjEv0lA0s8-MVg.text: the hand pull noodle soup is amazing, highly recommend the pot sticker. about 8 to 10 drive from the strip.

GUYYFhtRuoRxqhfG2tvyPg.text: Stopped here on the way back from Zion.   It was one of the best Chinese beef noodle soups I've ever had.  The noodles are all hand made and soups are flavorful.  The beef was also very tender.  If I lived in Vegas I would come here more often.  Highly recommend

fZeGs8EFoUVGza20WPOoBQ.text: Honestly the best noodle place in this town. Very good and fast service, clean place. DELICIOUS NOODLES!!! The dumplings were traditional and juicy. I'm very happy that I found this place, my boyfriend wouldn't stop saying how good the food was, he thought he was in a real city with a real Chinatown. Xie Xie

8K8Oh88QGmpM8w8KBxZorw.text: I'm writing this review as I'm eating in the restaurant.  We're here for EDC weekend & stay at the Palm Place on Flamingo Street, this place is about 2 blocks away from the hotel.  The restaurant look like others on the same block but inside is nice like industrial look with block wall.  We came here because of yelp review, we order Beef Frank, Spicy wonton & Beef pancake for Stater, we're so honey.  The food was great & service is wonderful & friendly.  We're also ordered pork belly noodles & Shang Noodles, I like Shang noodle better.  I will come back for sure.

Et0tkl9GOTxiwh2cRWfYSQ.text: I came in on a Saturday night and the restaurant was around 2/3 full. We were able to be seated at the last table before having to go with the bar.  We ordered shang beef noodle, dandan noodle, tomato/egg rice and the beef potsticker.  Shang beef noodle was my favorite of the night. The soup had a lot of flavor and the meat tasted good. However it still didn't taste like the beef noodle that I used to have back in Taiwan.  Tomato egg rice tasted like any tomato egg rice you can make at home. But then I didn't expect much from it anyways because it's just stir-fried tomato and egg on top of steam rice with a side of veggie.  Beef potsicker had a nice presentation but the taste was very average.  On to the last item of the night which was dandan noodle. This tasted nothing like dandan noodle I have anywhere else and it was cold. At first we thought maybe they brought us the wrong item because the people making the noodles behind the clear glass and the waitresses were all non-Asians (I know this sounds horrible but can't help but being a little stereotypical here). But then the waitress ensured us that it WAS indeed dandan noodle. She was nice enough to offer a little sesame sauce on the side to go with it though. At the end when I went to the bathroom I overheard the two 'chefs' talking to each other in Mandarin. This made them screwing up the taste of dandan noodle unforgiving to me.   Overall I didn't enjoy the food as much as I thought I would. I think I was hyped up by the reviews too much before coming in so expectation was too high. However I did really like their interior decor and how you can see they're making noodle. It is kinda like teppanyaki without people spitting over your food.

sR5Le9wS2_bXC6fCtfx22g.text: We had the wonton which wasn't spicy. I don't like spicy so worked out well. The pot stickers tasted homemade.  I had tasted hand pulled noodles which were too chewy and hard but this one is perfect.   Will return when we visit Vegas again

eaErqB_gUt8yGPc7b5zHlg.text: Love this place!!! Small cute place with tasty food... I loved the pork cabbage dumpling with hand pulled noodles... Julia served us n she was very warm n friendly n one star for her hospitality... definitely going back

b0uunnaoLab1D8GgN0RsWA.text: My wife and I visited this place after we saw an ad on this restaurant. The reviews on Yelp convinced us that we should try.  This is a very small eatery and can accommodate about 19 people at one setting.  It is located in a small strip mall. The interior decoration is pretty modern and has an large open kitchen. The appliances in the kitchen are all well provided and taken care of.   The menu is a small menu but large enough to offer a variety of dishes.  Specifically, this restaurant tends to cater to the younger generations and possibly to the non-asian group. Henceforth, spicy hot dishes are not really that hot.   We ordered four dishes:  1. Cucumber salad - strips of cold, crisp cucumbers mixed with a hot, spicy sesame sauce. The sauce is tasty and the cucumbers are fresh. Unfortunately, the cucumber too can have a bit of a flavor. If you like plainer food, this is ideal. For me, it is a bit too plain. Nonetheless, it is a B+.  2. Beef Pancakes - minced beef in a piping hot Bao. Very juicy and tasty. Though one has to be careful to eat them as the juice can be too hot to the tongue. Love this dish and it is definitively an A.  3. Pork dumpling -  presentation is nice but a major disappointment in taste. Can use some extra flavoring. The worst dish of the day. A solid C.   4. Shang Beef noodle soup with hand pulled noodle - my wife likes the noodle although I feel it is a bit on the tough side. The beef ( and tendons ) are well cooked, very flavorful and the meat is tender. But the soup is a bit diluted, a bit more concentrated will be better. Still worth a solid B+.  Service is good. Pricing is reasonable. Food improvement is possible, whether it is necessary or not depends on customers' taste.   For us, we are searching for the perfect Beef brisket noodle soup and we have yet to find it. But we will be back to this place till ....

8fW03VN6BLGJNEhM36V5EA.text: Fast friendly service. The hand made and hand cut noodles were good. The better of the two were the hand cut. The hand cut had a better texture to them.

9W3OpFfdo1xij4TqdkcJHw.text: LOVE this place... excellent food; wonderful staff; clean atmosphere and food is reasonably priced.  At one point my addiction to this awesome place lead me to eat here 5x's in one week.    I would strongly recommend this little hot spot for some serious deliciousness . Must try the cucumber salad, which is one of my favorite dishes.

2NYvnZytz-mMKxgd8DfE4Q.text: I love me some noodles and this place has quite a selection. We had both the hand pulled and the knife cut. Both are winners. Then there are the appetizers. The pot stickers and wontons were so fresh and delicious. How do I give 6 stars on this mofo.

gv4HXZnMYTJnvJTb6aFuGg.text: Wow!!!! I have only been to a few Asian restaurants in Vegas but this was by far the most impressive! The interior is quaint and pretty small. I love that there is a bar to sit at in front of where they are hand pulling noodles. You can choose your noodles for every dish and the hand pulled and knife shave noodles were both amazing! I loved the pork potstickers so much. I also really enjoyed my beef noodle soup! We also got the Dan Dan noodles which were great as well. I really have no complaints and I can't wait to come back. I had a really difficult time deciding what to order so I will be back soon to try everything!!!

yh-fpxNAnANsuvIrzLae-A.text: They do what they do perfect. Fresh board cut noodles. Delicious dumplings, beef pancakes.Dan Dan Noodles were spicy and salty good.Need to try the soup next time. Not a large restaurant, but tables open up quickly. Went on a rainy Sunday night thinking it would not be too busy, no such luck. Not a seat available. 5 minute wait was well worth it.

xo8XVt9zYCFmWqCNy9Eehw.text: Really good noodle house for the foodies.  Modern, hip, but still authentic.  The noodles were chewy and perfect!  I had the seafood in a creamy broth, can't wait to try something spicy.

IdkJ-xFTqL1JMS6iLDzoSQ.text: First time here. Simple yet delicious. Braised beef brisket was delectable. Bok choy perfect and broth sublime. But the noodles are the real star. I tried hand pulled and loved every slurpy bite. Can't wait to go back. Unbelievably satisfying for under $9.

ktqoP22cs43J0H7zwkkNGg.text: I was here for the first time a couple days ago. After hearing so much about this place I decided to give it a try. My first impression of the restaurant was its narrow space and limited seatings. Second impression was its cleanliness and extremely fast service. Third impression was the quality of the fresh hand-pulled noodles. I did taste the difference of the noodles here; it was way better than all of the pre-made packaged noodles I've always had at other restaurants. The flavor and freshness of the noodles are outstanding. In all honesty, I was not blown away by it but definitely did have some good impressions of this place. I do recommend this place if you're looking to try some fresh hand-made noodles in a clean setting but it's not a place for a big party to dine in, just FYI. I personally would return for their good food and good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy wonton is a must try. Dan Dan Noodles was very spicy, and Beef Shank Noodle Soup was good.

4u7O506mNM--hUqDT2qfcQ.text: Hands down, the best meal my husband and I've had in Vegas. However, this IS the first meal we've had outside the strip. The menu is very to the point and questions on the menu were answered with clarity. Service is quick and friendly! The noodles were very very fresh- husband got the hand pulled and I got the knife sliced noodles. We both ordered the Shang beef (the one with a dark broth). The broth hit the spot and warmed us up after being in the rain. The price is good but I'm saying this after paying premium price for every meal for the past few days on the strip so maybe it's biased? But approx 20 dollars for two full bowls of fresh noodles? That's a good and fair deal! My husband and I only wished this business existed in Dallas because it's so delicious! So happy to have had this as our last meal during this vacation!

JWTcHn31Xr5ATe2KcXzRvw.text: It's ok for me kinda oily for me but not to bad ones in a while you have to eat greasy food I guess price wise is reasonable I'll probably come back once in a while especially if late and I want soup

ErMqO1lT-cM06M2CLqdT2Q.text: Be prepared to be put on a waitlist. I waited for over 30 minutes and it was very much worth the long wait. The restaurant is pretty tight/ small and the servers did a great job of attending all customers immediately. As soon as I sat down I was greeted and my order was taken on the spot. I ordered the Shang beef noodle soup with knife cut noodles along with the spicy wonton appetizer. The noodles are made in house and you can tell by how fresh everything is. If you're visiting Vegas looking for some top notch beef noodle soup, check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy wonton appetizer
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang beef noodle soup with Knife cut noodles!

Gop0XmqOeBoQif_jlis-Bw.text: AMAZING FOOD! We got steamed beef potstickers, beef soup bowl and seafood noodle bowl. It was so fun to watch them hand make the noodles. The food came out super fast! I wish we lived in the area because we would be here regularly.

QE9evJQxten04_JzxoS0fw.text: Came here for the high yelp reviews. Here's how I rate it:  Cucumber salad: 1/5. A twist on the typical spicy cucumber app but its layered with thick peanut sauce instead. Honestly this sauce ruined it for me. Made the app heavy and hard to eat. Cucumbers warm too. Pretty gross. They need to scrap this app and go with traditional lighter spicy cold cucumber app instead.   Beef pancakes: 5/5. This was very good. Had nice texture and flavors. Our party all agreed it was the best dish we tried.   Beef with knife edge noodle soup: 3/5. The broth was good but not spicy like Im used too. The noodles were too firm/starchy at first but softened up over time when allowed to soak in broth longer. If they sliced the noodles thinner it would be much better. The beef was the worst part. It was very fatty and sinewy with majority almost impossible to chew. Pretty much scrapped the beef. Needs better beef quality. They gave a lot of noodles so thats good.   Spicy Wontons: 2/5. The whole dish felt heavy. Not silky smooth or light. We kill this at Din Tai Fung. Not here. Something is off.   Wonton seafood soup: I didnt try it but others said it was very good. Maybe worth a try.   Overall service was friendly and prompt.

m67iyYi8OKYUAPWc0dd2Jg.text: Came here before our flight back from Vegas with my sister and fiancee. We shared the cucumber appetizer, beef noodle soup, chicken chow mein, and dan dan noodles. You can choose your noodle type and we got the knife shaved for all three dishes. The noodles were fantastic and we watched the cooks shave it fresh from a block of dough as we were seated at the counter.  My favorite dish was the beef noodle as the meat was very tender + the soup was very flavorful. The chicken chow mein was a large portion and tasty but was slightly salty for me. Dan dan was probably my least favorite but it wasn't bad - just the flavors were more average.  Overall 3.5 stars and food was good, but I do think the 4.5 on Yelp is slightly inflated.

f3Yr9L-57ScJGklEoZW98g.text: So good! Came here last night. Had the cucumber salad (a MUST! The dressing I could drink), beef pancakes (very tasty but wish they had a dipping sauce), beef noodle soup (hearty) and the Dan Dan noodles (my least favorite dish, but still tasty).  Service was fast and friendly. Pricing was great!

O8Lny0Ws86rEojvJmIcgug.text: Yes.   Yes.   YASSSSSS  This place is legit and so modern in design. Love the counter where you can sit and watch them make the noodles by hand, drop it into the water, and plated to you.   The food came out FAST!   The real highlight is the noodles and how fresh it is. Not frozen. The sauces and "toppings" are all pretty standard.   We got the Dan Dan Noodles with Hand Pulled noodles. Texture was al dente just how I love it. The Dan Dan sauce was too salty for mine likings. I love a good Sichuan Dan Dan noodle and these were more Northern style. Still good though.   The Peking Zha Jiang Mian was delicious. Absolutely my favorite. I got the thick cut noodles. Carbs overload but so worth it. The black bean sauce and the bean sprouts, cucumbers, carrots, beans... all just came together so well.   The Spicy Wontons were a miss for me. Soggy and too oily.   The "pancake" or "bing" is actually really good. The style is like a pot stickers but round. It is a tad greasy but this dish is like that. Everywhere you go it is like this.   Prices were great. I enjoyed it.

uhDWI_SiQ6PgS_CtSBX5Wg.text: This intimate restaurant is all you'd ever want from a noodle place! Every time I go to Vegas, I make sure to stop by. The noodles are hand pulled in a kitchen in front of you (if you sit at the bar) and everything tastes amazing. Our top favorites are the Dan Dan noodles and the chicken mushroom noodles. AgXvOjUVFCNQ0b6r5ArAFQ.text: I used to complain where my husband bring me to eat, but this noodle place is way better than I expected.  Food:  We ordered spicy wonton, sheng beef noodle and pork rib noodle. They were all tasty. Their broths were very flavorful. Meats were tendered. If you eat spicy food, I highly recommend trying the hot sauce they put on the table.  Service: Staff are nice while they serve the noodles in an amazing speed. We ordered, my hubby went to our car parked right in front of the restaurant, the noodles came when he came back.  Will definitely return while I am in town!

ZBxLkb_9CRAT6eNT8cKOhg.text: Amazing place. Dan Dan noodles are amongst the best I've had. Shanghai wontons are incredible. Peking Wonton soup is great. The handmade noodles made in house are really exceptional. This place is a gem

tB_uG98l7enrZFPYkbn0MQ.text: This is one of the few restaurants with 500 reviews and a 4.5 star rating. So naturally we had high expectations but no, the noodles were overly cooked, not al dente at all and had no qualities of fresh made noodles. Factory made noodles are better than this any day. This place does not by any means do justice to Chinese noodle soups. Very Americanized.  The soups were passable, not great and the beef shank and stew were the strongest points for the noodle soups. The spicy wontons weren't bad but they were tiny and timid.  I have yet to find a really great place to eat in Vegas. There were a few great places years ago but it looks like the populace is complacent and touristy about food. It is more about name brands, zagat ratings and just being Las Vegas. Still looking.

ke9ZQCPrl5zIsjcOzE1STg.text: Shang Artisan Noodle gets down to business. The food is affordable, delicious, and quick. And, huge plus, their portions are generous. Even when I'm ravenously hungry, I always leave satisfied. Depending on how much self-control I have that day, I either end up with leftovers or slightly uncomfortable from eating too much.  Additionally, they do have vegetarian options: Tomato & Egg Noodle and their Tomato & Egg Rice, which is essentially one flavor option, but boy, do they do it well. The flavors are simple, yet harmonious. The sweetness from the tomato, the savoriness of the egg, the fresh component from the bok choy, and the great texture from their hand-pulled noodles work amazing together. A+ veggie option for my non-meat eating homies.   Lastly, while they do have a smaller menu, it's broad enough to offer something for everyone. And I can attest that Shang Artisan Noodle may do less, but they definitely do it well.

I ordered shang noodle,the noodles were perfectly cooked and the meat is tender.Good price and good portion.I will definitely come back here again.

b4JA44QO5Si_vxe248Evyg.text: Second time here and their noodles are delicious. Small restaurant with takeout availability. Their soup broth is sooooo good! Would come back!

ZvT5BauOQkGrM3gSLMA8lQ.text: Solid place for Taiwanese beef noodle soup (called the Shang Beef Noodle)! I've been here a handful of times already and this place never disappoints. The noodles are fresh and made in front of you and the broth is very rich and flavorful. At the very affordable price of $9.95, you can get yourself an amazingly delicious bowl of piping hot noodle soup. The spicy wontons are also a good appetizer to start with. It definitely has a kick to it, so only order this if you can handle some heat! The sauce for the spicy wontons is so good, I ended up tossing some noodles in it to finish it up haha. I've also had the dandan noodles, but I wasn't a fan. It just tasted spicy to me without depth of flavor. I've been wanting to try the tomato and egg noodles, so I will be back!

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dan Dan noodles

uV9Mb_vIuB9ukgKBpoLkJQ.text: Sunday, November 12, 2017 2:00PM   We Ordered:  Beef Pancake - Juicy tender soup dumplings. The skin was a little thick but the flavor was awesome and cooked to perfection.   Dan Dan Noodle - Chose hand-pulled noodle style. Wish there was more sauce, thought it was on the dry side. Looked plain but had a good kick to it. Added bok choy to this dish but it was under cooked a bit.    Shang Beef Noodle - Chose knife-shaved noodle style. Brisket was tender, bok choy was cooked perfectly. The broth was sweeter than expected but had a decent flavor.   Yang-Zhou Fried Rice - Good mix of ingredients. Rice was fluffy and is a good shared plate for 2-3 people.  Overall the food tasted fresh and clean. Atmosphere was welcoming and temperature was fine. Music could have been louder. FOH staff was attentive; we sat at the bar and could see BOH cooking, hand-pulling noodles which was neat. Menu was easy to read and I liked their utensils and serving dishes.

enuF89U0UdT-GP3vI2VxCg.text: Wow this place is amazing!! They make the noodles in-house and you get to watch! Food is fresh. Prices are affordable as well.

sjJF5ZhhodZhOBOZ-y2hVg.text: Crazy good noodles. Went on a trip to Vegas and my SO says this is the best Chinese food he's ever had outside of China. They have hand pulled noodles which are great but the knife cut is even better as they are very thin and less chewy. The spices in everything were phenomenal, very well balanced. Pork belly broth perfect sweetness. Beef pancakes a rare treat for us. Will visit every time we come to Vegas.

DeJkgTJU2g2OeRaQNX_WHQ.text: YUMMMMM - This place has the tastiest noodles, and the broth totally hit the spot on somewhat of a hangover-y day.  A friend of mine was in town and had a late flight back to California so we were looking for somewhere interesting to eat. He is Chinese and asked me if I had ever had handmade noodles before. I had not, so he Yelp'ed it and found Shang. He basically ordered for me, as I told him just to pick whatever he thought would be good, but everything was so flavorful and delicious. I know we got spicy wontons - very spicy for me but totally worth the mouth burn - and a cucumber salad, which was very different than what I've had, being that I'm used to a basic sliced cucumber salad made with rice vinegar. This one had some sort of tangy nutty sauce drizzled all on the top of it, which was very delicious. The noodles were almost like comfort food. I wish I had more experience with these types of noodles, so I could describe them better, but I suppose if you've never had them before (say, you're more familiar with ramen noodles, or pho, or udon) then you'll be in the same boat as I am and perhaps will give this place a try based on my noodle-naive review :)

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The delicious cucumbers I mentioned in my review!

qp5uzi5_dHPaXmnffclwVA.text: Best food ever so delicious. Good customer service and clean restaurant. The chefs are very creative so I would give them "A+" for grading.

2beyo1Mr9MbP_Su1CP2CkQ.text: The food was so flavorful! We both loved our food. It was also fun to watch the chefs behind the counter shave the noodles into the boiling pot of water! Definitely recommend to anyone looking for some great noodles.

vSZZZkiaxvZvDoN-RVWWoA.text: What type of Chinese person doesn't eat rice? Me! I can live without rice but I simply can't live without noodles. Hand-pulled and knife-shaved noodles are some of my favorites and I have been dying to try Shang Artisan Noodle.  It was only 11:15 (15 minutes after opening) and most of the tables were already full. Within 15 more minutes, the entire restaurant was packed. There was only one guy waiting tables at first and two people in the kitchen so service/food was a bit slow but they tried their best. I love that you could see the guy pull the noodles. It was very cool!  We started with spicy wontons. I'd give these 3 stars - they weren't spicy enough and the sauce was too liquid and did not have enough chili.  We also got two bowls of noodles to share: Shang Beef Hand-Pulled Noodles and Dan Dan Knife Cut Noodles. I'd give both of them 4 stars but for different reasons.  The Beef noodles had a good flavor (although my own beef noodle soup had more depth of flavor than this version). I wanted to love the hand-pulled noodles but upon closer inspection, they varied too much in size. I understand that they are handmade but the precision just isn't quite there.  The Knife Cut noodles had a more authentic texture. However, I'm not sure what part of the sauce mix makes it "Dan Dan" style. I was disappointed that it wasn't really Dan Dan noodles at all.  If you're looking for great tasting hand-made noodles, Shang meets that criteria. Authenticity is questionable.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang Beef Noodle in front (hand pulled) and Dan Dan Noodles in back (knife shaved)

NAa31oVlGMyDMWIks-bULA.text: First time in. I asked for beef chow mien but was told they didn't have beef. Huh??? Okay, so I went with the chicken chow mien and it was good. For $10.00 I thought the portion should have been larger.  Anyway, the food is good so you'll have to see for yourself. The menu just wasn't my cup of tea.  I probably just ordered the wrong thing.

a61y2y5cTK4341WNNSfnIA.text: The noodle is ok , when I do not know wat to eat I came here to eat noodle and pot stickers

h5qBDq7Ca-bO24t_QvpZuw.text: Came here to eat on a Saturday afternoon for my friend's bday weekend. It was our first time eating here, and every dish that we ordered were extremely delicious and hunger satisfying!   If you're craving Asian noodles, this is the perfect spot! Their service was A+! What I consider good service is: how comfortable guests feel sitting in a restaurant, and being aware of our needs and meeting them.   We came in with a party of 8, which made us wait a little bit longer before we could be seated, but it's understandable since it's a weekend afternoon.   We ordered the Dan Dan noodles, Shank Beef Noodles, the yang-Zhou fried rice, beef pancakes, beef&onion dumplings, and spicy wontons. THEY WERE ALL DELICIOUS!!   This spot is great too if you're looking for that Asian comfort food because they all got it! Highly recommend!

tF4jCvGeEKw0KEDHyWmAmw.text: This place is far. But I'll go through great lengths to get my fix!! Yum.  This place is small. Kitchen area can be seen from sitting area.

ZQyF5ltAnNq7nSIeJA4juA.text: All hand made noodles that are delicious.  You choose the type of noodles with each meal.  We had chow mein with knife-shaved noodles and it was the best.  Pot stickers were also delicious.  We ordered the beef pancakes based on the waitress recommendation and were not thrilled with it.  It is definitely worth a second visit.

4OyixNP2epoRakoYhKZT8g.text: It was just ok! Great environment and clean! I got the Shang beef noodle with the knife shaved noodle. The broth was a little bland and the noodles had a different texture. I would go back but would NOT suggest knife cut noodle. I also got the beef pancake which was good and juicy. I thought the best part was the bok choy and the meat in my soup.  I think I will definitely try hand pull noodles with a different meat/broth option next time.

q8VttsIg4I6mqZtcPiI3rw.text: The noodles are so incredibly delicious and the beef in the shang beef noodle is tender, flavorful, and juicy. The soup is life-changing, especially for a simple beef-chicken broth blend. Not only that, this is the best tasting water I've had in the three days I've been in Las Vegas. The water is perfectly cool and has a slight hint of cucumber that really quenches my thirst. Altogether this just became my favorite noodle place in Vegas, especially for the great cost. 5/5 for sure, an amazing and friendly experience.

hGHIigjzyPUzxcpEJwtPwQ.text: Very, very busy, so come early. Lots of good choices and good prices. For each dish, you can choose between two kinds of noodles. The best part about this restaurant is that you can watch them making everything in the kitchen! It's neat to see them making both kinds of noodles.

AwFOY1yWrZHS2eLyxzAVSw.text: My boyfriend and I came to this place to check out, we got 2 Shang's Beef noodle with hand pulled noodles and spicy wonton. The wontons were spicy yet delicious and the noodles were perfectly pulled and cooked! The beef in the soup was very tender but I personally thought the broth was light. GC5amZfOQPA5Knuo1JdmTA.text: The food is AMAZING!!!! Lindsey the waitress was spot on with suggestions from the menu,  attentive and very sweet.   Definately going back to try different menu items.  All the dishes and noodles are fresh and made to order.

lg29XMcl8MKCPSy3n0VGbQ.text: This place is amazing! Delicious flavorful food, fast service and you can watch them make the handmade noodles. I recommend the DanDan noodles and spicy wontons

OvRUZJDIjjZM-691nGzgHQ.text: I was in town for an interview and stopped by for lunch since this restaurant was a mere 10 minutes from my hotel. The decor was modern with industrial finishes and the small location was almost empty, save for a few tables. We opted to sit at the bar to watch the noodle pullers (is that right term?) and were immediately greeted by a very friendly waitress. We ordered the spicy wontons as an appetizer and both of us elected to have the beefy noodle soup with hand-pulled noodles.   YUM. The spicy wontons were really small, but the sauce was delicious and we gobbled them up very quickly. My mom's  a super picky eater and, owning a restaurant herself, is definitely an Asian food snob, but she really enjoyed the wontons. Our noodle soups came next and they definitely didn't disappoint. The noodles, although hand-pulled, were consistently chewy. The broth was rich and flavorful. The beef was so tender it seemed as though it had been cooking all day. The bokchoy was a welcoming relief of freshness to the dish as well. By the time we were eating, there was a line to get into the restaurant!  Overall, it was so delicious and if I'm back in Vegas, I will definitely come back to Shang's.

ED4sQQfHR748mo5GKCuRzw.text: I've ordered the spicy wontons, pork belly noodles and the seafood soup noodles from here. The spicy wontons had a great flavor, but wasn't actually spicy in my opinion. The pork belly noodles didn't have enough flavor to the signature pork broth. Both dishes just didn't have a strong enough flavor for them to be savory and authentic. The seafood soup noodles is a light, but flavorful broth. If you're in the mood for something with a lighter soup (chicken broth) and healthier ingredients (shrimp, squid, fishcakes, veggies), this is the noodle soup to get.  I always get the knife-shaved noodles because it's more traditional and crafty, and I always feel full after an entire bowl of chewy noodles. I love their various flavors of waters that, apparently, changes on a daily basis. The watermelon-infused is my favorite. The interior is very welcoming, modern and clean. Bar seating offers a view behind the open kitchen where the chefs hand-pull / shave the noodles and cook them fresh. I will come back again to try some of their other dishes!

Rv1F6OXO-1zzvDN_c89c6A.text: This is  good food. I give it a 4.5.  I eat noodles often and this noodle place has good selection. The noodles are good. The soup base for the wonton is really good too.

I wouldn't definitely come back here. The place is a little small but it's very clean!

GBlzNP_Mx5tPl5_hrpPwwA.text: Such a cute atmosphere! We did take-out but it seemed like a really fun restaurant to stay and dine. The Shang beef soup was ok. I didn't care for the flavor of the spicy wontons at all.

kQYBb3A7u1uclstvcxSXXw.text: Sit at the bar to see all the kitchen action including the noodle making, dumpling wrapping and all the cooking, very cool. The food was tasty, hand pulled noodle chowmein was my fave. The beef pancake was good, the beef noodle soup, tasty. The wonton in spicy sauce was a bit on the salty side. The potstickers were also good.

4JJRII-phTLShC9F9iT88Q.text: Came here with my gf before we decided to head back home from Vegas. We were the first ones there and before we knew it, they had a full house. We both got the shang noodle.  She got the thin noodles and I got it with the house made noodles.  Being Taiwanese, I love freshly made noodles.  They always have the chewiness to it that regular noodles dont. We also ordered an order of the wontons.  The wontons were okay.  Something about their wonton skins was kinda weird.  Their noodles were really good and they give so much meat.  The meat was pretty tender as well.  However, I was so disappointed in their noodles!  Their so called freshly made noodles tasted exactly like regular frozen noodles.  They didn't have that bite or chewiness to it.  I was so disappointed.  They also don't serve sour mustard like regular beef stew noodle places.  Anyways, overall it was pretty good.  Its in consideration as one of the restaurants to eat at when I return to Vegas in December.

_UcrSA8KcSofweqGxglddQ.text: Nom nom nom! Delicious!   Recommend hand shaved noodles with beef.   Potstickers are good but not outstanding.   Constructive criticism: - Allocation of labor seems disproportionate. The guy who pulls noodles and the petite waitress seem to be doing all the work!  As a result service is slow and when the waitress went on break, no one took our bill and I had to ask the kitchen staff about it. - Please put in more stools and tables. Additional 2 2-person tables and 3 stools can easily fit.  - Some pieces of beef were too much tendon and were too big. Need to be trimmed more and cut into smaller more uniform pieces. - The wooden spoons are very chic and hipster, but they are too shallow for scooping up broth!  Please get bigger spoons :)

kDUbJD1Ba-d73Mkv4CWE2A.text: Good Chinese noodle/soup restaurant. I had pork belly with homemade noodle and then the pancake appetizer and both were very nice and flavorful.

H5oeyHNhogwDxw6VZ1yRHA.text: My best friend and I went into the restaurant only thirty minutes after it opened and the lunch rush was already ever present. Our server Ciara, despite being the only server, handled every customer genuinely and took the time to check back periodically throughout meals. She was so friendly and so so kind, her service really put our experience over the top. She made everyone's interaction personal; my friend and I lingered drinking tea (which is delicious by the way - try the hot tea) awhile after our meal and Ciara kept reminding us that it was no trouble and we were welcome to stay.   The food was soooo delicious!! I got the beef shank soup with hand pulled noodles. The noodles are nice and firm, the beef was sooo tender and juicy, and the broth was JUST SO GOOD. We also shared a plate of spicy wontons which are divine; they aren't too spicy, they have a very sweet nutty/sesame spice to them.. so good. Just so good.   Definitely will be back. Love this place so far.

9PmSz8UcoSfM7piKmDdN7Q.text: Probably one of the best noodles I've had in a long time! One of the best spots in Las Vegas that's not on the strip. It's affordable and hits right the comfort zone. There could be a bit of a wait during the weekends since the place itself is quite small, but trust.. it's worth the wait!  There's hand pulled noodles or knife-cut noodles. If you go with a friend, I suggest getting both so you can try both out to see which one you prefer. I personally liked the hand pulled one better as knife-cut noodles were a bit too thick for me. The noodle soup itself was a bit spicy, but definitely hits the spot for the perfect 'hangover' food.   I can't wait to go back to eat there the next time I'm in Vegas again!!!

jTq73kDIfK6f0iP7IbPeYA.text: Wow! This place offers one hell of a great bowl of (Shang) beef noodle soup, fantastic Sichuan spicy wontons, and excellent dan dan noodles. We liked both the hand-pulled and knife cut noodles. We didn't love the potstickers or beef pancakes, but everything else we had was exceptional. Definitely worth the short Uber off the Strip.

OuDpW6SNXiALzfqNKbfHnw.text: Amazing noodle shop close to the Strip. There was a long line for lunch (since this restaurant is pretty small), but it was worth. We were seated at the bar where you can see the chefs hard at work and watch how they make their noodles while you wait for your food, which was really interesting.   They offer 3 different options for their noodles, and I opted for the hand-pulled noodles for my beef noodle soup. I loved the difference in textures and sizes for the hand-pulled noodles while I ate them. I remember my eyes widening when I took my first bite-- the soup was so flavorful, rich, and overall perfect. There was such a generous amount of green onions at the top. You can really taste how high quality all of the ingredients are and how much care they put into the quality of their noodles.   I will say though that the cucumbers caught us off guard. The sesame sauce drizzled on them were like a chunky, thick paste and the cucumbers were a little on the sweeter side. I don't think we'd get those again, but after all, the cucumbers aren't really what you come here for. All in all, Shang is pretty high up there on my list of all-time favorite beef noodle soups.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Weird sesame sauce drizzled on the cucumbers, but still good!
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The beef noodle soup with hand-pulled noodles

x_d6OhZjQ4vovcpf3zKoSQ.text: OK, so I'm probably going to disappoint some, irk others, or maybe just surprise some by the fact that I was not wowed by Shang Artisan Noodle.  Please don't hate me because I did not love this place.  But I did not love this place.  Like, if we went on a blind date, I would not go on a second date (well, unless he was paying, and I had absolutely no other place to go on a Saturday night, and it was a chance to eat some shrimp scampi).  I just don't get the high praise by so many.  It really is not a 4+ star place in my opinion.  (It's not a 1 or 2 star place, either.  Should probably average 3 1/2 stars, I think, based on my experience).    Well, overall, my impression was that this place was mostly horse and pony show and less substance.  The noodles were average, as was the broth.  What makes this place a stand-out are the decor and the marketing.  The line is out the door.  Word of mouth, Yelp reviews, and heavy advertising has made this the go-to place for a noodle shop in the area.  So, there is that False buzz that happens when there is the "velvet rope," and people have to wait, and wait, and wait, to get into a casual eatery which does not take reservations.  You almost feel like, "wow, this place MUST be good! Look how long the line is!" Friends of Yelp, I have to say to you today, that is a False impression.    I really like the decor.  It is super on trend, exposed red brick, white subway tiles, steel backsplash, wooden half benches and small yellow wood tables, faux wood floor, Chinese calligraphy wherever possible, wooden spoons, dark, monochromatic Qing dynasty plates, and the obligatory see-through kitchen, with a "bad-ass" old guy roping up raw noodles.  It's tasteful and sparkly, and un-Las Vegas.  That I like a lot.  That gives it an extra star.  (Otherwise, Shang would only garner "2" from me.)  The food was just okay, not that great, and considering the hype of the place, disappointing.  Perhaps if I had not gone in with 5-star expectations, I would have enjoyed it more.  But more likely, perhaps if I had not been first to "The Magic Noodle," (please see my review of that excellent noodle place), I would have not been so disappointed.  The knife-cut noodles here were dull and chewy.  The broth for the beef noodle soup I chose lacked depth and piquancy.  The vegetables did not seem well-chosen for the soup, and lacked the ability to round out the flavor or punch it up.  My dining companion said the same.  We split some pot stickers and a couple other appetizers.  They were oily, flavorless, dull, and/or unmemorable.  Not exciting or flavorful, particularly for a place that focuses just on noodles and small plates, such as we ordered.  My friends and I declined to take a "doggy bag" of what we did not finish.  The food was not bad! Don't get me wrong.  The food was ok, and the restaurant was very clean and tidy.  Just not awesome.  I think another problem is the long wait.  We probably waited for about an hour.  When you make people wait that long, and outside in the cold, rain, and wind (because there is no room in the Inn, i.e., the restaurant entrance), as happened with us, and you refuse to have a reservation system, or even one of those square handheld thingies that lights up and vibrates to let you know that your table is ready so you can at least wait in your nearby car, naturally, there are some expectations built up.  It better be darn good.  Like Soup Nazi good (or "Taco Nazi"--see my review of El Jefe's Taco Shop, which by the way, does not require you to wait in the cold, though they are in a gas station and have little seating like Shang Artisan Noodle, and have about the same number of customers-they just have their act together).  I will be stoic and put up with a lot for a good meal.  I am already planning my hour-and-a-half long wait for Palace Station's "The Oyster Bar" next week, which I am told is the norm.  But, ma'am or sir, if I have to wait an hour in the elements to taste your food, hungry and cold, without so much as a hot cup of tea, or a menu, in hand, WOW ME. That didn't happen here.    As a final note, I think there is some disconnect happening with Shang. On the one hand, it wants to be a down-home, get-'er-done-and-get-out, we-don't-want-to-talk-to-you, Chinese noodle shop. (Which, "The Magic Noodle" does excellently, as I mentioned).  On the other hand, it wants to be the precious, trendy, take-your-time-and-eat-we-don't-rush-our-patrons-aren't-we-precious? type of hipster place that gives the impression of authenticity (and apparently, persuades many of this), but really is about the Instagram post. I think this is a shame.  Shang need only make some changes after some soul-searching to make this place really as awesome as its raving fans insist it already is.  If you come, manage your expectations.  Bring a warm coat in the winter, and a portable motorized fan in the summer, and your own beverages as you wait.  But I would not return.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VH2gjCz7P5OZOiBFyAG2Yg.text: First off, why in the WORLD is a restaurant like this not out in Seattle!?!? WTF, after eating here, who cares about DTF! We NEED authentic hot beef noodle soup with succulent meat with the right amount of tendon, we NEED those JUICY beef pancakes that drip all over the place, we NEED real fat hand shaved noodles that are ever so chewy and luscious. It's just not fair!!!!  HOT damn!!! This place is the truth!! Anticipating a hangover, planned our last meal in Vegas and it was definitely worth it. From the spicy wontons to the dan dan noodles, you can't go wrong with anything you order. Only regret was not ordering the 3 other dishes I wanted! Your girl didn't want to look like too much of a fatty. Hah! But, portions are huge! Tables so small, if you have extra space you just ain't doing it right! Quality top notch! Authenticity at its finest!   High five to those that ignore the desert heat for a bowl of that hot murky goodness. Don't know how y'all do it.

YgTmQMrERC7meBlEzM4zOA.text: I was debating between 3-3.5 stars, but I wouldn't return here so rounding down. Shang Artisan Noodle is located a few miles off the strip, and is closer if you're staying on the Wynn side. Their space isn't very big, and it was about a 20 minute wait for a party of 3 at 12:45 on a Friday. Make sure you add your name on the list to the right of the front door (next to the cash register). I really liked that you could watch the chef continuously making noodles in the front area, but there's not a lot of room to stand while you wait. They have three different type of noodles to choose from for the dishes: Hand Pulled, Knife Shaved, or Plain Noodle. We ended up trying: -Cucumber Salad (w/Sesame Sauce, $4.99, yelp.com/user_local_phot...): Yum- this dish was actually my favorite part of the meal! The cucumbers were so fresh, and that sesame sauce was SO GOOD. I actually used the extra sauce to dip the wontons and noodles in. If you like cucumbers, this dish is a must order! -Spicy Wonton (w/Spicy Soy Sauce, $5.99, yelp.com/user_local_phot...): Solid, but nothing special. The wonton skins were nice and thin, and the meat seemed good quality, but the sauce was just ok- use the sesame sauce from the cucumbers instead! I wouldn't order this again. -Shang Beef Noodle (w/Hand Pulled Noodle, Braised Beef Brisket, Veggies, w/Hand-Pulled Noodle, $9.95, yelp.com/user_local_phot..., yelp.com/user_local_phot...): We all liked the hand pulled noodles over the knife shaved (they were too thick), and this was my favorite out of the noodle dishes. The broth was a little too salty for us, but it was flavorful, and the beef tendons were nice and tender. The beef pieces were mostly chewy though, and not that great. Although this was my favorite noodle dish, I wouldn't order this again. -Pork Belly Noodle (w/Knife Shaved Noodle, Braised Pork Belly, Veggies, w/Knife Shaved Noodle, $9.95, yelp.com/user_local_phot..., yelp.com/user_local_phot...): Eh, I didn't like this dish much. The broth was very salty, and the pork belly had a pork-y flavor. The pieces weren't quite tender enough, and we didn't even finish the pork belly pieces (that's how not good they were). We may have received a bad batch, but I wouldn't order this again based on the dish I had. -Dan-Dan Noodle (w/Hand Pulled Noodle, Minced Pork, Preserved Veggie, Spicy Soy Sauce, $8.95, yelp.com/user_local_phot..., yelp.com/user_local_phot...): Eh, this dish was bland and boring. However, it was a lot better when you added the sesame sauce from the cucumber salad. I would recommend ordering the sesame noodle dish over this one if you're looking for non-soup noodles. Service was fine, and the food came out quickly once we ordered. Since I'm spoiled by really good noodle places in the Bay Area, I wouldn't make the trek to come out here. They have parking spots available, but the plaza they are located in is small.

wABgyVkOYeAyXi-X8lptOQ.text: Definitely worth a trip off the Strip.  Noods had amazing texture and the broth was rich with great depth. You can choose the noodle type but hand-pulled is the namesake and go-to for me. The restaurant is small, but they maximized seating inside and the line goes pretty quickly. There's a glass wall thru which you can watch them pull the noods and cook your foods.   We ordered: -Shang beef noodles, hand-pulled with extra wontons and bokchoy: best beef noodle soup ever -cucumber salad: pleasantly surprised by the peanut/satay sauce -spicy wontons: delicious  -pork and cabbage dumplings: would skip  I definitely will come back to try the Dan Dan noodles and Zha-Jiang noodles!

LFXLGJt0QJ4xfVXTwq7PiA.text: So good! Had the Dan Dan with hand pulled noodles. Spicy, tasty, and the noodles were perfect. Had a bite of my fiend's tomato and egg noodles as well and it was good as well. I don't know if you could go wrong with any of the noodle choices here.

RfbNVVbL53VBRaPTj_PaRA.text: I've eaten a ton of noodle places and this by far is the BEST!!!!  Sit at the bar and watch them pull the noodles!  I had the beef shank noodles and that broth was incredible!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8lxJ1KkvdLLg6yYVCbyf6w.text: I've been here twice now and definitely recommend it to friends going to Vegas.  I prefer the knife-cut noodles but the hand-pull noodles are pretty good too.  I've only ordered the sauce noodle dishes but they've both been amazing.  I had the egg and tomato as well as chicken and mushroom and I also tried my friend's chicken sesame cold noodles which I'm planning to order the next time I'm in town.  Serving size here is very generous.  Come when you're hungry or you'll definitely have leftovers (which is also great!).  A friend got the extra noodles before but his eyes were bigger than his stomach because the regular portion is already a very filling meal.  Service here is also great.  The servers are all very nice and helpful.  Also, prices are super affordable especially considering the portion size!

BQheczbiK4pxJwTS4Oc-3Q.text: If you're ever in town just stop by here. Their noodles are to die for.   My bosses recommended me to come here when I was visiting and hands down my favorite noodle place. I can taste it as I'm typing this review.  We got the hand pulled hot oil noodles, and it was delicious. Such amazing spice and packed with flavor! Even my friend loved it.   This establishment is a little small so keep in mind there may be a wait at times!  If I didn't live states away I'd probably be here every week.

Y5nYY7CzC8CGzzf7nvskoA.text: When in Vegas, this is a MUST!  Off the strip, but totally worth the drive. Found this place on yelp. So glad I did. Delicious noodles, rice, soup, etc!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

linOt3WcSca1UqGCuyjUUw.text: Remarkable hand crafted noodles off of the strip in Las Vegas within an approximately $10 Uber rides from the main strip of Vegas.  It is so amazingly delicious with excellent services.    We arrived at 11:30am and the place was already packed with the first comers for the first opening services.  The place is not huge with bar and table seatings.  We waited about 15 minutes being entertained by the noodles chefs making the hand crafted noodles, pulling strings of noodles from a huge dough.  As seated, we were immediately greeted by the server.  Ordered the cucumber salad, spicy won ton, beef pancake, shang beef noodle,  and beef shank noodle.  The cucumber salad was very refreshing tossed with sesame/peanut sauce.  The spicy won ton noodle was not so spicy, but had a heat of schezwan sauce that complimented the dish.  The beef pancake was one of my favorites with crispy doughy coating of the pancake that held up the beef juice inside.  It's a smaller version of pan stirred bun, but with much favor of seasoned beef.  The broth in both noodle soups tasted very home cooked that had been stewed for many hours which provided a comfort feel.  Great dish to have after long hours of drinking in Vegas.  The beef shank was thinly sliced and with a soft texture,  the noodles was nicely pulled and chewy.  Overall, its a winner and can't wait to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy won ton

VRLBikdyvgsGOuABOz0uqQ.text: Oh heeeelllooo SPICY BEEF NOODLES ($9.95), BEEF PANCAKE ($6.49), SPICY WONTONS ($5.99), how you doin'?  My friends and I walked through the doors around 11AM and the line was out the door. It only gets busier around noon. They don't take reservations so plan ahead!!   Love how concise the menu is--they're known for a couple of signature dishes so those are the ones we ordered. And they did not disappoint.   Love the open kitchen--the chef makes all the noodles by hand (that arm workout, though). I was entertained the entire 30-minute wait time.   TLDR; Food tastes authentic, is totally affordable, and talk about amazing hangover food.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonton

Mkdt3qWNDaFhGS3Sk0WFmA.text: Nooodz! They're even better when they're fresh and hand pulled. Local friends told me to check this place out. A couple miles away from the strip, but worth the trip! Shang closes at 10 everyday. I arrived around 9:20 and there was still a couple parties waiting before. The restaurant is a little small with only a few tables. I opted for the bar since I was starving.  We ordered the spicy wontons as an appetizer, Shang beef noodle, and the dan dan noodles. Everything was delicious, although I'd probably skip the wontons and get another bowl of noodles next time. For the price and size, I'd add a couple more dollars and get more of their hand pulled noodles.  The Shang beef noodle would be perfect as a hangover cure. I'd prefer it over pho. The soup is so rich and the meats are tender. The flavors of the dan dan noodle were great, but beware of the spice. When they say spicy, they don't mess around!  Bang for your buck for a dinner and a show. Watching them hand pull noodles was pretty cool. My new spot to go to after a long night of partying.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dan dan noodle (really spicy!)
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy wonton
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang beef noodle

fZPnI57NRZX4RJwv15Uppg.text: We stopped off at Vegas on our way to Death Valley. They were being filmed for food show segment and the wait was long. We ended up going somewhere else. Fortunately on our way back we were able to stop by and grab lunch. The Shang Beef Noodle Soup was yummy. The noodle was delicious and couldn't be any fresher (I saw him making it) and the broth was flavorful but not heavy. My husband had the pork spare ribs noodle soup. His was good but my broth was better. We also got a chilly wonton which was good. The chef was very nice and smiled for my camera when I recorded him.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EhRBe4ymoaLGXJt0v4CPzA.text: Oh my Gosh!!!! This place is extremely awesome.  This is a newly opened taiwanese noodle restaurant.  This place is an absolute treat to a traditional Taiwanese noodle dish.   All their noodles are handmade and you can actually see them making the noodles by hand.  One of my favorite noodles is their knife-shaved noodle.  They use a large piece of noodle and use a sharp knife to shave little strands of noodle directly to the boiling water.   This is my favorite because it tastes chewy and not too thick or thin.  I ordered their Artisan Beef Noodle with Knife-shaved noodle and I also added extra noodles for $1.50 extra.   Their beef broth was full of flavor but not spicy enough for my liking.  But it's okay, they have a container of spicy sauce on the table which tastes spicy enough.   I am so glad Vegas has this restaurant.  It is too bad they don't have this restaurant near where I live.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

glp1rhrac24Zvs4cSTGyTQ.text: Amazing quality and prices considering this is Vegas. To be honest, these are on par with the quality of handpulled noodles we had in new york. Will be back. I have to agree the knife cut is my favorite style and Shang noodles were great. Can't wait to come back and try other items

Zk7J1GRcfoVT9sEcvnqHFA.text: My girl took me here one time and got me hooked. I'm trying to find the time to come again. I got the hand pulled beef noodle soup and it was so good I had to order an extra side bowl of noodles to really feel satisfied. The noodles were extremely well cooked- got that bouncy/chewy texture, and absorbed the flavorful broth well. We also ordered the spicy wonton and the beef pancake appetizers. I personally did not like how the wontons were flavored, there was some sweetness to it which in my opinion did not mesh well with the main spicy flavor, but again it's all opinion. I did enjoy the beef pancakes though (I don't think they're those exact appetizer names, forgive me). And everything was so reasonably priced!   Definitely will return soon.

MlnTwiDZCvpemcTVDhd48g.text: This place was mediocre at best, I can't believe I waited over an hour here for a table of 2. Came here around 1pm on the day before Christmas Eve and there was a long wait. They had great ratings so I figured it would live up to the the hype, but it didn't. Coming from CA, Shang just didn't compare to the many taiwanese noodle shops we have. We ordered the beef noodle soup and the chicken noodle stir fry. The stir fry was way too oily and the noodles weren't al dente, they were mushy and over cooked. The noodles were cooked better in the beef noodle soup. The beef noodle soup tasted like it was lacking something, but I couldn't pinpoint it. Their version definitely tasted more Americanized and not traditional. Service was slow as most of the waiters/waitress were very young adults. Overall wouldn't go out of my way to come here and it isn't worth the wait.

RjUcF_usA3BOBGVbqN4QyQ.text: Came here because I was craving Din Tai Fungs spicy won ton. Eh... it wasn't anything close to it. It was very bland, it seemed like the meat was not seasoned at all. The chili oil was super spicy. It kind of over powered the whole thing and couldn't enjoy it at all. If you've been to DTF, the spicy won is very flavorful and had a little kick to it, but not too much, and was just perfect!   Our waitress never came to us, I had to literally get up and ask for water twice and got up to ask for our check as well.   The two stars was for the soup we got which was the best seller. The broth was tasteful and yummy.  I may give it another try someday, but I'm good for now.

uGvlW0RvgZTqAVsxSfDd1g.text: Shang Artisan is becoming one of my must gets everytime I'm in Vegas.   FOOD:  - Pork Belly Noodle: The broth is so delicious, and the hand pulled noodles have more of a bite and thickness to them. My only criticism, would be to make a spicy option. Also they give you huge chunks of delicious pork belly.  - Spicy Wonton: I love these. For my tastes it's not very spicy and taste a bit more sweet; however, I have a pretty high spice tolerance.  - Beef Pancake: The name is a bit misleading, it's not really a pancake, more like a huge dumpling. My favorite part is when you bite into it and the juice comes flowing out of the pancake.

AtXWxlStaZ8CKwjJz2-uIQ.text: Great experience. Good service, great noodles and a show. Go here! The hand pulled noodles are worth it.

e4QerrbF-EXhmHKJNxlImQ.text: After a long hiatus, we decided to try Shang again.  It was dinner time and the place was full when we entered.  we waited 5 min and were seated.  We both remembered how good the mushroom and chicken noodles were so ordered that again.  You do have a choice of the type of noodle to order.  We went for the hand pulled. My order came first even though we ordered the same dish.  The other bowl came about 3 minutes later.  The meal was just as savory as before although the chicken ratio was on the slim side.  Still tasty.  Prices are good, environment is modern and clean.  Parking is available

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Updated photo of chicken and mushroom noodles
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside of Shang&#39;s
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and mushroom noodle dish. Excellent presentation and taste.

cZe4KClqe1ewFfmDujPUcw.text: Shang Artisan Noodles is a Must-Do Noodle House on Flamingo Road.   This hole-in-the-wall was a rare find. We were seated immediately at the open-kitchen bar where the chefs were hand tossing the house made noodles. The place is small, but chic.   We tried the twisted noodles as well as the shaved ones- fascinating to watch- yummy to eat! Fresh and delicious. The Tomato & Egg Noodle Bowl was excellent as was the Pork Belly Noodle Soup. Try the amazing Beef Pancakes, which can easily be shared. I've never had these before so I can't compare them to any others, but they were super tasty!   The cool vibe, noodle-twisting chefs, and super friendly service get my 5 Stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. johnclipes.yelp.com
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. johnclipes.yelp.com
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. johnclipes.yelp.com

dFn-eBIwUE5Ybg3-ZRv2Hw.text: Came here as they opened at 11, we were the first ones in the door. By the time we were done eating though there was a pretty big line of at least 10 people waiting to be seated. It's a modestly sized shop so if you come at a busy time expect a wait. We got excited and ordered a lot of noodles. We got a black bean noodle, dan dan noodle, chow mein, a beef noodle soup, some other beef noodle soup, chili dumplings, cucumbers in peanut sauce, and a seafood wonton soup wiht noodles added, and finally a cold sesame noodle. Everything was amazing and my expectations were exceeded. Definitely very fresh noodles, they were all made fresh. The meat was cooked excellently and had great flavor and was very tender. It was also obvious they used a really good flavorful broth and different broths for each type of noodle. This is probably the best Chinese noodle establishment I've ever been to in the US and tastes very legit. Food came out pretty fast, especially considering they were making it fresh. Everything just tasted amazing.  Their chili oil was also extremely flavorful and delicious.   Black bean noodle was great, dan dan noodle was great, the chow mein was one of the best I've ever had. So flavorful, very oily but you just kept wanting to eat it, amazing. The two beef noodle soups had amazing flavor and the broth was really the highlight and each was beefy in it's own amazing way. The chili dumplings were great and there were 6-8 in a serving I believe. The dumplings had extremely flavorful filling. The cucumbers had an excellent sauce and tasted even better with hot sauce on it. Also a great palate cleanser with all the carbs we had and oil. The seafood wonton soup is very light, great sick person food. The cold sesame noodles you have to stir up cause the sauce is at the bottom. Also delicious.   If I ever come to Vegas again I'll have to come back and order more noodles.

eUGgvNtiLMcGbcbF3fqXQQ.text: I've tried many of their dishes and I like their pork rib soup with hand pulled noodles.  I like the fact that you can see them making the noodles.  It's especially fun for the kids.  The kids also enjoy the pork rib noodles and chicken chow main.  If you like chili oil theirs is goood, but really on the spicy side.  So if you can't handle spice just start with a few drops ;)  the service is decent and the waits can be long.  Overall the food is good and i think it's worth giving it a try.  Even when the restaurant first opens there's already a line so come esrlier than later if you plan to come for lunch!

ts1wMTX6Fp92GEnzN1gP1Q.text: One of the better hand pulled beef noodle soup spots in Vegas, and I think I've tried them all. The beef noodle soup is fine, but what puts this place over the top are the beef pancakes. Crispy and pan fried on the outside, and super oozing with juice on the inside. I recommend cutting them in the little bowl before eating. Otherwise, if you bite right into it, you'll burn yourself while squirting your eye out -- or even the people around you!

DhYsB-NJIgDtk-GdJnHuEQ.text: Loved every item I ordered. Place was clean, friendly service, and great value!  Hand-pulled noodles tasted fresh, and every dish had it's own unique flavor. I ordered the cucumber salad, beef pancakes, beef noodles, chicken and mushroom noodles, spicy wontons, and chicken chowmein.

KNxVFrJ5hY0MjROPlZ-uuA.text: A serious gem so close to the strip! It literally took us 6 mins by uber to get here from the Bellagio. Seating is limited and they were still pretty busy when we went at 2:00 pm on a Thursday. I love the layout and the partial open kitchen. It is a real treat to be able to see the chef hand pull the noodles while enjoying the food!   We ordered the spicy wontons, shang's beef noodle soup (with hand pulled noodles), dan dan noodle (with knife shaved noodles), and yangzhou fried rice. The spicy wontons were a recommended dish and I have read plenty of great reviews on it but in my own opinion it did not live up to its reputation. It is good, but I wouldn't say it is out of this world. I would prefer it with more filling. It is still a great appetiser to share. Next time I really want to try the beef pancakes!   The beef noodle soup is definitely a winner! When we went it was literally 105 outside and it did not stop me from drinking all the broth! It was amazing. It is slightly different from the traditional Taiwanese Beef Noodles but the closest in comparison. The beef is incredibly tender and well portioned. The hand-pulled noodles pairs perfectly. The noodles are so fresh and cooked to perfection and coat the broth very well. The only thing is that I would request for extra broth as I am a slow eater and by the middle of my meal, I have very little soup left.   The dan dan noodles is advertised as spicy but it is definitely not anything too outrageous. I typically don't eat spicy but could handle this dish. This is their own take of dan dan noodles and not as traditional. Nevertheless, it was amazing. So flavourful and huge portions. I love that the customer can choose what kind of noodles they want as each provide a different experience. The knife-shaved noodles are thicker and have more texture to them. It was definitely a carbo-load type of day, totally worth it though.   Although the yangzhou fried rice did not look like anything special and seen on virtually every Chinese restaurant's menu, Shang's is definitely one of the better ones I have had. There was a solid ingredients to rice ratio and the seasoning was on point. Besides the beef noodles, this was my second favorite dish!   Service was fast and professional. This is the perfect place to get away from the strip or to nurse a hangover. I absolutely cannot wait to come back!

yeOzFjWUL0ORxqak3ynorw.text: Finally there is a fresh chinese Noodle restaurant in town! You can get freshly pulled noodles in soup or stir fried. You can get thicker noodles too. The flavor of the soup is delicious and the bite and chew of the noodles is spot on.  We tried the beef pancake and the waiter said it was juicy. Boy was it juicy, my husband bit into it and it squirted across the table. Innocent bystanders beware, you have been warned.  Service is nice and fast and super friendly.

Ncms1IKsgAZ_-dRyTIhpRw.text: One of my favorite noodle shops to eat at when I'm in Las Vegas. This is my 3rd time here. It's a small spot with bar seating and a few tables. The menu is not that large either but that is a good thing in this case. They make a few items and they are all really good. I always order the pork belly soup with hand pulled noodles.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pork belly is full of flavor and is so tender and the fat cap is cooked down so well it melts in your mouth.
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly soup with hand pulled noodle. My all time favorite.
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonton noodle soup with hand pulled noodles.

5RlPnu0eJP5_PTm2WUb5hw.text: I wish I could give this place 5 starts because the food very much deserves it! The service however was HORRIBLE. It was our first time here we had to wait forever for the waitress to come to us. When she finally did we had a few questions about the menu. For example what is this difference between the 3 types of noddles they offer and which one does she recommend. She just shrugged her shoulders, rolled her eyes and said hand pulled I guess. Once our food came she never came to check on us or refill our drinks. I had to ask as she was walking by for a fork for my son and she just handed me one and kept walking. Now we are here trying to get our bill so we can get out of here and nothing we are still on ignore. It's a shame because the food was soooooo yummy!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i02ii6OCvl4XRtus4BEUOA.text: Although not in same category we enjoyed this meal more than Lotus of Siam  Highly recommend:  Beef noodle soup (hand pulled or knife cut) Chicken chow mein (knife cut) Beef pancake Potstickers (pork & cabbage or beef)  Food is great for kids.  We were barely able to squeeze in our party of 4 adults and 8 kids.  Their service is impeccable.  Made it as easy as possible.

0diW8LptS3ebzD3YNyzooA.text: OMG!! I HAVE to give them props for HOW AMAZING THEIR TOGO SERVICE is!!!!  Today we ordered Uber eats and noted "vinegar/soy/chili pls", it was for the beef pancake.  It shocked me how generous Shang noodle is, each HUGE container was noted in markers.  Anyways: Shang beef noodle - of the chart!! Beef literally melts in your mouth (even good Togo) Dan dan noodles - 4/5 Beef pancake - 5/5 (surprisingly good Togo too) Cucumber appetizer - 5/5 (the sesame sauce goes perfectly with the freshness of The cucumbers) Pork belly noodle soup- 4.5/5 (I'd give a 5 if the pork belly is more tender, but the soup was sooooo good!) Pot sticker - 4/5  I've had it multiple times at the actual restaurant, But their soup is surprisingly amazing even Togo.

G0h-Ihtbhkutc8220T5daQ.text: We found this gem while driving in Vegas before airport, genuine Jaoanese food, soo good!!
