1ga9l06lFX4HlikVKWz36g.text: I had the pork belly soup noodles which were delicious. The broth was a bit sweet but tasty. The noodles I chose were the hand pulled ones and it was delicious. Great texture to them and held up well in the broth.

4me7vC1Ih4stu6rcnAeosw.text: I had high hopes for this place and the decor is trendy and the place is new and clean.  The prices are reasonable but I have to say that I am a bit disappointed in their star products, noodles.  We tried both the hand pulled and knife shaved.  I think the noodles are over cooked and not chewy enough for me.  However their beef shank and beef stock are excellent.  It is not easy to make a clear beef broth and they definitely have that down.  Also their beef pancakes were juicy and authentic.  Maybe when I am in town next time, I will ask them to not overcook my noodles and under cook it a little, then maybe it will be the right texture.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rJI-asNH4Xs_NJrTJzPKSA.text: Quality, service, price, portion, and selection are all great! The restaurant is on the small side, but we went an hour or so after the lunch rush. Their kitchen is also designed so you can watch them cook. Close enough to the strip to still be convenient too!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. beef and onion potstickers
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. shang fried rice
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. shang beef noodle

QKvmNGe9Fpz8RTp5V7u6dw.text: One of the best noodle places that I have ever visited in my life. I live in California and used to go to this place called Huang's which was also super delicious but sadly it closed. Ever since I have been trying to find a place equilavent to it if not better, and wow was this place better. The hand pulled noodles were super delicious and had a nice chewy texture. I ordered the Dan Dan Mein which was super delicious with a little kick. My mom ordered pork belly which was super tender and savory. Overall I give this place a twelve out of ten and would recommend it to all noodle lovers.

NE3fS0naCUMZsgbvu7EvhQ.text: The style is more southern China, the taste is more sweet spicy instead of strong spicy. The environment is good. The noodle is fair.

sBQg5bCO0BZ5wme5mbePTw.text: Phenomenal.  I got the beef shank w handpulled noodle which I would get again.  Annabel got the Shang beef knife shaved noodle which she liked--it was littler heavier and more sweet than I preferred but still good.  Pork potstickers and beef pancakes (which look like dumplings) were both great.

m8xbV0ZWmpB_tpc3DVP1jQ.text: I came here for the Shang Beef Noodle soup and I left a huge fan of the service.  For an Asian restaurant, they are really good about asking how things are going, making sure you have what you need in terms of drinks and food.  I ordered the Shang Beef Noodle soup and the broth was on point.  I got the hand pulled noodles and they were really tasty.  The broth was slightly spicy, but not overly so that you can't handle it.  There are 3-4 pieces of Bok Choy in there and enough beef in there to make it a great meal.  Their diet cokes come in glass bottles which are great.  Warning: $10 minimum credit card charge.

IamuH7q61fiMABKMYEutdA.text: Great place for noodles and I wish I had a bigger stomach to try more dishes. I had the pork belly hand pull noodles and the pork belly was delicious. It was braised to perfection with juicy soft tender meat and slightly dense skin for texture. The noodles were pulled perfectly for an al dente experience. The menu has a modern twist, but didn't forget its roots. Prices are reasonable and portion is just right. Best part is you get to watch the Chef hand pull the noodles behind the counter. Love it!

2O_LFoZdwvDe5rduUTaEKw.text: First and foremost let's establish that this place is named Up Noodle (and it doesn't sound better in Chinese)  The standard beef noodle is solid. The pork noodle was oddly sweet. We also ordered the sliced beef shank and it was covered bizarrely in vinaigrette and had a rubbery texture.

dvCVj8rbeWSGcAxuU44LhA.text: Had high expectations here based off of reviews but wasn't impressed with their noodles. I ordered the Shang Beef Noodle Soup, but the noodles didn't have much bite to them and was much softer than I anticipated. It tasted as if it had been soaking in the broth for some time. The broth itself was also much saltier than I would have liked with no option for adjustments, as the soups are all made ahead of time.   The prices are pretty reasonable for the amount of food you get, but I think there's definitely better options to dine at in Vegas.

kCV5jG2C_7TXKdugeeDshQ.text: It was yummy not what I expected but I like new things! Watching them make the noodles was awesome!

zH5sV-5a4F2tChyQIzzaCA.text: This place is great! Starting with the space, it's nicely furnished and decorated.  The kitchen is exposed so you can see the cooks working their magic and making noodles by hand - quite an art form.   The food is fresh, simple and good!

_y7YIeu1SrM9k8IXLrYITQ.text: We really enjoyed this place.  The restaurant is pretty small so there's seating for about 20-30 individuals and bar seats.  I ordered the Pork Belly noodles and it was quite tasty.  We also shared the spicy wontons which I thought had great flavor and a nice spicy kick to it.  The pork/cabbage dumplings were disappointing though, I thought the skin was a bit tough and  had too strong of a cabbage flavor to it.  My husband ordered the Shang Beef noodle and he enjoyed his dish.  He said the meat was tender and the broth was flavorful. Overall, when we are in town we would visit again.

UqpltxzrMXZHe2GcYCpF1A.text: My wife and I have been here a few times now. We try to sit at the noodle bar and watch the show. The cooks working hard creating the fresh broths and pulling the hand made noodles. It really is an art what they do.   The Shang Beef Noodles is for sure the go to!  Rich, hearty broth. Homemade noodles and crisp veggies. This one is a can't miss. They also nail the chow mein. Tons of the noodles with a well balanced sauce. Potstickers are amazing too. I believe they are seared on the flat top with an incredible crust.   This place is small with a great vibe. Definitely a must when you have the craving for a delicious bowl of soup. Servers are really friendly as well.

640PaL740PT6Zv3bOe3zTg.text: Yum! Had the hand pulled seafood noodles and my husband had the dan dan noodles. It's neat to watch them hand pull the noodles. It's like a mini show along with dinner. Service was quick and friendly. Great place when you are having a noodle craving and like fresh, hand pulled noodles.

zFj6s-hprxp_rp6p3b5WUw.text: I was really excited when I found this restaurant on Yelp while visiting Las Vegas! They offer different kinds of noodles, such as hand-pulled noodles and knife-shaved noodles, which you can see them make! I ordered the Shang Beef Noodles and the Beef Pancakes. Both were delicious! The restaurant is a bit small but we had no problems getting seated, and the design is nice and simple! Definitely recommend stopping her for a meal if you're in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang Beef Noodles (Hand-Pulled)
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Pancakes

pmtBU9yOm67tCGlyNwMAqQ.text: Some of the best dumplings I've had in recent memory. We got both the beef and the pork, both were really good, pork prob a little better. Noodles were really good too. I initially came here just to get some quick food before going out, but ended up really loving the food. Definitely recommend and I'll for sure be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Noodles and dumplings were fantastic.

y3wjnzo9loDFRASkU5hsxA.text: I never expect to find this such a great Chinese restaurant in Los Vegas. Much to my surprise, the knife shaved beef noddle soup is the best that I have ever tried in the United States. Everything is awesome. Great food, great price and great service. I wish they come to Houston in the future.

9KhLll46eYtlTf_nY8sTvA.text: The interior is sleek, minimalistic and clean. You have some live entertainment from the guy hand pulling noodles in the back window which is a great way to get you excited for what's about to come. The menu is just large enough to have something for everyone- hot dishes, cold dishes, soups, noodles, fried rice, dumplings.  We started with the cucumber salad which wasn't the style which I was expecting it to be- no fault of theirs. I was thinking more along the lines of slightly pickled cucumbers with chili oil, but what came was medium sized sticks of cucumber drenched in creamy sesame sauce. It was a little heavier for my liking.  I ordered the hand pulled noodles with mushrooms and chicken. The mushrooms were a nice mix of at least three different toothsome varieties and they, along with the chicken, had a wonderful wok flavor to them. It made me very curious to try their fried rice, something I generally never order. While this dish was solid, and generous in size, I would rather try something else from the menu the next time I go. Given their super fresh nature, the noodles just didn't have enough chew for me, and I think I'd prefer the hand cut noodles more.  Overall, a solid option and I have respect for what they're doing but I'm not rushing to go back. There are other options in the same dining plaza which hold my heart captivated :)

-r3P8p1HiFOt9yT_UzKBeg.text: OMG.......Can you say Happy Tummy Dance! 1 Hot Tea, 1 Sapporo, 1 order of the following: Spicy Wonton (YUM! ); Beef Pancake (delicate flavor); Beef & Onion Pot Sticker (YUM! ); Shang Beef Noodle with hand pulled noodle (sigh...sooo good) all for $35.91. Stephen, our server, was very attentive, helpful and sweet. Have enough take home for tomorrow if we can keep our spoons out of it. HAPPY TUMMY DANCE!!!!

HEW9VOnHP9O2O8gA46c3ww.text: The broth. The broth itself is enough reason to come back. The noodles and meat are just icing on the cake. Order the beef noodle and I promise you won't be disappointed.

wzd1uL7zWlZ1vPHtT--SYA.text: Such a great place to come.Food is delisious and i like the sliced beef shank so much. Highly recommend for you guys.

tl_Xn2z3XcBbTK8ZECnEuw.text: You get to watch them make the noodles! This is a great place, great food, very affordable for the value of the food. We had a great time here. Chicken chow mein was great. The dan dan had more shredded pork than I needed, to my taste, but maybe others would see that as a plus. Also it's right off the highway, so it's easy to run in and out on a long road trip. Couldn't recommend this more highly.

O8M0tozeULc10U3DX0LvFQ.text: It was a quaint restaurant where the staff makes the dumplings and noodles right in front of you.  The ingredients were very fresh.  I had the Shang beef brisket with the round noodles $8.95.  It was excellent.  Very tasty.  Mildly spicy.  The beef was very tender.  We also ordered beef pancake  ($5.49 for 4).  The cover pancake was crispy but the beef was juicy.  Excellent.  The restaurant on a Friday evening at 8pm was busy.  At 9pm still had a waiting line.  I definitely would return.  The glass of water had a hint of lemon.

x-EPavo94C6AhabkYQ06KQ.text: Ordered the peking zhajiang noodles. Good stuff. Hand pulled noodles were ,  kinda wished there was more sauce thasall.

_XEvTL9VrKT9PJzKswSenA.text: Very, very good noodle soup.  Rich, tasty broth.  I was very impressed.  Prices are excellent.  Worth a stop for sure.

2s4Dt9sjYU0X4jAqJChofA.text: Wonderful clean place. Very very good homemade noodle. Not as spicy as I wouldve like on their beef noodle soup. Great find for our little family nonetheless. Very very good pot sticker by the way.

NEhkyjkb4x5aMcREjMXezw.text: This is my 4th time since they opened.  Love this place!  The noodles are very fresh and broth is perfect.  Tried the gyoza and spicy wanton as well.  This is now my favorite noodle place!!

H7e-vwQMEAe-sIPmYDTITQ.text: We came in to town from a long drive from Bay Area and did not want anything heavy for dinner and crave for  good Chinese noodle. We came to Shang for the hand pulled noodles with beef and seafood. All five of us gave this place 5 Stars for the taste and price.

L-PERptzMmsKPR7QjGCIQg.text: The Shang beef noodle is amazingly good. Add a scoop or two of chili paste if you like spicy. Food is served fast and reasonably priced.

tCheH90Gy_qUZNq-AzAidg.text: Really amazing!  We had the beef knife shaved noodle soup, chicken & mushroom hand pulled  sauce noodles, beef pancakes and pork dumplings.  All of it was so good. The sauces and broths had a perfectly balanced flavors and the meat was tender.  The chicken & mushroom bowl had these black mushrooms that were so tasty.  The spicy beef dumplings were the best dumplings we have ever had, just the right amount of heat.  Large portion size and the noodles are hand made (we saw them making them).  The service was as good as the food.  The servers were friendly and helpful and made our visit very pleasant.  Loved it!!!

E-DZ-j0ut1ap75edG-AgXA.text: The noodles was unconventionally really good along with the soup. Freshly made and we didn't wait too long for our orders. It's a little small place but worth visiting. It's not too pricey either.

aP34BxoEeNw3DSdKY2WQIQ.text: Ordered the Shang Beef noodle with the regular noodle.  Next time will try the hand pulled noodle. The broth was delicious without been salty.  The beef pancake was definitely worth it.  It was full of delicious juice and it was the right size.  Would definitely recommend.

_PJ7Rpnk0Bp21r-uY09WcA.text: Had the Dan Dan noodles,  with hand made noodles.  Great texture and cooked very well. Flavor was good,  although not all that spicy. Super fast service. Will return.

aRLTJ8EkjBs3N4iAEh2Qhg.text: We compared this to noodle shops in Austin Texas and China. It was authentic and fresh. We tried the knife cut noodles in brisket soup and chow mein. Both were excellent. The condiments in the soup added to the flavor. Will return.

0ORMeTP60IuG79SqOxxwfA.text: This was our first visit. They could use some more staff but service was friendly and fast considering they were overwhelmed. It's set up similar to Monta with a bar where you can watch the cooks as well as a few tables. We had the poke belly soup with hand pulled noodles which was fantastic. The broth was really flavorful and the pork very tender. We also had the potstickers which were tasty and the presentation was beautiful. Cucumber salad was good but the dressing was a little heavy for my taste. The poem and cabbage dumplings were tender and nicely seasoned. But the best dish was the Dan Dan Noodles with fermented soy beans and just the right amount of heat. So good! We will definitely return!

ZkmVG6HTSEdOsxwKU1A6YA.text: Just finished eating our first meal at this place. We love the bouncy hand pulled noodles we picked to go with our soups. I had braised beef and the wife had the pork rib. Ask for their chili sauce but be careful how much you add because it's really spicy. For the appetizer we tried what they called beef pancake which turned out to be fried soup dumpling. Glad we took the gamble of trying it since our waiter didn't really do a good job describing it for us. Definitely coming back.

N2Eetl20GwqOJnQ64te3vQ.text: The hand-pulled noodles are a must - it's what this place is known for. I had the dan dan mian. Their dan dan mian is a simple, intensely flavored dish of noodles heaped with dried chile, fresh Sichuan peppercorns, pickled mustard, and a handful of crumbled pork. It would be better if it was spicier. Happy belly!

ncyJp2OrWdKjmWAQ56gVMA.text: What's not to like?  It's fresh made noodles.  Had their Shang noodles and beef pancake. Very tasteful.

M4kiWZG-f2p5rbD4jjuPvQ.text: Really good noodles and really filling. Great portion sizes and reasonable prices. I still love my japanese ramen but now I also enjoy chinese noodles!

4Sq2BgA1GPxcAniYRuq3xA.text: Found this place while in LV. Wow! Hand made pulled noodles and savory broth! Oh, and the staff are so nice and professional This place is a gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Belly Noodle

TWI889mv4_ZjIjBmhdKCMw.text: We aren't in Vegas often but no matter what we always come here. When we aren't in Vegas I constantly crave and dream of these noodles. The service is great. They are all always very attentive and very kind. I can't recommend this place enough. I usually get the Shang Beef Brisket Soup with the hand pulled noodles. The wonton soup is great as well. All their noodles are delicious but I highly recommend getting the hand pulled noodle.

csZYGrMl0KBr0ScH-7M-IA.text: This restaurant description on Yelp says "liked by vegans". But there is NOTHING on the menu suitable for vegans! I could not find a way to change this description. It needs to be changed, because it caused me to drive all the way to this restaurant for nothing.  I did not eat at this restaurant. Maybe the food is good, but not for me.

ue8QRzyr8U36E4TUBqNIVw.text: First the wait is long. We went on Christmas Day at 2:00 pm and Sunday at 5:45 pm and waited an average of 45 minutes to an hour each time but well worth it.  The staff is very friendly and efficient.  We ordered beef and onion dumplings, pork and onion dumplings,Shang Beef, Dan Dan and Beef Shank noodle soups.  The Shang Beef soup is very aromatic and absolutely delicious. The Beef shank comes with a clear broth which is refreshing and very light.  They have peppers at each table so you can increase the spice level for those that like spicy food.  Dan Dan was nice and spicy. The dumplings were crispy and juicy. Overall the best noodle soup/dish we ever had.  Also, they don't add any MSG to their dishes and the salt level is right on point.  I didn't feel parched couple of hours after eating here.  Will be a repeat customer!

YSYR6lgZtf6jtxzwWi4tJA.text: Two words: perfect noods. The thick doughy texture of the noodles and the rich flavor of the sauce is unreal here. Not to mention it's priced super reasonably. Highly recommend all the noodles and the beef pancakes! Noodle craving satisfied

0VPH-F1FVjByyYUcCy0duw.text: It was a special day for my Sisters and I decided to take them out. We decided to try this new place out that I bookmarked a few weeks ago. Today 9.8.16 was their official Grand Opening day. Once we walked in, we were immediately greeted and seated at once at this modern and clean place. Great use of space despite being small inside. However the bar with an open kitchen was cool and exciting to watch while waiting for your food being prepared. Moving on to the food we had.  Appetizers: Cucumber Salad-Fresh and crisp cucumber and seasoned just right with a hint of spice. The dressing was like a cross of peanut butter and chili oil flavoring. Beef Pancake-Juicy meat patty with a slight crisp paper texture that went well with the soy based sauced it came with. Spicy Wontons-Balanced Flavor and texture. The spices went well with the soy garlic flavoring with chili oil.  Main Dishes: Beef Shang Noodle Soup-Awesome broth and the hand pulled noodle was just right in texture. Chicken & Mushroom Noodle-Good dish that was well seasoned and great alternative from their soup options. Seafood Noodle Soup-Delicious and flavorful. The broth was balanced and not too salty.  Overall we had a good time and the service was on point. The server was very attentive and was very knowledgable with the menu. She was very helpful and patient with us especially when it came to deciding if we wanted Hand-Pulled Noodles or Knife-Shaved Noodles with our main dishes. Great place to bring family and friends from out of town with a good West Central location that is not to far away from the Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. (L)-Beef Shang Noodle Soup (Top R Corner)-Chicken &amp; Mushroom Noodle (Lower R Corner)-Seafood Noodle Soup
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of Shang at Night.

X6dhdCZ_cw6ZFkJMgihncQ.text: I enjoyed watching the tossing and stretching process  , it seemed so satisfying ! I loved the knife cut beef noodles I had... the meat was so tender , the broth not too salty, just right. Although I love bokchoy, its always hard for me to eat it in a bowl if not cut, and i didnt think it was as good because I also prefer  to cook in the broth. Kudos to the service and presentation! I probably need a ramen eating tutorial though!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Shang beef noodle soup, braised beef brisket with vegetables

QVyjRZF8UL06gJeQOacNlg.text: We found this hidden gem through a "word of mouth". My bf and I frequent this place often to eat their delicious beef noodle soup. Their service is amazing, and your food comes out relatively fast.  I would recommend the original beef noodle soup. Their tomato and egg noodles are also great if you are craving something light. Get them in their famous "hand-pulled" version. Every now and then, we would also get the potstickers. Keep in mind though, the potstickers would take at least 15 mins or more to cook, so order them first if you must. Their cucumber infused water is also delicious! All in all, I would highly recommend this place.

AdBP20-Vt5QFo3-bSzL3PA.text: The noodles is spectacular! The soup base and proteins are all very good. My only complaint is the slowest of service. This is a new place. So hopefully they can hire more people!

K7cxLSgwcCysGWV8v1k2LQ.text: 5 stars boiiiii  great service, quick, nice atmosphere & excellent food. Super fuckin attention to detail from the chili sauce on the tables to the wooden tableware & the badass noodle slingers. Definitely check this one out while you're in Vegas. Won't break the bank either

J-PpkWpDd8q6v-Q-U7Jnmw.text: OMG!  My friend and I are from Hawaii and there is nothing this good in Hawaii.  We were in Vegas for a wedding and after a night of drinking, we had to have some noodle soup.  Yelp led us to this place.  When I tasted the food, I felt like I had died and gone to heaven.  I got the knife cut spicy beef noodle soup and my friend got the hand pulled pork noodle soup.  We also got two types of dumplings.  Everything was exceptionally delicious.  The portions are large.  My friend and I should have shared one bowl of noodles.   My friend and I are back home now and crave the dumplings and noodles everyday.

WdVIu3bfOqKUWZKQAf7o2g.text: The newest hand pulled noodle shop in town! Being so new, it's clean and immaculate inside.  The interior design is simple with nice Asian influences.  Oh, but I do like the ladies room - check it out!   For day 2 of business, the servers were friendly and knew the menu items. I asked one server what she recommended, and she said a popular item is the Beef Pancake. The Beef Pancake is more of a pan fried dumpling than a pancake. Be careful when you take your first bite as there is juice that will squirt out! It was enjoyable, but I like a thinner dumpling skin like XLBs.   The Sesame Chicken Cold Noodle dish was made with fresh sesame paste/sauce. There was a strong sesame flavor but not overwhelming. With the hot weather, this was a refreshing dish. Filling too if you finish by yourself.   Lastly, I tried the Pork Belly Noodle soup with Knife Shaved noodles. I enjoyed the knife shaved noodles a lot, and will make it my go to noodle here. The broth flavor was ok, but needed an added element, so I added in their house spicy chili sauce. This definitely perked up the flavor, and along with the pork belly pieces, it was a solid noodle soup.   I will be back to try more! See you soon Shang Knife shaved noodles!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Knife shaved noodles
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly knife shaved noodle
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Redo menu side 1

lhzCE5Vf15FBUZ6YwGlKSg.text: AMAZING!!! We stumbled across this amazing noodle shop on our first trip to Las Vegas. We are hooked and came three days in a row. I highly recommend the Dan Dan noodles and the beef and onion dumplings. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful as well. We will be back on our next trip to Las Vegas :-)

Pury_NJg5XTfB1DTsYgcJQ.text: Shang Artisan Noodle delivers an outstanding cuisine in Vegas for noodles. Ordered two different noodles the "Shang" and "Pork belly". The broths for both was really tasty, and the texture of the noodles was different than usual noodles Becuase of being hand made and cut. I recommend the "knife cut" noodle Becuase of its heavy chewy texture.   The meat and vegetables was good but not the very best. The bowl does contain a really big portion for only about $9. It's definitely worth coming here especially when it's almost winter time this place will get super busy.   I love the layout of the place very big bar seating and also spacious for rush hour times. For just checking in you do get a free spicy wontons, maybe for a limited time only.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang beef noodles.
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary spicy wontons.

sEtkx_QfuA2x0ljdyxIUxg.text: I'm going to be one of the few who was not impressed with this place .. ok cool hand pulled noodles but the flavors we're just not there for me. I ordered the tomato and egg sauce noodles , I couldn't stop comparing it to spaghetti o's . I can get that for a dollar a can :/ . I haven't given up though I'll probably try Magic Noodle on Ft. Apache. A lot of hype but pretty average tasting food here , the draw is the art of hand pulled noodles but that's it.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato and egg sauce noodles ..
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excited to try these noodles ... looks yummy

g25WAvaP8Sci9dNuGXwHIg.text: I had this place bookmarked for the longest. I don't usually venture to this side of town but I decided to give it a try anyway.   Just an FYI - Parking sucks, not the restaurant's fault but it's very limited.  For starters, I asked for a water to drink. The waitress brings out what looks like water, but after the first sip (which I almost spit back into the cup because it grossed me out) I realized it was an infused water. I remembered another yelper posting a pic of their water which was very obvious that it had pieces of watermelon in it to show that it was infused.  Mine tasted more like it was infused with only the skin part of the watermelon. Gross. You've been warned.  The cucumber appetizer had a nice sesame based sauce to it with a very light drizzle of chili oil, but the way they have it stacked - the bottom pieces didn't have any flavor at all. It would have been better if the cucumbers were at least lightly pickled or marinated. Very bland.  Beef pancakes were good, they took 15min to make (and they did tell us) but came out nice and hot. They are very very juicy - seasoned just right. Dough is a little thick but this is typical.   Beef shank - soup base was very bland.  It was a very light white colored broth. It was literally 5 pieces of beef shank, some noodles and a pile of green onions.  Beef brisket - (I stole some of my wife's soup since mine was so boring) soup base was much better, had a darker red color with a little kick to it. But still dressed up with only some green onions.  I'll tell you where the was place really good, and that's their hand shaved noodles - the texture of the noodles with the intentional imperfect cuts was really great. It's just a shame that I had to use 3 spoonfuls of hot sauce to give my soup some flavor.  I wouldn't go out of my way to come here again.

FcTYFr7dzDVLCdGPsrIKvA.text: Noodle is overcooked and soggy. The soup is on the salty side. Pancake and Pot Sticker meat is so dry.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili wonton
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House special beef noodle soup

mRprWhHZl2rNqZLmcEWX3w.text: Great food, great service. Great ambience. We ordered dan dan noodles, has great flavor in it and the knife cut noodles have great texture.

LZteNN46aCBAu6yQuVZZlw.text: We're on a journey to try all the noodle shops in Las Vegas.  We've been back 2 times to try other types of soup they have here.  One thing you'll notice coming here is how clean and the decor of this place.  Very modern.  They also serve you infused cucumber water!  Huge plus for the dry climate in Las Vegas.  The service is excellent here, you can't complain when a place refills your water without you asking.   We had two appetizer.  Spicy wonton, my husband really likes it.  Cucumber salad....it had a weird sesame drizzle sauce on it...it was WEIRD TASTING!  Don't order it.  LOL, I was craving The Noodle Man's cucumber salad.   Our noodle soups.  We're a big fan of their knife-shaved noodles.  We've tried the other two types of noodles.   They're great, but the texture of the knife-shaved noodles is very unique, never had that before.  I ordered the Beef Shank Noodle and Seafood Noodle.  They don't use any soy product in the broth.  Both broth super tasty, very clean with the texture of the knife-shaved noodle.  I just can't remember if the use the same broth or if they were different.  My husband ordered Shang Beef Noodle, Pork Belly Noodle, and Dan-Dan Noodles.  He really liked all of them.  He's a big fan of their Dan-Dan Noodles.    Another thing I couldn't forget was their hot tea.  It was so tasty, the pleasant roasted flavor was what got me.  I am super happy, I did a little investigation and found it without having to call and ask them what tea was.  I purchased 50 sachets.  =)

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Noodle
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hmmm... Didn&#39;t like this...weird sauce on top. Cucumber Salad

mYUys7A8WyACgedL2KpSvg.text: This place was delicious, service was prompt even though they're busy  Dan Dan noodles are the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef dumplings
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dan Dan hand pulled noodles

SfCgJjgdrtI038qbEbgN7w.text: Very yummy noodles!!  We ordered the Shang beef noodle with the knife cut noodles and it was so flavorful and the meat was very tender.  Beef pancakes are also flavorful. Takes about 10 minutes to make. Yummy, fresh, flavorful, and very good.  Spicy wontons are also good but not as spicy as I thought they would be, but had very good taste, I was expecting it to burn my mouth with how red it looked.  Also had the tomato egg noodle, it was good but I think we would have enjoyed it more if we ordered the knife cut noodles.  If you're going to eat the noodles then I would recommend getting knife cut noodles. My mom loved this place so much she wants to come back and try everything else.

Z1mbFKaYg14qVqMRaNlX8Q.text: Love the pork belly noodle soup. Broth is bursting with flavor and there is plenty of pork belly.  Their pancake was also very tasty. Great service to boot. Highly recommended.

NT67mBoA7gbjDjqAXVK--g.text: I found this restaurant completely by accident. I intended to dine next door but was intrigued by the claim of hand made noodles. The meal did not disappoint!  I ordered the beef noodle bowl with knife cut noodles. The beef was flavorful and tender.  The noodles were hardy and a little chewy which was the perfect consistency for the broth.  I will definitely go back again.

bsfKmDmNoGwBUuJH5PvJfQ.text: Great service, AMAZING FOOD. The noodles are FRESH and the atmosphere is very clean. I will come back again for sure. Definitely recommend!

5Za28L60AslPK39BhNEVZA.text: I had a really bad experience today and I don't know if I will ever go back.  I love their noodles, but as I get to try everything out, eventually I find my favorite or know what's the best for me.  I love their beef from Shang's Beef noodle, but I only love the clear broth (which only available with Beef shank order, but I don't like beef shank), so I asked the waitress if it's ok I have beef shang noodle meat but with clear broth like in the Beef shank one, she had done this for me before, and this time, she went and talk to the chef/owner Sam to see if it's possible to do it again, but to my surprise, chef immediately shake the head said "no", but I felt like the whole time, he doesn't bother to understand the question further, both waitress and I tried to explain to him, but he doesn't seems to get it at all, I told the waitress I'll just get something else, then she went back and talked to the chef again, she came out and said she'll be glad to do it for me again, but she already got the warning from chef/owner for doing this, REALLY? getting a warning for making customer happy? this is just NOT RIGHT! why would you give your employee an warning when all they want to do is make the food the way customer wanted, all they have to do is put in noodle, put in clear broth, and then shang beef meat on top of it(not to mention they are both the same price), I'm not even trying to be difficult, but the chef/owner made EVERYTHING difficult.  On top of that, the restaurant was so busy(but when we arrived there it wasn't busy at that time), with about 20 people and ONLY 1 waitress, I felt bad for the nice waitress, the restaurant clearly under staffed, it's employee abuse, she even corrected the chef couple of time when the chef made the mistake on the order, and she had to start asking for help because customers were not getting their order or they just seated themselves, because 1 waitress just can't handle 20 people at once (I don't blame her, I blame everything to the owner), I honestly think she should be the manager, or go somewhere else to work where they treat employee right.  This is unbelievable, they have lost another loyal customer, and many more, because I will share my experience with all my friends and will not recommend any of my friends there anymore.  Bye Shang! you had been good only when you fist open, and this is what happen when your ego gets too big, time to look for another noodle shop.  *by the way, don't bother getting their fried rice, the portion was soooo small, it's not even worth the price.  Don't get their spicy wonton and expect it to be spicy, it's not even spicy at all.

hqmGlSlTSzYrCQmC6fqpCQ.text: Great soups. Nice, simple, modern decor. Cozy space. You can tell great effort goes into the food they make. I plan on returning regularly.

SRagk_zI5KK5-sOd9Y0gQQ.text: Very authentic Chinese noodles! Love the beef noodle soup with knife shaved noodle. The dining environment was fine and looked clean and tidy. Services were good too.

4mBZkyMr3bcqZxMUmhJx0g.text: Ate here tonight for the first time it's one of my favorite place now price is reasonable hand made fresh noodles great atmosphere and service our server Steven was awesome . I recommend the beef rib noodle soup and spicy wonton .

Ejb2WmT_tCh5MUCGJrqXJA.text: Definitely recommend. Taste authentic and this is as close as you can get to the real Chinese food. The broth can be a little thick tho. Almost like curry.

K2ozV1cBsmMGVt1xQ3Sptw.text: exquisite food, authentic hand pulled noodles. great pricing, friendly and clean. Sam and Suki are the best!

M-ezEBoTIS0xq17itaEjiQ.text: Hubby and I are always scouting for the Vegas version of "king of noodles" in SF.  I think we found it!  We were very impressed with the quality of the hand pulled noodles.  I love how it's made to order and the broth was so flavorful.  We both finished our bowls easily.  I had the Shang beef noodle and that beef was soooo tender.  My husband had the pork belly noodles and mmmmm melt in your mouth fatness.  We will definitely be back to try more items!

Ddx89G5NT8RDM4ncwX9dOg.text: If you ever decide to come try out Shang Artisan Noodles make sure to ask for Sierra! She was unbelievably nice and I honestly felt warm and welcomed. Best customer service and she was extremely attentive and informative. Keep up the good work and I shall definitely return again!

TVvkdhcTWgTn_OYrNJmmTQ.text: We found this place by pure luck and I'm really glad we did. We've been here twice now and both our waitresses were very pleasant and knowledgeable about the menu. We were told they had their soft opening about 2 weeks ago and they just had their grand opening on Thursday. My wife and I tried the Shang beef noodles. It was very good. The broth had a hint of sweetness to it. My wife likes their hand pulled noodles while I really like the knife cut noodles for a more al dente texture. They do make both types of noodles in house and if you're lucky, you can actually see someone hand pulling the noodles behind the clear plexiglass that divided the bar from the kitchen. They also have the plain noodles made by machines, but I don't know why anyone would want that instead of the freshly made noodles on site. I also had the Chicken and mushroom noodle which was also very good. We also tried their beef pancakes, pork and cabbage potstickers and the spicy wontons. The wontons had just a hint of heat to it and although they were all good, I think the homemade noodles is what makes this place different than others. The place itself is not very big but there weren't many people there so getting a seat was not difficult. I think the price is very reasonable considering the outrageous $$$ we've spent on the strip. I would highly recommend this place if you're looking for a restaurant to try a couple of miles off the strip.

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Wontons.

5Y8q67C1OVm_4Zoaar8Rdw.text: I like the atmosphere here. It has open kitchen, contemporary design, and just-right music volume. It's small restaurant space with 7-8 tables with a bar-like table in front of open kitchen.   Food is amazing. Highly recommended.

Q6_3mcZks6t0OxnMzo_kZw.text: Shang Artisan Noodles Restaurant is worth trying. I had the Shang Specialty Beef Broth Knife-Shredded Soup Noodle and the Beef Pancakes. Both offerings were very delicious! The broth was not too oily and salty, and the fatty beef cuts typical in Northern Chinese Beef Noodle Soup were tender and braised for hours as they should be. I dislike when some restaurants fail to fully marinate and braise the beef cuts leaving them dry and tough- not a problem here as Shang Noodles gets the combination of chewy soft noodle and braised beef just perfect. The beef pancakes were perfectly pan fried in fresh oil and fillings were juicy and savory.  If you sit at the bar seating area, you can watch a master chef actually performing dough kneading gymnastics to turn out heaps of fresh noodles- the chef we watched making noodles was obviously experienced and knew what he was doing and was very interesting to observe. This place is an excellent restaurant for Chinese Noodles.

oWVRUfqnUIj7Fi6k9zxxww.text: Went there yesterday with three others. I had the chicken chow mein with knife cut noodles--it was OUTSTANDING! Everyone else loved their meals. Can't wait to go back.

3craTpMi62o3uTwpip0BQw.text: One of my favorite new places!! I'm going to go as much as possible before it gets busy, which it WILL...

_BAFi4nWbN_FcU55M-wwcQ.text: This restaurant is an awesome place for noodle. Shang Beef noodle, Dan Dan Noodle and the spicy wonton are the great dishes that everyone should try.  Epically for those who loves spicy food.  A definitely place to come back.

BTxXmmtYiCcSIYc2o-o7Aw.text: Very very clean noodle house!! The service is extremely friendly and the noodles are all made in house, so they're exceptionally fresh. The restaurant itself is a modern, bright, open space. Recommended!

WXsDbA4ohRsVCAfed3Zp4A.text: I found this place on accident a few days before they opened.... had a conversation with one of the partners and asked if I was hungry I said of course.... I was lucky to be their very first customer and I've got to say that this place is absolutely amazing great food , great prices, and great service.  I returned a few days later with my family my wife had the beef noodle soup I had the pork noodle soup and my son had the seafood noodle soup... all with the pulled noodles of course as they offer three different types of noodles.  You get to watch them actually pull and make your noodles in front of your eyes  Oh and I almost forgot order the pancake it's absolutely fabulous

CVDzXVCTJ3Xa2K_1w26uoQ.text: There's something you should know before I start writing this review. I am not a noodle kinda guy. With my lack of knowledge and experience for the last decade with noodles please take this review with a grain of salt.   I honestly liked what I had but there's nothing to really compare it to because this is my first time going to a noodle shop in almost a decade.  The spicy wontons were definitely the highlight of the meal. The flavors from the wontons and the chicken chow mein were definitely not something you experience from an Americanized Chinese restaurant. There's definitely some authenticity to both dishes. My wife had a beef shank noodle dish with hand pulled noodles. She liked it. I had a small bite and didn't taste much flavor at which point my wife snipped at me and said I have no idea what I'm talking about. Which is a pretty accurate statement. Lol.  The lunch time wait wasn't that bad for us but when we left the line was pretty outrageous. I don't think any restaurant is worth waiting more than 30 minutes for because there is so many good dining options in Las Vegas. So if you get here and the wait is longer than 30 minutes, my advice is to go somewhere else and try another day.

B03eXjEy0DzmYpMRsq_zNg.text: What I ate: Shang beef noodle Visit Date: March 1, 2019 First time? Yes.  Behold, a rare 5-star review. You're gonna want in on this!  Shang Artisan Noodles is located off the Las Vegas strip and in small shopping/food plaza. It's worth the trip! Not only to they make and hand pull their noodles, they make them to order! In my hand-pulled noodle experience, I've come across noodles that are too thick or too chewy, but Shang has created the perfect noodle, AND, they have perfected their noodle dishes.   I got a bowl of the Shang beef noodles with hand-pulled noodles. We also shared the beef pancakes, spicy wontons, and chicken chow mein (also with hand-pulled noodles). The noodles pick up the flavors nicely.  The Shang beef noodles are made with beef and chicken broth and braised beef brisket. The spice/flavor combo was uniquely Shang, and the beef was so tender. The beef pancakes are more like hopya-shaped dumplings. They are filled and super juicy inside. The spicy wontons are house-made wontons with spicy soy sauce. I could inhale plates of this stuff. The chicken chow mein - stir-fried house-made noodle, chicken, and veggies. The sauce profile was sweet and salty.    You have your choice of noodles here - hand-pulled, knife-shaved, or regular. And you have your choice of sauciness - soupy, saucy, stir-fried. Next time I want to try their knive-shaved noodles(flat, wide noodles).OMG, take me back to Shang.   PS Sit at the bar for a noodle-pulling "show."

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NEcRo0CzbIdU-GrZzxLkCA.text: This place was okay; like many have said, the food looks great and the restaurant is very clean, but that's about the most memorable thing about it.   I've been here about two times, and either time I feel like I wasn't really expecting myself to eat here, but wound up eating here anyway because it was on the way home. The most recent time I was here, I had the beef shank noodle with a cup of tea, and while it hit the spot because it was warm and the noodles were fresh, it felt like the food didn't have much in the way of taste.   Even now, thinking back to it, I know that even milder Chinese food has heartier and tastier broth than what I had that day. By far the best part of Shang's are the noodles -- as they should be, since the kitchen and the marketing behind this place puts so much emphasis on the noodles being handmade.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qMr5OV2yTmopYGrOSn2hkA.text: We were visiting and wanted to try something off the strip and found Shangs. It is about 5 min from the strip in a small shopping center. The food was phenomenal they make their own noodles and you can actually see while they make your food and preparing everything. The location is a bit small and their may b a wait, but its worth it. We had the shang(pork) fried Rice, the chicken mushrooms sauce noodles (hand carved) and the pork and cabbage dumplings. Everything had amazing seasoning and the noodles were out of the world.  We will be coming back when we return. DEFINITELY A MUST WHEN IN VEGAS!!!

b3wKlLUKnneldZVTfHmaeA.text: Wow. Incredible noodle place. The chicken chow mien was incredible and the beef onion pot stickers were very taste. The portion sizes are large so you better come hungry

E1YdIngVINaDt1ymmdVd-Q.text: Ugh. I cannot get enough of this place. Warning, the wait is ridiculous but WORTH IT. I would recommend arriving about 5 min before opening as to have no wait or going at an off time. We ended up going twice during our short trip to Vegas. The restaurant is small but very cute and clean. You can watch the cooks hand pull the noodles and also hand cut them as well. This place has a lot of hype for a reason as the food is very fresh and very flavorful.  Hand cut noodles vs. knife cut noodles: I found the hand cut to be a little more chewy and al-dente. The strands are longer and shaped like a traditional noodle (think spaghetti or lo-mien noodles). Knife cut noodles are shorter in strands, softer (because it's less worked), and thicker (think your traditional flat wide noodles). I actually preferred the knife cut noodles since they are easier to eat, and I personally like a softer noodle.   For the actual foods: Spicy wontons- 5/5 hot chili oil over a nice portion of fresh wontons.  Beef pancakes- 4/5 beware they are super hot inside. The meat/soup filling was almost too rich, but still really good.  Dan Dan Noodles- 4.5/5 one of the best Dan Dan noodles I've had. I appreciated that it was not overly peanutty in taste. Note: if you've never had Dan Dan noodles before they come cold! Pork Belly Soup- 5/5 so deep and flavorful and a huge portion Seafood Soup-3/5 probably the worst thing we got because the soup was a little bland but after adding some chili oil it was a lot better.   I honestly cannot wait to come back here and try everything on the menu. You won't regret trying this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dan Dan Noodles and Pork Belly Soup.
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood soup (3/5, not the best item on their menu)

uhdoENP5SGkb2mZbdxn5ww.text: Decided to have a Lunar New Year dinner here with the kids and their beaus to enjoy a long and prosperous 2019 by enjoying long noodles.  Can totally see why this noodle joint has 4.5 stars with over 1200 reviews.  The noodles are hand made, service was fast, and quality was tasty.  Only thing is that spacing is limited, so it's not ideal for larger parties.  Party of 2-4 is ideal.    The beef or pork noodles are the best and paired with the cucumber salad is heaven!   If you're hungry and on the verge of "hangery" recommend you order 2 bowls. Yes, yes... 2 bowls!  =)  Can't believe we've never been here before.  Will def be a good alternative instead of having Pho when we're craving for some noodle soup.

GphaHkIi9ZQEC9OtVBgONw.text: great service, great food, great prices - what more can I ask for?!  I was digging the knife pulled noodles better than the hand pulled noodles.

ULH4IywY15YGUVkauU2OvA.text: From the taste and flavors standpoint this place is awesome! From an operational standpoint, this place needs help. I understand the long lines after what my party witness today. We had a party that finished their meal, continued to bust out their laptops and had the balls to work table-side like this place a coffee shop! Someone from my party brought it up to their attention. But I think they were still hesitant to get that party to pay the bill and leave.   After we got seated service was quick. Food came out pretty fast. We had a party of 7. We ordered a few spicy wontons, a beef shank cold dish, a few Shang Beef Noodles, and Jia Jiang Noodles. The spicy wontons had a nice kick to it. Pretty flavorful little morsels packed with spices and beef. The Beef noodles with knife cut noodles were prefect. The beef was tender. The Jia Jiang was sweet. Comes with minced meat and a brown sweet sauce.   Overall I would definitely recommend this place.

1poYgEIbCVSAfQS6-K9TbA.text: Shang Artisan Noodle is Chinese restaurant that specializes in hand-pulled noodles and small plates. The restaurant shares a parking lot with other businesses on the shopping center. When we arrived, there was a few tables ahead of our party but we waited until a table was open. A couple sitting at a larger table noticed we were waiting and decided to move to a smaller table.  In addition to the complimentary water with cucumber and lemon, we ordered Sapporo's, Asahi's, and hot tea.   We shared a few appetizers including Spicy Wonton (as recommended by someone picking up a carryout order), Beef Pancakes, and Pork & Cabbage Potstickers. The Spicy Wonton consisted of pork and made in house, topped with scallions and sesame seeds, and served in a really spicy chili oil. The Beef Pancake consisted of four pancakes stuffed beef and scallion and pan-fried. It took about 10-15 minutes to make. The Pork & Cabbage Potsticker consisted of six pieces of pan fried dumplings filled with flavorful pork and cabbage. It also took 10-15 minutes. It was nicely presented - it looked like a flower.  They have multiple types of artisan noodles made in house. We tried two different noodle soups - Pork Rib Noodle Soup and Beef Shank Noodle Soup. The Pork Rib Noodle Soup consisted of pork and chicken broth, hand pulled noodles, braised pork rib, and assorted veggies. The Beef Shank Noodle Soup consisted of beef broth, knive shaved noodles, beef shank, and assorted veggies. I liked the hand pulled noodles more than the knive shaved noodles. I liked the hand pulled noodles  more because of the thinness and texture. The Tomato & Egg Rice consisted of stir fried tomato and scrambled egg in a tangy flavorful tomato sauce, garnished with scallions, and served with bok choy and steamed rice. I plan to return on my next visit to Las Vegas.

lRBsSliiIiwB7CKnu6aF_Q.text: WOW WOW WOW!! I just bumped into this resto as I was looking for some good Asian eats. I was hesitant at first to have noodle soup for lunch when it's 95 degrees outside but oh boy, this place exceeded my expectations. Was seated right away at the bar and after reading some Yelp reviews, I ordered the beef noodle soup and also their cucumber salad. Here's my review:  1. The cucumber salad was fresh and crispy and definitely a nice balance to the richness of the beef soup. I love the peanut and sesame oil dressing. I added some of the chili paste on the side and a small amount of soy sauce and it was heavenly.   2. The beef noodle soup was THE BOMB!!! This was probably the most flavorful beef soup I've had in a while. The noodles were freshly made, good amounts of beef (shank portion) and it was very tender. And I just love the simplicity of the garnish they added was just green onions and bokchoy because u can really taste the beef broth. It was just a very delicious homie soup.   I don't know but I may come back here tonight for dinner and try their other offerings. If u are looking for some good Asian noodle eats, THIS IS THE PLACE TO BE!!

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef noodle soup - AFTER
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cucumber salad

bMO1oOXdPulEiKtYURv6Ag.text: Shang Artisan Noodle where have you been all my life and why did it take me this long to get to you?  My parents and I came in on a cold weeknight around 530P.  Good thing because even though this was a day I expected no one would be out (it snowed in Vegas) it was jammed packed in here by 6!  Weeknight, early evening AND snow but still busy?  Very good sign.  We ordered the spicy wonton and cucumber salad to start.  Those wontons are absolutely fantastic.  The dough is soft and silky, the filling is delicious and the sauce is spicy with just the right amount of oil and vinegar.  Pure balance in a bowl.  We also got dan-dan noodles, pork belly noodles and beef shank noodles.  It was fun to try all the different ways they prepare the hand pulled noodles.  Every dish was full of flavor and complexity.    The service was great too.  They fully anticipated our needs, refilling drinks and clearing plates swiftly.  They never made us feel rushed either, even with the crowd waiting to get in.

vXLSBGPxg3YBV8oJLGfvgQ.text: Hand pulled, flavorful, tender, incredible. Literally the best noodles in China town. Can't wait to come back and try the fried rice and other fresh noodle options they offer

3kCYdaylzq9vBJMIcZyiXA.text: I've never had Chinese hand pulled noodles before and my main squeeze has been eager to try for some time now so we decided to have a lunch date here. It's a pretty small place. There's bar seating and maybe 8 or 9 tables. There will probably be a bit of a wait, but I promise you, it's worth it.   A spicy wonton app to share and two Shang beef noodle soups, one with an extra noodle. They spicy wontons aren't super spicy. I liked them because of this-- you can eat without having your mouth set on fire. The filling and texture of the wonton were great. Don't be embarrassed to eat these with a fork if you aren't the best with chopsticks. They are slippery little buggers!   The soup was out of this world. Occasionally, I daydream about it. I feel like I'm being deceitful if I go without my partner in crime, so that's a (pathetic) reason why I haven't been back yet. Anywho, the noodles are fantastic; chewy but firm, easy to slurp, and are super fresh. The brother is rich without being heavy. I love the crunchy, crisp baby boks in there too. I considered ordering extra baby boks but I'm glad I didn't. It was unnecessary as the ratio of noodle to meat to baby bok to brother was just right. The beef was tender, flavorful and plentiful. It wasn't too fatty or lean.  All in all, it was a perfectly balanced bowl. I couldn't really ask for more in a noodle soup and I'm looking forward to my next visit.

2oItoPAoxw3WeDDfWxdfKg.text: I love noodles but they don't love me!  I normally can not eat noodles 3 bites in, I start to feel ill.  Not today!!!! These noodles were fresh!  I finished all my meal (never happens).   The noodles were perfect!   We ordered Dan-Dan noodle.  Half-way in I felt the spice kick in.   Shrimp chow mein had a nice amount of sweetness.  It offset the spice in the Dan-dan.  Pork and Cabbage Pot stickers were delicious.   Great value!   Will definitely make this a permanent stop when visiting Vegas.

jgW-VtEqKZqcVCYo-bDYMQ.text: It was my first time trying this place out I ordered the pork soup it was a mistake!  I didn't know there was going to be hair on my pork. I will probably never order that again however my boyfriend ordered the dry noodles and that was really delicious. I just recommend you to ask if you're going to order pork if you're going to get hair on your pork, it really took my appetite away.

ixQp4gzEm00tQgdv4t8MBQ.text: This place is like stepping into a restaurant in asia: Small, the kitchen is visible, and the food is authentic. It can be very busy because of the size of the seating  area but is well worth the wait for amazing homemade noodles. It is fun to watch the cooks stretch out the noodles by hand as you order. If you are in the mood for great noodles, you must try this place

IMQuZjLyOX4MKMKsfb2FWg.text: Couldn't decide what to eat so we Yelped some noodles. This place had great reviews and looked delicious. It was a little out of the way since it was off the strip, but definitely worth the uber ride.   We order a little of almost everything. Got the potstickers, got some noodles, spicy wontons, and more. Everything we got came out quickly and it was all delicious. We came a little before lunch time so it was not as crowded, but when we left there was a wait for Sunday lunch. Service was good.   Concept very similar to Din Tai Fung with a few differences. Way cheaper compared to the bay area prices. Definitely coming back here again next time I'm in Vegas.

UE12U7sAb_S80QS64e2edw.text: This place is a definitive must whenever I visit Vegas. My friends and I dropped by on the way to the airport, luggage and all. Although the shop is small, our luggages fit perfectly underneath the table. Food comes out fast, and their broth is the perfect thing to rejuvenate you after a long weekend on the strip. Shang is so unique because of their kitchen layout, which allows you to watch the mesmerizing process of noodle pulling. They also have knife shaved noodles which I think are best paired with the soups.  Below are all of my favorites which I think are 5/5:  Shang beef noodle with knife shaved noodles- knife shaved noodles have the perfect bite to them, pure beefy flavor soup, tender brisket, with perfectly crisp bok choy  Dan Dan noodles with hand pulled noodles- both of my friends got this. Perfectly cooked noodles, super filling, and the sauce was really good too.  Beef pancake- be careful, these are hot when they come out! I can never resist the urge and end up burning my mouth every time. The best part about this is the crispy exterior and the amazing soup that bursts out when you first bite into it. Dip it into abit of the soy vinegar.  Spicy wonton- this is my OBSESSION. I try these everywhere I go but the only places that do it right is Shang and DTF. Wontons themselves are good, but the sauce with the scallions is what makes it amazing.   I literally can't even think of anything bad to say except maybe that the wait can get long depending on the time that you choose to go. On a Monday at lunch time, there was no wait at all when we arrived.   If anyone watches Strictly Dumpling and knows who Mike Chen is, stay tuned for what I imagine must be a Vegas food review video. I ran into him filming while eating here!

O8qNua_smGgOMRHKJLpVhw.text: Really excellent & affordable food.  I had the spicy won tons and Dan Dan noodles (adding lots of the spicy/chili sauce they have on the tables), very happy I found this place - well worth a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dan Dan noodles.
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy won tons.

zCa-LMCcpk3rZZK-NtFJPQ.text: I went here today with a friend. They make their own noodles in house. They have 3 types. Hand pulled, knife cut and plain. Plain are thin like ramen noodle style, pulled are thicker and knife cut are flat noodle. The hand pulled and knife cut noodles are made in house and the plain are boxed noodles that are not made in house. These are the descriptions that the waiter gave me. So I ordered the chicken, mushroom and bok choy with a soy based type sauce with the hand pulled noodle. I chose the hand pulled noodle on the recommendation of the waiter due to 1 of 2 of the noodles that are made in house. I did like the noodles being freshly made and it had a lot of mushrooms (2 types - white mushrooms and wood ear mushrooms) with bok choy and scrambled egg and green onion with a soy base type sauce. I give the noodle dish a 3.5 star due to the sauce not being as flavorful. I had a similar dish somewhere else that the sauce was SO flavorful and made me want to eat the whole dish. I ate about half of my dish and took the rest home. I videotaped the noodle making and it was impressive. They make a regular flour noodle and a spinach noodle that I got to see. They also have noodle soups and fried noodle type dishes with appetizers and also fried rice dishes. They are very reasonably priced. It's a small place so the entire time we were there customers were always waiting to get seated. You can sit at the counter bar area where you get a close view of the noodle maker or sit and the very few tables they have. They had 2 wait staff working and were friendly and accommodating and were always around. The next time I go there I would like to try their noodle soups and appetizers. Overall I had a good experience.

fCxYJs6EQrPkLKWP1dFMAg.text: This place has one of the best beef noodle soups I've had in the COUNTRY! I echo what others have said... I come from CA where Asian food is supposedly better however, this joint has perfected the chewiness of the noodles, the meat as well as the broth. We would definitely adventure off strip again to have the beef noodle soup!

AyaLSChFrDjmZJb6iHQb2g.text: Omg! I discovered this the last time I was in Vegas.  It's going to be on my list of places to go. Everything was delicious.  I didn't have to wait too long for a place to sit but it was definitely worth it.

aLRBx0Rk3LyaYDXk9DG8-g.text: I came here on a Monday afternoon when it wasn't particularly busy. My cousin and I got seated quickly, and our server was very kind. Our food came out within 7 minutes. The broth in the soups here are always so flavorful and has just the right amount of salt. I love the spicy wontons here which pack some heat that I find enjoyable. The quality of the food here is impeccable. The menu has a reasonable amount of items, and I enjoy that there's an option to choose what type of noodle you would like. My personal favorite is the knife shaved noodles. As for the portions, I feel that they are very generous and gets you full in no time. This place is great for lunch or dinner but consider coming at earlier times to avoid long wait times.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RSAkaQxDiNkrif8SHkg5jA.text: My favorite hand pulled noodle spot in Vegas. Their soups aren't too oily like some and are very flavorful. Dan dan noodles are a must and def the best in town. Wonton noodle soup has fresh handmade wontons, just be sure to add noodles! The beef cakes are a must as well!! We've tried the tomato and egg noodles as well, very good. Can't go wrong here.

HxyULYnGa0L-dZ6s1DHyhw.text: Came here for dinner and then lunch again the next day - absolutely delicious food!  I try to avoid eating noodles too often, but the knife shaved noodles are unique and so tasty... I will make an exception every time I visit Vegas lol. They have a perfect chewy texture that's so addicting.  For dinner, I tried the original beef noodle soup (dark broth) which was rich and flavorful. The waitress told me it is their most popular dish, and it doesn't disappoint. There is a good size portion of meat and noodles.  I also tried the spicy wonton, which are amazing. This might be blasphemy but I like them more than Din Tai Fung's.   For lunch the next day, I tried the dan-dan noodles, which don't come with broth, but instead has a thin sort of oily spicy sauce. This was actually my favorite. I believe it's the same sauce they use for their spicy wonton, and the minced meat complemented the dish well. I'll probably end up getting this again next time!  The cucumber salad side was also delicious and a great way to break the taste of the noodles a bit, and also cut the spice because the dan-dan noodles are pretty spicy!   Highly recommend this place! It's small but the wait doesn't seem too bad because the food comes out quickly and people don't take much time to finish their food.

QUFn3u2Cbxx2pYnAkTveBw.text: Cheap comfort food for an Asian like me that constantly travels. I finally got the chance to try this place out although it's been on my book market for awhile now.   They offer traditional Taiwanese dishes like dan dan noodles, beef noodle soup and pancakes. Kinda of sad they didn't have the thousand year egg dish but I think they're main focus is the noods (like their business name advertises). I had the hand pulled pork belly noodle soup and it was everything I needed to make myself feel like home again. Noodles were soft and chewy and I love that I found a place that does hand pulled. They also offer knife cut and regular style noodles. The pork belly was tender and melted in my mouth.   I'll definitely be back when I'm in Vegas.

-DhUFR-U4LYYKgsDhWk3Yg.text: I've been wanting to try this place for a few weeks, I'm happy I can come to try today. As soon as Me & my friend step in, somebody greet with smile, show our table & gave the menu. It's not to long after that, another server asked for our drinks. We just ordered a glass of water and their water is so refresing. It's infused lemon & cucumber water. All their menu is remain me of my childhood food.  I like this place... the place is Clean, good food, good portion, good price, good service, fast service. It's not even 5 mins we got our food one by one, probably in 10mins we got all our food. Im so happy they serve my favorite taiwanese beef noodle soup. That is the reason I want to eat here. You can choose 3 type of noodle: hand pull, knife shave noodle, plain noodle.  We ordered:  * SHANG BEEF NOODLE W/ HAND PULL NOODLE $9.95 ( beef broth, braised beef brisket, bok choy)( I add spicy sauce that they have on table):  It's delicious-tender beef, a rich and slightly spicy broth, fresh noodles, a little bok choy. The result is a perfectly orchestrated bowl of spicy, savory, fresh deliciousness.  * Shang fried rice $9.95 (steamed rice, minced pork, egg, preserved bean sprout-I didn't notice but I saw preserved mustard green) : I like they put minced pork + mustard green (if I'm not mistaken) in there, that make this fried rice so tasty and colorful because they also put corn, carrot, peas. Even it's a little bit to salty for us but we finished it. * spicy wonton $5.99 (house-made wonton with spicy aoy sauce) : I like the fact that their wonton skin is not thick ( I don't like thick skin), good flavor meat + sauce, that's we call perfection  Overall really satisfied The price is not bad, all under $10. I think only 1 menu is $11 (seafood noodle). Big portion of all food, our beef noodle have a lot of big beef pieces. I can not wait to go back so I can try all their menu like dandan noodle, beef pancakes, chicken & mushroom noodle, tomato & egg rice, sliced beef shank, pork & cabbage pot sticker. I know it's a lot, right? You should come and try it

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu 1
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy wonton $5.99 - house made wonton with spicy soy sauce. I don&#39;t know what kind of meat but delicious

rdjnqxDZLtvIFQ2PzrYl_w.text: I found this place on Yelp and wanted to give it a try since they seemed reasonably priced, and the food looked pretty good.  My folks seemed reluctant to make the five mile drive from our downtown hotel, because they wanted the "Fremont experience",  but they came with.   AND GUYYYS, lemme tell you. No one was disappointed.  When you walk in, you see one of the employees making noodles by hand. The atmosphere is warm, cozy, and quiet and very different from the more "lively" restaurants we had dined at since our arrival, as well as the more "curt" customer service we were growing accustomed to in the area.   The service was fantastic! Our waiter was incredibly friendly and helpful in his recommendations.  The food was amazing. We all sampled one another's plates, and I'm just sad our hotel didn't have a fridge so I could order more to take back to enjoy later.   Even the Chow Mein was delicious!  Mind you, chow mein is a dish I've eaten countless times at countless restaurants over time, and while good, is usually unremarkable, BUT THEIR CHOW MEIN IS LITERALLY THE BEST CHOW MEIN I'VE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE.  And by the end of it all, between three orders of appetizers, and entrees for six people, our tab was still less than $80. The whole reason I decided to look into this place in the first place was because price was such a big factor at the time, and it still surprised me that we ordered so much food, each dish being INCREDIBLY delicious,  for such a fantastic price.   Y'all. I'm so sad I'll never have noodle dishes this amazing until I'm back in Las Vegas (whenever  that will next be ;c ).  SERIOUSLY. GIVE THIS PLACE A TRY. YOU NEED THIS IN YOUR LIFE.  This place is such a gem.

PIjDIpupX0Phil8cxAKbMg.text: Delicious and great prices! Our favorite noodle spot!! I love that you can see the kitchen and the flavors are on point! I rarely like Asian noodles for the sodium factor but I can eat a whole portion to myself  it's a place the whole family can agree on and won't break the bank!  I hope they open one up closer to where I live!

AfcdE51PSnFmXO0cnndRDg.text: Foods: 5 stars The noodles are absolutely heart tugging --- very deliciously executed. Just for the foods alone, I would return.  Service: 3 stars This place is very busy and physically small. The servers are handling a little too many tables and so they do not provide enough service coverage very well.   Ambience: 3 stars The noise level is moderately high. And, lighting is OK --- it's a regular eating place. A little cramp.

0rCu3Kx7RZs_yX_b9M9k4A.text: Ok this place was very hyped up! Given all the high ratings and reviews I would have expected more on the flavor.  However the decor, service, and cleanliness is all there for an asian restaurant.  The hubs and I got: 1. Spicy oil wontons - really good flavors and lots of green onions! Highly recommend it 2. Beef shank noodles soup- we got the hand pulled noodles but it was made too soft and not chewy. The soup base was nice and soft.  3. I got the seafood noodles soup with the same noodles. The flavors of the soup was great but the noodles were lacking.  We also paid $1 more for 2 more bok choy . They should just have a side of bok Choy dish instead!   I hope the soup is not made from msg because I drank a lot of it.  Probably wouldn't come back

OhRw7ybLbH-gyVW9IJqGAA.text: My love of noodles made this an obvious place I had to visit. I don't have much knowledge on Chinese food so brought along some friends with more experience and let them do the ordering.   The spice is real! Or maybe I really am that big of a spicy wimp, but some of the dishes were too spicy for me to dig in the way these dishes deserved. For a place that prides itself on their handmade noodles, the delivered! You could tell they were fresh! The beef was stewed to perfection and fell apart. My favorite was the beef pancakes!   If you can handle spice better than me (pretty much everyone), stop by and check out some great Chinese noodles!

ZgTEAA8Ss_V8hFoUQURcYA.text: Excellent noodles and service! So glad to eat noodles here! Best noodles in Las Vegas!

NJkeRT3EHHkWpaVRb9_qBg.text: You can never go wrong with Shang Artisan Noodles.  It's amazing that their noodles are all made in house. You really can taste the quality in every bite. I'm a huge fan of the Veggie Chow Fun with the Knife-Shaved noodles. It's magical every time.   The store is alvery clean & their staffed is very tentative to their guests. Would definitely recommend this place.

VXN4gUnn8cJLM0OmL9Ei8g.text: Adding to the cascade of 5 star ratings because our photos of the food look amazing!  Shang Artisan is a small spot off the strip with a small, concise menu. We arrived at around 4:00 on a Monday and the place wasn't busy at all, there was a steady flow but always available tables. We asked for a counter spot to watch them make the food; one fellow makes the wontons by hand and the nood dude does his thing, it's pretty entertaining (and he's a good sport with photos and videos too).  Based off the other Yelp reviews, we ordered the beef soup -one hand pulled and one knife shaved, the beef pancakes, and the spicy wontons. We had super high expectations and they didn't disappoint! Beef soup: Super rich but not oily or heavy, we were surprised at this because the broth is really dark and there are generous amounts of brisket floating around. Dat brisket doe! It was soft, tender, and flavorful.  Hand-pulled noods: nicely balanced. Long strands with a soft bite.  Knife-shaved noods: chewier bite with shorter pieces. I initially preferred this as I like chewier textures but as the meal sat they got a tad bit overwhelming, there was a lot leftover (enough to fill a small takeout container with just the noodles.  Beef pancakes: these are the title round dumpling looking fellas and True to all the reviews and waiter's caution, they definitely do squirt. Every. Single. One. These were so so good though, so definitely worth it!  Spicy wontons: I think it's just the chili oil but they really are spicy! I'm a lightweight though and only eat spicy if I'm behind on my daily water intake or need to induce labor so I'm not the authority you're looking for. The wonton itself was really really good!  Stop in, it's a nice break from the strip and really simple, good food!

NqIh3h5wQcvEBLKZSgrYdA.text: Had lunch here on Saturday! Best noodles I've ever had in my life. I had the seafood bowl! Delicious! Noodles are hand made fresh daily.

8gxtJDy3bEJ6UfNYtg9LQQ.text: Not only is the food good here, but the service is quick & the servers are friendly! We were seated right when we came in and they gave us the option of sitting at a table or bar. It looks like there are about 4-5 2 -person tables and about 2 to 3 4-person tables, but they can easily join the tables if you have a bigger party (although I probably wouldn't suggest for a party larger than 6). There are about 12-15 seats at the bar.  We ordered the Beef Pancake (comes in 4 pieces), Pork Belly Noodle Soup & Peking Zha-Jiang Noodles. Our server let us know the beef pancakes would take 10 minutes and if that was okay. We didn't think that was a long wait and it was nice they gave us a warning, so we said okay. To our surprise, our noodles came out within five minutes of ordering! The beef pancake came out around the time they mentioned.   The noodles were great. They were fresh and very tasty! I'd recommend to anyone looking for a quick eat and/or noodle fix!

XtSdS9Xw7CKskL-45-KHuw.text: I have never tried fresh, hand-tossed noodles before this experience, so perhaps I am easily impressed? I don't know, but this was delicious. There weren't a lot of vegetarian items to choose from, but I didn't want to pass up trying some of their signature dishes, so I tried to eat around any meat. Everything was simply amazing.   I ordered the wonton soup with added hand-tossed noodles, and shared the cucumber salad appetizer and fried rice with my husband and our awesome friend/realtor. It was really cool watching the staff stretch the noodles and toss them around like they're just playdoh. We were joking that they probably don't have to go to the gym since they spend their whole day doing that at work.  I'm a convert and will probably be open to trying any other fresh noodle place I see now. This was a great find!

g3ReVGhNBoDL9BOsbD13qg.text: If you're ever in Vegas and craving noodle soup, this place is a must! Came here during our first night in Vegas and was not disappointed at all. The restaurant is rather small with limited seating but overall it's very well kept and clean. My favorite part of the restaurant is the bar seating since you can watch the cooks make had pulled noodles right in front of you.   Now onto the food....  For my order, I chose the pork belly noodle soup with hand pulled noodles. The broth was very rich and flavorful and the braised pork belly was very tender. I do wish they had more veggies (bok choy) but nonetheless it was really good and filling! It was that good that my boyfriend and I went back the next day and I tried the Shang beef noodle soup with hand pulled noodles (he got the pork belly soup).   My new go to spot whenever I'm in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly noodle soup with braised pork belly and veggies

QfZk1bLPiWO1A7q32r80MQ.text: I came to this place twice while in Vegas for the weekend, because I loved the Shang beef hand-pulled noodle on my first visit. Also, the spicy wonton is a must-try. On my second visit, I ordered the Peking wonton soup with noodles and it was disappointing. Soup was a unexpectedly a white cloudy broth, and the flavor was just bland, that I was not sure what to add to bring out its flavors. Staff is helpful, efficient and checks in on you often. Oh, the water here is cucumber-infused!

7zTUr_R4hJczNQhv04IltA.text: Interior: nice and simple decor, great atmosphere. The whole presentation was pretty clean and neat. Not too much odor from construction. 5 star for that.  Wait time was great if you don't have a preference at bar or table. Sitting at the bar will give you a view of the guy pulling the noodle tho. I was lucky to get that view.   We got the beef noodle and the chicken noodle, both the taste were good and authentic enough to be Chinese. By the red oil dumplings were just too sweet and not spicy enough. It was a free dish for check in special but they should still keep the quality even tho it's a freebie.   Overall it's a great experience for me and I would come back.

We had the beef & onion pot stickers. I had the Shang beef noodle with the hand-pulled noodles. Both were amazing. We'll definitely go back and try some of the other noodle soups.

ks16cs4lX563ICAJWrhoMw.text: Amazing! The noodle broth is perfect! Add won tons to any of the bowls. I prefer the beef shanks! The bowls are under $10. Go and definitely check this place out. It is fairly small so there might be a wait!

muwyd5oZ1zY9TDr0dpnkjQ.text: My wife and I have eaten here numerous times and it is utterly superb. We started with the pork belly ramen and the knife shaved noodle, which is simply outstanding. After several visits we discovered the spicy wontons which are small bites of heaven. Currently we devour the chicken chow mein which is fantastic. Crispy vegetables with wok fried chicken and the knife shaved noodle. If you have not tried it you must consider it. We have been fortunate several times to have Lindsey as our server and she is fantastic! We enjoy Shang so much it has become a staple of our lunch rotation.
