3xPp-TKmw401IYKH5EvdIA.text: 2 stars for service and atmosphere. Out waiter was GREAT. The food and inside looked awesome and watching them make the noodles was fascinating. Unfortunately, nothing tasted great. There were 4 of us who normally love noodles and none of us were satified. My sister and I got dan dan noodles, shang beef noodles, beef pancakes, and potstickers to share. The beef pancakes were ok, nothing special, just tasted like over-thick potstickers. The potstickers were just ok as well; I've had better. Both noodle dishes were not great. We didn't finish our food and I wouldn't even take it home because I knew I wouldn't eat it again (and I hate wasting food - and money!) Very disappointed. The reviews and photos made it look so good.... All we could talk about after were all the great noodle places in town we would've rather eaten at.

NVTx5N39jdIS8mzsRVRw0g.text: I saw that this place was featured on Eater as one of the best places to get noodles at and could tell as soon as I walked in.  The noodles are handmade and you can catch this show while you eat!  I tried the dan dan noodle, beef pancake, spicy wonton, and chicken chow mein.  The spicy wonton had a great spice and the beef pancake was definitely a crowd favorite!  The noodles were cooked to a good consistency and were tasty.  I look forward to coming back to here and trying other dishes.

_i99cV7K5jJm7oaHAzPf4A.text: Best hand-pulled Noodle, that's I ever had in Las Vegas, NV! I recommended u try this noodle but mine is Seafood Noodle I ordered.

inhggUCeERCNrd5KufEhFw.text: Amazing food!  We had the beef pancakes and the chicken chow main with hand pulled noodles.  Both had wonderful flavor.  Waiter was very friendly and helpful in ordering.  We sat at the bar area and watched the cooks pull the noodles and make the bed pancakes fresh.

dgcE1UAtCWeJFK6fdOHnhA.text: I can't say enough about this place. Fresh handmade noodles made daily. Everything that I've tasted so far has been like a slice of heaven. I love love love love everything about this place. I wish all noodle houses made their own noodles, this alone sets them apart in specialized category. They also made them three different ways. 1-flat 2-shaved, and 3- regular. I highly recommend this restaurant. 3-5pm is the best hours. They also close at 10pm which is great! Super affordable!!!

ObXVctJYaifjKgaOE3R4HQ.text: I didn't go to much restaurant in Las Vegas. This noodle place the soup is delicious and the meet is fresh.   The waiters are friendly.

ZB-2-JrTfKvR_5sdPSYwFQ.text: Shang beef noodle was the best. Dan Dan noodle and pork belly noodle soup were way over salted

mui9XxL6KpAc8KaG3LvffA.text: My husband and I ate here three times when we were visiting Las Vegas a few weeks ago.  I mentioned to my husband that I found this place on Yelp and wanted to try it because the reviews were pretty good for this restaurant.   ATMOSPHERE: Welcoming and clean atmosphere.  There's an open kitchen to watch them make the noodles and cook your food.    It feels so exciting to be able to watch someone making hand pulled noodles.  You can choose three types of noodles:  hand-pulled, knife-shaved, or plain noodle.  If you want to order extra noodles, it's an extra charge of $1.50.    I wanted to give 5 stars overall, but couldn't.  For the service, I would definitely give 5 or more stars, but for the food, I couldn't.    SERVICE:   Definitely 5/5 stars.  If I could give more stars, I would. The service here is exceptional!  Best service ever!  I wouldn't write this if this wasn't True.  I'm very picky about service.  If the service is not good at an establishment/business, most of the time I dread to return or would not return to that establishment or business.    1st day - There were a lot of people waiting outside.  Found out that there were two large parties.  The restaurant is not that big.  I think it fits about 30 people.  We waited for about 20 minutes or so for a table.   Both of the servers working that night were very nice, courteous and friendly.  They asked if we needed anything several times even though they were very busy.    2nd day - We were greeted by a different server and he was also very nice, courteous and friendly.  He provided excellent service to us.   He also asked us several times if we needed anything.   3rd day - We were greeted by one of the same server from the 1st time we dined and he again welcomed us with a smile.  We definitely felt welcomed and was provided excellent service again.  FOOD:  -  Shang Beef Noodles $9.75 with Knife-Cut Noodles 1st and 2nd times were 5/5.  The knife-shaved noodles were chewy and the plain noodle (almost like spaghetti type pasta) had good texture.   The soup had a lot of beef flavor and was piping hot.  The beef was tender and flavorful.  We added extra noodles every time.    I couldn't wait to eat it again for the 3rd time, but the 3rd time, the soup was not hot and the noodles were soggy.  I was very disappointed.  I felt nauseated afterwards because I ate it lukewarm.  If my food is supposed to be hot in temperature, I need it to be piping hot.  My husband was ok with it. ___________________________________________  - Chicken Chow Mein $8.75 - 2/5 The first bite I ate was good, but then I realized that it was a little too saucy.  I think it would've been better if it was cooked a little longer.  It needed the high fire flavor too.     - The hot sauce in the jar on the table lacked flavor.    Just a thought:  I didn't like the fact that the workers in the kitchen do not wear gloves.  There's sometimes more than one person touching the noodles too.  A person would grab the noodles with their hands and place the noodles into a serving bowl.   Thinking about this, it's not sanitary.  It'll be better if the noodles are cooked and immediately put into the serving bowl.    Overall, I would definitely come back especially for the service.  Next time, I would request for my food to be piping hot.

b_-vY36ox3btV4gAkH0T2A.text: Had Shang Artisan Noodle for the first time this past Sunday. Service was fast. There's bar seating and you can see the workers cooking the noodles right in front of you. It's a small clean restaurant. I got the wonton soup made with homemade wontons. It doesn't come with noodles, I thought it did so I got it with the homemade noodles. The noodles are really good and tender.

faf81-41HW49UzAwEH2OEQ.text: Excellent soup .. great service - there is a queue so remember to get your name in the list - worth the wait

7x4vXTcz1I3DS4SlQ2tyMw.text: The food overall was pretty good. The noodle choices that we had were hand pulled and knife cut. The length for the hand pulled were long but a little soft and not as chewy. The knife cut noodles were on the short but chewy side. Personally I would go with the knife cut noodles. The beef shank noodle was pretty good 4.5/5. The broth was nice and smooth and the beef shank wasn't over cooked. The Dan Dan noodles were pretty good. Same with 4.5/5. It had a nice consistency with the knife cut noodles. The spice is not really a ma la type but it hits you right away. The chicken and mushroom noodle were 3/5 it lacked flavor and wasn't very great. The Shang beef noodle was greatly good with a 4.5/5 wish the noodles could've been more chewy but still long. The noodles was lacking salt and wasn't stir fried but it wasn't also in a soup. The sauce was like a gravy that didn't really fit up to expectations. The cucumber salad is 4/5 the sauce isn't too overpowering.

wiZgNTL7i5g94vF7ehwnmg.text: I decided to try to find a shanghai noodle place in vegas and came across this new spot. Surprisingly, it was tasty and the noodles were handmade. Watching them make them from scratch was pretty cool sitting at the bar though.  1st - ordered the beef shang noodle soup and the noodles were al dente just the way i like it. The broth was delicious but a bit watery. It was still super tasty.  2nd - ordered the pork and cabbage boiled dumpling and the fried ones. It seemed to doughy and too thick. Overall, seemed kind of bland.  3rd - service was super friendly and quick on the service. The place is really clean and a bit small.  If your in town, i recommend trying this place.

4j4zQc_mHpyWMFy8O_-laQ.text: Small seating area but worth the wait. Great noodles, reminds me of Okinawa. Highly recommend.

0Zc3KzGAE4ECWbTM_81zNg.text: My husband and I walked in here for the first time and it was at first off putting but boy are we glad we stayed! We walked in and there was only one table with guests. Then they just  stared at us. I looked over at the register and there was a sign that said "sign in and wait to be seated". I felt like I was in a doctors office.  Finally a young girl seated us and immediately wanted to take our order. She must have seen the look on our faces because then she asked if she could get us something to drink. We ordered iced tea and it came in a bottle.  She never came back. So so far I just wanted to leave.  Finally a young man with a big smile came and took our order and was very helpful. That was the best noodle soup ever!! The broth was so rich and delicious. Lots of handmade noodles and tender pieces beef. The prices are great and portions are wonderful. I ordered the beef and added wonton for $2. I thought I was going to get one wonton but I got at least 4! We will definitely be back this winter for a lot more bowls!!!!

vwQXRCmswtr8UiWG5bLG3g.text: Good service and great food! In-house hand made noodles were amazing.   I got the chicken and mushroom stir fry noodles and it was great. My favorite was the spicy wontons.

yo8g7wO682PxPYCaejm3BA.text: What a cute, cute restaurant. If you're looking for a little escape from Las Vegas, this is it. Although some of the workers weren't Asian, it felt pretty authentic Asian noodle joint to me. There is bar seating so you can feel ok coming to eat here alone! I saw a couple of people dining alone, which is something I never see in America. It was nice :) There are three types of noodles: hand pulled noodle, knife shaved noodles and plain noodles. The hand pulled and knife shaved are made fresh in the restaurant. The plain noodles are not. The hand pulled are your classic noodles, the knife shaved are thick gooey pieces. They recommend getting the broth noodles with the hand pulled and the sauce with the knife shaved. The knife shaved, however were not that great. They were too sticky and ended up being a thick mooshy thing at the bottom of the bowl. Be boring and get the hand pulled.  They recommend Shiang beef noodles for broth based and the chicken mushroom noodles for the sauce based. Both were really, really good and not spicy. Again, get the hand pulled! Sit at the bar to get the best video for your snapchat. The restaurant is small and gets pretty crowded. You might have to wait a little so come at off peak hours!

j3RTQ_EkHxrsX7tVSIhs0A.text: I got there just at the end of lunch rush and got one of the last two tables. But the place cleared pretty quick. The seating area is fairly small. I noticed lots of take out orders.I had the Shang beef noodle soup with the hand pulled noodles. Really good bowl of soup! The young woman that seemed to be running the front of the house was so enthusiastic about her job and the food it made for a very pleasant visit.

YxeznPABLzOkUpRVBeJRRA.text: Flat beef noodles were excellent! Greeted as I walked in.

ainFHhO2zRzo99_KA9sOyw.text: The place has great service and tasty food. But I'm just a little in doubt with the value.  Came here for on a weekday, the place is small but just about nice for lunch time. Didn't have to wait in line and seating is specious enough you won't feel uncomfortable.   We ordered a Yang-Zhou fried rice and seafood noodle soup. When the food came we're little shock  inside. The fried rice has great presentation, but it cost $9 for a small portion. For lunch, at a local noodle shop, this just made us kind of disappointed. The noodle soup was served in reasonable portion. The soup base was delicious! The hand pulled noodles has good texture to it too.   The restaurant is very clean and pleasant overall and service was great. Just think they should reconsider how much they're charging for their fried rice, or should give a bigger portion at least. Everything tastes great though! I'll consider come back for the noodles.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Noodle Soup
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yang Zhou Fried Rice - very small.. around $9

j2QlC8HnmOxxZSRC9uyz1Q.text: Their hand crafted noodles taste amazing. The Dan Dan noodle is full of flavor it makes my mouth water. The beef pancakes ooze with delight! One of the best Chinese food I've ever had

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yruKx3KPgQWsK4olli3nGA.text: I was kind of skeptical of their ratings, as everyone has different standards. But after eating their Zha-Jiang noodles, Bian Bian Noodle, and their Shang Artisan Noodle, I was surprised with actually how good it tasted. We chose the hand-pulled noodles for all of them and the noodles were great! Not floury and I love the texture and the thinness. Their popular beef pancakes were spectacular, the juice of the beef still remains inside the pancake, which makes it taste amazing. I would definitely be back again but unfortunately I was just there for vacation.   To back my review, my dad is very critical of Chinese restaurants that are "Americanized" yet he ate the noodles with no complaints.   And so this place deserves their high ratings.

LWnxdaa-nQDLztOcV4qKMA.text: There was a line when we got there but it did move fast. The food was delicious. Appetizers came out after the meal which was weird but all was good. Would definitely go again!

pjtx-ZlObL9V0IZSKplkGg.text: The beef soup is the only reason to go here.    Ohhhhhhhhhhhhhhh...... deliciousness in a bowl.  SO so good.  It's the ultimate comfort food.  It's perfection, truly.   We have been here/ordered out at least a dozen times from the middle of November through December. It's been consistently wonderful each time we've ordered.  You have to get the hand shaved noodles.  I have tried both and LOVE the shaved noodles.  It's an all-around hearty meal.  The broth, meat, noodles and bok choy are all so delicious together.  At first I ordered extra bok choy for the soup.  I tired quickly from that combination and have settled on ordering it exactly how it's made.  They have a winner!

0N8145s5Fwx6hK_3zcsFOQ.text: I love knife cut and hand pulled noodles, so of course I needed to try this restaurant. I have bad experiences ordering zha jiang noodles at other restaurants, but I still search for restaurants that can cook my favorite noodle dish. This restaurant did an amazing job; it was so flavorful and the knife cut noodles were so chewy, that it makes me want to return to Vegas just for these noodles. This is now my standard for comparison. Also had the cucumber salad, pork and cabbage pot stickers, and beef noodle soup, all of which were delicious as well

cng1ZQqWejTlTX7TBccS5w.text: Nice place to enjoy hand pulled noodle.  It can get pretty crowded at certain time so be prepare to wait.  Small dining area so place can full quick.  Nice staff

VTuGPYvyF4TISgxfdha1CQ.text: A friend at work told me about this place. The food is amazing!! I try to go for lunch every week or two now. Best noodles in Las Vegas!!!

bEJiiNvGKiK5e6mivpGRyg.text: Loved design interior.. clean restaurant. I ordered beef noodle soup and tasted nothing. It seemed so delicious but it was just water and no flavor. It was like eating instant noodle with warm water. I tried to put some soy sauce and chilly but nothing worked... Maybe chef forgot to put some sauce in my dish or whatever. The worst dish in my life..

-Aayn-AxY4CBnMp8PokUAQ.text: We had the spicy cucumber, spicy dumpling, spicy beef with hand pulled noodles soup and chicken chow mein. Everything was good. The spicy cucumber has an acquired taste. Most people order the spicy beef noodles.  The place has a hipster vibe.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best dish!  Spicy beef noodle soup. It has hand made pulled noodle.
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy cucumber is tasty but has an acquired taste.
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken chow mein. It satisfied my picky son.

dOIK0VtsVzbN9i43Dqt9Jg.text: Pretty good noodles. Excellent service. Noodles are freshly made. I got the pork belly. The broth was pretty good. It's not the best but seeing as there really aren't many places in Vegas to compare to, I'd give them props for their cuisine. The noodles were great but my belly was over cooked so it was harder than I like. Luckily I was dining with a dentist. Ok it wasn't that hard but it was tougher than I like. It's a trendy little place so I would say you will more than like it. It reminds me of Monta only Chinese style noodles.

OkrsWQ0bi_B6n3vwJuanqg.text: They say the best restaurant's  in Vegas are off the strip. Shang's is a testament to that.  This place is well thought out and they are not fukcing around  with their menu offerings.  The broth is deep and spot on, quality hand made noodles at fair, low prices.   There is a hand wound noodle choice for those that dont like the hand cut version as well.  Their dumpling appetizer selections are also top notch.  This is a Vegas jewel, skip the overpriced, wannabe foodie las vegas strip, and head on over to Shangs. You will not be disappointed.

Fw2pMK8lurJgsfT3PbZFgA.text: This place is AMAZING!!! We waited for an hr to be seated on New Years Day. It was packed!!! Well worth wait! I loved watching them make the noodles right in front of us! It was like dinner and a show. The service was delightful even though they were all so busy we never felt rushed and our drinks never ran out. The food came very fast and the price was phenomenal! Only $30! The portions were very generous! We ordered three hand cut noodle entrees and one dumping hoping to take some home for lunch the next day. It didn't happen. It was so good we packed it all into our guts and rolled out of there very full and very happy! This place is a gem! We can't wait to take our kids! We will be going back often!

FtUnlRll2PM-lLzB7bfgDA.text: Quick lunch stop on the drive through Vegas. When you enter you are greeted by a man impressively hand twirling/pulling noodles. I found it amusing that the art of the noodle craft was passed on to a staff of Hispanic descent.   The kitchen is open and you can see everything being made. If you choose to sit at the bar you'll get a meal and a show! The dishes were masterfully crafted with nice presentation and fantastic prices. Shang Artisan Noodles gives you SGV Chinatown food with modernized decor. It's a melding of the best of both worlds.

ldIwHQTB6F7wy6R5H5GUcg.text: WOW. can't say anything that other reviews haven't already said but i will reiterate how delicious everything was. i haven't had beef noodle soup since i was in taiwan because i didn't want to be disappointed but decided to try it here because of all the stellar reviews - DEFINITELY DID NOT DISAPPOINT. also highly recommend both the dan dan noodle & the beef and onion potstickers. very very happy with our meal and it was reasonably priced!

Py_B5gGxyvLjoVYC9eEGzQ.text: The beef and onion potstickers were crispy and delicious. The chicken and mushroom bowl was my favorite entree and the beef shank soup with hand pulled noodles was perfect for helping my nye cold. Will be back.

-1bf4ZqTIEGa7cq-1AUe1A.text: I was sick and craving some soup and stumbled across this place. I got it delivered from Postmates and oh my gawd was this delicious!!!! I swear the Peking wonton soup healed my soul! I also had the beef pancakes and chicken chow mein. Both great as well. I can't wait to check this out in person and order the whole menu.

00AHQs-KdpkIrpKMgUEL7A.text: Reasonably priced, delicious food in plentiful portions.  Cucumber salad and pot stickers are magnificent.  Hand pulled, knife cut...it doesn't matter.  Soup or Dan Dan...also doesn't matter.  We've never had a bad meal here.  It's a small place so be prepared to sit at the counter; then you have a front row seat to the kitchen and get to watch them pull your noodles.  Dinner and a show!

5EqZlFoBadtybYMBGnOQSA.text: After two visits, I've tried a nice selection of their offerings with clear favorites, though, I am looking forward to trying the rest of the menu! There are three types of noodles that you may choose when ordering any of their noodle dishes; Knife-Shaved, Hand-Pulled, or Plain. I'm not familiar with Plain, but I like both of the other options.  Spicy Wonton ($5.49) Beef Pancake ($5.49) Shang Beef Noodle ($8.95) Dan-Dan Noodle ($7.99) Chicken Sesame Cold Noodle ($7.99) Chicken & Mushroom Noodle ($8.49) Peking Zha-Jiang Noodle ($8.49) Shang Fried Rice ($7.99)  So far, my favorites are the Spicy Wonton, Beef Pancake, Shang Beef Noodle, Chicken & Mushroom Noodle, and Shang Fried Rice.  The Spicy Wonton are small delicious dumplings in a flavorful spicy soy sauce. What I really love about this dish, besides being tasty, is that it's not overly spicy. The sauce is really quite fantastic and goes well with so many of their other dishes!  I love the broth in the Shang Beef Noodle; it's rich and flavorful and the braised beef brisket is so incredibly tender. I had this soup with the knife-shaved noodles and it was perfection. I love the chewiness of the knife-shaved noodles and it's supported well with a broth rather than a sauce (it needs the additional moisture).  Another noodle dish I enjoyed is the Chicken & Mushroom Noodle. I appreciated how saucy it was since I wanted to pair it with the knife-shaved noodles. We added the sauce from the Spicy Wonton and it was so, so good!  I haven't tried their other rice dishes yet, but I really like the Shang Fried Rice because they use preserved bean sprouts and minced pork and these ingredients lend a wonderfully unique flavor.  I didn't love the Chicken Sesame Cold Noodle or the Peking Zha-Jiang Noodle. Both have rather viscous sauces and didn't work well with the hand-pulled or knife-shaved noodles. It needed more liquid or simply more sauce for better coverage. Also, flavor-wise, it was okay.  It is a small space, so get here early for lunch or expect a short wait (especially for larger groups). Service is fantastic and it's always an exciting experience since you have the ability to watch the chefs pull noodles, shave noodles, etc.

zLwYiX1PTj-03jjBm3e-FQ.text: I'd recommend to eat in as opposed to ordering to go.  Really really really amazing food at very affordable prices.    Not much more to say than that, enjoy!

RIA-UdJIM8Ve3Ig_k5JODQ.text: I highly highly recommend you ask for the regular machine made noodle. There are not many places you can get a classic beef noodle in Vegas.  (so I have to come back, no choice)  To Chinese people, getting a beef noodle is as common as Japanese Folks eating Ramen, or Yall Murican's getting a burger.  The problem is that this place is a fraud and there's nothing "artisan" about it.  You'll come in and be dazzled by some idiot pulling noodles by hand and bouncing it on a table making noises that grab your attention.  Real places like this in China and I mean from Shanghai to Zhejiang.   NO ONE BANGS THE NOODLES ON THE TABLE!  LOL. So why do I call their BS?  A skilled noodle puller, (go search one on youtube) although does it by hand, the noodles width is reasonably consistent. This is important so that they cook evenly.    First time I came here I sent my bowl back and asked for the regular noodles.  The hand pulled crap they make is laughably inconsistent. Obviously thinner areas were overcooked, and thicker areas were raw.  Why I come back is that they put the customer first and if you hate something for any reason they will make it right.  Go there, and try the regular beef noodle with the hand pulled, then laugh and send it back and ask them for the machined pasta.  So much better, so much more consistency in each bite.  I didn't like their other stuff like the cold dan dan noodles. Which for me is misleading.  Dan Dan Noodles are warm and spicy with a peanut sauce.  They gave me something that was cold with carrots?  I only go back for the number 1 with regular noodles. If that is all they sold, I'd actually give them the other two stars.

UcwTy8kDbxlElj5O-MxWew.text: This was an amazing dinner, the servers were super nice and we go to sit at the bar and watch them make the food and the amazing noodles. Definitely recommend!

TDiLUHghCfI3T5xFh6KH-g.text: We ordered the spicy wontons which were quite spicy. If you don't like a lot of spice ask them to put less chili oil. Even though they were spicy the wontons were out of this world delicious. My husband got the shang beef noodle with hand pulled noodles and it was really good. I ordered the pork belly with hand pulled noodles and I wasn't a fan of it at all. I only ate 3 or 4 bites of mine and filled up on the declious wontons and my husband leftovers which is why I gave 4 stars instead of 5. I'd absolutely come back here for the dumplings and beef noodle soup.

ADp-X-uHBEb1uohOWFVUTg.text: This was the first stop on our 4 day vacay and Shang Artisan set the bar high! The atmosphere was great, small quaint space, seating at the (for lack of a better description) noodle bar...which was perfect for viewing the boodle making, and a bank of booth/chair seating along the wall. I had the chicken chow mein and we shared the pork cabbage dumplings. The food, atmosphere and service were fantastic. We highly recommend!

Cd4MTaKqGQ_4jj8msenvMw.text: Shang Artisan noodle is one of my favorite noodle house in town! I went with my friend and we all like this place. This restaurant is clean and neat.       We ordered slice beef and  beef pancake for the appetizer. The beef pancake is very juicy and beef pancake is tasty too. For the entree, we get the beef noodle soup and fried rice. They are both yummy. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Our waitress explained the menu before we order. We also watched  the noodle show while we were eating. It was really interesting to us. The owner came out to talk to us and asked us for advice.       Overall, this is a great dining experience. We will definitely visit back!

eUQsTqePq_XOXFhFe9bd1Q.text: The freshly hand made noodles are delicious. If you like soups, noodles & potstickers you'll love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chowmein

T40WdWxyhZBbc8UD1AFsyw.text: Shang's beef stew noodle soup & spicy wontons were tasty.  The broth was fragnant and had good depth.  Dan dan noodle was a meh, need more intense flavors and spices.  Great fast casual joint, in and out in half hour.  Long line during peak hr but ok around 3pm. I'll probably come back to try other stuff.

rmGZ4nTyV7pp7wOnT1zdyg.text: My very picky Chinese parents loved the noodles at this place. 'Nuff said.

1YeEkrsEEuYokfwQ57CAfw.text: This noodle house was awesome! Menu items were limited, but what was offered was absolutely delicious. The noodle items had you pair a deep and unctuous broth and a choice of noodle, hand-pulled and knife-shaved, I personally preferred the knife-shaved for the large and chewy texture however the hand-pulled were great as well. The main aspect of this place was the fact that they have an open kitchen that is connected to the bar seating so you can watch them make the noodles, dinner and a show if you will. Appetizers/sides were really yummy as well, most were succulent, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The interior was small yet modern, service was good, and they even serve cucumber water! The best part of the experience was that everything was reasonably priced, $8-9 for a noodle dish and $5-6 for the appetizer/sides. My friends and I had a wonderful time dining here and I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef pancakes

Siv-j2AORd6fWoC_vCvt4A.text: Hand pulled noodles have the perfect texture. Fun to watch them being made to order. Soups are flavorful and the meats are braised perfectly. Delicious food, speedy service. The staff is professional and pleasant. I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Shang and will definitely come back. Highly recommended.

73aZc-Q5LGeAJbkUdKZ7bw.text: Great handmade noodles, beef and onion dimsum, and spicy wonton reminded me of years in Korea.   The chefs make the noodles at front counter which makes for an impressive visual experience.  May try to make noodles in the future.

t6CCmM6QoLJUq7VBfNhlig.text: Loved this place. Came for date night. Ordered the chicken and mushroom noodle and my dude ordered the Shang beef noodle soup. Both were really goodand I cleaned my plate and found myself taking more slurps of his brothers. Meat was tender. Ordered the spicy won't on and boy was it spicy. Very very good. But if you can't handle it like my white companion he had two and had to cap out. I ate the rest but I'm used to spicy food. Made my nose run but I was hanging on. Lol ordered two beers and total bill was less then forty. Not freaking bad! We are already talking about what we going to eat next time we come.

89g6YYMRAKf5bK4Iz6fJmw.text: I don't remember how many times I have been here, I love the food and the service, The food and the service are always consistent.

-ReFhQTlLrp5hHIZJS59rA.text: Oh you residents of Las Vegas are so fortunate to have this restaurant make you fresh cut noodles to enjoy your meal. Came into town with my son and his girlfriend and he found this great place on Yelp.  Thanks to all you Yelpers for making our eats a good one while visiting  here. Love the show of tossing, twisting and turning the glob if pasta into noodles as well as scraping pieces off the chunk of pasta into boiling water. We had the beef with home made noodles, had spicy wonton and let tell you, it was one of more spicy wontons I had.  Also had the chicken chow mein with knife cut noodles.  The texture of the noodles were totally different than I have ever had.  Everything good, nothing bad. You have to try for yourself. I went (3) times during my stay there and if you are (1) person it is a quick sitting. Son's girlfriend was so into the noodles she order to go and flew home for her mom to get the flavor of the food. Excellent.

uZ0KyVEqrLYqZuYaSvYq_Q.text: we love this place - the chili paste is fantastic - i put it on everything altgough none of the food need it - this visit we tried spicy wantons, pot stickers, and dumplings -- all amazing.  worth the wait - friendly staff

zad3ZDN81vtePOPBwWXX9Q.text: Nice little noodle shop in a strip mall. Food was tasty, and it was fun watching the noodles get made. All in all a good experience.

ShsKGAvvq7yQqEmptD5jtA.text: My go to noodle place if I ever had cravings for hand pulled noodles!  Not the best beef noodle I've ever had, actually slight disappointed in the beef noodle meat itself, although the noodles are great.  But they have the best spicy wontons for sure.  I can eat like 2 bowls of those.  The 3 different kinds of noodles are all great.  The dumplings aren't my favourite even though I am a HUGE fan of dumplings, their dough skins are too thick for me.  It's good for pan fried, but not good for steamed.  The beef pockets are good and I even like their seafood option of noodles.  They're all pretty good, but just wish their beef noodle meat quality is a little better.  The broth is good.  Such a clean place and clean kitchen (unlike some of the restaurants in Chinatown), love to watch the chefs do their work, especially the older guy wrapping dumplings all the time.    I am glad this place exists in Vegas...and still continue to hunt for better beef noodle soup somewhere in the valley.  But definitely go for their spicy wontons!

syEwsHkxLpXHbLNqrWGBwA.text: noodles are good, need to be a bit more qq, pork belly noodles soup had a heavy taste...too much sugar and too much salt, it was overpowering that I couldn't eat the soup broth, pork belly was tough as well. beef pancakes in appetizers was ok...

L1Nwn2nA4z3MD7Op5c6sUw.text: Great foods, Great service, Great inside and Great price!  Beef pan cake is juicy inside crispy outside.  Beef in noodle soup is completely tender and well favored.   Everything is just way too good!

iZg4XYMBdW0e5i2eqgKaRg.text: This place was fantastic. It was quite busy when we came but the service was quick and the staff were friendly.  We had handmade noodles with chicken chow mein and beef flank soup.  We also tried the spicy wontons which are very good but really spicy :). The dumplings you can tell are made there, fresh and delicious.  The atmosphere was fun. You can watch them make the noodles.

hm5m82H6-QkifNmNZ1uYXg.text: This is the real deal.  Best pulled noodles in the southwest.  Equally important to great hand noodles are the broths and sauces they put the noodles in.  We have the beef noodle soup, the chicken and mushroom noodles and pork and cabbage pan fried dumplings.  All the meats were high quality and fresh.  I will be coming back!

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and mushroom with knife edge noodles

VC8Jv-GRjxP8k1_SM35lJA.text: Came around 4:30 on Wednesday. No lines. I ordered shang beef noodle. It came out in 5 mins sooooooo goooooood!!!! Broth was rich beef tender :) waiting on beef pancake. The server said it would take about 10-15 min. Excited to try that one soon

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3Lx06PdMeltF849S4m0tGw.text: OhmyGOD this place is good. Tiny menu, cozy seating, but HUGE flavor. I had the seafood noodle soup with hand-pulled noodles (!!!). The broth was full-bodied yet light, and I loved the amount of fish cakes, meaty shrimp, and squid that came with my bowl. My husband had the chow mein with hand-pulled noodles and loved the sauce that coated his noodles and chicken. We started the meal with freshly made pork and cabbage gyoza--excellent, and I loved the texture of the dough. The only thing missing was a dipping sauce for the dumplings, but even then, they didn't really need one. We cleaned our plates! Will definitely come again. Sit at the bar to watch the noodles being pulled. Amazing.

tTn8R0NcxNOwaMLGOw40pA.text: Yummy noodles and reasonable prices! Clean and cute decor. Great slurp before heading to the airport

NewyHSrKmALCUoanttiV0Q.text: What a wonderful find as we drive into Vegas from Southern California. The pork dumplings were amazing and we added extra book Choy to our noodle soups. We sat at the bar and watched the noodles being made. A great experience.

ZZfRiCD5IYx_EEJTVy-ylw.text: My wife had the seafood noodle soup along with pork and cabbage dumplings.  They were both very good.  The noodles were made fresh and tasted like it.  The broth was very flavorful.  Good sized portions.  My Yang Zhou fried rice was perfect!  The rice was tender, the meat not overcooked, the flavor was delicious.  The service was good.    Like the Terminator, I'll be back.

AI8ShmEJevBxKLYkIA9tcQ.text: Love the noodles! Place is simple and very clean. Staff is very helpful and friendly. Very good food and portion for the $$ you pay Staff is pleasant i would suggest them to add shape and pics of their noodles, the first time there i had no clue and couldn't picture the noodle i wanted... knife cut, is flat and large as your little finger lol hand pulled is the size of regular chow mein both shape are yummy yummy variety of braised beef, chunk beef, chicken, pork for Mushroom lovers try the wet noodle mushrooms it's to die for. appetizers runs about $5/$6, cucumber salad (i wasn't impressed, the dressing was like a paste of something. i would rather get some vinegar and oil) dumplings are fresh and very tasty, prepared by that "elderly" man, i enjoy watching him preparing the dumplings or noodles  so time i feel like a stalker but he prepare the  dumplings and noodles with such grace that i can spend hours watching him if i could.  i usually order their organic iced tea. the other day i just ordered some water and was very surprised that the water was infused with some cucumber, it leaves a very pleasant taste :) all their drinks are bottled  service is fast even during rush hours. they close fairly "late" 11pm  shang artisan noodles is one of my favorite noodle place. healthy and yummy

HvnVZcNiPot358RqG1DyHw.text: I absolutely love the culture of this spot and the food is beyond delicious. It was so good I had to have it again. Its so fun to watch the noodles being made, so i sit at the bar to have entertainment while I eat. There are also tables along the wall also. Super cute place, friendly and super fast service. Can get packed, but they usually have a fast client turn over.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EX2VkIJ0VxGduFguL-FiJQ.text: The 1+ hour wait was worth it!!  The broth in the Shang Beef Noodle was rich and so full of flavor!! Lots of beef too. Could have had a bit more vegetables though.  The stir-fried noodle was so good, my SO (NOT a noodle person) ate almost the entire pile!!

a_NOgdv7JrmG6qX-on4bPQ.text: I came back here recently close to closing and the noodles were not as good as I remember. The noodles tasted like the dough was sitting for a while and it was too soft with no chewiness.  Not really impressed anymore. I prefer other places for fresh handpulled noodles now.

QtnWRplM86iOhxBoXxJsTQ.text: We really enjoyed this place!  We ordered the cucumber salad, beef pancakes, their beef noodle soup w/ hand pulled noodles and their chicken and mushroom noodle with chef noodle.   -The cucumber salad was refreshing.   -The beef pancakes was served immediately off the frying pan so it was hot but also really good.  They have sauces on the table side for you. -The beef noodle soup was what I expected (really good).  The hand pulled noodles was soft and bouncy.  I thoroughly enjoyed it. -The chicken and mushroom noodle was good.  It was served in a sauce that I can't describe.  Not as good as the beef noodle soup.  We came here Saturday noon time for lunch and it was about a 20 minutes wait.  We took a Lyft here but there looks to be ample parking.

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5OMyFXVXLrKf7rXp9RpTKg.text: Hand pulled noodles are definitely the way to go here.  I normally enjoy knife cut noodles but they are a little too thick for my liking at Shang.  Beef pancakes are fantastic - nice and juicy with flavorful meat interior and a crispy dough exterior.    I prefer din tai fung's spicy wontons to Shang, but they were good if that's your thing.   Not spicy enough for me...so added lots of chili oil.  The Shang beef noodle soup was excellent, but as I mentioned before, the hand pulled noodles are better - my BF got them so I stole a few bites.

9NEb7g7HXOrRdT8drkuTOw.text: This place is a must dine. Noodles are  made fresh and pulled in front of you. It is a small place and wait time can be long sometimes, we got lucky and only waited 20 min. I personally liked the hand pulled noodles because it had a chewy texture and it was cool to see them make the noodles also. Kids loved the Beef pancakes. I really enjoyed all of the food but my go to was the Spicy wontons.

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef and Onion pancakes

llHzbZu6q39bc1jKxABSLw.text: So some friends were in town and one of them actually told me about Shang Artisan Noodle. She actually heard from another friend who said it was worth going to and we needed to hit it up. It doesn't take much to convince me to eat some noodles so before we knew it we all hopped in a midsized Subaru and tore off towards the strip.  Shang's is in a small-ish plaza, but is pretty easy to find. I noticed that it had a banner outside proudly declaring "NOW OPEN". Isn't it funny how a lot of restaurants out in Vegas seem to have that "NOW OPEN" banner above their doors even if they've been "NOW OPEN" for over a year? It's kind of like how Kohl's always seems to always have a sale going on where they can offer you 30% off sweaters then after you buy everyone in your family a sweater (including nana) they throw Kohl's cash at you too? What? How does their business model work? Either their sweaters dissolve when wet or the sale or "Now Open" banner is some kind of gimmick.   Anyways I digress.... Oh wait! One more...what's the deal with Bed Bath and Beyond and their cardboard coupons they mail you every month that give you like $10 off purchase of $50 that you can use even after their expiration date?  Anyhow, Shangs.....We went on a Friday afternoon between lunch and dinner so it wasn't too crowded. Busy, but we were seated immediately. The ambiance was nice. I liked that you can see a tired young man, let's call him Philippe, behind a glass wall twirling and pulling fresh noodles and another older guy, let's call him Reggie, cooking up said noodles for various customer orders. It gave the impression of "fresh" or we couldn't afford a wall so we put in a window to save on construction costs.  Anyways, here's what we ordered and what I thought about them:  Cucumber Salad - Meh. The cucumbers were fresh and the sesame sauce was sweet, but overall it wasn't really anything to write home about. You can skip this one and save precious stomach space for something else. Spicy Wonton (Hot) - This was delicious. It wasn't really spicy, but spiciness is kind of subjective. The wontons tasted great and the last one didn't get soggy so its structural integrity never came into question. Pork Belly Noodle - GET THIS! WOW this was really tasty. If you like pork this will not disappoint. If you don't like pork get this anyways and you may become a believer. The pork pieces were generous and marinated thoroughly. I got the hand pulled noodles because I wanted to ensure that  Philippe's future employment remained secure. The noodles tasted great! Not too starchy, not too soft, and just the right chewiness. The bok-choy tossed in complimented the dish well. Dan-Dan Noodle (HOT) - This was spicy. Good, but since it's more of a sauce noodle and I lean toward soup noodles it's ranked lower than the Pork Belly Noodle. I also prefer my pork in bigger chunks and not minced. Pork and Cabbage Pot Stickers - Meh...these were okay. Better and way fresher than the ones you'd get from the frozen food section of the 99Ranch, but okay overall. Like the cucumber salad you can skip these and save stomach real estate for something else.  Overall the late lunch was pretty satisfying. I'll definitely hit up Shang's again if I'm not in the mood for Ramen, but the Pork Belly Noodle was so good that I think depending on how I felt I'd probably prefer it over Ramen. So I guess it'd be like weather dependent - Cold, rainy, gloomy then you go Japanese Ramen (Sora, Monta Raman, or Ramen Tatsu). Mild, sunny "casual shorts and T-shirt" weather then you go Shang Artisan Noodle.

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Rib Noodle - great, but too many bones to have to fish out even though the meat melted off the bone.
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Rib Noodle - hand pulled noodles. This is really tasty, but go with the pork belly version since you&#39;ll get more meat.

c1znJaIVxo-kCzzR0rZ8dA.text: The menu is not big, and the restaurant is quite small, but the flavors are living large! The food is authentic and the quality of the freshly-made noodles is obvious. Prices are a bit on the higher side, but portions are fair and the food is very tasty.  Service has been excellent on all of my visits here, and the interior is very clean and modern. Highly recommend for a tasty affordable meal!

fs6mfZH4_MaV58cHLNK4Qg.text: Food and service was good.  The price and portion was good also.  The restaurant is a little cramped.

7bvJ6zIygpEsvptcFarikw.text: Super good! The noodle is soft and strong. All dishes we orders are tasty. Worth a visit here even its far from city

owQo8mhmoZe9TkkioCr46Q.text: The dreaded "I wanted to love this place but...." I didn't.  Overhype rarely matches expectations and I would say it is a perfect example here.  To be clear, nothing was bad, it just didn't WOW or scream 4-5 Star awesomeness.  The best aspect for sure are the fresh noodles.  Then the beef in the Shang Noodles were tender and tasty.  From there, it drops.  The broth is surely not of the taiwanese deep beefy taste nor spicy, so be warned and you my like it better here.  It was a-ok and slightly sweet.  As the lower reviews note, the beef pancake while comes pipin hot and juicy, lacks flavor.  It's quite forgettable.  The spicy wontons are just way too small and seems like they try and hide that fact with a strong pepper lacing.  The sauce was also sweeter then I prefer.  Surely I am jaded as we eat this type of fair all over Taiwan, Hong Kong, and Asia.  The prices here are decent which reminded me of mom and pop joints in Asia, but it won't match the taste if you have the same type of expectations.  Great and happy service here to be sure.  Bright, and clean joint.  Glad this place is great for many many people, but surely it will miss for many others.

pYOi9c7mhGEYq5m1xAnorw.text: Spicy won ton!!!!!  You've got to order the SPICY WON TON.  It is delicious and probably the best won ton I've ever had.  I followed this up with the chicken chow Mein with knife cut noodles.  The portion is generous and the chicken and noodles were perfectly cooked and seasoned.    Shang Artisan Noodle is a gem.  Located in a small strip mall with minimal parking, the dining room is always full when I eat here.  If you're dining during peak hours, expect to wait outside.    The wait staff is friendly and the appetizers and entrees are served promptly.  The dining area is casual and the noise level is low.    You will love eating here, it's a must try.

JlOt-GzthJCBfM9eQCKczA.text: A place I've been wanting to try just minutes away from the Las Vegas Strip. Upon arrival they only had the bar available. Given I had two kids, we opted out and waited for a table. The wait was minimal, only waiting about 10 minutes. We ordered their famous beef pancakes, beef & onion potstickers, Shang beef noodle, pork rib noodle and the chicken chow mein. My Husband and I didn't care for their appetizers. They are nothing what others raved about. Their soup on the other hand was delicious! Full of fresh pulled noodles and amazing broth. The serving size is very decent - plenty for two people.

4rC_kr00QsAZUe_b3qGE4w.text: We got lucky with the wait here and the servers were friendly. I would give this placer overall 3.5 stars but 4 stars for noodles only.  We got the sliced beef shank, beef pot stickers, Shang beef noodle, and pork belly noodle. The beef shank is lacking in flavor and dry. The pot stickers were pan fried dumplings (yes, there's a difference). The pork belly noodle was with knife noodle and the only downfall was the pork belly was a bit overcooked. The Shang beef noodle was with pulled noodle and probably one of the best noodle soup I had in USA so far.  I would definitely come back to try other items and would recommend to others.

KD01BdsJrLzTOvR1L5UJUA.text: We came here based on Yelp reviews, and this place was marked as must go place since my hubby and I love noodles! We are obsessed with hand pulled noodles! The flavor of the noodle soup was rich and delicious. I was happy they have hot sauce and vinegar on the table for customers to add more flavor. The cucumber salad was fresh! The beef pancakes were a little smaller than my expectations but flavor was good! I would come here everyday if I live in Las Vegas!

gMCSGuOri6YVXZ5h830gow.text: Wow. WOW. That beef noodle soup broth was perfect. Having been to Taiwan almost every other year growing up, I can say that this beef broth was special. I kid you not, I drank that whole bowl of soup dry. The beef brisket was tender and had a generous portion of it. Boy choy added a nice touch and was the perfect amount of crunch. I opted for hand pulled noodles and it was amazing to see your noodles being made in front of you. To be honest, these hand-pulled noodles weren't my preference of choice but still was great.   The beef pancake was delicious, as well. Be aware of the amount of soup/juice held inside when you take the first bite.   Spicy wonton was good. The wrapper was the special super thin type and was made well. The meat was good too, but my preference is more meat like Din Tai Fung's. The sauce had a spicy kick to it and again, this comes down to preference, but I do like Din Tai Fung's spicy wontons better.  However, that beef noodle soup sold me. I even told my parents about it later because it was that good. I will definitely be back.  Also, service was great! The young man was attentive and friendly. Ambiance and presentation of everything was great with wooden tables and chairs, quality wooden chopsticks and spoons. Bathrooms were clean and there's two big outside picnic tables for the waiting. Pricing is reasonable too. I'll see you again, Shang!

6qxbd3D8s8xReGVr99irZg.text: Wow! Some of the best noodles I've ever had! And such a value! Glad we drove 300 miles for your noodles!

VJZqf1iEjW2bQps_uIMl2A.text: This place is sooooooo good. Probably the best beef noodle soup I've ever had. So good, we came again two days after trying it for the first time. We got the classic soup with hand pulled noodles. The beef pancakes were so so, might be a lot to share. The cucumber salad is really refreshing and tasty (peanut butter based sauce). The spicy dumplings go really well with the soup!

3MfGoDD39I_v3ALDvbdkuA.text: I was skeptical that there would be a good asian restaurant so close to the Strip, but the skepticism was quickly shot down once I started eating.  I came here with a couple girl friends and I got to try their dan dan noodles and the beef noodle soup. While the dan dan noodles were great, the beef noodle soup was truly phenomenal - complex flavors, tender beef, and chewy, wide noodles. The portions were also quite large for the price-point, and the service was friendly and efficient.   The perfect trifecta - excellent food, fair prices, and big portions. Definitely worth a visit!

P6OwTtkr4cvM-BInHvMGeA.text: A friend of mine couldn't decide on what she wanted to eat and randomly found this place. We ordered the pork and cabbage pot stickers, which we were told might take longer than expected. I ordered the chicken chow mein and my friend decided on pork rib noodle soup. Chow Mein and Noodle soup came out quickly and we were both happy with the dishes.  Great flavors, tender meat, and the noodles were amazing. When the pot stickers arrived we enjoyed them as well, although they weren't as flavored as the main dishes. I would come back again.

AagolpKwPBUoeJjTxirCNQ.text: Long overdue review.  Agree with all the positive posts; the only thing I can contribute that hasn't been addressed yet (as far as I have read) is...  It's a CLEAN, non typical Asian restaurant. I'm Asian, but I can't do "authentic" Asian restaurants, they skeeve me out and I can't enjoy the food when the interior is dirty/not modern/however you want to describe it, everyone knows what I mean.  It's located in a sketchy neighborhood, in a sketchy plaza, but the inside is nice and clean and has an overall nice vibe.  Other than that, I can only repeat what all the other Yelpers have to say, good food, reasonably priced, very quick to come out, servers are nice and attentive. Luckily for us, we have never had to wait very long...we must have great timing.

ABJjdDH_3b1GXxPwInEZmQ.text: Best beef noodle soup bar none. The chunks of beef was tender and melts in your mouth. It is well balanced with veggies to take the heaviness of the soup and noodles. Extra points for having some awesome chili paste. I haven't had any that tastes just as good as the chili pastes I get back home in Oakland CA. Beware of the long lines and wait time as this is a small location with very limited seating.

oNTAL-eCjnot9aSNH18WRQ.text: Dont think this place gonna be my go to for Chinese noodle. Went there on Saturday night. The place was pack, but we are lucky, there wasn't too many customer in front of us.  We got sat and couple minutes later the waiter come around and ready to take our order. Great, cos we are hungry. We order the shang beef stew and seafood noodle. We also order spicy wonton as our app.  Food came out pretty quick. Love it! We tried the food. First bite, second bite. Slurp the soup, slurp again. Nahhh.... this restaurant just not for meh. The soup too bland for me. But the beef stew was perfect.  The waiter never came back to check on us after he dropped the noodles but The bill came out right before I finished my meal. That's mean he paid attention only to make us to leave because there was so many customer waiting on the list. Oh, one thing. We were to hungry that we dont even bother to complain that there was a hair on our spicy wonton.

JCWvTK5qyLYKk9EAbKvN7A.text: Came here for dinner around 8:30 PM on a Monday and the place was fairly busy.   They are located in a small shopping strip.  Walked in and waited to be seated however no one at the host stand and servers were busy catering to the customers until I finally flagged someone down and said I just need a seat for one and was promptly seated at the bar where there were plenty of open spots.   Rocky start at the beginning but customer service got alot better once seated.     Was quickly greeted and I placed my order.    The sliced beef shank first came out, within a few minutes and there were several slices on the plate with a Balsamic sauce.   It was tasty and reminded me of traditional Chinese style beef like this.  It is served cold, and firm yet easy enough to pull apart.   Hard to describe.     Next up came the hand pulled pork belly noodles.  Great noodles and the large chunks of pork belly were tasty.  Generous portion in the bowl and I actually put some of the shank beef in my soup.    Broth was good and server made sure to check up on me more than once and also kept my water cup full.   Definitely kudos for coming to check on me throughout my meal.     Great place to check out if you are in the area.

WBNee_hwqEzHGh1wiiUDqg.text: Delicious. Delicate. Bold.  We had the chicken mushroom knife shaved noodles and chicken chow mein this time and it was excellent. Best chicken chow mein I've had. I love that the water has a hint of cucumber. It's the details. Yummy

pmDZk00iQU-tF5kU5dlmjw.text: Visit here every time we visit Vegas. It's been about my 6th visit and I have to attest that their taste is very consistent. Consistency is very important for any restaurant to hold up after opening for awhile. Hence really the reason why I'm giving this place 4 stars.   Great place to dine and get that craving or homey taste, comfort food out of the way. Taste, service, decor, cleanliness and friendly staff is on point. They don't take reservations but line goes pretty fast. It's a small store front with bar seating and as well as tables.

1QZnbFOg5DeqU53Z4TUwyw.text: My family was in town for the day, and we came here based on my brother's yelp research. There was a mild wait when we got there, which I usually take as a good sign that the place makes good food.   I ordered the pork belly noodle with pulled noodles. My mom got the pork rib with regular noodles. My brother for the beef shank with pulled noodles, and my boyfriend got the Shang beef with knife cut noodles. The best part about having a larger party means I can try out more than just one dish. I personally think the best broth was pork and chicken.  It's so flavorful and complex. The beef broth is good, but the pork and chicken is better. All types of noodles were great, even the regular noodles. I think the best noodles surprisingly was the knife cut noodles. They're thicker thin noodles, so the broth has more surface area to attach to.   If I'm ever in the area again, I'll definitely come back.

yi6fyJAg1vbZEPKpHnlCjg.text: A solid place for quality chinese beef noodle soup. Not mind blowing, but definitely decent!  The Shang Braised Beef Noodle Soup has a deep flavor without being too salty or oily, which is a fatal flaw of many beef noodle soups. Just one scoop of the house chili sauce really elevated the flavor as well! I loved the knife cut noodles, but they could have had a bit more "chew" to them.  The Beef Shank Noodle Soup is a clear broth and therefore lighter. It still tastes good, but if you're a fan of bolder/meatier flavors, I would recommend sticking with the Shang Braised Beef Noodle Soup.

5BWmmQJbcRTO2RX2NBmu3A.text: So I had been wanting to give this place second chance since so many people seem to like it.  I also had been having hardcore beef noodle soup cravings, and the last time I went somewhere they fell short on the broth.   I remembered enjoying the broth the last time I came here, it was more the noodle execution and meat portion that had fallen flat.  I was determined that last time was a fluke, and I would experience the sheer joy everyone else seems to be from this place.  I tend to hold a lot of stock in a well developed broth,  so I had hope.   I asked the difference between the braised beef and the beef shank soup.  The broth is deeper in the braised beef and there is more meat.  My goal was to have more meat,  so I hoped for the best by choosing the braised beef.   I also tried the hand pulled instead of knife cut noodles this time.  The broth is still super yummy here, the noddles were a little better too this time around, and most importantly there was more meat for sure.   I still have had better noodles at another business in town, but overall prefer this locations soup.  Currently I feel they have the best beef soup in las Vegas.

GdHX5MOVT4lpqiKRwSMCOQ.text: Who doesn't like noodles?!  Especially when they're made freshly on site.  You can see the chef making the noodles through the open kitchen.    Shang Artisan Noodle is located in a small plaza next to a boba shop and Thai restaurant.  We were craving some comfort food since it was a chilly Saturday afternoon.    So glad we decided to eat somewhere off the LV strip.  This noodle restaurant is small so expect a wait during certain times.  We were seated within 10 minutes even during the lunch rush.  The staff are so friendly.  They checked on us many times during our meal.    We ordered: Shang beef noodle and the Peking wonton soup both with hand pulled noodles.   The broth for the beef noodle was savory.   The wonton soup had a lighter broth but still tasty.  We enjoyed our lunch to the last slurp.    Will definitely come back whenever we're in town again!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peking wonton soup + hand pulled noodles. ~good!
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang Beef Noodle ~delish!

cj0peEA_nfnWQ06UbF509g.text: I wasn't impressed. In LA, we have so many choices available from dan-dan noodles to Chongqing to ramen and everything in between that I'm not sure this place would even rank anywhere as high here as it does in Vegas.  People raving about this place like it's something amazing boggles my mind all because, what, you can see the noodles being made in front of you? Bro, places like that are scattered throughout our Chinese ethoburbs in SoCal. C'mon now.  The wait was ridiculous for something this average. The texture of the noodles were good but the overall flavors weren't there. My husband got the Seafood Noodle, which was bland and pretty disappointing. I ordered their Dan-Dan Noodles- too salty, partly because there were barely any noodles to balance out all that sauce. The portions are just stingy in general.  Maybe I should've gotten more popular items but if this is supposed to be such an awesome place, shouldn't everything taste good? The service was solid and quick but I probably won't be back.

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Noodle- rather boring.

HqyYBzC2biUXbAkMDydcUA.text: Location - very close to the LV strip  Parking - can be a challenge when Shang is full of customers   Price - $  Service - very efficient   Food - those hand pulled noodles are addictive. The beef noodles is a must. The spicy wontons is a must while waiting for the noodles. Don't brush off the chow mein, those hand pull noodles again makes a big difference.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 Year Anniversary

RoPh6vULHubRmabn0JoHFQ.text: Vegas' Chinatown may not be as aesthetically pleasing nor have as much history as SF's, but it sure as hell has a lot tastier restaurants.  While the Strip itself has such great restaurants, I've always wished that I was able to venture off the Strip more to get tastier food and more for my money. Luckily, I still have one close friend that lives in Vegas, so when we're able to meet up sometimes we spend time off the Strip.    She picked me up from the airport and it was perfect timing and asked what I wanted to eat for lunch.  I asked if we could go to Spring Mountain since there were some noodle places I wanted to try.  She agreed and the restaurant opened a few minutes before we arrived.  There were already two tables occupied and in no time it was full.    It was a breezy cold day so I knew that noodle soup was the way to go.  I asked the waiter his recommendation between the beef soup and the pork belly and he said definitely the beef.  I usually prefer other noodle soups over beef, but have been seeing all the drool worthy beef pics, plus I did ask him for his opinion.  We both ended up getting the beef noodle soup and shared the potstickers and spicy wontons.  She got the hand pulled noodles while I got the knife cut noodles.  We actually got our wontons and potstickers after our noodles, so not ideal, but that's ok.  The broth was well flavored, lots of depth and didn't feel oily and the beef was tender and moist.  Nothing beats fresh homemade noodles!  While their knife cut noodles were good, mine ended up being more knife shaved short noodles vs. the longer strands of knife cut or Biang Biang noodles that I've seen on others' Yelp photos and Instagram accounts.  The bowl also came with bok choy and a lot of green onions.  I was amused as I watched my friend who hates green onions pick all of them out of her bowl.  To be fair, the menu did not note this, so be aware there's green onions oh plenty in most of their dishes I believe.  I think one of things I always wish with beef noodle soup was that the muscley connective tissue part could be removed before serving to make it easier to eat.  I'm not a Taiwanese beef noodle soup connoisseur at all, but I'd have to say the best I've had is at Bing's in Fremont, CA, but Shang Artisan's is trailing just behind.  I really enjoyed their crispy AF bottom potstickers and their chili wontons were perfect, and packed a punch.    We were stuffed and had to take leftovers of the potstickers and chili wontons back to my hotel room.  The noodle dishes were under $10 and the dumplings were under $6, so it's super wallet friendly and delicious.  Shang Artisan I'll definitely try to come back next trip out and would love to try some other noodle dishes.  Shang Artisan, can you consider opening up location number 2 in the Bay?  I'd visit you more than my local noodle spot, I promise!

xClMHNq4kbPfuPKuB1TyTQ.text: Yeah, I tried to get a cheap meal in Vegas and still spent over $40.  I'm not really sure why we went to Shang Artisan Noodles.  We have a few noodle shops in Southern California that hand pulls their noodles.  We arrived at about 7PM.  We were seated after about 10 minutes at the bar with a great view of the noodle maker himself.  We ordered their pork belly noodles, a beef stew noodle, beef pancake, and a pan fried dumping.  The food came out pretty quick.  The noodles were okay.  My wife and daughter thought the pork belly noodles had a sweet, not in a good way, flavor to it.  The beef stew noodles were decent.  I've had better in Socal.  The noodles were okay, it seemed starchy and like a white flour overload to me.  The pork belly noodles made the beef stew taste good.  Pan fried dumplings were unique in presentation, but okay.  The beef pancake was a nice juicy mess.  They were good.  But they exploded when you bit into it and ruined a vacation shirt on my first night. It's an okay place if you want Chinese northern noodles.

iNIKkx3q7V2NrSARzaIxkQ.text: I stopped in for lunch and was hoping to taste some really good fresh noodles.  unfortunately it was not up to par and was just a soggy limp mess.  not sure what all the hype is about and there was no line to get into this place at lunch time.

Jq6AeLm70lIYRUjluIfTbQ.text: Wow. This place was hopping! We waited about 30 minutes for a table, and people were coming nonstop. Wait staff was running around non-stop. Amazingly enough they were able to turn the tables over quickly and were friendly and inviting despite how busy things were. The food was awesome!! We got hand pulled noodles with braised pork, wontons and hand pulled noodles, and dumplings. Best I've had in the US - only place I've gone that rivals it is a small hole in the wall in NYC. But this place was clean and the food was light - not greasy. Noodles and dumpling skin were awesome - chewy - and flavors were outstanding. Definitely worth the wait!

rnKFlP7DSybR6clAf3v66g.text: We were in town for the rugby tournament and saw this place by our hotel. Wow great food, great prices and wonderful staff. Everything less than $9.00. The whole family tried something different and loved all the dishes.

f6eUaAjiOoosS-yLtz_A9g.text: Easily the best Chinese noodle shop in Las Vegas!  I just had the Spinach Knife Shaved Noodle with Pork Belly - heavenly!  Authentic handmade noodles and super fresh ingredients in perfect balance.  Must go again!

D49vIvVdZkqoRBsy27ekjw.text: One of the best noodle houses I've ever been too! Great prices and great food! Would come here again!

m2xgoQW2rWqbA7xBxT3KSw.text: The service was incredible! The staff were attentive without being overbearing.  The food was excellent! I tried pan fried noodles, dumplings and hand tossed noodles. All of the dishes were prepared quickly and the flavors were well balanced and unique.  I will definitely recommend to friends and family!

VZ9PdFmntMieJ6Z_0XiCZA.text: I am from Taiwan and I can tell you that this place is amazing. The beef noodle soup is. It only delicious but also cheap! Those beef pancakes are phenomenal! Be careful when you eat them! Highly recommended!

Y4PiMURr7SpW9nVzs3S6dA.text: This is the first time I had been here and it was amazing! the hand pulled and knife shaved noodles are made fresh and you can taste the difference. We had beef and onion dumplings and they are made to order and steamed the flavor is explosive! We also had pork rib noodle soup the broth was far better than I expected I could eat it every day. Also got a chicken and mushroom noodle bowl with pulled noodles the baby bok choy was so buttery and melt in your mouth and the sausa was savory it was simply delightful. We also ordered  peking zah-jiang noodle with shaved noodles I can't believe how good this was the sauce was outstanding. I wish I lived a little closer I would eat here all the time. And the prices are so reasonable! love love love this place.

eaXp1bt_UZ_cApXzuWT02w.text: There's good effort put into an authentic hand-pulled/knife-cut noodle, but ultimately misses the mark. That being said, the noodles are still al dente and tasty, and so are the broths and fillings. However, the servings are a tad small. A solid "sometimes" choice.

lCbnjppVBpPtmDSj_MM04g.text: The noodles were great. I got the pork rib hand pulled noodles, spicey wonton and potstickers. The pot stickers were big and plentiful, I took those home as left overs. I the future I think I would just order the soup and no appetizers

YRnBpAyDJRSwt-eD7fkasg.text: I tried 3 different soups, seafood, pork belly and beef. They were all super delicious, nice clean place and the guys make and prepare the noodles in front of us. It was also a bit entertaining to see the noodle making process. Thumbs up!

_r0RI8SUvH3QjV3QQVT3Qg.text: An absolutely amazing food experience! Spicy wontons and anything with hand pulled noodles is a must!  Although the restaurant is unassuming from the outside, once inside you are immediately greeted with a full open kitchen where you can watch the noodles being hand made, a True art form in itself.   Most importantly though, the bold and unique flavors of the various dishes are definitely worth a visit!

7E7E38vRo5OyU0bvbQpAvw.text: This is a cool new place especially just for Chinese noodles. You usually see japanese ramen shops but rarely do you find a place that focuses only on noodle soup.

c073TEvCmX1uVJFCYrxaug.text: At Shang Artisan noodle, I really enjoyed the spicy wantons and beef pancakes as an appetizer and for the main course I would recommend Shang beef noodle soup with knife-shaved noodles or hand-pulled noodles. The Dan Dan noodle sauce was a bit spicy but if you would rather have more noodle and minced pork than a broth soup, it's the way to go. My only disappointment was the space in the restaurant and parking arrangements. If you can look past that and the quality of the food alone, I would give 5 stars. Their location however definitely needs an improvement as soon as they are able. Visit here and you won't be disappointed.

jU-Hc1E4rTmQfwKsVsIBQQ.text: Delicious food. Definite try the Shang beef noodle. Hand pulled noodle is the best!! Broth is amazing, beef is really tender!

qphoG7b0MMG77wWHR0pVRA.text: Excellent food. The spicy wontons are amazing!! The broth in the beef noodle soup is delicious!!!

zqUnco_K_0psrGSgMfOa_A.text: Really enjoyed the authentic Chinese cuisine there. I don't really write any reviews but this one place is worth my time just because they have my fav Chinese Jajiangmian (fried sauce noodle) not like the typical Korean black bean noodle that sweet, it's savory meat sauce pair very well with knife shaved noodles and assorted veggies. This is so far the only place in Vegas I've seen that has this dish yet so authentic and delicious!!!!   Service is also very warm and fuzzy so def worth a try !!!!!!

kOScyM-WXZFzoedCqWaJ_g.text: The noodles are so silky smooth! Very sexy! Lol however after eating at the brick n mortar I ordered some for lunch "to go" and the sexy went to sticky gummy noodles even though the flavor was delicious.

Jgi9lS58UWsbMnYTRBcd1Q.text: Absolutely delicious with high quality ingredients and, for a casual restaurant, a cool vibe.  Our waiter couldn't have been nicer or more knowledgeable.  This is a great, inexpensive restaurant with wonderful food.

E1f9yfgvNTXX0FBN5LJf3w.text: Great food. Knife carved is a little too thick for my liking but the brisket one is my fav along with pork belly

3WEjlODGs7llw18k_FdvnA.text: Shang specializes in Chinese noodles, and boy, they do not disappoint. They have an open kitchen, and their noodle making magic is on full display. The chef or the cook is doing all sorts of tricks with the noodle dough, twisting and turning it like a giant accordion.   On to the actual noodles themselves...Tried the beef noodle soup and the Dan Dan noodles both with the hand pulled noodles. The beef noodle soup was solid. The noodles had the right texture and consistency but not the most flavorful broth that I've had. I really enjoyed the Dan Dan noodles. The minced pork combined with the sichuan peppers produced quite an explosive flavor. Also tried the spicy wontons and Shang fried rice, and they were both delicious. The spicy wontons could have been spicier though, and the fried rice actually tastes a lot better than it looks.   They serve complimentary watermelon water which adds a nice touch to the overall dining experience. Very clean, modern place with attentive yet unobtrusive service. Will definitely be back for those Dan Dan noodles.

e70g07LTzThDwW1kPV8d8g.text: Loved the noodles omg I I wish I lived closer I would be a regular, oh well another vacation perk to come back for right lol.

1p4PBmocCraijBoTY5jOuA.text: First time here, we wanted to get something to eat before we hit the road. And we ordered the following items:   Cucumber salad, interesting presentation but not bad. Shang beef noodle, the broth was good nothing else stands out. Dan Dan noodle - not spicy enough. Personally, I didn't care for the knife shaved noodle either. Peking wonton soup - broth didn't taste that good to me. Peking zag-Jiang noodles - was ok. Pot sticker - ok  Overall experience was good, nice clean place, ok food, but nothing stands out for me to return (I'm sorry).

awQLtRcTgVekDVpN23mAkQ.text: I love this place! The food was great and I loved the show element.  My friend and I both started with the tea which is a house blend. We really liked the flavor. For a starter we shared the Spicy Wonton appetizer. The homemade noodles definitely stood out on this dish. The wonton was delicate and the flavor was perfection. The spice level was perfect.   I had the Shang Beef Noodle Soup with knife-shaved noodles. My friend went with the Pork Belly Noodle Soup with hand-pulled noodles. The hand-pulled noodles resembled udon noodles while the knife-shaved noodles were thicker and wider. Both were delicious! My Beef Noodle Soup was a great dish. Everything in the soup tasted fresh and there were generous amounts of noodles and beef. The bok choy, cilantro, and green onion were delicious with the noodles and beef. There was enough to save for lunch the next day.   The inside of the restaurant is very clean and the decor is minimal. All seating options allow for watching the food being prepared. Seating options include tables and counter seating next to the kitchen. Pricing is more than reasonable for the quality and fresh nature of the food.   Our server was excellent. He was great with answering questions and took great care of us. As the night went on the restaurant filled quickly, but he kept up with everyone well. Most importantly, he made sure our delicious tea never ran out.  I'm already looking forward to my return to enjoy more of the delicious food!

gGIiICNn1a_YDdscc7UQtA.text: I'm more like a ventured eater who likes to explores new food places and rarely stick to one place after the first try. But I came back to Shang twice within a month, which said a lot! I have tried the Dan Dan Noodle which is more like pasta with meat sauce, the Spicy Wonton which is fresh and flavorful, yet the Beef Shang Noodle is actually the one that got my heart! Had it in a chilled fall evening and what an experience it was! The soup has a rich beef flavor and it carries just enough of spice to blend in perfectly with the hand-pulled noodle (highly recommend this kind of noodle over others since it's more chewy! ). Oh and I also tried the beef dumplings, didn't know they were panfried, so when the dish came out, we were shocked!! It looked super appealing with crunchy skin and fresh fillings. Anyway, really great experience there, the servers were attentive too! Keep up the good work!
