FjOpFTgeNvT8GPS9x8p8mw.text: Not much to say.   The ambiance is fun and authentic. They are making the noodles right in front of you - it's fun to watch. The food is amazing. The potstickers literally burst with flavor. The spicy wantons were sublime. The broth was so rich and flavorful.  The pork belly was tender and the fat was creamy. The price is surprisingly low.

IzWLVIUH3NfI571_y-Fsmw.text: This place is worth a try!  It's located near the busy intersection of Decatur and W. Flamingo not far from the Strip.  We came right before noon so parking was fairly easy.  This was our first time here.    SERVICE:  Good, very nice, attentive, drinks and food came out in a timely manner.   FOOD:  We ordered the Spicy Wonton, Shang Beef Noodle soup with hand pulled noodles, and Pork Belly Noodle soup with hand pulled noodles.   Spicy Wonton - Nothing spectacular but not bad.  Wonton skin's and meat were cooked nicely, the sauce (tasted like a combination of Chinkiang vinegar/soy sauce/chili oil/topped with scallions) was a bit too tart and sweet for my liking but not bad.  I think a little bit more meat on the wonton's could improve this dish.   Shang Beef Noodles - Very good!  Good portion size.  The broth appears dark and rich but was definitely very subtle with good flavor.  The hand pulled noodles were cooked perfectly, nice and al dente.  Beef was very tender and delicious.  Recommended!  Pork Belly Noodles  - Good.  Just like the Shang Beef Noodles, portion size was good, broth also appeared dark and rich but was actually very light and subtle.  Broth had good flavor (reminiscence of a chinese pork/egg dish my mom made growing up).  Noodles were on point again.  Some pieces of pork belly were tough and some tender.  All and all, it was good but we'll probably try a different dish in the future.   The bill came out to be about $33 with tip, definitely not bad at all!  Look forward to coming back here again!!

8ti7mWwn8BMWIg_2x6Rb5w.text: Noodles are homemade and cooked perfectly. Came here with a group of 16 and we were surprisingly seated fast. I had a taste of about 1/3 of the menu and they were all really google. Their appetizers, too. I honestly don't think you can go wrong with any dishes here. I'm more amazed to know that all of my noodles were hand made. A must try when visiting LV area and craving good authentic Taiwanese food. Give it a try!

QlJMtV600km-nAIGQo4Arg.text: My friend was talking about handmade noodles and I've never had it, so I figured I give it a try. I am glad I had it at this place! Probably the best thing about this place is that it is affordable. We got three appetizers. I can't really remember all three, but the spicy wontons was a must have! I got the Shang beef noodle and it was great, as well as filling! Definitely hold off on getting extra noodle/broth at the start. They are generous with their offering.

mbgJuD04zvg-gpNuIUc2XQ.text: This restaurant is excellent! The food is outstanding, the servers so kind and helpful and the restaurant is very clean! The beef and onion potstickers are so flavor filled! The entrees are so delicious I can't wait to go back! Large portions for a great price!

iWNilPfwrzAhDwQXhc8phA.text: Shang's commitment to quality ingredients, friendly service, and reasonable pricing will hopefully have more eyeballs looking their way soon.  I would go here over Noodle Man any day of the week.  One standout is their freshly made "Spicy Wonton" appetizer, which offers a comfortable heat that is accessible to most palettes.  I loved the silkiness of the wonton skin as my teeth broke into the delightfully, juicy pork center.  I also enjoyed the thick skinned "Beef Pancake" (eat these in small bites or the juice WILL shoot out the other side!) and the fantastic "Beef & Onion potsticker".  Those deep fried "potstickers" you've been eating elsewhere?  Total garbage!!!!  Their signature noodle soup, "Shang Beef Noodle", was sumptuous.  Not spicy or robust like the Taiwanese version, but the beefy flavor I sought was well pronounced.  That had everything to do with the braised beef brisket combined with all that delicious bone marrow broth.  And THEN there were all those hand pulled noodles underneath it all!!  Slurp after slurp, bite after bite...wonderful.     Other items:  Sliced Beef Shank: Served chilled and topped with balsamic vinegar sauce, this was another great starter.  I appreciated the tender and slightly gelatinous texture.  Shang Fried Rice: The preserved bean sprouts were the dominating flavor, which may not be a hit with fans of Americanized Chinese, so the Yang-Zhou version would probably be preferable.  I liked it, but it's not for everyone.  Cucumber Salad:  The combination of cool cucumber, tasty sesame sauce and the slight heat of chili oil on the bottom was a winning combination.    On my "to eat" list for future visits is..........the rest of the menu!!  Other tips:  - Do not let the noodles sit for long (ahem phone pics, cough,cough) as the texture will change and they are best as soon as served.    - The "Hot" items are not that spicy, just flavorful, so specify if you actually want HOT.

k1t3orVhOF0xAErk0kONmw.text: This is my favorite place to go when wanting beef noodle soup. The portions are huge, especially for the price. The flavor is rich and the knife cut noodles are great. It's nice to see people making your dish right in front of you. Other noodle dishes are also great, and the side dishes are tasty as well.

lcMZhaRQtDNPOqsMmgsPvg.text: My family and I were craving for noodles and we tried this place. The noodles are done in front of you. We tried dumplings, spicy wonton, pancake dumplings and four bowls of different noodle soups. All was delicious and in good portions. The place is a little hot and small. So go early to avoid waiting outside the restaurant with temperatures over 100F. We will go back!

Q3QG7FW3TsIbA1wckeBn6Q.text: A meal with a show: Shang specializes in hand-pulled noodles, and the open kitchen allows you to watch this while you wait for your order.   My guy and I shared the spicy won ton appetizer and two noodle dishes for lunch- the Shang beef noodle soup with hand-cut noodles and the chicken and mushroom noodle with knife-cut. Surprisingly, I enjoyed the knife-cut noodle more, it reminded me of a thicker pappardelle. Both bowls were generous portions, and the soup broth was fairly good. I do wish the chicken and mushroom bowl had a few more mushrooms to balance out the amount of noodle received.   The concept, layout, and menu are very similar to Noodle Man but with a more convenient central location. Didn't notice any desserts, but they are right next door to Very Berry Cafe if you want to continue the Asian theme to complete your meal.

fL6K30UU_Qj5oO9li_xG_Q.text: Another bookmark conquered off of my extremely long list of Yelp bookmarks. And it was an excellent decision deciding to come here too.  First impression is how clean the restaurant is. It could easily be a cafe serving just coffee or plated desserts. Not at all what I would stereotypically imagined a Chinese restaurant to look like from the abyss of my imagination.  That is a very good thing indeed.  The interior design is well conceptualized and executed, obviously the work done by a professional designer and contractor from scratch.  While we were looking over their simple menu, one of the chefs was making the handpulled noodles  from scratch (I didn't see the dough being made, just the very important part where the chef transformed a ball of dough into magical strands of noodles using nothing but his hands and physics, much practiced technique of Chinese noodle-making, without the aid of machines to roll out sheets of dough into the proper thickness and cut into the desired width).  He made it look way too easy!!!  At first I was going to order their hand cut noodle, but opted for the hand pulled noodles, since it was literally being made in front of our eyes, as we sat at the counter, right in front of their kitchen where noodles are hand made and the noodles are cooked and plated.  And I settled on ordering their Pork Belly HandNoodle , while my friend ordered their Dan-Dan Noodle .    It didn't take too long for our orders to be made. The Dan-Dan Noodle  came out first, followed shortly by my Pork Belly Handpulled Noodle.  The noodles are easily the main draw of coming here to eat. My Pork Belly Noodle was served with a very good broth, not oily or too salty, just a well made broth with 95% tender braised pork belly. (No preserved cabbage served here though, which is more of a Taiwanese style).    The Dan-Dan Noodle, according to my friend Jason, looks to be too salty (too much Dan-Dan Sauce) which he confirmed right away.  But he still liked the freshly made noodles.  The complimentary (due to checking in on Yelp) Wonton in Chili Oil  was not very impressive. The wontons on their own were above average, which are also made with handmade wonton wrappers. But their sauce was the underwhelming component that failed this dish.  In spite of the disappointing Dan-Dan Noodle and failed-to-impressed Wontons in Chili Oil, I still enjoyed the food enough to look forward to coming back again. However, next time I will give their Hand Cut Noodles  a go, I expect it to be every bit as good as their Handpulled Noodles.  4 stars.

krFItO_O_n_vcibFpn05KQ.text: Danggg this noodle place is amazing. People may say making noodles is easy but making noodles like they do is a different level. I strongly recommend the Shang artisian noodle and pork rib noodles. The    broths are both very tasty and delicious. The best part is the noodles, it is totally hand made and it has goof balance on hardness and softness.

ymaosRlxbYyuGza3mmfr9A.text: Went here for the first time today and I am not sure how I feel about this place. I love the Noodle Man so I was so excited to try out this place since it has a similar concept. The place is new so very clean and modern looking. They have a bunch of smaller tables, probably not the best place for large parties, especially if they get busy it will be difficult to pull tables together. The waitress was very sweet and made good recommendations.   For appetizers we ordred spicy wontons and beef and onions pot stickers, both came after we got our noodles (not much of an appetizer if it comes after the meal), but this wasn't a big deal to us. The spicy wonton looked really small but there were about 8 wontons in there, so pretty good portion; however, being called "spicy" wonton it was not spicy at all, there is a sweetness to the sauce that I did not expect, I would have liked for it to be spicer. The pot sticker came after we finished our noodles, the waitress said they were experimenting with a new pot and it messed up the pot stickers so they had to re-make it, they gave us a plate of the cucumber salad complimentary for the wait, which was very sweet of them. The skin on the pot sticker was too thick for my liking, the meat was kind of bland and dry, nothing special really. The sauce was really good though.   I got the pork belly with knife-shaved noodles. The broth as really good, very flavorful, but they gave me very little broth. The noodle was very thick and stuck together, it was hard to pick up each noodle, it stuck together like a big...glob. My sister got the Shang's noodle with hand pulled noodles, her broth was good but a bit warm, not as hot as she would have liked. She also said it was a little bland, she expected it to have chilli like at other places, but maybe it is just a different style.   Overall I think the place is decent, but I prefer the Noodle Man for the spicer wonton and broth. But they are pretty new so maybe just need a little time to adjust.

EAA30avvvZ49sVwkDfL1KA.text: The dan dan noodles were good and surprising spicy. I will definitely try them again. I also had the beef pancakes with my order and those were also really delicious. Overall a meal you won't regret.

o-0L0sy8kv7IJwPTtuocAQ.text: Amazing hand made noodles,  we literally ate one of everything! Highly recommend get the beef pancakes.

p71dpRsDM0fjmd8wUbCjLg.text: This is a great place for authentic chinese noodles. They offer handmade noodles, knife shaved noodles and a type of machine made noodles. Noodles are served with either soup or sauce. I tried the beef noodles soup with hand made noodles, and it was al dente and amazing. You can see the skillful chef making the noodles through the open kitchen. He made the noodles from the dough in front of you so you knew it was fresh. Price is very reasonable. The place is also clean and tidy. It is definitely a good spot.

dJJnaLDK59P2_bHDYm04HQ.text: I went there , I order tomatoes noodle and beef noodle soup, tomatoes noodle is good, beef noodle it is ok. Beef I doesn't taste that good. Service is good .

4TR-DQV3_lnxq6tLhxDoDw.text: If you're looking for authentic noodles that will make you feel warm, this is the perfect place! I've been here several times and always left feeling very satisfied. I would highly recommend the beef pancakes, as well as the dan dan noodles!

oUvMmOASAuuxOHuN9my-sw.text: The beef noodle soup is good. Not the best that I have had. The noodles need more bite and the texture is too soft. The meat and broth is excellent and a little chili oil puts it over the top.

M-P2zsqZE6E7Tf_2isnuQA.text: The hand-pulled noodles were amazing here!!! This was our first time here and the service was very fast and friendly! The restrooms were clean! The spicy wonton is super tasty!!!

QHhWNsnXxf8ZYhnuHZjB9A.text: Took my husband, his business partner and my dad to this place .. boy we were pretty impressed. We had the beef noodle soup, beef tongue and spicy wonton. Delicious and taste fresh!

FgNs1WqqDYJk81IOXI_BqQ.text: Place was Delicious and noodles are made right in front of you. So fresh. We had both the pulled noodles and knife shaved noodles. Both cooked right in front of you.  Great lunch place.

AgQbca0Hu7BaQGvC3YUmDA.text: wow unbelieveable food i will be back for more whenever i come back to vegas everything on the menu is really good =)

SCFUnyYP2qvF34ZEjbmcGw.text: Had for take out! Uber eats delivered. The food was ok , no complaints but nothing very exciting or negative to say. I enjoyed for the most part . Had the spicy wontons , pork noodles , and beef & onion dumplings.

T2IETnhS3DNgEmJpEhMj8g.text: Packaged noodle probably tastes much better than this. We tried this place hoping its an authentic Chinese hand pulled noodle place and we were very disappointed. My husband ordered dan dan noodle, way too salty and i ordered chicken and mushroom hand pulled noodle, noodle texture didnt taste like True hand pulled noodle, not much flavor either. We ordered beef pancake since there were so many good reviews on yelp but nope, it wasnt good either...thick dough not fully cooked. Will not be going back for sure!

kRjha1UmAL-dgi9XXVvS-g.text: Authentic and prepared with care.  Can't beat the freshness of noodles made in front of you.  Broth is full of flavor.  Will return.

MjdHsFuAtDqwKlCszePIHQ.text: The place is cute, modern, and clean. Love the food here. I've been here multiple times and my favorites so far are the dan dan noodles with plain noodle, seafood noodle with knife shaved noodles, beef pancakes, spicy wontons, and the Shang fried rice. I come here often when I want noodle soups or something that isn't as heavy and salty as ramen. Service is always great, they're always on top of it and food comes out quickly.

PIk1lZRLhbjBsdda_aQoFw.text: Loved the knife cut and the hand pulled noodles So happy to see so many amazing restaurants open outside the strip city. Not loving the gambling atmosphere at all, I wouldn't mind coming to Vegas for a food trip!

vXbOXu1vtQgO0Zy9zjPxWQ.text: Great food.  Kind and gracious service.  Came in for last minute order to go and they were so helpful and accommodating... on a holiday.  That's A+ in my book.

7Gw9GSLEkp8yjQ5gITC3yA.text: 3.5 stars! I came with my daughter on a weekday and it was packed for lunch. The guy making fresh noodles was a fun touch. We ordered hand-pulled noodles in the following:  -Shang's Beef Noodle Soup -Pork Belly Noodle Soup -Jia Jang Mein (bean paste noodle, soupless)  We also ordered the spicy wonton appetizer (10 very tasty, very tiny wontons). Overall the soups were flavored very nicely, but for us the noodles were too thick and almost undercooked. I like a bit a bite/spring to the noodle, but this was almost hard. Maybe it was just a bad batch?   The hot sauce included on the table is really delicious! I would not mind coming back to try everything again (especially the wontons).

W69w6JeHA9ZjGUZjn-nDyA.text: So glad we decided to try this place! We had the spicy wontons, Dan Dan noodle and the pork rib noodle soup. Everything was delicious! The hand pulled noodles were tasty and the bite to them were perfect for the dishes we ordered! The service was amazing as well! Ciara was very knowledgeable and took great care of us. I will def recommend this place to all my noodle lovers!

fnsrQizDuKBAwZsa8l8ScA.text: Best noodle in the city hands down. I come here at least once a week. The pork belly is insane !!

mqhCY5oLA1LXP6gZ3JQDTQ.text: The spicy wonton was my favorite. We ordered another round of it and the potstickers. I had the Shang beef noodle soup which was good, but would've been better if it wasn't too salty. I also had a taste of my friend's order of the Peking Zha Jiang noodles which was okay.

6P73qnU5w2Zv0A8IUe-LHQ.text: This is the best Asian restaurant I've ever been to..so much so that we were here for dinner last night and came right back for lunch today! We had a great time watching Luis make the hand-pulled noodles from scratch! Lupita provided excellent service and was very friendly! We loved the spicy wontons, chicken chow mein (we added bok choy and extra noodles), Shang Beef Noodle Soup and the Dan Dan Noodles! This place is a must for the best Asian food in Vegas!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Chow Mein with extra noodles and bok choy and spicy wontons!

zIn0KeJ7aI_wv4iyq9aDTg.text: Great noodles! I got the Dan Dan noodles. I liked the pork with the very fresh noodles. I love how you can watch the noodles being made. Very cool! The parking lot is small. Good place for lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dan Dan Noodles with pork.

NMWiAHS84aafPveSrKeRnw.text: When I'm craving hot soup & don't want ramen, this is my go-to place. Their menu is simple, the place is quaint but their food is DIVINE.  Shang Beef Noodle is sooooo good. Piping hot broth with braised beef brisket and veggies. It sounds simple but it really hits the spot on a cold day. I also loved their Spicy Wonton. For me, the sauce has some sweetness to it then the spice kicks your taste buds at the end. I can't quite explain it. The potsticker presentation is a must see, besides the taste. It's so pretty because it's shaped like a flower of some sort. The beef pancake is also tasty. Watch out though! Don't bite too fast or too hard, the soup inside will burn your tongue or hit your neighbor, both of which are not very pleasant.  The prices are awesome & the service is always friendly. I can't wait to go back!

YAKYHroEI8pMwL3dkLO7Pw.text: The flavors were yummm!!!  Seeing the noodles freshly made on site was fun.  We really enjoyed the beef noodles and the wonton appetizer.  We would definitely come back.  Keep in mind that the restaurant is fairly small, so if it gets busy, there will be a wait.

rxEbKd7P8a74eDhkQdfpOA.text: We went to this attractive restaurant for lunch today and we will definitely be going back. Our server was friendly and attentive. There were only 2 other customers when we arrived but others came while we were eating. We both had the beef shank soup with the hand-pulled noodles. We also ordered the spicy wonton. Both were excellent. We have been to China and I guarantee you this food is authentic.   As I was in the food service business for 25 years, I could appreciate that the tables and seats were being cleaned and sanitized. I thought the whole restaurant was very clean. That is a big plus.   Yelp has not failed us again. Generally speaking, when a restaurant has 4 1/2 stars, it is very good and worth checking out.

KcHs6417XYV7kJ-4Uic_OA.text: Omg! Their beef noodle stew was sOo goood with a real coconut drink to complete my lunch. If I am back in vegas.. I would come back here again~

4ynfiowVLDuE7azhphbjqg.text: I love that they have an open kitchen to watch them make noodles by hand. You get a meal and a show! The best spot to take in this action is at the counter so you can see it all go down. The pork and cabbage potstickers are Instagram worthy and they're delicious. I'm a fan of the beef pancakes too, but damn they're hard to cut. I was making a mess trying to slice them open. And, you definitely want to cut them open. If you bite into them you'll be sprayed with steaming hot beef juice. I also loved the beef noodle soup with knife-shaved noodles. The broth was complex and savory and the beef was tender and filling. A great meal all around.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef pancakes ($5.49)
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef noodle soup ($8.95) - beef broth, raised beef brisket, vegetables, knife-shaved noodles

CK2EotJcELKb2EuEaxsxEg.text: I have been on a mission to find hand-pulled noodles in every big city I visit!  This Raman place was so good that I sent friends visiting Vegas from Montana there and they said that it was "the best meal" they had in Vegas!!  Definitely order the beef Raman bowl!  It's their specialty.  And when a restaurant has a specialty, YOU TRY IT! Vegas has high turnover in new restaurants, but I'm hoping this place sticks around for years to come and I'll be sure to go there every time I'm in town!

IK6FZmeMGNo4gczcdV8INw.text: Delicious noodles and great service! Loved the Beef Pancakes as an appetizer. Great atmosphere as well.

Mj46C2wibLxlvDdWWzBHEg.text: We were looking at something off the strip, Thought what would the locals like? It was well worth the 4 stars. Everything is fresh the Broth was perfect, My wife is Asian and Picky, we waited about 20 minutes, My 15 yr old wanted to sit at the counter, we waited. It was worth the wait. We felt everything was perfect, Perhaps we were fortunate that the water was fresh in boiling the noodles because nothing was too salty, with the hand pulled noodles or the shaved noodles it was all ok. The service was great, if i was going to nit pick, I wish they had more brisket served with the noodles, very tender, and I have had better Pot Stickers here in the Bay Area otherwise I would have put up a 5 star rating, Can I give 4/[2 stars? This was about a  $12.00 Uber ride from Treasure Island You cant go wrong with Shang Noodle.

bKVVZLz2FX6qRjQNt7VPug.text: Awesome! Awesome! Awesome!  Good food. Good price. Good and extremely friendly stuff.   Fresh handmade noodles in open kitchen.   Must go in Vegas!

AQj2Ia9HKyIwoRLf2-9E9Q.text: FOOD: 4/5 Ordered to-go here. Flavor was good. Ordered 2 kinds of noodles. Chicken mushroom with hand pulled noodles (chow mein type) & the egg tomato with knife cut noodle (flat). I suggest to just stick to the hand pulled one if u do take out. Because by the time we got back to the hotel (half hr later), the flat one turned into a clump of dough. I could imagine it woulda been more separated & actually looked like noodles if I had eaten it right then & there in a bowl. The hand pulled one stayed separated. Other than that, the flavors were great. I also ordered the beef pancakes, fried pork dumplings & fried beef dumplings. The beef dumplings & beef pancakes were pretty much the same. Just different shapes. I preferred the pancakes though cuz it's more fried due to the shape.   DECOR: 5/5 Clean & modern. Love that we can watch them make prep & cook right there. It's a little too hipster looking for me though.  SERVICE: 4/5 The girl taking the order walked around with her lil tablet. Wasn't like super friendly. She just seemed like a robot. The guy Latin guy with the green eyes making the pulling the noodle was nice about me taping him pulling the noodles. Please just be respectful & ask them if u can tape them. It's so rude when ppl just start video taping  or taking pictures without that person's consent.   Prices weren't too bad. I have to admit, when I first found this place on yelp, I wasn't sure I wanted to try it cuz the pictures & name of the restaurant looked & sounded way too hipster ish for me. I thought it was gonna be some fancy schmancy small portion dishes for an arm & a leg. But I decided to try it for the hand made noodles & I'm glad I did. The portions were bigger than I expected for the price they charge. They exceeded my expectations. The only thing that's hipster stuck up ish about this place was the robotic hostess/server. She wasn't rude or anything & answered my questions. She just needs to crack a smile & act a little more personal. This isn't some exclusive rich club or party. Reminded me of those ppl in movies working at some hip exclusive restaurants.

pHu8ylmqGJLnGouwwyCCcw.text: This place is pretty solid. The noodles are delicious and the broth in the beef packs quite a flavor punch. Pair that with some of the potstickers and you've got a pretty solid trip to flavor town.

Wcv5dI9wdiwdBU6daxA3kQ.text: Wondered in here randomly and was pleasantly surprised to find quite a gem. The beef soup noodles were actually pretty tasty. Skip on the spicy wontons as they are nothing remarkable.

ducA4Fd3p-iGRzde1UCWEA.text: The food was much better than expected. We ordered: - Beef Noodle Soup with hand pulled noodles. The broth was flavorful and the braised beef brisket was tender and plentiful. Very very good. My favorite. - My boyfriend had the seafood soup with hand carved noodles. It was good but beef broth had more flavor.  - The beef pancakes. Very good. My second favorite. Do not cut them. As another customer recommends "Bite the top open and suck out the broth." You do not want to lose the broth.   - The spicy wontons were tasty. My boyfriend's second favorite. - Tea. It is one of the best teas I have been served in a long time. Almost no restaurant serves a good quality tea anymore.   Menu is simple but a rare find in Las Vegas and the food is reasonably priced. The place was clean and the service was very good. Very satisfied customers. Recommend.

aHaEJKvDkLQQp3blCvzS0A.text: Just love this place! The broth is awesome and the handmade noodles is so smooth.  Second time here all the way from AZ just to have some authentic noodles.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes with ground beef.
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gyK3_Ai4tcL1LiUsJWBChQ.text: I wandered off the strip for lunch when I found this place on yelp and it did not disappoint! It's a quick 10 min drive and there was no wait when I got there for lunch. I sat at the bar area and was able to see all the noodle making action on front of me! I've seen this many times before but the chef here was very enthusiastic and you could tell he was enjoying what he was doing!  I had the dan dan noodles with the scissor cut noodles and the beef pancakes. Both were excellent dishes. The dan dan was tasty and the noodles were so chewy and dense. Just how I like them. The beef pancakes were juicy and full of flavor, a perfect compliment to my noodles. Service here was also friendly and the waitress was attentive. Prices are also super reasonable.  Would definitely recommend if you're craving shanghai noodles and willing to make a quick trip off the strip! Probably some of the best, authentic and fresh noodles you'll find in vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dan dan noodles
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Juicy (!) Beef pancakes

UHMcsOZcOFpFiohb6sOVtg.text: Small but amazing noodle restaurant that is affordable and fast. Recommend getting beef dumplings to share (they take about 5-10 extra minutes to cook, and have a juicy filling that might squirt at you when you chomp down so be v careful) and if you have a friend comfortable enough with you to share noods with, the hand pulled and knife cut are the way to go. We went traditional and got the beef noodles and the pork belly noodles. So good. Next time will def try the dan dan noodles.

j19L89X2TKvLv8yKTO_euw.text: Quick drive off the strip and so delicious! I had the beef noodle and it was worth the hype. Consistently busy the entire time and the food was quick and made to order so it came out in waves. So good! Great service too!

zt2pkMAKcF_5HC2YF2DjSg.text: Loved it! First time there and 10/10! Recommend anyone who loves noodles like I do!! I've never tasted anything like it and the taste was so exquisite! Definitely coming back here with more friends!!!!

GU_heXrxfB4PdlmdADlwOQ.text: Shang Artisan Noodle was well worth the wait. And wait we did. About 1 hour for two people. The place is small and the wait list is paper. No reservations. You come, you wait. We started with the beef pancake, spicy wonton, and Dan Dan Noodles. All great choices. The beef pancake takes a while but they are delicious. The spicy wontons are spicy, but soft and yummy. The Dan dan Noodles we order were with plain noodles. The flavor was good, but I expected a little better. I ordered the Shang beef with hand pulled noodle for my entree. It was savory and decadent. I definitely recommend it! My partner had the pork belly and thoroughly enjoyed it. The service is speedy, but attentive. With it being so packed and only having two servers, they move through the tables quickly. Note that your food is going to come out as it's ready so we ended up with our soups before some of our appetizers. It didn't bother us any. It was all tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang beef
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dan Dan noodle

cXIsNWNaWXcJviP7xoTs1w.text: I think my expectations were too high. It's hard to find good dan dan noodles, so I was excited to come here. We took an Uber from the strip to visit.   Shang beef soup with knife cut noodles: 3/5 noodles were cooked well, but the soup was bland and there wasn't much meet to noodle ratio. I added a lot of chili for more flavor.  Dan Dan hand pulled noodles: 2/5 again, noodles cooked well, but it was more bland than I expected. Also, I thought dan dan noodles had tahini in it, but these didn't, so I was pretty disappointed.  Hot oil wontons: 5/5 good flavor   Service was good, so they get 5/5 for that.   Overall, I probably wouldn't come back. It's an Uber ride from the strip and unless I was really in the mood for hot oil wontons, the other dishes didn't blow me away.

w-iZ62EGxFvhR884NVF0zQ.text: Try the Shang beef with hand pulled noodles! Sooo yummy! The pork dumplings were delicious as well. I'd recommend going at 4:30pm to avoid the lunch and dinner rushes.

se7bNAvhp0x6zZA4l6INeg.text: Recently Shang Artisan Noodle was recommended to me by a friend, so we decided to check it out. The reviews on Yelp are almost too good to be True. I mean... beef noodle soup? How can it be that good? At first I was a little hesitant to try because the pictures made it look just alright however boy I was wrong. We came here on a Saturday night. The restaurant was a bit crowded however we only waited for 5 minutes. It's a small place however reminds me of the ramen shops back home.   Menu consists of different types of dumplings, noodle soups, and more. First, they make their own noodles in house. If you order any of the noodle soups, you can choose how the noodles are cooked. There's three different ways: hand pulled, knife shaved, and normal. I have no idea what the difference was however the previous reviews suggest knife shaved. We decided to get the Shang beef noodle soup and spicy wontons. The spicy wontons come in 10 small pieces   We received our food quick! The pictures made the bowls look small however it was a regular sized bowl that ramen is served in. The broth.... the BROTH! I have never had anything like it. The beef makes the broth so rich and tasty. The noodles were similar to chow fun noodles however had very edged and not perfect cuts. It's was really delicious! I would recommend getting that cut. The spicy wontons were good as well. It's really spicy! There's a dipping sauce where you can add to help the heat but also add dimensional flavor.   Overall it was great to try something new! I just wished we had something like this back home. There's noodles are well made and tasty. The broth is delicious... what more can I say? Just try it out. Also we weren't expecting for our water to be cucumber lemon water. It caught us off guard but we appreciated it! Yum. Pricing is reasonable. All dishes are less than $10. They don't have a dessert menu but there's a lot of dessert places in the area. We're coming back the next time we're in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy wontons

8wGXiwzPYb9IrR3BbTvIag.text: One the great noodle places here in town. What near here is week by week they change up the noodles, spinach one week and something else the next. Place is always packed because it's so good!! Love the spicy wontons.

jHoz3pMsHKSIEZ0cC0GUlA.text: We came here on a whim bc of the yelp reviews and it just happened that chef Marcus Samuelsson was shooting a show segment at the same time so that was cool. I got the Dan Dan noodles with hand pulled noodles. I'd recommend the Dan Dan noodles with knife cut noodles instead. The spicy wontons were spicy and flavorful! The chicken and mushroom noodle was okay. Not my favorite but the ear mushrooms were super good in it. Not the best hand pulled noodles I've ever had, but it was a pretty good meal in Vegas.

uivu23HoAnNs-8AC41kPWQ.text: We went on Sunday at 1pm and had a wait time of an hour. We got boba next door in the meanwhile. The food was delicious. We ordered spicy wontons, shang beef noodle with hand pulled noodles, and dan dan noodles with shaved noodles. I personally like the pulled noodles because the shave noodles in the dan dan noodles because it felt more heavy to me. I  havent had dan dan noodles much but I felt like they needed a little more sauce. The beef noodle soup, noodles and broth were perfect! I would go there again.

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dan dan noodles
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang beef noodle soup

w3mV2YJ0jgIu9GBsZCBnlg.text: This was a great choice.  Prompt and friendly service.  Food came out almost immediately.  I read a review who thought their spicy wontons were better than Din Tai Fung.  I'd have to agree.    We had the Dan Dan noodles and the chilled chicken noodles.  Both dishes hit the spot!  I'd happily recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pZlFUZNCkCaJC3Dh4XqNUw.text: Arrived two days in a row, with 10 groups on the waiting list, left both days in a row and ate elsewhere.  I understand having a sustainable restaurant, but if it's incredibly tiny, business walks away. Pho so 1, Cafe sanuki is close enough by, as well as Hot N juicy.

JlJl-j1IlJtJNl_z_iIxJw.text: Wow. This place truly blew me away! I had pretty high expectations for the food and I was pleasantly surprised. I had the beef noodle soup and shared spicy wontons with my dad. 10/10 recommend! In my opinion, it tasted better than Din Tai Fung if anyone is familiar. We came around 2pm Sunday and waited about 15-20 mins. The food came out extremely fast and portions were fair. I will definitely come back the next time I visit Vegas.   My only kind of complaint here is that there was a large table of 6 just hanging out while someone was doing their homework at the table. Mind you, they were already finished eating. With 6 parties waiting to be seated, it was unprofessional that none of the workers stepped up to kindly tell them to leave. This may have been a one-off situation, but it is so important that everyone is mindful of the people waiting for a table. One large party waited more than an hour to be seated at a table and were aggravated as well.

4zvdE00j_1_65e8TJuAl5Q.text: |[ w o w ]| Mmmm this was so good. I am an absolute Asian noodle lover and this place has it! Handmade noodles with a hearty flavorful soup broth was all I needed to make my day. Highly recommend for noodle lovers all over.  |[ n o o d s ]| Beef noodle soup 5/5: delicious and filling. Got the handmade wide noodles and it was perf. Loved everything about this. Has bok choy in it. One of the best beef noodle soups I've had.  Dan dan noodles 5/5: friend got this and it was equally delicious. The spice flavor stands out and it's different in a good way. That Chinese "ma la" flavor is acquired though so be aware before you order. Personally I love it (its spicy).   |[ l o v e ]| Cute modern indoor seating, noodle making action can be seen behind the counter. All in all, high quality food at reasonable prices. Parking lot out front. Wish this was in LA.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef noodle soup
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dandan noodles
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef noodle soup - yummy!

B34PAbhJtQGE0i-5701FrQ.text: It's very delicious!!! They has real made it!!!  ramens or other more Mein chow is awesome!!

Hurbk0sfbJab24YzhN5wPg.text: For freshly made hand-pulled noodles and dumplings, this place DOES NOT DISAPPOINT.  It's also a plus that the wait staff is so attentive and nice! The noodles themselves are damn good in flavor and texture.   We had the Dan Dan noodles and Shang beef noodles and both were so flavorful done just right. The boiled pork and cabbage dumplings also hit the spot.

zWy6CzpDtrUzSxt_cNrtdA.text: Pretty good noodle shop. However I think I'm a little spoiled living in California.   The pork dumplings were my favorite part. (9/10) The dough here is a little thicker than usual, and the pork flavor is a bit different than I've had in the last. But I mean this all in a good way. I would definitely order this again. Juicy, sweet and filling.   The spicy wontons were pretty good (7.5/10) and satisfied my craving for them, although I've had much better for way cheaper in OC/LA. Maybe it was lacking something in the sauce? Or maybe it was the filling inside the wontons that were a little dry. I can't exactly pinpoint it, but I know I wasn't wowed like I usually am with this dish.   Dandan noodles were also good (8/10). However I prefer when there is some peanut paste in the sauce, and this was purely Szechuan chili-based. I didn't mind it since I love spicy, but I guess it's just a personal preference for the peanut version of this sauce.   I'm not sure I would go out of my way to come here again, given that there's so many other restaurants in Las Vegas and CA fills my Asian food needs. But I do recommend you check it out and try for yourself!

QTddKTRK0UEYEyJEWXHrwg.text: One of my favorite noodle houses in Vegas! They hand pull the noodles fresh in the open kitchen. I always order the Shang beef noodle with knife cut noodles.. my FAVORITE! Iv also tried the pork belly noodle with hand-pulled noodles, Dan-Dan noodles, spicy wonton and beef & onion potstickers.. all delicious! Their Harney and sons genmaicha hot tea is yummy as well.. I ended up going to the Harney and sons website and ordered a packet of sachets! The cucumber infused water is a nice touch as well. Just a heads up they get PACKED during lunch hour.

J83IhhGwGo9b3_mq-KtjsQ.text: Hand Pulled Noodles might as well be the bane of my existence because I can't help but purchase every bowl of noodles from the restaurant (But I'll contain myself).   My friend chose to eat at this noodle shop because she too shares the love/hate relationship with noodles. We came here in the morning time, but since the restaurant is bit small and we had a large party, there was a regular wait. We were seated at the bar and could easily watch the chefs put their soul into making noodles. They also had cute little tea chairs and table decorations around the counter.   I ordered the Dan Dan noodles and egg and tomato, both of which were amazing. My friends ordered various noodle dishes as well as sides such as the pork dumpling, the Shang Beef noodles, and the spicy wonton. Luckily with that, I was able to have a taste of *almost* everything.   The quality of food was to die for because the noodles were so fresh and soft and the spicy won ton was just as good as Din Tai Fung, if not better! I would definitely recommend going here for the experience and so you could develop an addiction to hand pulled noodles as well!

knb66KqXALaRjQNz2q4yhg.text: This continues to be the best meal I have when I'm in Vegas. I order beef pancake and Dan Dan and it's $16. Great prices and excellent food.

RSa7bLRjgIXAceYGTZWYdw.text: Found this on Yelp.  Friggin love it.  I actually like the shaved noodles more than the handpulled but that's just my opinion.  Dumplings were yummy too.  Dan Dan spicy noodles, Shiang Beef soup, and Chicken Cold noodles.  Can't go wrong.

oO6IzIgS4V4MLJ-ED-DbbQ.text: Hand crafted noodles! We couldn't hardly wait to try hand pulled noodles and knife-shaved noodles. We got the pork belly soup with hand pulled noodles (rich and delicious), spicy won ton (damn hot, but oh so good), beef pancake (more like a pan-fried dumpling and my favorite of the meal) and dan-dan knife-shaved noodles (really tasty).   This little shop is about blow up so get there and get to eating. And just a reminder, 20% tip is standard for good service. These people deliver that and more.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Left are the damn spicy won tons. Right are the amazing little beef cakes.
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly soup!  So deep, so rich!
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hand pulled noodles

tFs5-mq5rWFo_w5_aMJQVg.text: They were very busy but we only had to wait 10 minutes. We sat at the bar and were able to watch hand pull noodles, make fresh dumplings and cook. Very pleased with the atmosphere, great service and delicious food.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken chowmein
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang high fried rice

Zxv2m5RQH69I-2YY7E5V9g.text: Slurp Slurp Yum!!! Great food with even better prices! 4 of us ate for $64 and change. We each ordered  a meal plus we shared 3 different appetizers. I feel like we got more than our money's worth! Had the pork belly noodle soup and the broth was rich without being heavy. The chunks of pork belly were flavorful and soft so if you're used to crispy belly the texture might throw you for a loop. We all ordered hand pulled noodles but would like to go back and try knife shaved noodles. Everything is cooked to order and it's so cool to see them shaving the dough into the boiling water as each order comes in. Hubby had the Dan Dan noodle and it was spicy! Enough to make him break out in a sweat and this is a man whose favorite pepper is a habanero! Bottom line, if you don't mind traveling off the strip for great food at phenom prices you won't go wrong here.

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Porkbelly noodle soup

EYb6fuUN87pkdNwDgX2s1Q.text: Awesome hand-thrown noodles.  If you have never had fresh hand-thrown noodles you will not understand what is so special about them.  Any everything is fresh.

OLBd6S4yQOmoS2UPX2GTIw.text: Nice noodle and rice. Pretty good service and good price. Really good price. What's the mostly point if need say something not good enough is its place. If you drive your car or you are very familiar with the UBER or CAB, it's reasonable to come here to enjoy with friend or family but if only one person the transportation fee compared higher than enjoy at stripe. But if you need noodle not at Chinatown. It's worth of drive and all serve are young.

vpOplYt4S1E041UBe07IPA.text: I love there hand pulled and the knife cutting noodles!! Noodles are fresh. I ordered their Shang beef soup and that was really delicious. Second time around I ordered the mushroom chicken and that was just ok. The seasoning was a little bland. If come in and don't know what to order, definitely try their Shang beef noodle soup.

U-7X9MY8ZNZRTtSAzrZTXA.text: WOW WOW WOW!!!! How am I just finding this gem in China Town?! Everything is made fresh right in front of you. The homemade noodles especially the flat noodles for those that love a little chewier texture is AMAZING!!!! Watching how they make the noodles leaves me in pure astonishment alone! You basically get a show while they make your meal. I went with the shanghai beef soup with the flat noodle it was delicious. The meat was tender and falling apart in my mouth, cooked to perfection. And you get big hunks of vegetables yum yum yum so crisp! The broth for me was the only thing I needed to doctor as I like mine spicier I added chili sauce and it was great just what it needed! Highly recommend the beef pancake and the hot n spicy wontons! One of my new favs!

KdylwMzpNq3JFcGaM5Y8bw.text: Our favorite restaurant whenever we come to Vegas. Freshly made noodles and tasty broth. We've tried their shang beef noodle soup, pork belly noodle soup, pork & chicken wonton soup, chicken chowmein, yang zhou fried rice, and beef pancake. They are all delicious. Shang beef noodle soup reminded me of Niu Rou Mian that I had several times in Taiwan. Tried several other Taiwanese restaurants and found theirs is the closest to the one in Taiwan. Definitely a must when you come to Vegas.

YzgPKOwaFLXX6zPxGBE6_w.text: Fast and courteous servers serving handmade noodle. The Broth was savory for which ever kind of noodle we ordered. Love the modern and clean vibe of this small spot worth the wait.

84BkXJnDV8ywLI1rcdSMhA.text: I like fresh noodles so giving this place a try and due to a high yelp rating.  This restaurant is small with just a few tables and there are 10 seats at the bar where you can watch the cooks do their magic.  I ordered the beef stewed Noodle, chili oil wonton, Dan Dan Noodle. The beef stew was tender as I expected. The Dan Dan Noodle was just ok for me. The sauce for the spicy wonton is a bit too salty for my liking.  Also, the meat stuffing is not much for the wontons.  These young servers were very fast and one of them offered us water while we waited for our seats. You don't often find that kinda treatment. Anyhow, I'm rating this place 3 stars for food and service.

NHR_SaoEaw9fvFLMKngrKQ.text: Delicious food and excellent service! Ordered the beef pancakes, cucumber appetizer, and Shang beef soup with knife cut noodles. We will be coming back!

aQ6OG83yeNKm94N9OPl_MQ.text: This place was insanely good! Best noodle bar I have ever been to. Spicy wonton is a must try! I wanted to order 3 or 4 more orders! Go straight for the handpulled noodles also. I got the pork belly noodles. So fragrant and the flavor was so deep and rich. Little on the sweet side but it had so much balance with everything that was going on in that bowl. I would suggest getting here early because the place can fill out very fast. We got lucky and were the first customers before the rush. After that, there was almost an hour wait.  Would I return to this place? I'm making it my mission anytime I'm in Vegas.

GtwJSlOYzZK9vORzT4AIxg.text: The texture of their unique hand-crafted noodles is a very special one, it's awesome. I recommend the Beef Pancake, super delicious and juicy.

tDIGDsjoJJCNGAhHfzVNaQ.text: I know nothing about noodles. But on a recommendation I was told to go to Shang. It is on the west side Decatur and Flamingo. Located in one of the strip malls that used to have a great French cafe on the corner of the property. The inside of the restaurant is very simple but nicely decored. It probably has seating for thirty people. I ordered the spicy wontons as an appetizer $5.95. They were spicy hot but not too hard to manage but had a good flavor.      I  also ordered the pork belly Bowl. The stock was flavorful and the noodles were shaved.  The noodles were very tasty. The broth  had bok choy in it and the pork belly was okay. The pork belly was not fresh and had been precooked and some pieces were a little dry. A food prep thing I'm sure.  You are served a nice flavored water, I think it was cucumber water.       You definitely will be filled by the time you get to the end of your noodle bowl. It was not too salty nor lacking anything. I am not a pro on Noodle bowls but I would take a friend here for something different. The price is reasonable 8.95 for a big bowl.     The waiter was very cordial and was helpful in choosing the right noodle for my bowl.       You could see them pulling noodles in the prep kitchen.      You are given chopsticks and a personal size ladle for your bowl. The waiter said anyone who requested a soup spoon and fork are available for those who cannot manage chopsticks.     Nice job! Will come again as the weather gets colder in Las Vegas.  This will be a nice place to go for comfort food.

GEZGxa1eg_K_SNWlCXseLg.text: Not easy to find hand made noodle in US, this is one of those ones where they make noodles right in front of you. Delicious soup noodles and very affordable prices. I would give 5 stars if they open a little bit earlier on the day...then this would be a great place for you to swing by and eat soup noodle as a comforting breakfast before you hit your way home.

RGuPgru6oNO3Z1uftkV6ZQ.text: Not bad at all for a change of pace from the tourist-heavy Vegas Strip restaurants. They make the noodles in front of you, which makes for an entertaining show. I had the Dan Dan hand-pulled noodle dish (a Sichuan Chinese specialty), which was tasty if not quite authentic. Quite a reasonable deal, at $7.99 given that it's delicious and made fresh by hand. Service was friendly but a bit slow since they were short handed, but it's a pleasant environment anyway. If you have a craving for noodles in Vegas, it's worth the drive out here.

_QbJAi-ea8sOYYleXglOLQ.text: Delicious!!! The food was so fresh and tasty! Best noodles!!! The servers were very friendly.

Cf_27LhiJqF_0kj1HiJTRw.text: The service here is great . The tea was good. Other than that we found nothing that was good about this place.  The first dish that came out was the sliced beef shank. It was supposed to be a cold dish and it came out frozen not able to be eaten.   The knife cut noodles were doughy. The pork belly itself and broth had good flavor. I bit into a piece of what i thought was pork belly it was a huge chunk of ginger unpeeled.   The "spicy" wonton had no spice at all.  After we told the server that our beef was frozen she brought out a complementary dish cucumbers with sesame sauce on it. But....the sauce on the cucumbers was not edible either the taste was unflavored sesame wallpaper paste.   We were hoping this place would be as good or better than noodle man but it was not and unfortunately will never be returning.

yRKVtrA_RUizWKbNNyHrAA.text: We stopped by here for dinner while visiting Las Vegas. It was a pleasant meal. We got noodle soupls, dan dan noodles, dumplings, chili oil wontons, and cucumber appetizers. I didn't like the cucumber dish but everything else was very flavorful and delicious! They served cucumber water as well.

3T5KlIKmw_1reTnsdSK_HA.text: This place is the BOMB! I went with the Shang's beef brisket and hand pulled noodles. Wow, the flavor was amazing, and I don't think I've had fresher noodles. Perfect texture. I added in some chili paste they provide on the table to kick it up -- be careful, because it's legit chili and hot. I had not previously experienced Chinese noodle soup like this, it reminded me of Vietnamese Pho, and you eat it the same way: with a large spoon in one hand and chopsticks in the other.   The service was excellent -- efficient and friendly, but not overbearing. The restaurant is spanking clean, and you can also watch the food being prepared in the open kitchen.   My only suggestion would be to lower the sodium in the broth. It's pretty salty, but I will admit that I am not a huge fan of sodium. But I can't wait to return and try other items.

XIjKRFxeYhguawJl4MLglA.text: Good food  good service, reasonable price, very simple very tasty, convenient location.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5e5XMS4Keyx5C8RDuSylhw.text: Not recommended. Noodle soup taste just ok. Honestly I can say it is just a little below average.  The Beef pancake with cheap Stuffing seems missing something. Don't let the good review fool you. I really doubt.

lt6qO6ymS4aPhFQY7omXOg.text: Food came out fresh and quick.   Shang beef noodle was tasty, but it's missing something like pickled mustard or some hint of acidity to break up all that salt and savory.   Dan Dan noodles is a bit on the spicy side for those who arent used to spice. It's simple and straightforward.   Beef pancakes came later in the meal. Nice and crispy on the outside, VERY juicy and hot on the inside - take caution when you bite into it.   All in all, tastes like Asian street food/noodles and all is good.   Place is located in a small establishment on the side of the street. Seating can be on the bar overlooking the cook/kitchen or seats with the tables on the side. Service was quick and efficient. The place doesn't feel crowded though it's on the smaller side.

nIAbPjWIyG1AdZogjr_Srw.text: Best noodles and wontons I have ever had!!! We got to the restaurant at about 11:10 am and were the first ones on the waitlist by 11:20 the waitlist page was filled up.  I can't wait to go back!!!

dcWJR2uOGUAJHKKZuOsVIg.text: This place is small and expect to wait. It's become quite popular and the wait can be hard when it's over 100 degrees outside. Luckily, there is a boba place right next door to have a cool drink while you wait. Anyhow, there is different ways to get your noodles. I like that you can have options with your noodle type. The beef noodle soup here was flavorful! I liked this and the beef pancake was good but had to take it back as it came way at the end. By then, I was full to even try it. One thing I thought and didn't really find appealing was the sesame cucumber. It was descent but I didn't expect like a paste over cucumber. Overall, a very good pick to start our Vegas week getaway. It's affordable and the flavors are good! Always a treat now to go exploring outside of the strip to eat some good affordable Asian food!

e57cn5seP0NgWQAI04UFkA.text: One of my favorite Knife Shaved Noodles I've had in the US! (Sorry, Asia does it on another level) My only regret is that I came to Shang Artisan Noodle during lunch on my last day in Vegas.   We got there at 11 am right when they opened, and were seated right away. It became completely full with a wait by 11:45, so definitely get here early unless you're willing to wait. Trust me, it's worth it!   I ordered the Beef Shank noodle and my boyfriend ordered the Shang beef noodle. The dish names are similar, but such different flavors! The Shang beef noodle is definitely heartier, but the broth is not too heavy. The soup has a sweetness to it, also with large chunks of beef. The beef shank noodle on the other hand was a glorious cure to the Vegas hang over. Light, silky cradle broth with thin slices of beef. It's great with the chili oil if you want some spice.   The knife cut noodles are my absolute favorite since I always want the noodles al dente. Right now, they're serving the green jade noodles for a limited lime made with spinach (makes the dish Instagram worthy too! I have no complaints with each dish being $10.  Overall, love love love this place and can't wait to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Shank Noodle, added a bit of their chili oil. A peep of the cucumber salad in the back.

iGwIDRR13zPgqxAw8tRQ1w.text: I have been here three times and I enjoyed my food on each visit. The place is clean, the service is fast and attentive and the food are delicious. I love their noodles. It's freshly made in the premises and cooked perfectly. My favorite is the Dan-dan noodles and the beef pancake. The noodles are very tasty and slightly spicy. It cooked and seasoned perfectly. The beef pancake is similar to pan fried Xiao Long Bao. The meet is wrapped in dumpling skin instead of bun. It has nicely seasoned beef with a little broth inside the dumpling skin.  It certainly a place to visit to satisfy my craving for fresh noodles

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Pancake
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dan-dan noodles

rDLYW9wvZdJ2dfTX6YY5wg.text: Hit this spot up for an earlish dinner, was there around 5:30pm and was able to get seats at the bar right away. This was pretty awesome since we were able to see the chefs making the noodles right in front of us. The service here was decent, everyone was nice but I wouldn't go so far as to say it was amazing. We ordered the spicy wontons and Shang's beef noodle with hand pulled noodles.  The spicy wontons were just meh for me, their sauce was a bit spicier than what I've had before and had this odd sourness to them. I wouldn't get them again honestly. The beef noodle was awesome though! The hand pulled noodles were ok but I really liked the broth and the tenderness of the brisket was superb. Only thing was I would've liked a bit more brisket.

PhGAAEowxwHtvh_z7DSciA.text: Great hand-pulled noodles and fried rice. I had lunch here with my family and we were seated promptly. Our server was attentive and took note of a food allergy which we communicated. I had the Dan Dan Noodles and they were spicy, just as I liked. The spicy wontons were a great appetizer as well, very flavorful. Overall the fried rice was my favorite of the dishes we ordered. I will be returning here next time I'm in Vegas!

T_UX9UttAk3W8mMviQpZog.text: First off, the noodles were amazing!  Took a weekend trip to Vegas and this place was recommended by an Uber driver.  We decided to check out the place because it's less than a mile from our hotel.  We signed in and the wait was 1.5 hours close to 2.  Even though the line was long, it was well worth it.  We chose the hand-pulled noodles and you can definitely tell the quality is way better than machine-made noodles.  Prices were decent.  This place is definitely recommended to try.

BJX62r9JyR2uvWKy3ddN2w.text: Came here with some friends while we were in town for a conference.  He also looked up on Yelp, seeing the reviews, we decided to try it out.  We were starting to get a little concern, we went thru some iffy neighborhoods before we there (thank you, apple maps, the fastest route is not the best).  Situated in a new strip mall, the shop is packed with people waiting outside.  It took about 25 mins for us to get seated and the tasty adventure begin.  We had order the spicy wanton, the beef pancakes and the pot stickers for appetizers, those came fairly quick and were so delicious.  Not a huge amount of spicy on the wantons, but full of flavor.  The beef pancakes and pot stickers were great, filled with juice.   Noodles were good too, I had the Dan-dan noodles, which was excellent.  Noodles were chewy, and soft at the same time with just enough texture.  The soup (my wife had it) was awesome, I kicked myself for not ordering it, cause that was awesome too.

FXa64Dqt7PE2GNCbaup2ng.text: Two days ago, I saw pictures on Instagram from two of my favorite Elite Yelpers and food bloggers, Emily R and Stefany V.  The pictures featured these absolutely stunning green noodles...and if you know me, you know that I LOVE noodles of any kind.    Checking out both pages, I discovered that Shang Artisian Noodles was celebrating their 2nd anniversary, and offering a pretty sweet dine in deal:  ALL noodle dishes 50% off...and 2 days only, hand pulled jade spinach noodles.    We arrived and took the only available seat left in the place, it was packed with people!  Shang is a small restaurant, but it is bright, clean, and features an open kitchen where you can watch the noodles being pulled, and watch the awesome process of knife cutting the noodles.    Service was polite and super prompt.  We ordered:  Seafood noodle soup with the jade spinach noodles Beef shank noodle soup with jade spinach noodles Beef and Onion pot stickers:  these we were told take about 15 minutes, which was fine.  The soup arrived first.   The seafood soup was light, with perfectly cooked shrimp and squid.  (This also comes with a fish cake, but we opted to not have that, my husband isn't a fan of fish cake.) The noodles were perfect:  They stood up to the broth and didn't get soggy at all, they maintained a perfect texture and bite.    The beef shank soup was bloody delicious.  The broth was a little more rich than the seafood broth, likely due to the beef shank.  The beef was amazingly tender.  Again, the jade spinach noodles were just perfect.  Love these.  I'm honestly a little sad that they are only available for a limited time.  The pot stickers arrived, and they looked REALLY neat.  They are pan fried and came out with this...crusty top...it looked like a giant mushroom.  The crispy crust was so yummy, and the pot stickers were hot, juicy, and really flavorful.  We really enjoyed these.  After devouring his seafood soup, my husband opted to try another bowl of soup...at 50%, wouldn't you?    He ordered the Shang Noodle soup, which was a brisket soup, this time he opted for the knife cut noodles.   This was the winner of the evening.    The brisket has a tiny bit of fat on it, which most people don't mind...I tend to have an issue with the texture, but the piece I tried was perfection.  The knife cut noodles were spectacular:  I honestly wouldn't order any other noodle with this dish.  I'd order this just for the broth.  It was SO good.   This was a spectacular visit.  Its not horribly far from us, so I anticipate that we will be going back again, and soon.    Thanks to the staff at Shang, we really appreciated the personable service, and the delicious food!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang beef noodle soup with knife cut noodles.
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nom nom nom
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef and onion pot stickers

Tupzmz5bBkhFPMuUmHgR4g.text: This noodle joint is new to the neighborhood. It's located a few miles away from the strip, even further than Palms. It's intimate -- a dozen seats at the bar and about six tables. No outdoor seating.   Even though it's 100 degrees outside, we came by for some hot noodz. There was no wait when we arrived, but the place filled up shortly after. Service was efficient. Friendly, attentive. They play Top 20 music -- not the censored version, though, and they have plenty of children who dine in.   Here's what we got:  Shang Beef Soup with Hand-Pulled Noodles - $9.75. Fair prices.  - Beef broth, braised beef brisket, bok choy and scallions.  - Flavorful and a hint of spicy.  - Great portion, good amount of noodles.  - Noodles are slightly undercooked, so expect a bit of crunch.   Beef Pancakes - Four pieces for $5.99.  - Super juicy! Be careful when cutting them.  - Pretty delish. Highly recommend.  - Great appetizer for two to share.   Ample parking, as Shang is located in a plaza. Easy to find.   Not bad for a lunch option, but it's quite far for tourists. I would come back at some point in the future, no rush.

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Pancakes

fDMo0m_u4isT3qnvcfgCSg.text: Delicious place to get some hand pulled noodles!  I had an early flight into vegas and uber straight here from the airport.  Got here at like 10:30 but they don't open until 11 am  so I had to kill some time.  When they opened, they had a line already.  The place was almost filled up at 11:30.    There was an awesome gentleman pulling some noodles and putting on a show.  Pretty cool to watch.  Very clean and modern place.  Ordered the spicy wonton and it was delicious.  Meaty and flavorful filling while the wrapping was thin and delicate.  Also ordered the pork and cabbage dumplings.  This was my least favorite dish.  The wrapping was too thick.  I ordered the dan-dan hand pulled noodles.  Flavorful, kinda spicy but the noodles were excellent.  Chewy and soaked up the flavors of the minced pork.  My girlfriend ordered the Shang beef hand pulled noodles.  Broth was deep with beefy flavor and the meat was tender.  Overall, an awesome place to grab some noodles in a nice modern clean restaurant.  Hopefully someone is making some noodles since that's a nice little show.

4zKfzL8NF9Rxj98H85wTsQ.text: Great homemade noodles! And enjoyed all the different stuff they have to offer. Had the chicken and mushroom noddles, spicy wontons and the beef pancakes. Everything was good didn't want a spicy dish to finish off. But they do have the Chile paste on the side so I added that to it.

MeD82tokbj-fI6skdMh1kg.text: The noodles here are hand made and you are able to see them make it in front of your seat! You know these noodles are fresh and you can definitely taste it. I got the beef noodles and omg it tasted so good. The soup is very rich and hearty, perfect for a colder day.  The noodles pick up the flavors of the broth too. The "dumplings" were probably overkill. I got so full from them and the meat inside was moist and super juicy. The outside of them is very crisp and it pairs well with any noodle.   One issue is that this place is kind of small, so you will wait a bit before you are seated if you have a larger group. I had to wait about 30 min for a group of 5 during lunch time.

FCwEsw8vuqHOmQblqtlKug.text: Well, the reviews are right. The food here is solid. Noodles are nice and chewy, flavored really well and not heavy on the msg.  We ate a little of everything. Dumplings, noodles, Shang fried rice, cucumbers. Everything was good.  The chicken and mushroom noodles have egg in it so don't order it if u have egg allergies.

mfQI2H2MmYLCXlGPn7eCAA.text: The texture of the hand pulled noodle was not springy and chewy at all. I was disappointed because of the raving reviews. The attraction of this restaurant would be watching them pull the noodles in front of you. The only upside to this restaurant would be the friendly service. I would not encourage you to try this restaurant even though it is a short drive from the strip.

nPancs2qH1biVCZEf0J1BA.text: 2/8/18  So the soon-to-be family is here, straight from China.  My gf's sister is more accustomed to traveling, even having spent a year or two in England getting a degree, but the rest of them........ no, as FOB as FOB can be.  And other than for our wedding, her parents pretty much have only left China for this once, and probably never will again...  So what has that got to do with this restaurant?  Well, imagine grabbing some of the most stereotypical Americans and throwing them on a plane to your favorite exotic country--you'll immediately encounter a problem... they won't eat nothing!  Hell, if it's a country where McDonald's doesn't exit, they might very well get close to starving to death.  Yup, so we just finished up Vegas and it was time to head home... and OMFG I could not believe this place existed!!!--and even just a couple miles from the strip!...  1. Shang Beef Noodle $9.75 "beef broth, braised beef brisket, veggies":  Look, the beef noodle soup here is so authentic, so good, that it's NOT authentic!!!  Cause in China, they don't actually make broth this intense, to the point that it's even a bit cloudy.  It's almost like a tonkatsu broth, but Chinese-style made from beef.  The noodles are of course great (spun and pulled right in front of you be the very non-Chinese noodle master--I believe he told me that the owner learned from China and taught him.)  Maybe the noodles aren't the most "q q" I've ever had, but they're damn good anyway.  Too bad the bok choy was a bit raw, but I didn't mind given how great everything else was... among the very best, in America, or even in China / Taiwan!  10/10  So, if you got Chinese or Taiwanese relatives over that are picky eaters (like 95% of Americans and the world), and need to eat in Las Vegas, THIS IS THE PLACE.  They'll be happy.  You'll be happy.  Shang Artisan, thank you for saving my family's lives.  5/5  #lasvegas #chinesenoodles #chineseramen #chinese #vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Master Noodle Puller wants to be a cowboy
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang Beef Noodle $9.75 &#34;beef broth, braised beef brisket, veggies&#34;

2TM5joATiY36LZwNr5XJ4Q.text: Located off Flamingo Rd in Las Vegas the parking is tight shared with the other businesses in the strip plaza. This place is small few tables and bar seating . This place does get packed during the lunch hours. The noodles are all handmade on the spot you can see them make them. Some of the noodle soup does not have noodles in them and is an extra charge. I got the Peking Won Ton soup since this one does not have noodles you can get them at an extra cost of $1.50 this was very good and I recommend getting it with noodles taste was excellent. The staff here was great and friendly. Overall good noodles and I would come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dB0eHkWrDk3HxC4gl6Qfrg.text: This place is always busy. As soon as it opens, every table usually gets filled. But any time I'm in Vegas, I stop by here for a meal on the way home.   You get seated, and given water and menus. The water is refreshing, especially being in the Vegas heat. The menus have expanded over the year, but that's not terrible. It's great. I always go for the beef shank noodles; the bok choy is crunchy, the beef shanks are always tender and juicy. The soup is never heavy. I also usually get the hand pulled noodles because I enjoy this texture more than any other noodle choice. My boyfriend usually gets the knife cut noodles, which are bigger in width. We also usually get the spicy wontons, which compliment the soup very well while you're drinking your soup and eating your noodles. Delicious and always worth the wait!

qYYYCw6FEvIivbFg2rlB6g.text: Best hand pull chinese noodles in town and even in the southwest (to me as a noodle fan from los angeles). Authentic taste  in modern style. Not big portions just right for an easy dinner. Prices as fair as Japanese ramen. Like their decoration ideas and the new way they operate a traditional Chinese noodle restaurant. Limited seating and super busy but worth the wait. Not really recommended for groups over 4. Will come back definitely when next time visiting Vegas.

dC_8bvunKDB0_wQ3De7T-A.text: Amazing noodles. We loved Dandan noodles!!! Hand made noodles are truly amazing!!  Get there early since you will have to wait.

KEPwE4710AMVfCSDsIsChQ.text: Yum! The beef noodle soup was fab! Everything about it was super! The meat was melt in your mouth and just the right amount of spice! pPMl_7_WCl9lYU_HDQzQnA.text: This is probably my most favorite find in Vegas thus far. I was looking for a noodle place and this place popped up. Shang is a little restaurant that specializes in hand-pulled noodles.   [1] Beef noodles - It seems that most of the patrons in the restaurant at the time ordered the beef noodle soup. My roommate got this and she really enjoyed it. It's served with bok choy, green onions, and cilantro. The broth is delicious and the beef is extremely tender.   [2] Dan Dan Noodles which is a dry noodle served with minced pork, sichuan pepper, chili oil and scallions. I'm always craving cold udon which can sometimes be similar to dan dan noodles, so I opted to go against the crowd and get this dish. I really enjoyed the hand pulled noodles, the minced pork was perfectly savory, and the chili oil pulls everything together perfectly.   [3] Spicy Wonton - Delicately wrapped wontons served with chili oil, green onions, and sesame seeds. Really really good dish, I would order this again for sure.   [4] Beef Pancakes - another favorite dish of mine, I always order it whenever I get the chance. The presentation of the beef pancake at Shang was unconventional, they're more like little cylindrical fried dumplings. Really good, also another must order.   The bill was surprisingly cheap for the amount of food we got! There was only one server that night and she was holding it down!! I can't wait to tell my friends and family all about this place.

yspHEHqXGws1ZqciPyYTrQ.text: Amazing.  Simply fantastic.  I'd totally go again. Clean and courteous staff combined with a great menu made this a five-star dining experience for my group.  Overall, I was just really impressed with this restaurant. I ordered the Beef Noodle Soup with hand-pulled noodles, which was just phenomenal. I want to try the knife-cut noodles next time. You actually get to see the staff create the noodles from scratch too, which was entertaining and super IG-able good (hint: use the boomerang setting). The beef was tender with a good combination of fat. The soup was simply delightful.  Price-wise, it was extremely affordable and I left satisfied. You definitely get your money's worth. We also got beef pancakes, which were good;however, I'd probably skip this appetizer next time.

KLrcx_tXJVo03V9P2UsuXw.text: Fresh noodles. I was hoping for some pho but it is standard ramen. Had the Shang beef and the pork belly soup with pulled noodles, waiter warned us that shaved noodles are chewy. Had a beef pancake appetizer and the pork and cabbage dumplings. Both appetizers will squirt all over you, we were warned, so poke and drain first. These had plenty of flavor to keep you happy. Noodles were really good, the shang broth was good and meat tender. Pork belly really does not belong in soup is what we  found out. I would skip this dish. Service was excellent, water glass never emptied. Price is okay, paying for the noodle entertainment.

My friends and I were very satisfied with the service and the food. Highly recommended to try! Will come back soon! 50% or not, one of the best noodle soups I've ever had!

wJhZmD-JTjLkbYn6ZdrlSw.text: Shang is a little restaurant that specializes in hand-pulled noodles. While we were in Vegas a month ago, the trusted Yelp app pointed us down the road from our hotel. It was nightime, it was cold, it was time for noodles!   When we arrived on a weekday night, there were only 2 tables occupied. Our server greeted us quickly, broughtus menus and checked back in minutes to take our order.   We had:   Peking wontons with knife cut noodles. The noodles were chewy, great texture in a nice light broth, but the wontons were the smallest I've ever seen. They were mostly wonton skin with very little filling, maybe the size of a dime.   Shang beef noodle soup w/ hanf pulled noodles. Great flavor with tender pieces of beef. Some had chunks of fat, some were leaner. Broth was good but noodles were lacking. It's about 1/2 of theportion of what I normally get with an order. The menu listed an extra order of noodles for $1.5. Being from SoCal surrounded by Chinese noodle joints, at first I wondered why it was even offered, but quickly realized I needed it.   The service was very pleasant and fast. The place is clean, well lit and has an open kitchen where customers who sit at the counter can witness the chef working the hand made noodles. We enjoyed our 2 orders and it hit the spot in satisfying the need for something warm and soupy, but couldn't help comparing it to the dozens of places in the San Gabriel Valley that also serve up really tasty noodles at a bigger portion and better prices.   Yes, I do recommend a visit here. Great texture of noodles, great service and great flavor. Even though I'm surrounded by places that will give Shang Artisan Noodles a run for its money, I'm not ruling them out just yet. After all, there are plenty of other items to try on the menu.
