GsR1aVb_GiFRhqFTAwuyeg.text: This was our 1st visit & came here based on reviews.  Food was amazing & staff were great!  We got there early as reviewers suggested as the restaurant is not big. We tried the beef noodle as recommended by other yelp reviewers.  It was good. We also tried the beef pancake & it was yummy.  Looking forward to trying other noodle dishes when we travel back to Vegas!

l64yvOB0dmOyA_BNaOJ5DQ.text: After my first plan for dinner bafflingly failed, I found another nearby noodle restaurant that delivered. Well, figuratively anyway. Unless you go for Uber Eats, which is fine if you don't want freshly cooked noodles, and that would probably be a big mistake. Am I rambling? Whoops.  Anyway, I found my way to the plaza on Flamingo near Decatur containing Shang Artisan Noodle as my plan B for early Sunday night dinner. It was easy to find because it's next to Yonaka, a place that's quite familiar to me. I walked inside and was glad to see that only a couple other parties of patrons were there.  I chose bar seating when the server asked me my preference. I took my time to look at the menu as well as friends' reviews. Sadly, they were out of the consensus favorite knife-shaved noodles and only had hand-pulled noodles and plain noodles available.  Of course I had to settle on the hand-pulled noodles at that point. My Shang Beef Noodle Soup ($8.95) came out after a few short minutes. The noodles indeed were al dente and tasted fresh, but they weren't utterly captivating. The broth wasn't complex, but it was  properly seasoned and hence quite slurpable (albeit with a shallower than expected wooden spoon). The beef was just tender enough and was fairly tasty. The bok choy was cooked nicely, and it brought a juicy crunch and a slight bitterness. It's not my favorite bowl of beef noodle soup around, but it's pretty solid overall.  My "appetizer" came out later, having taken roughly 10 minutes to cook as I'd been forewarned. The Beef Pancakes ($5.49) are not what Americans would call a pancake, but instead a stuffed savory dumpling or bun. They're pretty doughy and have a flavorful, juicy ground beef filling that gushes out liquid when you cut into it with the serrated knife. I completely forgot about the dipping sauce during and after my first bite, and that sauce does help lend sweetness but isn't strictly necessary. I didn't bother to try out the tableside condiments of soy sauce or chili oil on either of my orders because they didn't seem necessary.  Luckily, I got to catch a show toward the end of my meal when the chef made another batch of hand-pulled noodles. It's pretty fun to see the strands gradually take shape and thin out as the chef twists and rolls the dough. This is definitely the best part of sitting at the bar, or at least with your seat facing the kitchen.  I'll definitely come back to Shang Artisan Noodle so I can sink my teeth into the knife-shaved noodles. Even without having tried those noodles, I'd recommend this restaurant as a good solo or small group dining option for fresh Chinese noodles and those juicy, beefy morsels on the appetizer menu.

qMWeQIV0H50z_Nc5gobWBw.text: It's the best noodles I have ever!! Strongly recommend cucumber salad, beef noodle soup, and master noodle shifu

WqeLv2ijbRV6Ov-VA2O9pw.text: It's usually a good sign when walking into a packed house. That said, if you're not feeling the patience, go early- it was a Wednesday evening and our wait time was 30 minutes. No big deal here, I was looking forward to finding out what this place is all about.   As we were seated, our server delivered fresh cucumber water, the flavored water was a nice surprise. The smells are enticing for sure. The dining room lively. The decor modern. So far, so good.  Ordered: Cucumber Salad that comes with a pureed dressing- extra chili oil over top- the dressing of peanuts, chili oil, nutty sesame oil and seed, and ginger for the zing. This was satisfying, light and refreshing - a good plate to share among friends.  Beef noodle w/ Knife cut noodle - arrives piping hot and topped with fresh herbs (green onion & cilantro), the smells were so good wish there was "smell-o-vision" to share with you as the soup steamed through the herbaciousness.  My first thought after first bite? Nice tooth to the noodle! Glad we went the knife cut, on suggestion of my fellow Yelpers - good call and thanks ya'll! The texture of the meat had too much fattiness running thru to really sort through without getting fat in each bite, so that freaked out the bf and wasn't my favorite truth be told... anyone sensitive to textures, I'd say try the pork rib or one of the other soups. That said, THE FLAVOR of the meaty beef broth had that roasted-bone sweet richness- personally, I recommend this one for that deep beefy-onion flavor.  Pork rib noodle knife cut - First thought upon first bite? Oh My. In a good way. Meat had a good texture, on the bone adding all the delicious meat-on-boneness. Then there was the sweet, onion, and slightly acidicly-light and almost lemony broth that I found delightful to the last drop. Lighter than the beef, but still rich in pork broth flavor and again freshness from green onion/cilantro. The noodles were once again cooked perfectly, not soft, not too hard - just right. And I really enjoyed eating the pork down to the bone.   Solid 4.5. Will return to adventure through some other dishes, I am confident they won't disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cucumber App

Zuz5gOJDI1gbgta8ARtZDA.text: Fresh Shanghai style noodles!! They make their own noodles!! You can taste the firmness of the noodle!!  Taste is different which you have to acquire!! But, it's fresh!!   Must try!!

sSEs5HWlylZV3TrTaWXUPg.text: We are leaving Vegas to head back home to SD and needed to get something quick to eat.  This place was packed, but we arrived just in time to have a short wait.  The food was amazing.  The fresh hand pulled noodles were some of the best I've had.  We had to try the Beef Pancakes and were so happy that we did.  Highly, highly recommend this place.  We will definitely stop by here when we are in Vegas.

_dNd9vhkRjBPDeAdQO8Lxw.text: Could have been better. Although, it was decently price especially in Vegas. There were a lot of underwhelming features to Shang as I grew up in LA with a lot of noodles shops.  Let's just start off with saying that the fresh noodles were actually great. We ordered 2 appetizers and 3 noodles. I would say that their pot stickers might be the worst I've ever had or close to it. The reason to it(although the picture looks AMAZING) is that there was no seasoning and for some reason, it was like the chef accidentally got the sugar instead of the salt. It was REALLY ODD as you bite into it, you get a very bland taste that ends with a sweetness to it. I understand that there are a lot of dishes that adds sugar to food but this was just odd. I would say that was prob the worst part of it all.  The meat bun was okay. I had one better but it wasn't too shabby.  SO the 3 noodles, they all had their flaws and they all had their pros. Starting with the beef noodles, the beef was actually super good and the soup was super flavorful that I kept going back but what the problem was, was that the noodles didn't soak in the flavor of the soup. So it was like you're eating 3 things seperately. Noodles, soup, and beef. It's not say the beef noodles were bad or perhaps maybe I had to get the thick noodles for it to soak in the flavor of the soup but thatwas the issue.   The  dan dan noodles was topped off with a lot of the meats which is not the problem. It's also quite different from the usual dan dan noodles. DO I prefer the original style over this one? Maybe just a little bit. The problem was actually the fact that they brought us this luke warm. I'm pretty sure I know the reason to it too. I'm sure all the meat toppings were made already so the freshly made noodles was cooked hot topped off with the cold meat toppings making it luke warm which is just terrible. So I would prob enjoy this dish so much more if it was hot...or if you had tell me it was cold noodles but it was warm...  The chicken chow mein. I actually like this dish the most. It was really flavorful and I said that I loved the noodles despite my complains. The real issue was the horrible chicken. It just tasted bad and frozen(but mainly bad). You know it never really happens where you don't eat the proteins but this was the case because it was just awful. The chow mein with the veggies were sooooo good but that chicken really made this dish worse than it is. I was thinking about how much I would love the beef from the beef noodles with this chow mein even though it's a weird mix up but regardless it's a 3 star.   The service was better than you usual ones because there's a lot of American speakers which is good in a lot of way. So there's that.

1QhBvrU_p4ThNhTZNZVVUg.text: Friendly staff both greeting and serving. Small, bright and clean site with limited table seating and counter space. Standing room only for waiting with a constant flow of singles to groups of six. You know you'll have great reviews of your meal with a wait like this. $6 Lyft from Park MGM as this off the strip and nothing else around so you're driving out just for the food. You'll be entertained watching the hand pulled noodles being made or the shaven noodles into the boiling water. Pan Fried Pork Dumplings came out HOT and crispy, Beef Noodle Soup with the hand pulled noodles are richly seasoned well. You have a choice of hand pulled noodles, shaven noodles or noodles to the sauces dishes or soup choices. Price point is one third less than any of the casino noodle shops on the strip. Looking forward to our next visit.

3PmKVSYrntj0qFIHnSt00A.text: Epic and affordable noodles minutes from the strip!   I'm a vegetarian, and they were able to accommodate me (the tomato and egg noodle soup has meat-based broth). I had the chow mein with the hand pulled noodles and it was delicious. My mom had the hand pulled noodle soup, and she loved it as well. Shang's is perfect for some slightly more upscale comfort noodles, at a very reasonable price. We went on a Saturday night and unsurprisingly it was packed, but service was very efficient and we didn't have to wait.   If you're craving delicious hand pulled noodles and have access to a car, or don't mind splurging on an Uber, then you must try Shang's!

eCeTQzgYO5SO4PcX97jP_g.text: One of the best in vegas!  It's a small place, you get to see how they cook and make noodles, it's very entertaining.  The food is excellent.  I always get the Pork Belly with Knife Shave noodles.  Their menu is very simple and not confusing.  Service is always great.  They do get busy though but in my opinion, it's worth the wait.

1dZHxKnjyEvBYj28xxec-Q.text: Great food! Awesome ambiance...enjoyed sampling a lot of the items on the menu.  Been back multiple times.

8YyPEQQX07rwwOuBSxfUuA.text: Heard this was the noodle spot to visit, so rounded up a group and went for dinner. The store is in a newish nondescript strip mall near Flamingo and Decatur. The store inside is quite stylish and beautiful, though.   You queue at the front of the store after signing in at the lectern. We only waited a few minutes before being seated at a table for 4. The menu is quite simple and I opted for the beef brisket noodle soup with hand pulled noodles. There are 3 varieties of noodles that you can choose from.   For entertainment you can see into the glass walled kitchen and watch the cooks stretch noodles and do the cooking. Back to the soup - it was one of the best that I've tasted here in Vegas. Very flavorful and the brisket was top notch.   We also ordered the beef dumplings which are an accident waiting to happen. They were served directly from the skillet - and the waitress warned us to be careful as they were super hot. Bad idea to just bite into one as they are full of hot steaming liquid that is likely to burn your mouth. So punch a hole in the side and let the steam out if you aren't familiar with drinking boiling water. They did taste great though.   Awesome place and I will be back with other friends in the near future.

oHrwEwTSD3Ht9M6Sq-RUfw.text: This place is pretty tasty, I'd recommend the knife cut noodle over the hand pulled. The knife cut one is wide and is different from the typical noodle. The hand pulled looks more like your typical noodle. The pork ribs were very tender and fell off the bone. Beef was good too, but I liked the pork rib better. The baby bok choy was good and just the right soft and crispness. The spicy wontons are spicy, but good. The reason for four stars is because everything is pretty salty. I had to keep drinking water.

WRyzmBwruEBASQCjzMzf9A.text: Went for first time off of the reviews on here and they were all correct! Good atmosphere! Had chicken mushrooms hand pulled noodles and was flavourful and noodles tender definitely a new regular spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom Chicken hand pulled noodles

td-cPcACooEH7Q24aSaa1g.text: I feel like it's a moral sin to overpay for mediocre Chinese food on the strip. There was a convenient restaurant located downstairs of our hotel and just the thought of paying $18 for beef noodle soup and $12 for two pieces of dim sum was hard to digest. So we ventured off the strip and found this new and highly rated spot!   Solid 5 stars for organized and renovated interior, friendly service, cheap and affordable prices, and the most delicious beef noodle soup and spicy wontons! I'd always knew Chinese food on the west coast was much more superior compared to the DMV. But my goodness, their hand pulled noodles were so soft with the perfect texture. Our food arrived quickly because you can see them prepare each dish fresh as ordered. The beef to the Shang's beef noodle soup was so tender and the fatty parts just melted in my mouth. I'm afraid to say I prefer their beef over my dad's! The soup was flavorful and an addition of bok choy and extra noodles was only $1 each! That's quality and quantity!   The skin to the spicy wonton appetizer was silky and soft and the spicy sauce was different than anything I've had with this particular dish. It was spicy but not overpowering and very flavorful too.   We also ordered the pork and cabbage potstickers and the filling with flavorful with the unique addition of soup inside! So be careful as you bite into it or else the soup will shoot out the other end! You have to eat it dandy with little bites at a time. I got into it after the first piece and watching my hubby take big bites and losing all that good broth.   Oh how I wish there was such an affordable and quality place back home at the DMV. I'm sad that I discovered this place on my last day in Vegas or else I would have been coming here for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

B_QnBHNqRjLQjCQS62P3wA.text: This was so good. Family of 6 went & we all loved it. The hand made noodles are so good. Must try for sure.

HFQ2BUgbYka4dQsIPfk4gg.text: Great to see and consume noodles made thousands of years ago in China.  The knife cut noodles was something I had only seen on meTube.  It was a really good experience.

ZNGy5eBtXxGlmSnUXeGYNQ.text: Food is fantastic and ambience is great.  Loved the Shang beef noodles  Was hesistant to write a good review as place is too busy as is!  Usually minimum of 30 mins of wait but well worth it

W76nM7nrtH88jr_iyNPOAw.text: Best Chinese noodles I've ever had, and I've had my fair share in areas where you would think they're good (SF/LA/NY). Will definitely make my way back here any time I visit Vegas again.  Shang Beef Noodle - 5/5. No real complaint here at all. The meat was the most tender I've had at one of these types of places (which, granted, is a low bar cause it's usually overcooked). Noodles were springy and cut well just like good hand pulled noodles should be, veggies were just the right amount of cooked, and the soup had a deep meaty flavor without being oversalted, which is indicative of them not taking shortcuts with making the soup like other places. I was actually able to drink the entire bowl and not have a sore throat after.   Cucumber Salad - 4/5. The presentation was nice, and once you mixed the peanut sauce with the cucumber, the dish had a nice light flavor.  Spicy Wonton - 4/5. I haven't seen this in the states that often, but this was well done. The sauce hit the right sweet/sour/spicy spots without being too overbearing. My one complaint is that the amount of filling was low compared to the wrapper, so the ratio felt off when you bit into it: would have liked to see it stuffed a bit more.

oRnD3t6SZX8OFi4HWfYG6g.text: Definitely did not disappoint   The hand pulled noodles were chewy! And I'm really pretty iffy about veggies in noodles, because I like it cooked soft, so it was just right!

TfEL0tSZiHRd3xPfF3h6_A.text: When in vegas, it's always best to eat off the strip! Loved that their noodles are made in house and are fresh. Tried the beef noodle soup, chicken chow mein, spicy wontons and beef pancake.  Beef noodle soup was good, but felt a little plain compared to the ones in the 626 of los angeles. Still very good though.   The chicken chow mein and beef pancakes were delicious. Got knife cut noodles with the chow mein, which were a game changer since small noodles are typically served for that dish. Spicy wontons were ok. Not as amazing as the ones from din tai fung, but good none the less.  Overall, I will be back next time I'm in Vegas! #sendnoodz

l4ELF9nqcbuuVcbwVOu6Ig.text: So we went here on a Monday afternoon close around dinner time and it wasn't that busy. We were seated approximately 5minutes after we came in. But I think we were just lucky because as soon as we were seated, a bunch of other parties started lining up! Talk about perfect timing!  We ordered the Shang Beef, Dandan, and Seafood Noodles and a side order of the Beef Pancake. The pancake took a little too long to arrive, though. We were already more than halfway through our noodles when they served it. But it's okay.  So on to the good stuff. First, the servers are very nice, attentive, and polite. It just made the whole dining experience a lot better for a casual restaurant. Second, the food is actually pretty good. The Dandan is the clear winner for me. It's spicy and the flavors are right. A bite took me back to years ago when I was living in Singapore. That's how authentic the taste is. This doesn't, however, mean that the other two noodles aren't any good. Because they are. The Shang Beef Noodles are seasoned right and the Beef pieces are served in generous portions and are light and soft. The broth in the Seafood Noodles is also really good.  Now for the not so good bits. I mentioned earlier that the Beef Pancake took extra long to be served. And they really tell you that when you order that it takes 10 minutes. But that's not really the case. Anyway, I don't mind the wait. It's just that the noodles are a bit too heavy to eat that by the time the Beef Pancake were served, we were only able to eat one. And that's just to taste it and not enjoy it. If we could have been told that it really takes almost 20minutes to prepare, then we would have asked to just get that to us first before the Noodle Dishes. Anyway, the Beef Pancake is okay. Nothing special except for the juicy soup that goes out of it. Similar to a Xiao Long Bao.   Overall, the experience was great and we will definitely be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DmLat0kPdHaBgzBwwFdYKQ.text: Theres nothing better than Shang Artisan Noodle. It epitomizes the best of East Asian cuisine in Las Vegas. A small space with a pleasant wooden interior, Shang offers an environment that reminds me of being in Japan or Taiwan, and even allows you to watch the fresh dough being made into their awesome noodles. My favorite is the knife cut (I love thicker), but they're all great! Also do not skip the side dishes! If you're going with one, or its your first visit, you must try the beef pancake. Its flavorful, juicy, and the dough perfect. The pot stickers are also awesome (as are the dumpling, I just love a great, classic pot sticker) and I get the cucumber salad every time. I recommend the chicken sesame or dan-dan, but for those adventurous (or the vegetarian) I was impressed and would easily order the tomato and egg consistently too.

rVyI-RJVWkWyCOlgDzjA2w.text: Came here with some friends since Very Berry Cafe was closed for some reason.  This place has amazing food and the noodles and handmade.  One thing I do have to say is that my pork Belly was dry.  But, the broth was fantastic. Not greasy and full of flavor.  The beef pancakes are really good too.

SFuHtIgrxrzK2uGFzm5Nrg.text: Service was great, place is small and clean.  4 stars is for the food.  A great novelty type of restaurant with decent food.  It was good, just nothing spectacular or special about it.

TNKTnXB8Frsf8G4nuYW-1g.text: First time we tried here. Surprised with all the handmade noodles. Loved the delicious Shang beef noodle soup and chicken chow mein. A little oily, but food is fresh and tasty.

nes93uiLh9v9FN7NP81zoQ.text: Awesome noodles and appetizers! Will definitely be back. Fave was the beef with the hand pulled noodles.  Place is in a nondescript mini-mall but don't let that fool you. The food and service was excellent and even their rice barley green tea was delist!

hllNyzY0FPYKXyepzHkm1Q.text: Quality fresh handmade noodles and wonderful dumplings/potstickers. Great service too! One of my go to spots when come to Vegas

0CVWJ6M4lST8YYoHbAjUhg.text: This place is soo good. We went there before or car ride home.   Got both beef noodle soups with hand pulled noodles, potstickers and the beef pancakes. Yes, we were hungry (needed to soak up all the alcohol)!  Everything was delicious.  Service was quick and attentive. I'd definitely return.   It's a smaller restaurant but clean and a small parking lot.

nuhFN6n0549IVgQInLH_mw.text: Tried to eat here tonight, but staff decided it was better to hold multiple tables for 2 (which were open) until they had enough room for a table of nine instead of seating the two tops. Never had that happen at a restaurant, especially one that only has enough seating for 20 people. They might have well of closed their entire restaurant for ONE table of mostly small children that did not call ahead or sign in.

AokeB9xi5c66D19pGyAo3w.text: We both got the Shang noodle soup. I had the knife cut noodles and my husband got the hand pulled noodles. The knife cut noodles were overcooked and mushy. They fell apart in my bowl while trying to pick them up with my chopsticks. The hand pulled noodles were not of even thickness so the doneness was not consistent. The beef needed to be simmered longer as the tendon portions were still tough. The only thing good was the broth. Flavorful without being overly salty or full of msg. The beef shank appetizer was very tough. I would not recommend it.

JNzbd59hn2HekpZnfwK69A.text: Three people, three different things. Everything was awesome. Just as good as the HPN place we go to every time we're in NY.

34wXv1ysBeSTMX3Gjky4uw.text: Super good!!! Come here when you get tired of steaks and burgers. Lol! I love the shaved noodle. It's the best!  Delicious!!!

3VpJGJSBvW8p2Gmd25DQ8w.text: Had a quick meal w a coworker before our shift & our server was attentive & proper :) Perfect portion sizes & I recommend the pork belly noodles, hand pulled noodles. Spicy wontons were decent~ weren't as spicy as I thought they would be. I'll definitely be back on my day off :)

qhjKOgw07oEnrVaOWySvvg.text: decent chinese food, good portions and clean presentation!  i had the beef noodle soup and it was quite flavorful. the noodles had a nice bite. the colorful shang fried rice was on the salty side, but the appetizers (beef pancake/spicy wontons) were tasty.   there is a show of handmade noodles. high ceilings, ample dining space contributed to a plesant quick lunch.

xM-RMRQ_z3tuABUQHIH_0g.text: Noodles are amazing! HUGE servings too. Must come and check it out for yourself. Oh and they fling their noodles around. Pretty cool. Trendy restaurant.

zXhEI8fKD-euBvS_PeeMqw.text: Awesome! If you love beef noodle soup, get the Shang beef noodle soup. The spicy wontons are a must too. They dumplings are good. Everything I've had here has been delicious. Service is always attentive. They have a really nice cucumber infused ice water too.

V-97cEZwZrpUosYirTACCg.text: Good service. Good food. I recommend the knife shaved noodles with tomato. Tasty! The beef shang noodles had tender tasty beef and broth, not too crazy about the pulled noodles, they do give you a ton. Fried rice was ok. Spicy wontons were bomb! I ordered 2 servings and I'm glad I did. Good value for the price. Might go back next time I'm in Vegas.

1zoeVUvlyyHl0wwrZHxQiQ.text: Hands down one of the best handmade fresh noodles that you can watch sitting at the bar. The noodles are cooked right and seasoning is on point. This place is clean and trendy. Pot stick, cold sesame noodle, pancakes, and pretty much everything we ordered are so good. Would highly recommend this place to everyone if you're coming to Vegas. I also love their green tea. Bookmark it!

GJS3hBs_j9K8c3_uPdo1OA.text: Overall the dishes were solid. Not the best noodle place I've been but I'd go if I were to crave noodles. The soup base for beef noodle soup (Shang beef noodles) was not quiet what I'm used to in Taiwan. The pork rib noodle soup was a little salty and the ribs were a bit hard. The knife cut noodles were nice and chewy but the hand pulled noodles were not as chewy as I would like. The cucumber salad was really so-so with not much flavor. The beef buns were decent. Overall solid but not spectacular.

MvnoDLMlXyhWxt_gmqctYQ.text: My son's "thing" is noodle soup, so of course we had to try this place. We get a lot of good noodle soup and ramen in the San Gabriel Valley back home, but this was definitely worth the trip off the strip.  The hand-pulled noodles were delicate and perfectly cooked. We tried the beef noodle soup, pork belly noodle soup, and Peking wonton soup with noodles - potstickers and beef pancake completed the meal. Everything was delicious - my son said it's the best he's had second only to Grandma's, which is probably the best compliment he could have given. Personally, I thought it was way better than Grandma's, but it's hard to compete with formative childhood memories, so all in all, we'll just say the food was awesome!

IWh7pRImS5OYFC2UiWm0QA.text: Great food, simple, clean and real flavorful. Homemade Noodles are real delicious and tender, meat lots of flavor and well prepared except a little tough. Overall! great food and service

BMqLrziFsWnkHoKgSsg8_g.text: The people were really nice and the place was clean. However, the dan dan noodles I ordered tasted too salty. The spicy dumplings were unusually small with little meat.

22iYEJ7S_m99xa8PDGknvA.text: It was my wife and I, plus friends first time there, we loved how it was an open kitchen, and we got the hand made noodles. My wife got the Dandan noodles, I chose the Shang noodle. We both loved the dish, my friend also enjoyed his shrimp dish. I would come back to this and try the other dishes, and choose my favorite. Highly recommend to try this out!!!

XHqc_lO9JaBaQtZHIKoELg.text: Craving something soupy, try this place off strip. Worth the experience and good food for Handmade/ handpull noodle.   Sat at the bar and watched the chef hand roll and pull the noodle, and knife cut the noddles into the boil waters what an experience. Recommend sitting at the bar.   We order: Cucumber salad $4.95 ( not a fan the sesame seed sauce over powder everything)  Pork and cabbage pot stickers $5.49 ( so worth it! Takes 15 minutes to make after ordering. Hot juicy and not dry! )  Shang beef noodle with the knife cut noodle $8.95 ( did think it made much flavor was my least fav)  Pork belly noodle with knife cut noddle $8.95 ( so good! Pork could have been more tender, but the broth was good and the knife cut soaked the flavors from the broth compared to the hand pull noddles)  Dan-dan noodle with hand pulled noodle ( may fav out of all the middle dishes)   Very reasonably price for everything total was around $50

F-jvmHW9iNaAOjE_aC8oIw.text: This is my favorite place to eat in Las Vegas. The atmosphere is clean and fresh, you can watch the noodles being pulled and enjoy a nice cup of tea. The Dan Dan is to die for and the service is always great. It is a small restaurant, but the wait is never too long. The menu does not have too many choices, and that proves the quality of each dish. I have been to this restaurant 8 times in the past year, and for a town like Las Vegas where there are millions of places to eat, any place that has you going back is worth its weight in noodles.

1rIB4B-_mKoC-FfyZ0wp5Q.text: It was good. But I wasn't too impressed. It satisfies my cravings. I will return to this location

CbJ3H8vj0SLN7iaaqdEJPA.text: Agree with the 5 star reviews, also brought my Chinese parents in law for delicious noodles. Brisket Shang noodles w/ knife cut noodles was the bomb. Super flavorful brisket. Perfect noodles, much better than I've had in China!

BKlUv33Ecylh3TNjMnZOYg.text: I probably watch to many of those shows where Tony Bourdain, Andrew Zimmern, or David Chang, are in some small eatery over in Asia enjoying the local fare. I alway think "I wish we could have that here!" Well hah!  Now that I live driving distance from Vegas, I can! I'm a big fan of noodles, and had been hoping to try hand pulled noodles for years. Shang is everything I'd hoped for.  The big plus is being seated around the kitchen area where you can watch as lumps of dough are transformed into noodles. This is an art that took a very long time to develop and takes years to master.  The result is a noodle texture like nothing else.

vKIlzFoyA6NBi6iKMTDcJg.text: Wanted to have something light in vegas after all the heavy meals. This was a newly opened ramen place.  Could see the noodles being made fresh in front of us. We sat at the bar, and was able to watch as they made all the food. Quite a nice experience!!   The ordering is all done on iPad for the servers, modern layout.  It's not very big, so get there early so you don't have to wait too long.  Luckily when we got there, there was enough seats at the bar. When we left. There was a line up at the door already.   I had braised pork ribs noodles. The braised pork ribs was pretty good, but one of my family members gave me a braised beef, and that was so good! Definitely go for their signature bowl!   We got some dumplings, and also pan fried bun (sorry I don't remember the name on the menu anymore), but it was so so so juicy!!! Be careful when you bite, the juices squirt out and might be hot! We watched as the master made it in front of us. It wasn't frozen or anything!   Awesome place for some fresh made ramen and juicy dumplings!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dumplings!
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So juicy!! Must get!
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised pork rib noodles

RbW-aJaWsMSrh3aoTt7D8Q.text: REALLY good. And talk about that eye candy!  My friends and I came here on a Sunday at 3pm and there were only a couple of tables left, but they had obviously just been through a huge lunch rush as most of the tables still had to be cleaned. At first we asked for a table but thought better of it and decided to sit at the bar. Do this. Sit at the bar. It is totally worth it and the experience of watching the noodle transformation, the dumpling making, and just food preparation is probably a totally different experience than sitting with your companions at a table.  The restaurant is small -- no more than twenty tables and a wrap-around bar with about 20 seats. The staff here is super friendly and very, very helpful. They make no assumptions about how much you know about the menu and are incredibly enthusiastic to offer suggestions. For appetizers, we ordered the following: Spicy Wonton - house-made wonton with spicy soy sauce and Beef Pancakes. Totally agree with the other reviewers - the sauce for the spicy wontons is a bit on the sweet side, but otherwise they are very good. Don't expect huge lumpsof meat wrapped in a tiny wonton though, because they are cute, tiny wontons. I really loved the beef pancakes and thought they were a unique cross between a soup dumpling and gyoza. Delish!  For my main, of course I had to order soup! I tried the Shang Beef Noodle: beef broth, braised beef brisket, veggies + hand-pulled noodles. The  soup is HUGE. It is incredibly flavorful and the beef is tender and seasoned well. Everything in that bowl is delicious, made even more delicious by the hot young man constantly pulling noodles in front of us. I'm telling you, sit at the bar. Oh, and you get lots of noodles in the soup. Don't order extra noodles, that's just crazy.  Worth traveling off the strip? If only just to see the noodle maker...

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang noodle - sooooo good!
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef pancakes
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy wonton

L6FRemjPWXMFCJ7b6q2SqA.text: 5 stars for the food, 4 stars for the service and wait. They're very friendly and are working as hard, fast as they can. Perhaps to help turn tables much quicker, investing in a busser would help with the wait. Customers were waiting for their checks, waiting to pay, and then waiting to sign/payment change. 2 waiters did everything, which caused some wait but hats off to their nonstop hustle!!Outside of that, the food is really good! Fresh, bouncy hand pulled noodles. These fresh noodles make a world of difference and I'm thankful for them! I've had the Shang beef noodles, Dan Dan noodles, cucumber salad, beef pancakes, sliced beef shank, pork & cabbage pot stickers, and beef and onion boiled dumpling. All very, very tasty. But if there's one appetizer that's a must, it's the beef pancakes. If you've had XLB's, then you'll love this change in texture. Be sure to prepare your chili oil and vinegar dipping sauce too! Note that the sliced beef shank appetizer is cold. It's kind of like eating left over meat straight from the fridge. I just ended up adding it to my bowl of soup. Clean establishment and restrooms as well. I hope one opens in SoCal.

HQabtdu838zSkD3EcnslFQ.text: We came here last night for dinner, at the recommendation of my husband's coworker. Seated immediately, we ordered: 1) Shang's beef noodle soup w/ Hand pulled noodles (x2) - this was delicous; broth was flavorful with a kick of spice; husband enjoyed this bowl that he had to order 2 servings of it; since 1 bowl wasn't enough. haha 2) Pork rib noodle soup w/ Knife shaved noodles - this was great too; I had this dish; about 5 pieces of pork rib, fell off the bone, and bok choy (2 pieces) in the broth; i loved the knife shaved noodles; personally think it tastes better than my husband's hand pulled noodles 3) Pork potstickers - tastes great too; juicy pork filling  Can't wait to come back again! Limited parking in the lot.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potstickers, Shang beef hand pulled noodles, pork rib knife shaved noodles

_Ljb47yXdxlvwOM24cP4mA.text: Okay so we might be giving this place too much credit but the only reason why we gave it 4 stars because the ingredients were FRESH, most importantly the noodles. It was so fresh that I feel like the noodle was too bland. Kind of like "doughy". The noodle did not absorb the flavor in the dish as much I thought it would which was disappointing.   So we ordered the Dan Dan noodle which was minced pork with green onion and spicy soy sauce. That itself was on point. Super delicious especially if u add more green onion and the chili paste provided at the table. (If u like spicy) We also ordered the Shang fried rice which the waiter recommended as most popular and most definitely, that dish was super good. The taste was super favorable that we finished the whole plate! Lol we also ordered one of the appetizers, which was the beef and onion boiled dumplings. It was okay. The dough by far was fresh but a little too hard than expected than the usual soft dumpling you're used to.   With that said, the place was clean. Service was fast and friendly. Small but accommodating with the typical noodle bar which we sat because we enjoy watching the cooks cook and noodle dough being made.  What was also awesome was that you could choose 3 types of noodle for your dish which I haven't experienced at any other noodle place like this! You can choose between hand pulled, knife shaved and another option I can't think of. I recommend the knife shaved one even though I didn't try it myself! Lol it looked really good on everyone else's orders. We unfortunately picked the hand pulled noodle which I feel might've been too thick which is why the flavor did not absorb well. Overall, nice experience but not nice enough to crave or go back to...

janntpzxWX2-Y_V2V2LoPw.text: I really hate to review this place because you'll come here, like it, tell all your friends, then it will be a bitch for me to get a table and have to wait....   It's the bomb. No booze license so come buzzed already and prepare to eat well. Dinner and a show.

bvZrkuxBsR6EE_aBACBfkg.text: Came in here expecting good spicy noodles but was thoroughly disappointed. The noodles was spicy hot alright but missing a lot of variety in the spices. Also the noodles itself had a very bad texture in the bite and pull.

We also had the Pork Belly noodle soup with shaved noodles that was also as good the broth was tasty and the pork belly almost melted in your mouth would recommend both dishes...  keep up the good work !!!

2QR7ynndXpcX0kzCHlrU0Q.text: I wish we have this place back at home. Screw Ramen this is a way better alternative for egg noodles. Taiwanese with a bit if Chinese touch, these are some of the best Dan Dan noodle dish around.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Must try all! Best of the best.

Qs7KnRqqmvwtRq73pYf8RA.text: Here for the lunch noodles. Beef noodle soup on a cold Dec. Friday morning. Hand pulled and fresh. The dining room is small and gets packed; but the food is worth it. Spicy wontons for appetizers are delish. Bathrooms are clean and service was friendly. There's a nice little show when they hand pull the noodles right there in the restaurant. Prices are decent to for the quality, and quantity. Make it a stop next time you're hungry and near the Decatur & Flamingo area (just west of the Palms Hotel and Casino.)

fRv8zuFo3BwbV25gmbG_MQ.text: Was really happy to try a new hand pulled noodle place!! Since Noodle man and Ramen Kobo were both disappointments   Clean and modern decor, well lit, very comfortable ambience  The cold cucumber appetizer was tasteless to us, two other friends joined us later and agreed, we didn't finish  Chili wonton looked promising!!!! All 4 of us again was disappointed with the blandness.   3 of us ordered their house beef noodle soup and I ordered the Dan Dan noodle. My Dan Dan noodle was super salty and my husband did not care much for the beef noodle soup.  However our 2 friends enjoyed their beef noodle soup very much. I would suggest to come and at least try it for yourself since 2/4 of us really liked it.  Great news is, noodles did looked and tasted hand pulled and the staff was very nice and friendly!

83XvQC0kx2XxzlQFX-tO5w.text: This was our first time here after reading the other great reviews and we were not disappointed.  We had the Shang beef noodle soup and it was absolutely delicious.  Enjoyed watching how they hand toss the noodles for the soup!  Nice setting and very clean!  This place fills up fast so get here early.

36S4YSppgTCbOirz5TTh7g.text: A great find among all of the overpriced, underwhelming Asian food on the Las Vegas strip! Even though this is technically off the strip, it's definitely worth the short drive; one, because of the reasonable price point, and two (and most importantly), the food is really good! The night before I visited this place, my dad and I had some pretty bland noodles and dumplings at some resto in Ceasar's Palace, and not only did it not hit the spot, but we paid an absurd amount for what we got. Our dining experience here was a different story. Everything was super tasty and the noodles were a really good texture/consistency - perfectly al dente. My party had the spicy wontons, beef pancakes, beef shank noodles and shang beef noodles, all of which were really good! The next time I'm in Vegas and in the mood for soupy noodles, I know where I'm going!

NUAa_AiHhII3mljt5IXDEw.text: Dan Dan Noodles, ftw! This has been the best place for hand pulled Dan Dan noodles so far. Super excited for the chance to have this again for dinner whenever I'm in Las Vegas. Be sure to order extra noodles as you'd want to soak up the remaining juices and yummy meats that linger after your large portion. Haven't had anything else on this menu and probably won't. Eat the noodles!!!

F0t-0mdH5j6fOx-OJIOwlw.text: Super Impressed with this place. We came in from the Bay Area so we've seen a few This is one of the best meals we had during our week stay. Great, clean, hip ambience.  They did their best to accommodate our party of ten. But most impressive was the food. The noodles were just the right chewy texture, dumplings were very good. Noodle soups were super tasty and the price is right. They know what they're doing!  Will be back.

QWExhYqKlcTkMBs61NOkKA.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE hand pulled noodles! I thought the tables were a little small and seating was a little tight but not uncomfortable. Usually has a long wait as the place is a little small but worth the wait if you've got some time! Def recommend to anyone looking for a little comfort food whilst in Vegas! Boyfriend got the beef noodle soup and loved it. I got the one with pork belly and wontons and also loved it. I can't even describe the flavor profile accurately without doing it wrong- its savory, light, umami, its everything it's supposed to be.   You've just got to try it for yourself!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gtueKIo8MocohZLHLvFvdA.text: "Shanging out" at Shang Artisan Noodle should become a new verb trend, defined by relaxing with friends or significant others over Vegas' best Chinese style knife cut "QQ" (ie, al dente) noodles. Located off the strip proximate to the Palms Casino Resort, this modern meets age old traditional Chinese style noodle-ry offers the warm opportunity to satiate your cravings to teleport to old Shanghai (or Taiwan?) and enjoy oodles of delicious knife cut noodles; a fun dumpling fling; and more...  Against the backdrop of Vegas' vibrant and colored music scene, a bite into the chewy noodles will have you jamming: 'she Shangs she Shangs, oh baby, she chews she chews, I go crazy cause it looks a little sour, but it stings like a bee, the yummiest hand pulled noodles in historyyyy.'   My favorites?  (1) The Spicy Wonton (ie notice the notation HOT next to it on the menu  - A little smaller than usual, this appetizer dish is comprised of mini spicy wontons tossed in a house special spicy sauce, sesame, and green onions. The sauce is so delicious it can be eaten with rice and make for quite a delicious meal in itself.   (2) The Shang Beef Noodle (with Knife Shaven Noodle) ()- Witness the Noodle master carefully pull and cut the knife shaven noodles in front of your eyes. The aroma of the beef and chicken broth with aromatic star anise based traditional five spices waft to your inner depths of your soul. This is the only soul mate I need - it was love at first bite. The QQ tender noodles so expertly balanced against the depth of the beef broth, with just the right about of crunch from the baby bok choy and green onions has got my mind dreaming.   Note: you may elect from 1 of 3 types of noodles: hand-pulled noodles; knife shaven noodles; and plain noodles. I hands down recommend the knife shaven noodles.   Shang, your delicious bowls of knife shaven noodles have given me a safe haven - a humble retreat from the opulence of the strip - my heart S(h)ang...

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang beef noodle
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang beef noodle (knife-shaven noodle)

ODnlC824xbHZsKZtAWA0EA.text: These noodles are fresh, delicious, and are sure to fill you up.   Arriving to Vegas on a Friday afternoon, we quickly stopped over for a meal before the debauchery began. A hearty meal at it's core, the noodles are a great start to the weekend. The Shang Beef Noodles seem to be the most popular option as that is what I also chose. There are three different options of noodles, and I am sure that all three are good options.  With my meal, I chose the knife-shaved noodle. They are basically chunks of noodles to go along with your beef noodles. To be honest, the beef noodle soup wasn't anything special. It's good, but it does not shine as much as the noodles. From the taste of the noodles, I knew it was fresh and made to order. They also give you a heaping serving of beef chunks which always helps to make the restaurant stand out.   I like this place for the fact that the servings are big, the noodles are fresh, and the soup is good. Not sure if it would be worth if it there was a giant line out the door though. I did enjoy the hearty meal at the start of the weekend.

sizY6TwYvwo7WavyeD1MOg.text: BEST BEEF NOODLE SOUP EVER - the broth is sooo savory and has the perfect amount of kick in it! The beef very soft and fell apart in my mouth. They have option for hand pulled or knife cut noodles. I got the knife cut noodles which were amazing. They were thick and soaked up the broth.  - the wontons were soo good they were the perfect amount of spice and super juicy - onion pancakes were crispy on the outside and hella juicy on the inside   Service is great, they came around often to pour us their cucumber flavored water.  - took about a 25 minute wait we came on a Saturday noon time for lunch. It's pretty small and crowded, located in shopping plaza with a great boba place next door as well. I was happy and full :)

htOnGOUWid14NQm3Owo_XA.text: Not 5 stars....6 stars from me. Yes, it's that good.   My friend and I decided to pay this place a visit and we weren't disappointed.  You know it's a great place when Google, Trip Advisor, Yelp, Zagat, hotel bartenders and a couple of locals HIGHLY recommend this gem.    My friend and I walked in 20 minutes before closing....now, at most most restaurants, the staff would moan and groan - not here.  We were warmly greeted, seated and given the menu. I had done some research ahead of time and knew I HAD TO order the dan-dan noodles and the spicy wontons...we asked our waiter for any recommendations, he suggested the beef shank soup and we ordered it.  When the food was brought to us, it was like the heavens parted and the angels sang.  The dan-dan noodles were the best I've ever had, the spicy wontons were worth their weight in gold. (The spice had a slow kick....you'll think, "where the heat" and then you feel it.) The beef shank soup was delicious!  The meat was nice and tender with tons of flavor - the broth.....just put it in an I.V. bag and stick it in my veins.  Have I sang the praises of the noodles?  If not, I should.  The hand pulled noodles are deliciously al dente.  They deserve an award or a song.  Yes, the humble noodle is that good.  Seriously, do yourself a favor, get away from The Strip and visit this local gem.  Your wallet and tastebuds will thank you.   (Before I leave town, I will be visiting and getting another order of dan -dan noodles and some of their beef pancake.)

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy wontons.  These little bad boys are a work of art.
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Need shank soup.....DELICIOUSNESS IN A BOWL.
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arial view of the most delicious dandan noodles in all of Vegas!

6vn2IitTFgkrDgjfDASb2A.text: The noodles at Shang blew me away! It literally revived me from a 4.5 hr drive with its delicious soup, flavorful beef shank, and chewy noodles; I got the Beef Shank Noodles with Hand-pulled Noodles.  Besides my own dish, I also got to try my family's dishes which were all AMAZING. The Dan-Dan Noodles was spicy, but everything came together very well. Pairing the dish with the Cucumber Salad was the best life decision I've made in awhile. The Cucumber Salad was, of course, refreshing with fresh cucumber chunks drowsed in peanut sauce; I was in love.  The Shang Beef Noodles came with tender beef brisket and had a slightly darker flavor compared to the Beef Shank because of the addition of chilli oil and paste. It was, nevertheless, super enjoyable as well.   We also got the Beef & Onion Boiled Dumplings and Fried Rice to share. The Dumplings were decent, but not mind-blowing. On the other hand, the Fried Rice was very well-fried, dry and smoky, with plenty of shrimp, ham, and veggies.  It was hard to fault Shang in its food and service. Although the place was packed, the staffs worked very efficiently and got through the queue of customers swiftly. I'm so glad to have found and tried Shang. Its beef noodles will forever be in my memory.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Shank Noodles
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang Beef Noodles
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dan-Dan Noodles

oqe1iAiu9F8IpVoAg4Tdbg.text: If you're visiting Vegas, it's worth traveling off the strip to experience Shang Artisan Noodles. The hand pulled noodles are on point, and the spicy wontons are some of the best I've ever had.   Noodles are all about "mouth texture" as my mom would say, and Shang has got that down! The noodles are perfectly chewy and fresh. I am only sad that my stomach isn't big enough to try both the dry and wet noodles. Guess it's another reason to come back to Vegas!

AbwH4aVs_FsYJGK6Q8oFPQ.text: Totally worth it  Came all the way from CA and had to stop by The noodles are super chewy! The interior is nice and I love all the wooden accents, tables. I came on a Sunday around 2 thinking it was after lunchtime and there was a waiting list and stready stream of customers. It's very popular.

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang beef noodle soup.

Z-UcfZraVC8Y0GfyfhcUSQ.text: Been there, done that. It's a hole in the wall with maybe 20 seats. Definitely not a place to socialize or hang out because there's always people waiting to be seated and you feel rushed.   I like their spicy wonton, perfect burst of flavor in my mouth. It is now $5.99 and got like 6 pieces of wonton (not the biggest either). When I saw that it was so small, I had to order another one for the hubby. Noodle soup wise, I ordered both the hand pull and knife cut. It taste the same like anywhere else, really nothing special and at $9.95 each. My total bill came out to $35. I live in Vegas, at this rate I can eat any where. Definitely a nice experience but I would not go out of my way to come here for it, I'll settle for a hearty bowl of Pho any day.

6oC8kVsnzR13v4AG2wXLKg.text: Al dente knife-cut noodles and flavorful broth. Needed to double check my gps location to make sure I wasn't already back in the Bay Area upon slurping the noodle jizz in my mouth.  Cannot believe I'd been so stupid trying to find some authentic chinese food around the strip before finding this gem. Pretty sure this was the only place my parents legitimately enjoyed during our Vegas trip without feeling like my wallet got robbed.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Legit knife cut noodles and flavorful beef brisket broth

twCmdUzSYBbJiMdq5rByhg.text: I came here for lunch after a hike after seeing amazing review and thoroughly enjoyed my experience.   It was Monday at around 1pm and there was about a 10 minute wait. Besides that, everything was fast and smooth and efficient.  I got the pork ribs soup with hand pulled noodle and being curious as I was, I ordered a side of the hand shaven noodle as a side as well. I also got the beef pancake.  The noodle soup came out first and it was in decent size bowl. I was more amazed at the portion of the hand shaven noodle..it was humongous for an extra $1.50! The soup was amazing, I slurped that soup until there was nothing left. The pork ribs were eh, I could do without it as it didn't really do anything to the dish. As for the noodles, you can tell the difference between shaved and pulled as the pulled noodle was chewier and sturdier. The shaved noodle was softer and would have gone really well with a dry style dish. Both were delicious though.  The beef pancake was also delicious. They were fat, crispy and plump on the outside and filled with soup on the inside. I love the sweet-ish siy sauce as it compliment the dumplings very well.   Overall, portion, price, efficiency and quality exceeded my expectations and I would definitely come back for sure

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef pancake

nM5k7Fm1zo5hQ1IZ1eDcXw.text: I've had a bunch of hand pulled noodles in the past few weeks and the bowl I had here was one of the best. We got the original Shang bowl and the pork ribs bowl and both were super flavorful with chewy noodles that made for a dreamy combination. I preferred the knife cut noodles over the other ones but both were delicious. Very reasonably priced and the interior was so cute!

InwPcoJVTFohH6fcTl1ykQ.text: I enjoyed my inexpensive meal.  Ordered the spicy wontons and the sauce they were sitting in was delicious.  Also had the tomato and egg noodle dish, adding bok choy for additional $1.  That was yummy too.  Gotta love those noodles!  We were seated at the counter but didn't get to see noodles being handled.  Maybe they just didn't need to make a new batch while I was there since it was during non peak hours.  As for service, it was excellent.    Upon my departure from the city, I tried out a different noodle place just to compare.  Verdict is, I wish I had come back here instead!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uasqjT8e71LDz4xM_yteMg.text: Don't laugh but this was our first stop after our flight landed in McCarran International! It was a Sunday around 11:30 am. Lots of people were already waiting outside.  As I put my name on the waiting list, I counted 26 people in front of me!!!  Not acceptable. We left for my plan B stop in Chinatown (Mian).  A week later after we hiked 6 national parks , we had our second attempt. This time it was a Tuesday, also around 11:30 am.  No line and plenty of tables available.   We ordered Shang Beef Noodle and Pork Belly Noodle, $9.95 each.  Since we sat at the bar, we got to watch the noodle master hand-pull and cook our noodles. There were also classic Chinese miniature dining rooms on display at the bar counter which were pretty cool to see.  We knew when our noodles were ready because we observed the entire cooking process. The Shang Beef Noodle soup was simply perfect. The noodle, beef, and the broth...all spot on.  I really couldn't find any bone to pick.  The flavor of the broth was similar to the Taiwanese beef soup, my favorite variety.  The Pork Belly Noodle soup, on the other hand, was a bit on the salty side, overwhelmed by soy sauce. I would not recommend it.   I was very happy with my experience. I would definitely come back next time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang Beef Noodle Soup $9.95 - Excellent!
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Bell Noodle Soup $9.95 - Too heavy on the Soy Sauce
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from the bar - best seats :)

0POU0L6XW-uBtqKuizijBQ.text: Bottom Line Up Front (BLUF), this place is amazing. Great food, excellent service, and wonderful atmosphere.   Now, as Paul Harvey would say, "...Now for the rest of the story." The wife and I are on the strip for a conference all week. At the end of the first day, we were looking for a place to eat.   She found and recommended this location. I hinted that it was too far (4 miles), I complained that the Uber there and back would cost more than the meal (for both of us)!!!!   While in the Uber, I gave her the "... slow head turn" look of disappointment at each missed stoplight (9 total).....   Sixteen minutes later, we arrive. From the time we sat down, we were all smiles, toes wiggling, and holding each other's leg.  After the great suggestions from the waiter, we ordered. We watched the cook toss and twirl our hand cut noodles. We received our food and retreated deeper into our heavenly place!!!!   You gotta take some and treat yourself to this little piece of heaven on earth.   Ps: Meal cost: $26.94       Uber cost: $19.34       Experience: Priceless!!!!

U4wEaJeIwsYBaOBuz0FKcw.text: What a unique experience! The noodle dishes we ordered were very flavorful, i'd say one of the best noodle soups out there! The beef in the Shang Noodle Soup was very tender, soup base was incredibly good! Equally tender and tasty was the Pork Rib noodle soup. I was initially gonna go for the pork belly soup but our server suggested it was fatty and perhaps the pork rib is less fatty.. He was right! The cucumber salad was very refreshing! It had brown sauce on it with a hint of sesame oil. While you are enjoying the meal, you can watch the staff preppin' the noodles. You choose from 3 different kinds of noodles: Hand-pulled, Knife-shaved noodle or regular noodle. We went for the Hand-pulled noodle!  Staff were friendly and attentive. Note: this is a fairly new spot so please support them!

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice decor in the restroom...

gWxbQVBu5DAFK7SEKqYBSg.text: Ahhhhhhh Jesus. It's hand cut, fresh noodles. My weakness.  There's nothing like hand pulled noodles AND knife cut. We had the chili oil dumplings which were nice (although I prefer the ones at Noodle Man). Our party of 5 ordered several items, including the cucumber salad with peanut sauce (satay sauce).   The Shang Beef Noodle soup was nice. It'd give it a 4/5 stars. The flavor just wasn't for me, but everyone in my party enjoyed it. I'd like to try the beef shank or pork belly if we come back.  One item that we did order that was fire were the Pork & Cabbage Potsticker.  Seating is pretty limited so expect a wait. We waited about 15 minutes on a Thursday night which wasn't terrible.

8tp1PNNt7gUYQsLJNK_cjA.text: It's off the location on the strip, but who cares because the food is so good and inexpensive.   Whenever I go here, I ask for the "chicken chow mein hand pulled noodles" - you'll thank me later. It's the BEST chow mein in the valley in my opinion.  The portions here are PERFECT. Noodles are carbs and carbs are heavy. So wear sweatpants! Lol.   I prefer sitting at the bar because you literally see the noodle gods pulling and cutting away. Plus, they make handmade dumplings!! Who wouldn't love this place? I personally prefer the beef pancake over the dumplings, but be careful with the beef pancakes cuz it squirts juices  and you don't want that in your eye! DIP THE BEEF PANCAKE IN THE SAUCE WITH THE CHILI THATS ON THE TABLE. Again..you'll thank me later.    The workers are nice and they always refill the water. That's an automatic win for me! It's a very cozy place and the wait time isn't that bad at 7:30PM on a Saturday!

DeacO8b7Pn96NeCjP-CsTQ.text: One of my best decisions to come here after my quick stay in Las Vegas and it was quite honestly the highlight of my trip!   After reading several reviews about their hand pulled noodles, I was instantly intrigued because I have never had it before. PLUS, what made the whole experience even more spectacular is that they make the noodles in front of you. I was blown away by the noodle craftsmanship bestowed upon me and it made the 20 min wait much more bearable with my pending hunger and childlike impatience.   BUT yes... there is one negative and that is the WAIT TIME. The restaurant is quite small with some tables and a bar section. I did come in with a party of 7 around 8:30pm on the weekend. So I highly recommend arriving earlier or be granted a long and uncomfortable time of waiting around.   NOW ONTO THE BEST PART ..THE FOOD!!   SHANG BEEF NOODLE SOUP: 5/5 Makes sense that this seems like their most popular item on the menu. It had extremely tender chunks of beef and fresh boychoy. The noodles were soft and chewy. The soup held tons of flavor. Everything was perfectly balanced ..as all things should be. :D  SPICY WONTONS: 5/5  Soft and juicy wontons filled with meat in a bowl of chili oil sauce. Simple dish yet it was packed full of flavor and was around delicious.   PEKING ZHA JIANG NOODLES: 5/5  Came with an array of vegetables including carrots, edamame beans, sprouts, and cucumber. The sauce had pieces of minced pork. Definitely get this if you're looking at their "sauce noodle" menu section.  Also, I want to add that their wooden utensils with their engraved restaurant's name add to their whole aesthetic. Many people would overlook the small detail but I thought it just added another level of depth to the place.   OK LASTLY and a small disclaimer..  I know I'm not the best at describing food and flavor..but I do know when the food is GOOD. My descriptions don't do the food justice so please stop debating to come here and give this place a try. It's a MUST!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peking Zha Jiang Sauce Noodles with Hand pulled noodles
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Wontons
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9xe7OjCCupCS3H41o8On6w.text: I remember the first time I had a bowl of ramen that's not  cup noodle and it completely blew me away. It changed my life. I cherished first moments in my life, and often wonder if I could experience that again. And I did. This time it was at Shang Artisan Noodle. The way I taste, feel, and see noodles will never be the same. There's no going back.  There are so many noodle houses in this city. Options are endless. As I've learned from my past, you never judge a book by its cover. This noodle shop is in a strip mall. It honestly lacked that authentic Asian store front I would expect from a decently high rated location in Las Vegas. Upon entering I noticed this shop is smaller than I expected. At the front you will find a noodle boy rolling long ropes of noodles for show. We were greeted by a pleasant waiter as soon as we enter. He sat us closer to the back of the shop. Most of the seating were empty which I was pleasantly surprise considering the reviews of others consistently long wait time is expected. This is a tiny place with probably 50 max seating.  Taking a first glance at the menu I found that their offering was very simple. Which I really like. There was a list  of appetizers to choose from. Then I started to glance over their noodle items. It's the main reason I'm here. They serve three cut style of noodles. I wasn't familiar at all to any of them so I needed more assistance with that. Staff was pleasant and service was good. I opted for a shaved noodles.   Now, when you're at Shang artisan noodle..I swear you cannot go wrong with whichever bowl you choose. Feeling nostalgic, I opted for their tomato egg sauce with add on bean sprouts and spinach (delicious add on available for extra $$) it's a dish I remember vividly from my childhood. That dish reminds me of grandmother. The noodles came real shortly after our order. I mixed my noodle bowl around and my first bites were so surreal. I felt transported back to my childhood in East village. The next bite I had screamed where am I? The noodles was cooked perfect with incredible texture, and chew. I felt like I was eating in a shop in China. Wow..wow.. just amazing. I had a taste of my partner's noodle bowl. He opted for the beef broth soup. I had a spoon full of his broth, and oh my. Nom nom nom. I was actually speechless.  This is probably the longest review I have ever done for Yelp. But you get the idea. Shang Artisan Noodle is a place you don't want to miss! if you want not only good noodles, but food that literally entertain all your senses and takes you back or forward to memory lanes look no further!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ry_zdwY4xkEi2ZZuKdJs3A.text: Off the strip in a much more calm, quiet area, exiting the crazy Vegas glitz and glamour.  This place was literally AMAZING. I'm not sure I would be able to find a beef noodle place as good in LA... and that's saying a lot.  I got the beef shank noodle soup and I could not stop drinking the broth, which, honestly, is the best part of this dish.  There were big heavy cuts of beef and tons of noodles!   Overall, great experience and amazing food. I will be back when I come into/go out of Vegas again!

J4OHYfo4892yy2-9V-wvWQ.text: Great service, better quality noodle than The Magic Noodle and the broth was excellent too.  The beef pancakes and the pork & cabbage pot stickers did not live up to the Yelpers' reviews. Instead, both were too doughy and heavy. The Yang-Zhou fried rice was excellent and delicious.

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef pancakes:doughy
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried pork n cabbage pot stickers: doughy

9RX4qDKqMPiyBSXPW_xXmg.text: This place is a MUST!! I recently went to Vegas for our 6th wedding anniversary without the kids and we just went nuts! Drank all day and partying all night... Day after, we were so hungover, my wife suggested that we go get some soup with noodles. Our usual go-to is a Vietnamese Pho joint but my wife asked if I likes traditional Chinese food and I said no because... Well... I never had it! After a bit of debate of what it is and why we should try it..etc.. Finally, I gave in and went to this place. Right when I got in, I was bit confused because it said Chinese Artisan Noodle and they are famous for their TRADITIONAL CHINESE NOODLES, but it was small and very contemporary, almost looked like a chain restaurant. Everything aside, we got seated and ordered what my wife had already researched and chosen for both of us... Yes.. The staffs were very nice and helpful. The order came out faster than expected, which also raised another red flag, but I was hungry, hungover and just needed something in my stomach. So, she ordered the Shang hand-pulled beef noodle and dan-dan noodle, which is a spicy soy sauce with minced pork and veggies. The Shang beef noodle!! My man!! The soup was red but but spicy.. and the braised beef brisket... Was the most tender and perfectly cooked and there were a lot floating in the bowl, I almost cried... It was superb! It was about $10 but it was worth every penny. The dan-dan was not my kinda noodle dish, just because it was bit too spicy without the flavour to back it up. It was still good but I guess I was too blinded by the SHANG BEEF NOODLE! I saw that they had other great dishes, which I will definitely try next time I visit Vegas. I am a fan and I encourage everyone to try this place when you go to Vegas!!!

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Shang Beef Noodle

iHHBCrz8YOqsc3X3XLrnIQ.text: As the name implies,  hand made needles from scratch! The portions were perfect,  we under estimated and had lots of extra food.  Our meals were wonderful not one complaint from our lunch crew.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib soup!
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dumplings

twXnyB2moeiTwJY9YcIvig.text: After reading so many positive reviews about their dishes, my expectations were high. High enough to make about a 20-30 minute drive out. Parking is a bit hard to find and there is always a line, no matter what time you go. However, as you wait, you can sip on some boba from the store next door. I'd have to admit, I was a bit underwhelmed by the flavors of the dishes. The best one was probably the cucumber appetizer, with the spicy wontons at a close second. As for entrees, I definitely preferred the soup noodles more than the dry ones. The soup had flavor, but not as much as the soup noodles I'm used to back home in the SGV. It was a bit pricey, and considering the two hour wait, I would say that I would not come back.

1aUTlajTVd2IIt96A79YCA.text: I'm down here in Vegas, and I just had to seek out one of these noodle places that specializes in, house made from scratch, hand pulled noodles as well as the knife cut noodles. No using big boxes of dried noodles here like some local chop suey joint. Coming from Sacramento area in CA, we have no hand pulled noodle places, I'd have to go to SF area and forget trying to park there! I was looking forward to trying hand pulled noodles for the first time. I think these are wheat based noodles, as opposed to rice (white), or egg (yellow), as they can be stretched and tossed about.  Shang Artisan Noodle has an easy location in a little strip mall with easy parking, right next door to a new Thai restaurant. Inside it's very modern and not real big. It can get crowded on weekend prime times. The kitchen noodle production is behind glass and you can easily watch the noodles being made and tossed about stretching the gluten in the noodles.   The menu is on the smaller side, hence they can concentrate on doing each dish well. They offer sections of appetizers, Noodle Soups, Sauced Noodles as well as fried rice and chow mein. The noodle dishes can be had with either hand pulled, Knife Shaved or plain noodles.  Prices average about $6.00 for appetizers including won tons, pot stickers and beef pancakes. The noodle soups are all around $10.00, including the traditional beef noodle soup to the more exotic pork belly noodle soup. The sauced noodles were all around $9.00 and included Dan Dan Noodles as well as the less seen Tomato and Egg noodles. If you really want something like fried rice or chicken chow mein, they have that here too. The full menu with prices is posted on their website.  I tried the appetizer of the Beef Pancake along with a bowl of the spicy Dan Dan Noodles. I've never had or seen a dish like the Beef Pancake, less like a pancake and more like the shape of a little crab cake. It was basically a dumpling with a thick skin with a beef mixture inside, pressed into that shape and browned on each side, like a pot sticker is browned on one side. It was good, but maybe not eyeball rolling back great. The food came out of the kitchen fairly quickly.   Next was the big bowl of noodles. It's served with all the separate ingredients presented on top of the noodles, then you mix it with chopsticks. There were no forks on the tables, so you better know how to use chopsticks ... it's not that hard, but I might say at times a fork may have been easier with these long noodles.   My first bite of these hand pulled fresh made noodles .... OMG! These are the most wonderful noodles I've ever had! The texture was just right and the feel in my mouth along with the spiciness was something you just gotta try! I really enjoyed this dish ... but I'm sad I can't get this at all where I live! Gotta get back to Vegas soon! You lucky people who live here, need to get over here and try the noodles! There was no language barrier at all, as it can be a problem at some ethnic food places. I'm eating here again next time I'm in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks like a rounded pot sticker.
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside of Beef Pancake
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Pancakes, not really pancakes.

DAlig3SgBy-2gE-8Hzw5UA.text: The beef noodles were a tiny bit salty for me but the hand pulled noodles really are the bomb diggity. This is not overly hyped at all. We even ordered 6 to go because that's how much we enjoyed it. Sadly, at home, the noodles aren't as chewy as they were fresh out the pot.   Texture-wise, we preferred the hand-pulled noodles over the knife-cut but both were good.   Definitely order the beef pancakes, which are more like fried juicy pork dunplings in thick dough. It was surprising to have juice oozing out so be careful not to burn yourself. I can eat this all day. Next time I visit vegas I'll be ordering these for delivery to the hotel room. 5/5  Spicy shrimp wontons were also good. Not memorable but not bad. 4/5  Per recommendation from the waiter we also had stir fried chicken and mushroom over white rice. It was okay. 3.5/5

gj-_1PgxHVhK6PRJ_S8Vww.text: I'm normally not a beef noodle soup kind of person, but this place was very good, especially for the price. We started off by sharing some pan-fried dumplings and chow-mein. The potstickers were awesome because they were "real" potstickers - the residue of "crust" were still on the dumplings, so you know they were cooked the real traditional way. The chow mein with knife cut noodle was surprisingly good. I always associate chow mein with crappy Chinese take-out, but this plate gave me hope that chow mein could be a real delicacy. The best thing about the noodles was that they had some chew to them. The hand-pulled noodle pork belly soup was perfect for a slightly chilly afternoon after a hike in Red Rock Canyon. I wish there were more slices of pork belly, but the chewy noodles and tasty soup more than made up for it.   The waiter staff were fantastic - one guy was *almost* too chipper and happy, while the waitress was always there to fill out water up to the brim. It was really great service (something you don't always find in Chinese restaurants). Although it's a little off the strip, it's definitely worth the trip!

Dtgm46YW62qe1eITvqjLeA.text: Artisan noodles! Nothing beats fresh hand made noodles. This small local Vegas noodle place is doing the noodles right! The properly crafted, stretched, cut, & cooked noodles were the perfect arrival dinner in Vegas after a long drive! Spicy wontons were perfect bite sized appetizers. Interesting mala/spicy sauce. It wasn't that spicy, just enough heat to make your appetite to perk up. Ordered the knife cut dan dan noodles and hand pulled zhajiang noodles for entrees. Dan dan didn't look all that spicy but the heat kicks in after the slurping so be aware. Sauce is simply minced pork and peppers sauce. No sesame/peanut sauce. It was little more spicier than dan dan noodles I'm used to but delicious! It will wake up your tired scrunched up body from 4 hour drive from Cali to Vegas! Zhajiang noodle sauce with the minced pork was sweet, savory, & just delicious!! The fresh and crisp vegetables (edamame, carrots, cucumber, bean sprouts) added nice crunchness for the hand pulled noodle.  Service was friendly, fast, & accommodating! Our waters and teas were topped off without asking for refills. Food is made to order and since they make fresh noodles, everything came out very quickly! So happy to have found a great place for noodles in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Zhajiang noodles with hand pulled noodle - sweet, savory, &amp; fresh with crunch vegetables!
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy wonton
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dan dan noodles with knife cut noodles - Spicy!

MtyuWhDt9bcMaFmCkmVeSQ.text: Food wise this place deserves a 5, but when coming in, I encountered a rude male worker who was very unprofessional with his service. When being seated, be brought us waters and when placing down the water he did it so carelessly where when he placed it down, some spilled out onto the table and HIS hand, but he didn't seem to care so he turned around and walked away as if nothing happened. He again came back to hand us tiny bowls and when placing the bowl down, he threw it into the table so rudely and saw the expressions on our face and then apologized forcefully. I'm not sure if he was having a bad day or something but this place was good for the food! There was a female worker who was super kind and helpful though and she made the whole experience better. Ok now food wise, the Dan Dan noodles were super good! The noodles and sauce had a really "creamy" texture which I loved! The soup for the beef soup, was a delight as well and super flavorful!
