YXv_Mj2Y0omfGiALcBozNQ.text: If you're Taiwanese or Chinese and you're craving for some comfort food then this place is the best place in Vegas for your taste of home. Seriously #1 hands down and there's a bonus! boba place next door!!!

fqIFIWhJGD3dZ1iM8Oxouw.text: WOW! A fresh hand pulled or knife cute noodle really makes for an amazing dish! We were so excited to find this place on yelp and knew we had to give it a try.   We came in and were quickly seated. We were so amazed with the fresh noodle pull in front of us that we took some time to order - the staff was so patient with us letting us record their noodle making. We finally ordered and ended up getting the beef pancakes, Peking and wonton soup, Dandan noodles, Shang beef noodle soup, and chicken chow mein.   The consistency of the noodle had such an amazing bite and the flavor was on point. Perfect amount of seasonings so it was not overpowering. The beef pancakes were so crispy and delicious!   I wish we had one of these around here so I wouldn't have to go to Vegas for it! I will definitely be back when I'm in Vegas! Also, shoutout to Lindsey for the awesome service!

3_LUpfvqKHSJml3PV7cGGw.text: Once I saw handpulled noodle shop. I was so excited to go. I was here in LAS to travel and in fact I took uber all the way there which costed more than a bowl of noodle. But hey I grow up with noodles, so It meant sth .  Ordered Dan Dan noodles( was even going to order some dumplings and sides, but waiter said the bowl is big.) noodles turned out to be so different than what I expected Dan Dan noodles to be.. Not much of other taste, so its like minced pork with sweet soy sauce poured over on boiled soft noodle.   Was disappointed.

x6D5Ym-e-RaHbNv3FNiUNQ.text: My wife and I have been to las vegas 2 times now and this was the first time we ever had shangs and WE BOTH LOVE IT!!! She had dan dan noodles and she says it was a little on the spicy side and with thin noodles but meat portion was good and she says her dish was really enjoyable and my dish was their specialty and that was REALLY GOOOOOD!!! but on a side note i would like thin noodles as well because i had their knife cut noodles but i would enjoy thin better. Well the staff was really nice and work really hard. There was a table of 3 that came in smelling of booze and came in and when one of the ladies sat down she knocked down they soy sauce bottle and made a huge mess..... i hope that table tipped well because that waiter was way too patient and nice to them.

CmEBYwzopHGsKanv2fyy-w.text: I like to brag that my mom is a Taiwanese beef noodle soup expert so I'm always down to try a bowl of beef noodle soup when I've heard good things. This is what I look for in a solid beef noodle soup:  1. Flavorful but not overly salty or fatty broth - check! 2. Generous portion of soft, tender braised beef - check! 3. Hand-made, fresh, chewy noodles - check! (If you like a thicker noodle, get the knife cut) 4. Vegetables - I love pickled mustard greens in my beef noodle soup which is Taiwanese style so I wasn't surprised Shang's didn't have it. But they did serve a generous portion of bok choy which I appreciated very much so - check!   I also ordered the beef pies which come in 4 small portions. Mix the chili and soy sauce on the table for dipping and beware of the juicy inside when biting! I really liked the small portion of the beef pies -- makes portion control easier since it can get a little heavy on the tummy.  Overall, it was a solid meal with no disappointment. The price is very fair and I would definitely consider making the trip here instead of going to Noodle Asia on the strip.

dXzcBKnb9hvwYV3Plx-wtg.text: This place is the best!  Food was fresh and delicious, the service was impeccable. Will definitely return the next time we are here.

OTJTXgHIPbHz052bqEgWmg.text: Woooow. Let me add on all the other reviews. This will be a place every time we come to Vegas we go once if not three times. Wife and I loved it here. Noodles were amazing and made right in front of you. The chow mein was closest I found to my beloved California Chef Chu experience. The house made chili oil was so good. This place is authentic and I loved the spicy wonton--wasn't too spicy at all. Must go here--but be warned the place is small so may be a line but service when we went was good so was worth it. Also worthy to note water has cucumber and lemon so if have any allergies beware but we loved water, noodles and everything! Will be back!

vvY7meu_0JWk1BAGjlP0jA.text: Ordered Shang beef noodle, beef pancake and chicken chow main. All three dishes were delicious!  One star is for the water, it tastes weird.

dIyY1HyfNRrpIuD-I1sqgQ.text: Would highly recommend Shang Artisan Noodle - really good food at very reasonable prices. Be sure to arrive a little before they open - this place is really popular so expect to wait if you come later. We ordered a couple of different dishes;  the Shang beef noodles, Chicken Chow Mein, Spicy Wonton side dish. They make the noodles in house and you can select the type of noodles (either hand pulled or knife shopped I believe). The Shang Beef Noodles were really good - the broth was flavorful and the beef was very tender. I'd also highly recommend the Chicken Chow Mein - it had a lot of wok flavor. The spicy wonton appetizer was my least favorite dish - it was a little on the oily side, but the noodle dishes are the star of the show. This place is definitely worth the 10-15 min drive off the strip if you want to get your noodle on at a reasonable price.

CWrSCsr5Kpyml6KfkjTt3A.text: Excellent place. I went here last Saturday with some family. I discovered this place originally about a year ago through yelp.  There was a slight wait on Saturday night, about 20 minutes for a party at five. We ended up sitting at the bar area which was a pretty cool experience since you get to watch the cooks make the noddles.   I ordered the Shang beef noddle which was very yummy, in addition to a plate of potstickers. The beef noodle broth was excellent and very flavorful. The potstickers were spot on as well and tasted very fresh. I recommend using soy sauce with them.

PJc03-081qzMPt1uDxtfog.text: It's fine. I got the Shang's beef noodle. The broth is tasty though quite salty and left me thirsty all day. The noodles are fine. Nothing stood out about them.   My dad was hung up on how a Chinese-owned place serving Chinese food would have strong Japanese aesthetics and design elements.

4SDxT-Aa3WVu75vyl3WpOA.text: Wow, super impressed with the whole staff here.  Being from San Diego, we are accustomed to eating Ramen, pho, and any other noodle dishes u can think of.  Staying on the LV strip without a car, lyfting off the strip is not worth it if the food is just mediocre.  My wife wanted to try something new, I myself am ok with eating at Noodle Asia since we always stay at the Venetian. The price at Noodle Asia is around $15 per bowl of noodle soup, however, you don't have to pay $20 for a round trip Lyft.  It's worth the money and we will be heading back here for sure, on every Vegas trip.  I got the ShangHai Beef Noodle soup and wife got pork rib noodle soup.  Broth was phenomenal and the noodles are fresh fresh fresh. They make their noodles on the spot and you can record it to show your friends.  We order beef pancakes for appetizers.  Just think of it as a prom dumpling but circular and fried. It was so good bc the juices were gushing everywhere.   Make sure to add the chili oil to give your meals a special kick

KYhRzAGw52FlS23L0iYCyQ.text: The food was excellent! Hit the spot for me! Also what made me want to review this place is the ambiance. The place was nice and it looked super clean. The service was good, all of the staff were nice and it was entertaining to watch them hand pull the noodles. If you go here, better sit at the counter where you see all the action.   Will definitely be back at this place!

-9xbhNwrVX1jhc5C75x4pw.text: Awesome noodle bar not to far from the strip.  Loved all there options we have tried so far.  We have been in Vegas now for about 6 months and have been here 7 times either for lunch or dinner.  Make the stop in and check it out!

mV6cJjbX2oh98IPtIDCqjA.text: one of my best friends lives nearby in henderson. i'm from california but i'd heard good things about this restaurant via social media and was dying to go on my last visit- i'm a sucker for hand pulled noodles and try to get my hands on them whenever possible. i also love when restaurants have the noodle pulling on display, it's fun to watch your food being made right before your eyes.   i was seriously tempted to order everything on the menu but decided on the dan-dan noodles: knife-sliced noodles (thicker & wider than their hand-pulled counterpart) topped with minced pork, bean sprout, and spicy soy sauce. it was absolutely delicious!  also ordered the pork & cabbage potstickers and the presentation was so cute. they looked like a little flower, all stuck together and clearly pan fried to perfection.  the spicy wonton appetizer was impressive, the dough was very thin and delicate. the meat pancakes were good but we made the mistake of trying to shove them into our mouths, and had juice fly out of them upon first bite. so just make sure to cut into them first.   the decor was clean and modern and there were no negatives when it came to the service. definitely will be back next time i'm in town.

7eEZ-morsWn-yWSIiGSKVQ.text: Atmosphere is clean. I like that you could see your food being made fresh in front of you. Service is extremely quick and friendly. 2K74gr7aQmGS_nyubn0KMw.text: First off loved the decor, very clean and simplistic. Now we have tried hand pulled noodles at a couple places in the valley and this was one of my favorites. The spicy wontons were by far the best wontons I've tried. I could just order those and a bowl of rice next time and be completely satisfied. Now we love beef pancakes but I gotta say the noodle man had better pancakes. But they don't have dan dan noodles and I love saucy noodles!

yzVj27ks6iqdd4aquV5gbw.text: Wow this place was incredible. Don't be fooled by the extremely simplistic looking Dan Dan Noodles (about $9) and Chicken Sesame Noodles ($8.75). Service was impeccable, we were super thirsty in the Vegas heat and they must have come by about 6 times to fill our cups up. I want to try everything here!!!  Off strip place in a residential area, great prices, easy plaza parking (even though we ubered).

lyK-3bZ2ZB35eBHnqrWcmA.text: It's hard to find hand pulled noodles, let alone I was a big fan of their knife shaved noodles which is basically wide noodles. It was interesting because their Shang Beef noodle soup was a mixture of chicken and beef broth. I wasn't quite used to it but it was unique.  Their spicy wontons sure do have that spicy kick embedded into the meat. It's flavorful and the wrapper itself doesnt fall apart on you.  We also ordered the beef pancakes. If you can imagine soup dumplings but in a beef pancake form. I would say this is a must order for how unique it is. As soon as you take a bite into the beef pancake, the broth and juices race out to give you that rich taste, but also the pancake itself is crisp.

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. shang beef noodle

iYYdslonFfYLTyeaNYKWqA.text: I waited over an hour to eat here. You would think that a hot bowl of soup would be the last thing anyone would want to eat in 104 degree F weather. So that already says a lot about Shang Artisan Noodle. It's worth the wait. Thankfully, there was a boba store next door, so the wait wasn't too bad.  The service was also top notch. They will actually come into the boba store to check if you are waiting in there. The staff working inside the restaurant were also friendly and swift with their service. Here's what we ordered:  Things to note-- You can order either hand pulled or knife shaved noodles. They also have a list of topping add-ons for your noodles.  *Shang beef noodle - Everything you could ever ask for in a bowl of beef noodle. Add a little bit of the chili oil sauce (satay?) for some more heat and depth. I ordered this with the knife shaved noodles and the texture was PERRRRF. It was full with a touch of chewiness.  *Chicken and mushroom noodle - A non-soup noodle bowl with wood ear mushroom. This and the Shang beef noodle were the favorites. It was slurpy even though there was no broth. So much umami in this bowl of noodles I can't even explain it. A must try.  *Dan dan noodles - Probably the least popular, but not bad. Just not as good as the others.   *Beef shank noodle - A clear broth with juicy pieces of beef shank. Completely different from the Shang beef noodle so don't get it twisted. I was surprised at the depth of flavor of the broth,  *Spicy wonton - You can't go wrong with this dish. Spicy, vinegary, savory, juicy.   *Cucumber salad with sesame sauce - We devoured this. At first I was kind of put off by the visual of the sauce, but it went complimented the cucumbers. Very refreshing yet umami at the same time.  *Beef pancake - yummy, but they were popped so the juices escaped :( but still tasty.  Overall, I must say that Shang Artisan Noodles was way better than any of the noodle joints on the strip. GOGOGO!

2BpP94scXDZlI_gHwiQsDw.text: Whoa! Didn't expect this place to be this good! Come here if you tired of sucky, expensive and yucky hotel food. Not too far from the strip area and close to the Chinatown area, about 10 minutes drive from our hotel. The wait wasn't too bad for dinner, about 15-20 mins wait when we got there. The service is excellent! The decorations of the restaurant is nice and bright, made me feel like I was back home at LA. We ordered the shang beef noodles, dan-dan noodles and Yangzhou fried rice. Even my picky parents approved their food! The shang beef noodles have a rich taste, the beef soup was just so good! The however,  the dan-dan noodles was a bit too spicy due to the Sichuan pepper. I mean, it was Sichuan level so.... the waitress suggested us to have the sauce separated next time we order that. 100% recommended!

T8E9eqgW8QfEuAfEVlJjhw.text: Mouthwateringly good noodles that are well-worth the price and wait.  Called ahead to order take-out: ate chicken chow mein with knife shaved noodle and pork and cabbage boiled dumplings.  The chow mein was delicious, not too saucy, the chewy noodles chock-full of savory goodness. The chicken is tender and fresh, hearty slices of white meat chicken doused in flavor.  By comparison, the dumplings were relatively average. It's not that they were bad -- if anything, the wrappers were truly excellent. But inside, the pork and cabbage were relatively bland and were not evenly balanced (some were heavier than others).  I'll be coming back!

t0M-wlSnr_6c4kfFm4hM6A.text: This place is a dream. My sister and I were in Las Vegas for 24 hours. Staying at the Palms, we wanted to find a place nearby to eat. Nothing is more comforting than a bowl of noodle soup after countless hours of travel. We made it a point to arrive right with the doors opened because we knew it was a small space. We were immediately seated and offered water. Guys, this water is infused. Lemon? Cucumber? BOTH? It feels so luxurious to be drinking "fancy water" (what I call infused water) or "spa water" (what my sister calls it).   The service is phenomenal. Polite and helpful, even offering us a suggestion on where to find dessert close by. After we put in our order, this noodle magician starts twirling the dough in front of us. It was amazing. We started with Spicy Wontons, YUM!! It's soaked in a sweet soy sauce with a hint of heat. The beef pancakes were also delicious. I think it should come with a dipping sauce that is vinegar forward with slices of ginger. The pancakes were mild in flavor, great texture, but I found that I wanted to dip it into something... so I used the Spicy Wonton sauce.   We got the Shang Beef Soup with hand-pulled noodles and Pork Belly with shaved noodles. Shang Beef Soup is everything. It's a more mild flavor that builds as you eat. It's not doused in salt, either, so you really get the flavors of beef. The brisket is so tender while the bok choy is soft and crisp. It's the perfect combination. Pork Belly is a completely different assault of flavors. It's dense and sweeter. The shaved noodles are so cool, thinner on the outside and chewy toward the center, cooked perfectly al dente. This soup was so good, too, but I prefer the Shang Beef.  I don't think there's a bad decision here. I would probably go back once a week if I lived there. Right before we left, my sister wanted to buy one of the wooden spoons because it quite literally is the most perfect soup spoon, just the right size (height and weight) and ergonomically designed. Thanks for the most amazing experience, leaving us happy and satisfied.

There is a unique atmosphere that makes the experience really special. :) Highly recommended.

J0IxtL3SE2sHcJBmUOa7Cg.text: My boyfriend and I decided to do a Vegas trip for a few days and was craving Chinese food. We just stumbled upon this place on Yelp and was actually decently surprised at how authentic and good this place was!  I also loveee that they hand pull the noodles right in front of you.   What we ordered:  beef noodle soup: this tasted pretty authentic for me! I'm usually on the hunt for good beef noodle soup and it never hits the spot so I was definitely surprised and how much I enjoyed this dish! The soup was super flavorful and the meat was tender. The hand pulled noodles was also a great addition to this dish! dan dan noodles: one of my all time fav dishes! I'm usually use to dan dan noodles that has more of a creamy peanut sauce but this was definitely a nice change spicy wontons: these wontons weren't spicy enough for me but I loveee the flavor of it! I just added their spicy sauce (which wasn't spicy as well) but I loved the over mix of texture it gave! I also like how the wontons were a lot smaller than most places so you get way more pieces! beef pancake: this was good but I was thinking beef rolls when ordering this.   All in all, I HIGHLY recommend Shang Artisan Noodle. Will definitely come back the next time we're in Vegas. :)

AZQElaBZfgrkY50S_Cunww.text: We went to Vegas for a quick weekend get away and stumbled across this gem. I ordered two items. The beef pancake and the Shang Beef Noodle. The beef pancake came as 4 pieces, which is a decently sized appetizer. I would recommend that you must be careful when taking a bite into the beef pancake, as it is a tad juicy - similar to a soup dumpling - but not as soft/wet. The hand pulled noodles were AMAZING. The noodles were the perfect chewy texture and had a nice doughy flavor. You get to see the chef pull the noodles right in front of you.    There seems to be limited seating - but the wait was not too bad.

yDCRa82CDpUDqZz6Fs6JLg.text: This is one of the best noodle place I have ever been to. Its sweet, cozy and nicely decorated. On the peak hours, you might have to wait for a bit. But that's how you know a place is good.  I get the beef shank hand pulled noodles every time I go and I love it. If you want something you can eat more easily, I would recommend the knife shaved noodles. But I feel like hand pulled noodles are more authentic. It comes with a generous portion of meat and soup. You can see the chef making the hand pulled noodles by the window, and you know how fresh you get it :)   The order is really fast. The staff is nice and I like the customer service I get every time I go. All in all, I would totally recommend this place to anyone who likes noodles :)

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Shank Noodles

0lEZTR6nuwAdBpXuMSTpOQ.text: It was ok and not a "Wow" in taste. Sat on the counter and it seemed that they never clean under the counter next to their condiments. We accidentally touch the back board and our hand got sticky tried to wipe it with our napkin and the napkin got stuck.

3iyxgIQHP2KMB-7_L1wL2g.text: I wanted to love this place, however, there were a few things that were disagreeable and made the entire experience only worth 3-stars in my mind.  First of all, service was excellent.  Service and quick, and accurate.  The broth and beef that was served with the Shang Beef Noodle Soup was excellent.  The broth was rich and flavorful, the beef was tender and tasty.  Also, the vegetables were cooked perfectly.  The portion size is also quite substantial.  It might just be me, however, when you get served a bowl of noodles, I am of the mindset that it should be steaming hot.  My soup as served lukewarm... Yes, I could have complained, however, I kinda feel this is a quality control issue.  From the name of the restaurant, I assume the noodles would be the highlight.  I ordered the hand-pulled noodles.  For me, the noodles were not quite the right texture/density.  They seemed rather light, and had little to no chew to it.  I would almost compare it to a thicker canned chicken noodle soup noodle.  Another thing I look forward to was the chili sauce.  At most asian restaurants, I would say it is a very important additive.  To me their sauce was bland, and very heavy-handed on the cinnamon/clove/anise flavoring.  It just didn't quite have the heat, saltiness or umami flavor that most other chili sauces have.    I also believe they flavor the water with cucumber (at least I hope it was)... While not a big deal, I did not enjoy it at all, and would have preferred plain tap water.

8CGWugFPrmOst3mOrjWTNQ.text: Couldn't wait to try this place and there was about a 30-40 minute wait at 8pm. Fortunately, I needed that time to wait since I was severely hung over. Yes, it hit me at 8pm! That's what 3 days of drinking will do to you.  The beef noodle soup was bomb, with wontons added in. Noodles were perfect, beef was perfect, and soup was deliciously amazingly perfect!  Will be back next time I'm in Vegas, but hopefully not hung over so I can eat a whole bowl!

bCEQnyOKxaB7swdcTnPfJQ.text: Got to say this is my favorite hand pulled noodle place out of the 3  places I go to in Las Vegas.    This place is a little small and there is always a wait every time I've been here. The inside is pretty small maybe 6 tables and seating at the widow where you can Watch the cook make the noodles and that's maybe 10 chairs, so if you come with a big group Expect to wait a while. Service was good here and the food is good. The last time I was here i ordered the Shang beef noodle and it was delicious the braised beef brisket was really flavorful and the hang pulled noodles where really good. like I said I eat at 3 hand pulled noodle places and this one is my favorite. I will be back here for sure.

ZfMbq7bKfk2jBOtHrw6fng.text: This food is legit. I love the hand spun noodles. You know you're getting quality, not processed with preservatives. Everything tasted amazing and customer service was great. Also, I have to say, I hope the workers get paid enough. We were at the bar watching them cook and they were working hard and fast. HBlxsOhOkjGACvvJJ6MWkQ.text: Delicious noodles, wontons, and beef pancakes! We loved watching the chefs hand-pull and knife the noodles! So entertaining! Definitely worth the wait!

v4oQA-2Dc4j4JMfEjiXmAw.text: One word: Amazing! This noodle house was just so amazing. I've never really seen hand pulled noodle restaurant in California. This place was just too good to pass up in Vegas. My husband and I came here in the morning and it was busy so we waited for 30 minutes for a table. The wait was well worth it because it lived up to its name.   I had the pork belly hand pulled noodle while my husband had the beef. We also ordered the spicy wonton. The spicy wonton was really good though not enough spicy but definitely the flavor was there.  The beef from the beef noodle was so tender but for my pork belly it was a bit tough. Though the pork belly was tough, the broth and noodle was amazing. The noodle was just cooked right and fresh. You can tell a difference between fresh made noodles and package noodles and let me say that these noodles taste far from package.   We paid less than 30 for our meal but so worth the 30 for such delicious and flavorful food. My husband said I bounce back from the disappointing dinner we had the night before.   Definitely go here if you want some epic noodle for an epic price!!

mryD0l5iebOAH8N000opCw.text: We have gone to many noodle spots and by far this is our favorite. Food is very clean and tasty. They have other options besides noodles compared to many of the other places around the area. It is very clean and waiters and waitresses are extremely attentive. 5 stars for me.

wIDEuMCLSyRxWe6LGhx1nA.text: It was good hand pulled noodles. Usually there is a long wait list for lunch on the weekend

InagfmM5i-YjCCnnRJNSUA.text: When ever I drive to Vegas we always tend to try and have at least one meal off strip at a local restaurant. So when i went to Vegas at the end of August we happened to find Shang Artisan Noodle while looking on yelp. We both wanted noodles so we figured why not go check it out. There was a little bit of a wait since there was a large party waiting ahead of us. The restaurant its self is pretty small a few tables as well as bar seating which gives you a few of all the noodle making.  With us waiting we where able to check out the menu and knew what we would want as soon as we sat down.  I ordered the beef with the hand made noodles, and my husband got the pork belly noodles, beef pancake, and beef and onion boiled dumplings. Everything came out super fast and fresh, everything tasted more then amazing.  The pork belly was super tender and almost melted in your mouth and the beef in my soup was super flavorful. The noodles are some of the best I have ever had. Both the beef pancake and the dumplings are well worth it. I will defiantly be back on one of my next Vegas trips!!!

wcqdP8fBoXN7vbMZqBZWMQ.text: I really enjoyed eating here today. I can't wait to go back! The place is small and clean, however, they don't take reservations.  I had the Pork Belly noodles hand pulled and it tastes very fresh and rich in flavor. The broth is strong but tastes great. Not watered down or overly salty. My boyfriend ordered Shang Fried rice and this fried rice stole the show.  Their Shang Fried rice is steamed rice and it tastes delightfully caramelized, with chock full of tasty tidbits of eggs, minced pork, preserved bean sprouts, and veggies.  My parents shared the Seafood noodles and it was a little bland for me. We also tried the Sliced Beef shank with balsamic sauce and the beef tasted of good quality.  The pricing was surprisingly good.   Overall, a nice dining experience. Oh and you can watch the chefs make the noodles. Sit at the bar for a show while you eat!

WDl42IO6ovi1xc6y2rN1TA.text: It's rare to find hand pulled noodles freshly made at the restaurant nowadays. The service is good. Price is generally reasonable, not too pricy. Restaurant is clean. If I've had to wait, it has only been for no more than 10-15 minutes. Their beef pancake isn't something that is offered everywhere and is reminiscent of what I have had growing up. Though they do exaggerate how juicy it is. Not that it isn't but I've had beef pancakes with much thinner skin and far juicier. Dumplings are solid. Overall I will continue to return again.

aFZEBNOm9CWfq48ox5xInA.text: Great show! Peanut cold noodles with hand pulled, and the chow mein with knife cut were the favorites! Shang Beef and Dan Dan are missing flavor profiles (type of chili used maybe?), but tasty none the less. The open kitchen and display of noodles being made is a nice touch to enhance the experience and will make you believe you're getting a better meal than you can taste. Enjoy!

uRGlCO_xdLju6DGtlv0gfQ.text: We only did takeout so I don't know how their service is, but their takeout was good.  The packaged everything well and most importantly the noodles were separate from the broth and properly labeled so it was easy to finish preparation when we brought the food home.  Food was tasty and reasonably priced for hand pulled noodles.  The rice with tomato and egg was just OK, but their beef noodle soup was good.  The pork belly soup was just OK (pork was hard and dry not soft).  Their spicy won ton was tasty.

L17VGzJAX05EJvj3Ex6OVA.text: The best part of this restaurant is the service! They have the friendliest staff that explains the menu and makes sure you have everything you need. We tried the Shang beef noodles, beef shank noodles, spicy wontons, and beef pancakes which were all delicious!

-bCckTtJ1Apdo9JiCWWcTQ.text: Came here at 2 and it was packed! Must be good! Thought we would have to wait awhile but they seated us in under 5 minutes. The staff was so friendly and courteous. Food was great - noodles are awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1pbmRx6S-ndUiZU7LdfyVg.text: I really really wanted to like Shang's but they are just missing....something. All of the dishes lacked flavor and I had to keep on reaching for the hot sauce (not that hot) and vinegar at an alarming rate.   Spicy wonton - Not spicy at all, quite bland and watered down to be honest. Their sauce was not thick and tangy compared to other  I've had in my lifetime.   Beef noodle soup with hand pulled noodles - Also bland, but I think it is just the variety of beef noodle soup. I prefer a Taiwanese version with pickled mustard greens and a richer deeper broth.  This just wasn't it.   Dan dan noodles - This was not a peanut based sauce and was more like a Zha Jiang mian. I tried a bite and thought it was actually very flavorful but I'm not sure if I'd feel the same after a whole bowl.   A stand out item was their beef pancake which was carefully made in front of our eyes. We watched the gentleman roll out the dough and wrap the pancakes with precision made to order. The filling was hot, juicy, and savory.   The waitresses overall were very sweet although you could tell they were a bit understaffed for the evening. Noodles were fresh and constantly being made which looked exhausting. But the noodles are just a vessel and without the right sauce/soup and ingredients they just don't mean anything :(

mF-bbw4r5Or9Zo1XBzIsnQ.text: The food is very delicious and the service is great. Nice bright and clean in the restaurant.

9BTXVmraGDcqVgb99AustQ.text: This was a great find. Fav appetizer was the beef pancake. I highly suggest the exta noodle order for $1.50.  This place is tiny so there can be a wait but they turn the tables pretty fast.

_3Ll3rcl33XC5heJAWCJMQ.text: My gf and I came here last night and we left very satisfied. This place has a really cool concept with the cooking area open to its guests. As we sat at the bar, we watched the chefs slicing the knife cut noodles and twirling the band pulled noodles.   We ordered and within less than 2 minutes, our food arrived! This was the quickest service i have ever  seen. Our female waitress was phenomenal- she was very quick and friendly and always attending to our needs. She ran the whole show at the restaurant! But besides the superb service, our food was heavenly.   Our Egg and Tomato noodle was incredibly tasty. The tomatoes were sweet, tangy, and soft and complimented the medley of cooked eggs and hand pulled noodles.  We also ordered the Beef Shang Noodle- a favorite here for good reason. I recommend ordering the knife sliced noodles with this one and ordering an extra side of noodles because you will probably need it considering how tasty this dish is and the noodles may be on the lighter side depending on your hunger. The soup was very flavorful and the beef was very hearty.   I highly recommend this place for an intimate or small gathering. If you have a large group, it is more difficult to get seating due to the small size of the restaurant. The food is super tasty and the service is top notch.

cYqlyQ2Y0qCNSOC-rh-2aQ.text: The location was easy to find and the inside setting of the restaurant was very comfortable. I felt like I was in Shanghai :) it's like a mini  I ordered the cucumber salad (4.99) and the beef hand made noodles (9.99). The cucumber salad was my favorite (it was cold fresh and plenty in terms of amount.)The noodles could've been softer and more noodles could be inside the bowl. I finished it in 10 bites . Overall the staff was friendly and the food was not overpriced. I recommend this to anyone who wants a taste of Chinese noodles.

eKQi2DrZDCfJY3dHTLlLWQ.text: Loved Shangs!  We opted for first available seats and wound up at bar.  We were so glad as we watched the noodle making process over & over.  It was really interesting & the cooks were all really nice & fun.  There were 8 of us.  We tried the beef potstickers, beef dumplings, cucumber salad and a variety of noodle soups & sauce noodle.  Everyone was really happy with their meal.  Delicious!

f2ufcW6lIDOe_IpF3ChXlA.text: Never having Chinese noodle soup before, I wasn't really sure what to expect. We sat at the bar and watched a gentleman, on the other side of the glass, pull and twirl strands of uncooked noodles before our eyes. And I enjoyed every minute of it- dinner and a show? SCORE. THE SERVICE. The server was nice and knowledgeable and described each dish perfectly. There were no surprises for us when we got our food. And she did not lead us astray. They were also quick refilling our waters (it's the little things that count.) So onto what's even more important. THE FOOD. We ordered spicy wonton and I'm sensitive to spiciness but if you avoid the hot chili oil, it wasn't that bad. But if you like the spice than dipping and rolling it around in the hot oil would satisfy your taste buds. The wontons are smaller in size than what I'm used to and I ended up pouring a little soy sauce on them. The flavors were good and all, however, I probably wouldn't order that appetizer again. For our main course, we ordered Shang beef noodle soup with the thin hand pulled noodles (naturally, wanted to try what the noodle artist had been working so hard on making- but you have different options, the one we ordered is similar to spaghetti in shape/thickness but there's a flatter noodle choice as well.) Anyway, this soup is what I would come back for. The broth, texture of noodle and the braised beef brisket were YUM. The thought of its dark broth and bok choy are making my mouth water as I'm recollect and write this review. Honestly. You just have to try it for yourself.

3OB800Zt12Cyhy074On_1w.text: Great broth and noodles. I had the beef shank and my wife the pork ribs. Chilli sauce is the right. Nice and clean. Glad we stopped in for a afternoon snack.

iWK7y4IbWV5X34kf1vTvfQ.text: LOVE that we can find delicious knife shaved noodles in Vegas! Hands down gotta order the Beef Noodle Soup it had much more flavor than the Pork Rib soup. The beef pancakes take a bit of time to make but they are like circular pan fried dumpling. I also really loved the handpainted walls in the dining area and the bathrooms.

FufgHAUKJrExoZx1EywFbg.text: Shang Artisan is a traditional Chinese hand made noodle restaurant. Let me start by saying this place is good and fairly priced in case you don't want to read the rest of my review. The restaurant is very small and can only hold roughly around 20 people (I'm guessing) at a time. I came for dinner and beat a huge wave of people. I was able to be seated and finish dinner and still saw the same group waiting. The menu is limited with a few appetizers and 3 types of noodles. Everyone at my table got the hand pulled noodles but I want to come back and try the other two. I got the Shang Beef Noodle with extra noodles. The broth was delicious and the noodles were very good. My friend got a wet noodle plate and was told it wasn't as good as the Shang Beef. My biggest complaint was the main dishes were brought out way before the appetizers were. By the time the appetizers came, we were all way too full to enjoy them. We got the beef pancake and wontons, both were mediocre for me. Overall, nice little restaurant with big taste at an affordable price. Definitely worth a try.

8rB8452MA09_dCEqWANoyw.text: Such a gem off the strip!!!  I come here every time I'm in Vegas when I get sick of buffets, burgers, pizzas, and overpriced food.   Noodles and dumplings always taste freshly made.   And all items are priced on point between $5-$9.

WCJYQrsxjkiGUjbkYLhubw.text: Always the best noodle soups... Watch them make your noodles and dumplings... Always a hit and never a miss... The water is lemon and cucumber... a great palette cleanser... Most authentic we have found and we go to many small hole in the wall places looking for those back home flavors... Found them here... cheers.

yLypN5BvKe63s2npm33xXg.text: Located adjacent to Yonaka, this little strip mall is shaping up to be quite a devastating one-two Asian foodie combo sandwiched between the frenetic Vegas Strip and the daunting gauntlet of Spring Mountain for the uninitiated tourist.    Like its Japanese counterpart (Yonaka), Shang possesses a clean minimalist interior with a modern reboot in terms of taste and presentation of classically inspired dishes, although the latter bears a more staunch adherence to old school principles and tradition.  As a prelude to the meal, I highly recommend requesting a seat at the bar, where one is treated to watching the staff stretch and pull noodles, as well as witness the art of knife-shaved noodles deftly flicked into a boiling cauldron of water.  On the day I frequented the restaurant, I had the added enjoyment of watching a young apprentice in action under the steel-eyed gaze of the master (much like Pai Mei's cruel tutelage of Beatrix Kiddo in Kill Bill) and while the finished product turned out great, it gave me a greater appreciation of the difference in experience since the young grasshopper was covered nearly head to toe with patches of flour on his black toque/jacket after repeatedly flinging the dough across his body like LeBron James throwing chalk into the air (he'll get there someday).  For starters, the spicy wonton noodles have great flavor soaked up by the chili oil, but I would have preferred a slightly more generous filling and maybe cooking them a tad less so the skin was a tad more al dente.  The beef pancakes are beautifully plated and appear more like Danish pancakes with little pan-fried cylinders of dough encasing ground beef/chives with a scorching pocket of concentrated broth.  Much like a soup dumpling, handle this one with care since one could seriously injure oneself or those around them upon opening its contents.    The main event is obviously the noodles, and one has the choice of selecting three types of noodles (hand pulled, knife-shaved, and plain) and choice of various noodle soups and sauced noodles.  Our party of four sampled 2 soup noodles (pork belly, pork rib) and and 2 sauce noodles (dan dan noodles, cold sesame noodles).  Overall the noodles have good chew and absorb/adhere flavors from the broth/sauce fairly well although my one complaint is that the predominant flavor that stands out is salty.  A good Asian broth/sauce carries undertones of spice, acidity, and an occasional afternote of sweetness or umami and I just felt like the salt factor overpowered and distracted especially in the sauced dishes whereas the broths did not extract as much spice/bony richness that I know exist in finer renditions.    The julienned vegetables in the cold sesame noodles could also utilize a finer cut and as another yelper suggested, perhaps an extra helping of noodles tempers the imbalance, but that's cheating unless you have the extra stomach space.    All in all, a solid spot for some tasty hand pulled goodness, but at this point cannot place them among the pantheon of world class noodle joints.

hguJEK3k3HBHVZouS4DRsw.text: SAN is a small little noodle shop located on Flamingo Rd. near the Vegas Strip. They don't have much seating, so you may have to wait. Luckily, we went early enough (11:20AM on a Thursday) that we got seated within 5-10 minutes. As you're waiting, you can watch the chefs make your noodles from scratch. They'll throw it around and twist it and toss it in the air, and it's really entertaining to watch. I'm giving SAN 5 stars because 1. they have great friendly, efficient service 2. the food is so reasonably priced compared to everywhere else in Vegas ($10 for noodles) and 3. the food is SO GOOD. For the table, we ordered a cucumber salad. Unlike other restaurants, their cucumbers are covered with a sesame paste and some spicy oil. It's a little like the traditional Dan Dan noodle flavoring, a little "peanuty" a little spicy, but it's deliious and refreshing. I myself ordered the Pork Belly noodle soup with hand-pulled noodles. The hand-pulled noodles are the traditional noodles that are a little thinner like spaghetti, whereas the knife cut noodles are thick and flat and more doughy. I absolutely loved my dish! The broth was so rich and aromatic; a little on the sweet side, but it complimented the tender pork belly so well! As for the noodles, oh my gosh, these are possibly the best noodles I've ever had. They were the literal perfect texture of chewy and doughy and you can taste the dough/yeast flavoring still, and somehow they got it to soak up the broth so perfectly that the noodles are flavored with whatever you order. Overall, I had a great experience at SAN and would highly recommend it to the noodle lover!

voq6u_45OSqEMzGDuBJ5gw.text: So my wife and I were here about 2 months ago during our recent stay in vegas.  My wife found this place on yelp since we were looking to get something to eat and didn't want to spend a lot of money since we had reservations booked for Joel Rubechon the following day.  We both ordered bowls of the house special beef noodle soup and an order of the meat pancakes.  Now since I live in Irvine, I will say that I have had a lot of good bowls of beef noodle soup and this place was up there on my list as some of the best beef noodle soups out there.  Probably better than even some of the other noodle places in the fancy hotels.  Anyways, its not too far off the strip and also an easy uber or lyft ride that wont set you back too much to the point where you felt like you paid $30 for some noodles.

swS1fQtbP6_SGY5fz8EBnw.text: Delicious!!   I ordered the beef shank w hand noodles, $8.95, and it was soo good! The noodles are freshly handmade in front of you! The dish came with clear broth and it has SO much flavor! I was very surprised because usually clear broth soup is usually bland, but not this dish! It came w a few slices of beef shank, baby bok chit, and a handful of noodles! Noodles were cooked to perfection! Very soft and chewy!   The spicy wontons, $5.49,are nice addition to your meal, but it is more sweet than spicy. There was like 6 or 8 pcs of wonton (not sure how many) but it was good! They're very small, not your avg sized wontons.   I was very satisfied with my meal!

NF3EhhyMh7RL-X1g7jHGqA.text: This hit the spot! I got the pork belly soup with knife-shaved noodles. The meat was super tender and juicy, the broth was rich and flavorful, and the thick noodles were perfectly chewy. It was a perfect bowl of soup although I would have enjoyed more broth just because it was so tasty. There's a True difference to a place like this where the food really is made to order vs other noodles shops that just pump out the food. It even tastes better having been able to watch the chef hand shave the noodles and hand pull the noodles. When you see the work they put into your food, it's hard not to enjoy what they've made for you! I also tried the spicy wontons which were also pretty tasty but be warned, they've got a good kick! I definitely recommend this place especially if you're in the mood for a good authentic bowl of noodle soup!

c_oW-jswNcRNtOpxI5bTgA.text: I'm a big fan of noodle, it has such a magical pull on me... especially experiencing one that is freshly made right before our eyes! :)  Ventured to Shang on our recent trip to Vegas as I have heard many happy praises about this place. Situated in a small strip mall, the restaurant is quite intimate aka petite, but is charmingly decorated. We were seated at the counter that surrounds the open kitchen, where you can witness all the actions. So grateful.   Ordered and shared:  * Pork and Cabbage Pot Sticker: This looks utterly tantalizing with the crispy edges around it, taste-wise however was not particularly special.   * Spicy Wonton: Sooo good! Beautiful play of flavor, a burst of savory, spicy (not too spicy) and juicy goodness in each bite. A must order!   * Shang Beef Noodle: This one was my favorite during our visit. I opted for the knife-shaved noodle, thick with springy texture, as for the soup, it was full of flavor, deep and rich. The beef was also unbelievably tender - overall, best beef noodle I've had, anywhere!   * Dan-dan noodle: As for this, we went with the hand-pulled noodle and it didn't disappoint. The noodle has a more delicate texture compared to prior but still chewy and springy. The spiciness level was just right with generous amount of ground pork on top. Delish.   Also, be prepared to wait in lines as this being a popular spot with both locals and tourists. But that aside, the food was superb, the staffs are full of smiles - Highly recommended if you are a noodle fan or just looking for a comforting dish to warm your body and soul.

I really enjoyed this! I wish it was spicier tho. -Pork & cabbage pot stickers 6pcs ($5.99): The presentation was pretty & taste of this was so GOOD! Def try this! Theres a crunchy-fried topping on top of the dumplings -Pork Belly Noodle ($9.75): i love the noddle soups here, def flavorful! And the pork belly is soooo soft :)  -Shang Beef Noodle ($9.75): my friend ordered this & i tried it out, sooo good also!  I def want to go back to try their chicken/mushroom rice & dan dan noodle !!!

EUsFypTTfqyHjbMWnE_6SA.text: Went to this place and ordered Dang Dang noodles, beef noodle , beef pancake  Did not like the noodles at all, Dang Dang is a little spicy, beef noodle tasted like water down  flavor of Vietnamese soup called"bo kho "but both bowls of  noodles  were too salty. Best thing there was the beef pancakes and I think all the fried/ steam dumplings probably pretty decent but I didn't get to try it except the pancakes Place was small but then again I guess it's normal size for Asian noodles place in Vegas. The place was also crowded despite we got there around two hours more before their closing time Service was friendly and he try to be very helpful since it's our first time here  Definitely  know if I would be back for their noodles but wouldn't mind eating the beef pancakes and try out some of those dumplings dishes

r0m8NLIiTZtpa3M-HyLMlQ.text: I'm in love with this place.  Saw (What I assume to be the owner) on the news, advertising his restaurant a while back and gave it a try.  Took a couple coworkers here and they absolutely loved it so have been back twice.  As you can see from other reviews, they offer a variety of chinese dishes but are most famous for either the hand pulled or knife shaved shang noodles.  I've had both and I didn't have a particular preference.  The knife shaved are long and flat and the hand pulled are your classic round skinny noodle.  Had the shang noodle soup both times and loves the amount of meat, taste of the soup and quality of the noodles (I do have to say that I like my noodles a little more al dente then most people but did not tell that to the waiter so that one is one me).  Service here is excellent. Quick, polite, and prompt - everything you would wish for in a restaurant.  Will definitely be back in the future.

bR2_NhIxqvs3kckb6-i4NQ.text: So yummy.   This might be my new favorite noodle place. Typically udon or ramen wins. But not amymore the beef noodles here are too good and the portion of beef is perfect.  Obviously I had the beef noodles. Well a few times now I just can't stop coming back here.   The beef brisket noodle soup comes in a savory broth with bok choy and a generous helping of soft brisket. Seriously I could eat this weekly.   My husband gets the chicken and mushroom and it is so yummy too. The portion of mushrooms and chicken is generous and the gravy sauce is addictive.   We have also tried the beef pancake a d think they are just okay. A house favorite but too much dough for me.  The beef and onion potstickers though are freaking incredible .   Drink selection solid.  Prices fair.  Service attentive.  Restrooms clean.  Wait never too long.  What is not to love about this place? Seriously I'm thinking about going back right now.

Sw7uAZQsB1G86cQJHsjekA.text: My friends and I visited Vegas over past winter break, and we searched Yelp the night we arrived after a long road trip for places to eat. We decided to try Shang and arrived about an hour before closing on a Thursday night and it was PACKED (there was no way we would have had ample time to sit down at a table and enjoy our meal haha). Discouraged by the long wait, we thought we wouldn't have had the chance to try the hype.   Luckily, after a few days that comprised of $$$ and 3 hour wait buffet (on the strip of course) and decent dinner at a steak restaurant, we arrived at Shang again on our last night in Vegas. As predicted, it was crowded and we waited for over an hour...BUT THE OVERALL EXPERIENCE WAS WORTH.   A waiter kindly and quickly took our order despite how busy their business was. We ordered spicy wonton as appetizer and were surprised by how unexpectedly spicy the sauce was. The main highlight was the beef noodle soup (Perhaps, hands down, the best beef noodle I've ever had). Three of my friends ordered them while I got the dan dan noodle (slight regrets, but I got to eat about half half haha). We all got hand pulled noodles, and the noodle consistency and texture were A+.   Do definitely check out this place because it's well worth your time and money

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. (sadly beef noodle soup was devoured before I was able to take a pic so here&#39;s) Dan Dan noodle. Deceptively spicy but still good

_6nZIBcf55vKuuT10wb9Gg.text: Great quality for a good price. Staff was attentive and friendly. The restaurant is small but serves its purpose well. I enjoyed the soup ladle utensil for the broth of my noodles too. Never saw that before haha.  The beef pancakes were tasty and the ramen style noodle bowls were filling and super flavorful. More then enough to fill your belly after a day of exploring the Grand Canyon West Rim!   Thanks guys. Would definately be back if we lived in the area. A+

dzyz-xzIJWIJOKtrS8BYmA.text: Arrived: 8:50pm Estimated wait time: 25-30 min  Sat down: 9:12pm  What I ordered: - Beef noodle soup ($9.95) - Dan dan noodle ($8.95). This was so bomb, be sure to order with cut noodles. - Beef pancake ($6.49)  The Establishment: - Really way too small. Maybe six sets of tables and with a noodle bar.  - This means that the 30 min worth of customers waiting are waiting inside the front of the store on a cold day such as this one. But the beauty of it is, they all waited, you know why?  Why you would come here:  - I kid you not. As a Taiwanese born yelper, I attest that this place has the most ahhhhmazing noodles. I don't foresee any future Vegas trips without a pilgrimage to this restaurant. I don't want to hear anything about that wait or that there are other places like buffets to visit, this dining experience was totally worth it.   Why you wouldn't come here:  - You're really hungry and 9pm arrival with a wait time of 30 min really doesn't cut it. But really, suck it up, it's worth it.   Cheers!

rNUTdS3LnbDjw3dMvllqNw.text: The knife cut noodles have such good textures, you can see how much work the chefs put in to making these noodles!   Got the beef noodle soup, dan dan mien & the fried beef pancake. All were really tasty and must try!

9DwNQwM348rfA4poDYPbHw.text: Fresh noodles! Fresh pulled noodles made in the window. Our party of 6 tried almost everything on the menu. Everything was good, but we like the fried rice and braised beef noodle soup the best. The dan dan noodle was pretty spicy, the spiciness that creeps. We liked the seared pot stickers more than the boiled ones. Service was great. Go early or prepare to wait. Seating is limited.

BXg3SMF4TYVRVkXYy6wtxw.text: [to the tune of of Jumpin Jumpin by Destiny's Child] Ladies leave your man at home because Shang Artisan is full blown and their broth is made from bone cuz it's 11:30 and Shanghai's Jumpin Jumpin!   Too much? Yeah, probably. I was just super excited about Shanghai Noodle's beef noodle soup and had to express it in song. Also ordered their beef pancakes and I was genuinely agog. It's a busy spot but worth the wait especially since our server was so nice and attentive! Excited to come back! Will probably not bother our server with my Destiny's Child cover but I cannot be expected to stick to my word in this area.

yZJpCa4NVSCWeNw1UjMlHw.text: Absolutely love this place! Place is very small just like most ramen bars but the wait was not too bad before my group was seated. While we waited, it was very entertaining watching one of the employees pull a big string of (ramen) dough and shaves them into a big pot of boiling water. I ordered the beef shank Noodle and it was very good! The broth was tasty and not too salty like a lot of Noodle places. The beef was extremely tender. I was however disappointed with the appetizers we got. The beef pancakes were not very good and the dumplings had a very strong alcohol taste to it. Other than that, I will definitely be coming back to try the different noodles.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Shank Noodle

t1RQsPqqmrfQOIBIoEznhA.text: This was our last meal in Vegas and I was so sad we didn't find this place sooner! We were tired and craving a good hearty meal that would last us our flight back home. Hand pulled noodles and soup sounded to die for.  After we checked out of our hotel, we ubered straight here with luggage and all. The wait staff was nice enough to let us leave our luggage behind the host stand. A real life saver. The inside was super aesthetic and I already knew I would like this place.  Our server was very kind. I asked him what his favorite was and he said the Dan Dan noodles with the knife cut noodles, so I got that! And my boyfriend got the beef noodle soup with hand pulled noodles. We also got spicy wontons to share. 10 come with the order.  The food came pretty quickly and all if was exactly what we wanted. The beef noodle soup broth was a little too salty to our liking. If there was a slight bit more hot water it would've been perfect! But I love salty so I can overlook that. I loveeeeed my dan dan noodles. It was the perfect amount of spice. I loved it so much I forced myself to eat only half so I can bring the other half to work the next day. The wontons were just the way I liked them so I ordered another to go.  If that doesn't say "I love this restaurant," then I don't know what does.

SdXaRnHT0MDja6QNrYBW5g.text: Shang noodle house did not disappoint. My husband and I came here on a Tuesday around 430pm and there were not many customers yet. We were seated right away and I had a view of the chef making the hand pulled noodles.   The price range here is affordable. Most main dishes were under $10 and appetizers were in the $5-$7 range.   I ordered the Shang Beef Noodle and it was very tasty. It was the kind of broth where you dont need to add anything else for flavor. The noodles were made just right. It wasnt too thick and had a bit of chewiness.. just how I like em.   I also ordered the beef pancakes which tasted ok. There was definitely more meat than pastry and in my preference it was a little too much meat. There was also an odd flavor that I wasn't too fond of. Which knocks the one star.   The service here is great. We were first served by a lady who made sure to check on us a reasonable amount of times. By the end of our meal we had a different server who was also just as attentive and delightful.  The inside of the restaurant had a clean, stylish, minimalistic feel. The wood work on the counter looks great, the wooden spoon for the soup was unique, and the cup for the tea was cute. I would definitely return here to try other items on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang beef noodle

Ed17-w0n1BAWQAvnjnjL7A.text: Definitely the best restaurant I went to on my trip to Vegas and that is saying a lot.   Shang Artisan Noodle is some of the best Asian food I have had in a very long time. All the flavors, texture, and service were at the height of my expectations during my visit. Fresh prepared noodles in every dish is now going to be the standard for every place I review now.   The very best part of the whole experience was the price. With this much quality and quantity I would have payed double what I payed anywhere else, but Shang Artisan Noodle sets pretty much their whole menu at $10 or lower. I was able to try 4 different entrees for the price of one on the strip.   Our waitress was literally by herself for about 10 tables during the lunch rush and she had no problems taking care of the whole house. It was quite impressive.   If you are a fan of Asian food or noodles/dumplings please give this place a shot because it is super high in my list of places I will go out of my way to eat again in the event I come back to Vegas.

4S17W_uabRKk-Sbi-UuT0w.text: Good food but wasn't blown away.  Everything made fresh so it takes a bit longer than expected which was fine.  Need to try more things to get a real feeling for all they do.  I felt like they appreciated their customers which is important to me.

8xldtaSO1PzAEYzCpTRgDg.text: We came here yesterday for the first time and my husband and I kept telling each other why haven't we been here before? If you love noodles and soup combinations, this is one place you need to check out. I had the pork belly soup with pulled noodles and my husband and son both had the Shang beef soup with pulled noodles. These were so good and the soup portions were just perfect. We also shared the beef pancakes. We were warned that they are filled with lots of juices so we let them sit for a little bit before digging into them and they were still very juicy.  We would love to go back and try the other soups.  We sure hope you make a new location  in the Henderson area soon!!

SJCmwOdwt486TOIOcVitDA.text: Yum ! Yum ! Yum !!! Bold flavor  Everything pork is amazing !  The beef broth is to doe for !!  The dumplings are hand made and so goddamn yummy especially if dipped in beef broth   Choose the knife cur noodles they are the best ! New fav local spot  With a charming vibe  Very down to earth !

lSVBar_2AQdox1zUolHWtg.text: two words: WORTH IT. I recommend coming in at a time that won't be so crowded. The wait can definitely be quite lengthy since there's a limited amount of seating. You can either choose from bar seating and see your noodles being made, or a booth, which is designed more for parties that want to eat facing each other!  In terms of the dishes, they have a wide variety but I definitely came in to try their most popular dish: the Shang beef noodle ($9.95) as well as the beef pancakes ($6.49). My party also ordered the dan dan noodles ($8.95) which was also very delicious. They have chili oil on the table so you can always spice it up to your liking!   On a side note, the location is not too far from the strip! So definitely expect a lot of visits from locals and visitors!

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 4 Piece Beef Pancake ($6.49)

xxR5jXLopPJgnqgHoAqw2A.text: Great off-the-strip option when you're craving noodle soup! The restaurant is small and popular so expect a short wait!  We got to sit at the bar and watch them making the knife cut and hand pulled noodles (you can tell them if you have a preference for table or bar seating when putting your name down) ---spicy wontons: skip, I like that these are smaller than most wontons but the filling is a bit dry ---shang beef noodle: a mild spice level and LOTS of flavor. Got it with the knife cut noodles which I preferred over the hand pulled noodles! BEEF WAS SUPER TENDER, perfectly cooked  ---prok belly noodle: the fiance got the hand pulled noodles which he preferred, maybe those would be better in the sauce based dishes. I wasnt a huge fan of his soup  Will have to try the sauce based noodles next time!

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly noodle
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy wontons

XX71Aq69S1aQF3AC-p9krQ.text: Menu looked interesting. I was most intrigued by the fresh pulled noodle technique. Unfortunately, I was busy catching up with an old friend that I didn't get to take a picture of the "noodle art" and how it's made. I ordered the Shang noodle soup assuming it was their main dish and original to their restaurant. I didn't think to ask if it was spicy because in the description it was just beef broth, braised beef and vegetables. I know I mentioned I was sharing with my 3 year old because she ordered "noodles". When the dish came, the broth looked spicy - so before I went in for a taste - I asked the gal and she responded "oh no, it's not spicy at all". Mind you - I'm sharing with a 3yo. So I tried it. I don't like spicy - any kind of spicy. And I think she probably sets spicy at a 5. This could've been a 1 but it was still spicy. What did I miss??   Shang Artisan Noodle, can you explain? What kind of ingredients are in the dish that make it spicy.   So rather than traumatizing my 3yo to see if she likes it, I just requested to order something else. I went safe and ordered shrimp chow mein. For $10+ I did not expect them to throw in tiny frozen shrimp. C'MON NOW?!!!, but it was. Prob smaller than a quarter or at that size.  I explained to our server that even though she mentioned the soup was not spicy, it was too spicy for my 3yo.   My friend told me not to give the soup back because she'll just take it home since they'll prob just throw it away. But I guess they don't care to compensate unhappy guests out of courtesy. The vibe I got was that the servers were just worried about getting people in and getting people out. There was no connection. There was no checking out how people were doing. I don't even think there was any eye connections with the person who took our order and then again the addl order. Did she even hear the reason we were placing another order?   I still have mixed feeling about going back. I was too caught up in my company that I wasn't as upset as I should have been. So walking out of there - I have mixed feelings.   We also ordered the pork and cabbage pot stickers which were ok.   They have clean restrooms. Single stall. 2: one for men and one for women.  Maybe someone can recommend a different dish to try? Or advise me how to order the Shang Noodle Soup less spicy?

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang Beef Noodle - tell me this doesn&#39;t look spicy?

sEdL3o6Tk1WG4S_JPE2Ysg.text: Was excited to try this place since it is so well and heavily reviewed. I tried the cucumbers in sesame sauce, the beef dumplings, and the noodles with chicken and mushrooms.   Please keep in mind that I live in Philly and eat hand drawn noodles pretty often in Chinatown there. Therefore I was a bit disappointed by my meal here. I thought everything was a bit bland. The noodles had a good chewiness/texture to it but the whole dish needed more salt or umami flavor and I am someone who usually prefers things to be less salty. The dumpling filling was good but the coating was pretty thick and made it less enjoyable. The cucumbers were probably the best out of the 3.

iyf1kcI9Vr3iz4q_M2l6lA.text: I'm not sure if the craze here... perhaps this is the better noodle shop closest to the strip? Everything tastes after a hangover, no?? Jk!! On a more serious note, the wait is pretty long (45 min) in the scorching sun and minimally shaded area. The food breakdown: -Shang beef noodle: mildly spicy and standard. The beef was tender and super fatty. The pulled noodles were good.  -Shank beef noodle: a beef and chicken broth that is more lean than the Shang beef noodle. This tastes healthier and lighter for sure.  -beef pancakes: super juicy and hot, but they always took 20 minutes to make.  -potstickers: juicy and crunchy but also took 20 minutes to make. I was too full to enjoy these.   Service was fine. Our water cups were always full thanks to one of the servers!    Not sure if the food is worth waiting 45-60 minutes!

YrDC770NJswwncRMUmeLsA.text: My co workers and I have been going to this place a lot and they're awesome.   The spicy wontons are a 5 star! But you have to like spicy food because it does have a kick to it!   Their hand pulled noodles are THE BEST. I always get the chicken chow mein. Large portion, so much flavor, chicken, and veggies but they are (just being honest)  greasy.   The Shang fried rice with pork is also great never had fried rice with corn but it's good!   The pork and cabbage potstickers are tasty and beef pancake. Full of flavor and the dipping sauce makes the dishes that much better.   This place is usually always busy so if you plan on dining in have some patience and if you're doing a pick up call ahead and take your time getting there to pick up your food. But worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang Pork Fried Rice 4/5 stars.  Spicy Wontons 5/5 stars, if you like/enjoy spicy this is the dish!

FFqSPXSRT0JEBo_xOZKhlA.text: I love places that make their noodles in-house. Not only do the noodles tastes that much better but I've noticed that these places also take more care in making their soups and sauces to complement the noodles. Shang Artisan noodle is no exception.  Shang is a small restaurant that's pretty popular so it can fill up pretty quickly during peak hours, so expect a bit of a wait. Service is pretty quick, so you won't have to wait that long. I love that you can see the chefs making the noodles through the glass wall.   1) Spicy wonton - skin is so thin and the spicy sauce is fantastic. This place reminds me of my favorite spot in Monterey Park for spicy wontons. This is   2) beef pancake - super juicy as you cut into it. Don't bite it because you'll burn yourself and the juices will fly all over the place. I got splash damaged by my neighbor who didn't know. The skin was pretty crispy and thick.   3) Beef Shang Noodle - I opted for the knife cut noodle which is a wider noodle. Gotta get this when it's an option because it's so rare to find. The This topped my favorite beef noodle spot back in LA. The broth was fantastic! Super flavorful yet pretty light, so you don't leave feeling heavy and lethargic.  Service: very respectful, friendly, and efficient.

R35Q1C_ew4ak3007UiNzbw.text: Popular Las Vegas eatery, serving modern interpretations of traditional Chinese handmade noodles. Located in a strip mall, the interior is casual, with table and bar seating. The open kitchen allows a peek into the process of making noodles from scratch. The menu is concise, including various side dishes, soups, sauce noodles, rice, and chow mein. For any dish with noodles, you may choose between hand pulled, knife shaved, or plain noodles.   I got the Tomato & Egg Noodle with hand pulled noodles, and my boyfriend got the Chicken Sesame Cold Noodle with knife shaved noodles. Both varieties of noodles were good, with fresh glutinous flavor, and the perfect amount of bite. However, the dishes as a whole were pedestrian. The sauces were thin, bland, and watery due to the noodles not being dried properly. The Tomato & Egg noodle sauce just tasted like salt.   The Cucumber Salad, albeit simple, was the star of our meal. The crisp, fresh cucumber spears were evenly drizzled in a richly savory sesame sauce. Service was friendly and fast. I think Shang has serious potential, especially considering the lack of similar restaurants in Vegas, but their recipes desperately need work.

8L0x3BmAETfyBoG8ysfoVQ.text: Had to see what the hype was all about. No wow factor for me. Food was kinda mediocre.   I enjoyed the show on how they made their  in-house noodles behind the counter, that was entertaining. The store was clean, staff was very attentive. We were seated right away and the food came out quick.

dvXlUUqyOHVpQIv6lyOy-g.text: What amazing and delicious noodles this place has! I came here due to a recommendation from a friend since we both love beef noodle soup. My parents and I tried their spicy wontons, beef pancake, Shang beef noodle, Dan Dan Noodle and their Wonton Noodle.   I ate the beef noodle soup and I really enjoyed the amounts of beef they provided in the bowl. The noodles were plentiful as well and tasted extremely fresh. I was imagining the beef pancake as the beef rolls, similar to the ones you'd get at Mama Lu's in Alhambra or 101 Noodle Express. They tasted nothing like it and it get more like a fried soup dumpling more than a pancake. The spicy wontons are so small compared to like Din Tai Fung or any place that serves it for that matter. The spice tasted more like Sichuan since I felt a smidge of that numbing feeling you'd normally get from eating g Sichuan food.   This place definitely reminded me of another restaurant in the 626 called Noodle St. I honestly like Noodle St more but it's rare to find knife-cut noodles these days so I'll always order it no matter what. I'll definitely come back to eat more noods because carbs is love.

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonton Noodle Soup
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dan Dan Noodles

6Sn9kPxs3jeHT--98cttCA.text: Really enjoyed this place a lot and it's not far from the main strip area. Located close to the Palms resort, this local hot spot satisfies your noodle craving. They make their noodles in house and be sure to watch the master stretch and pull the batch. Their noodle dishes looked really yummy and you can choose between hand-pulled, knife-shaved, or plain noodles for you dish. We chose to try the spicy wontons, Dan Dan noodles knife shaved style, and the popular Shang beef noodles hand pulled style. The spicy wontons are what they say filled with meat and swimming in a chili oil based sauce, be aware that this is steamed only. The Shang beef noodles were served in a delicious beef broth base with bok choy with super tender pieces of beef brisket and the hand pulled noodles were nice and chewy. The Dan Dan noodles were surprisingly spicy. Like my kind of spicy, but unfortunately to spicy for my bf to eat. The ground meat is served on top with our choice of knife shaved noodles that were wider in form. There isn't much spice if you just ate the dish without stirring it, but we didn't know that and so my bf stirred and mixed the dish ingredients and apparently there was really spicy chili oil and such in the bottom. So be cautious when ordering the Dan Dan noodles if you do not handle spice well. Overall the experience here was awesome and I am definitely coming back.
