Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang beef noodles
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

F2xjPRKc8puUpCna9_-MMQ.text: Stop looking for a place to eat, you just found it.  Everything here is outstanding, even the service. In a way I want to write a bad review, so the line getting in the door wouldn't be so long!  Look at the photos, nothing but delicious food, nuff said.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy wonton
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef pancakes
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dumplings

-SvQa9rDlQufHbOzC6kHvw.text: Knife Cut Noodles!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I've been to Vegas multiple times, but never had time (busy being hungover) to make it off the strip. What a waste of previous trips... However, the last time I was in Vegas 2 months ago, we ventured off to Shang Artisan Noodle based on a recommendation from a friend. MY GOD DID IT HIT THE SPOT!  My friend and I walked in around 2-3pm (after lunch rush). Thankfully the place was half empty so we got seated immediately. We ordered the Cucumber Salad to share (3/5 it was good but I've had better). My friend ordered the Shang Beef Noodle Soup with Hand Pulled Noodles (my friend loved it 5/5), and I ordered the Beef Shank Noodle Soup with Knife Cut Noodles (5/5). I personally preferred mine better because the broth was less heavy than the Shang Beef Soup.  Overall, this place is worth taking an uber off the strip. So much better than that super overpriced asian noodle place inside the Venetian lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang Beef Noodle Soup (Top), Beef Shank Noodle Soup (Bottom)
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cucumber Salad

c8CbODRuru1mGG4JZWPuiA.text: Bar seating for the win. I love watching that man with the beautiful colored eyes make my noodles!  In all seriousness, ordered the dan dan noodles and they're pretty good. Noodle is the right consistency of chewy without it being soggy. Portions are a bit smaller than what I would approve of, but the flavor is solid. Went in around 4pm and by the time I was done (5pm?), there was a line forming outside with a waitlist of probably 4 party.  I didn't like their spicy dumplings as much as their noodles. The dumpling skin was thin, which is good and legit. The seasoning from the chili oil also tasted legit. It was the meat innards that made me disappointed. It lacked any memorable qualities and reminded me of the same feeling I get when I eat frozen ravioli from Costco. Yeah it filled me up, but I'm not excited eating int.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sFij3t5lY_VM9C-37gExow.text: Would come back in a heartbeat! Definitely get those Beef Pancakes, hot juice in yo' mouth! Slightly crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside. I've had many others like it and this is probably one of the freshest I've had.   But honestly, in my Beef Noodle Soup adventures...this place would rank pretty high up there with their Shang Beef Noodles. Small chunks of tender brisket in a hearty, what seems like a tomato based soup, with just the right amount of spice and flavor. I've had a similar bowl of noodles in Taiwan that tasted just like this. I'm glad I've found a place just like it. Just note, the noodle soup is not spicy and if you glance at the whole menu, there's really only two items that has a symbol of chili pepper next to it.  Don't fret because on your table is a small jar of what looks like chili oil. Gives it a boost, but certainly won't knock your socks off.   We got the above dish with the hand knive cut noodles. Great texture and chew. We got the below with the hand-pulled noodles, both are are same price whatever style you choose.   We also tried their pork belly noodle soup. The soup on this dish is not as complex and I thought it just tasted like soy sauce and sugar. (What you normally would coat on Asian pork belly anyways). Again, the hand-pulled noodles are excellent on this (Or probably any soup).  Definitely expect a wait. Our was about 30 minutes and we ended up at the counter with our party of four. Write your name down on the pad and order boba next door and wait on the patio chairs. The inside of this place is small and the parking lot isn't the biggest either. So come early if you can, but I'm sure there will still be a wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef pancake
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Belly with hand pulled noodles
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang Beef with knive cut noodles

AdUWAqUFIPynhlmAGn1ZHg.text: Coming from San Gabriel Valley are,i have to give props to Shang's Noodles!! It totally lived up to the number of reviews they had. I ordered the Peking Zha Jiang Noodles cause i didnt want anything soupy in this hot vegas summer weather. I have to say the noodles were fresh with deliciously marinated minced meat and tasty sauce. I made sure to mix everything well before eating it. I also got the appetizers too. Parking is pretty easy and chinatown is easily accessible when you stay at the hotel on the strip. The price at this noodles shop is reasonable and cheap compare to those tourist traps on the strip. Overall, i highly recommend this for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peking Zhajiang Noodles

VRW1aUEw2i0UbBWKDqEcwQ.text: What an amazing place. There's only seven tables and two long bars to sit here so I understand how the wait can be long at times, but the turnover is really fast! They serve us so fast and so well and the waiters are especially attentive. After a long weekend of drinking, it's great to come here to refresh.   I got the Peking wonton with hand pulled noodles ($1.50 extra) and it was nice and refreshing, not as salty as everything else, more refreshing and with a clearer broth. My boyfriend got the braised pork belly and the pork belly was incredibly tender and the soup was a lot more rich and salty.   All in all, come early because we got there right at 11 and got one of the last tables and by 11:30 it was completely full.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy potstickers
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy pork and cabbage potstickers
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised Pork Belly

65xtXCjkQx6J48EzezFHqg.text: 3.5 stars  Came here because of their hand pulled noodles.  I was told the Knife shaved noodles were the way to go, basically flat hand made look fun noodles.  Any of the noodle dishes you can can select either hand pulled noodles, knife shaved noodles or plain noodles.  The plain noodles are thinner than the hand pulled and not made in house.  I opted for the Pork rib noodle soup with knife shaved noodles.  The noodles were great, very chewy in a good way but the broth was kinda luke warm and although flavorful, i wish it was more salty, (if that makes any sense).  The pork ribs easily fell off the bone but were still dry, i think because they had not cooled in the braising liquid.  My friend ordered the pork belly noodle soup with knife shaved noodles, they shared the same soup base, which i think is made from the basing liquid of the pork ribs and belly.  We also ordered the beef pancake and spicy wontons.  The wontons were not spicy at all, i'd give them a 2 out of 10 maybe.  They were pretty good but not great.  The beef pancake was not the traditional type I'm used to but rather 4 dumplings fried on the flat top.  The dough was nice and crisp but a bit too thick for my liking, the meat inside is tender and juicy but the ratio of dough to filling is off.  Im told this place can get crowded since it only holds 26 people, but we got there when it opened so there was no problem.  The noodles were great the side dishes and broth could be improved but I'm rounding up to 4 stars because of the hand made noodles.  I'd return to try one of their dry noodle dishes and maybe some other appetizers.

aif7Y6MudPPOZB0rjnoa_Q.text: This place is the perfect example on why you should go off the strip and eat.  Yes this place can get pretty packed but that's because the food is so good. There are tables to the left and a little bar surrounding the kitchen where you can sit and watch the chefs while you eat.  This is the 2nd time I been here. The last time I had the hand pull noodles.   This time I was inspired by a Instagram post that this place posted of the fried rice.  We got in and were quickly seated. My finacie ordered beefshank soup with handpulled noodles and I ordered the Shang fried rice.   We also ordered the beef pancakes to share. If you go here you must try the beef pancakes at any cost. They are extremely juicy and paired with their housemade sauce...my mouth is watering just thinking about it.  When our food came, the server provided us with a extra bowl and plate so that we can share each others food which was very thoughtful.   The total cost of our meal was about $30 and with the amount of food and service you get, it's well worth it.

DIbmGRPQDsoknw-aGvWWZw.text: Wow, what an amazing place. If you're someone that likes to try something new/different, if you're someone that likes taking pictures of your food, or if you're just someone that likes good food then this is a good place for you. I love that you can order your noodles different ways and that you can see them being made right in front of you. The service was great too!

Vr6FWYDJMBBAR6OO8R4GWw.text: Ordered hand pulled Shang beef noodle soup, Yang-Zhou fried rice, and beef and onion dumpling.  They came out real quick and tasted great.

qvMNgZcUAp4ZjJwgnOy-nw.text: Loved watching them make fresh noodles by hand.  The flavor of the broth were really good too.  Just hard to come here for lunch because the wait is sometimes 15-20min long.

nz8fBYfoNogyvMXz1Z44Mw.text: Was pleasantly surprised / impressed by this place. I really enjoyed their pork noodle soups and beef noodle soup!  It was my first time in Vegas so I didn't know what to expect of the food here. I'm from LA so I would say that I have pretty decent standards. I really enjoyed their handmade and their knife cut noodles. I definitely definitely recommend trying this place out. :)

iNsED2uzhiTxySX7_ejrSg.text: Amazing. Absolutely amazing. Sit at the bar so you can watch them hand make the dumplings, pulled noodles and knife-shaved noodles while you wait for your order. We had the Dan-Dan Noodle, Chicken Chow Mein, and Beef & Onion Pot Sticker. I would order everything again. Left here stuffed to the brim and 100% satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious, fat, and jucy pot stickers! Beautifully Presented.

_zMG9vFEV2vmdlzvvNQ5eg.text: Noodles, fresh and hot, served by the ample portion in deep inviting bowls. To share or not. Extraordinarily attentive staff and a kitchen team that clearly enjoys the work. Table or bar, take your pick. We savored chicken mushroom noodles with hand pulled noodles, beef brisket with knife cut noodles, hot wontons, and beef pancakes. Nothing disappointed.

gqbIA2qT2sxfTf_9mJlnEw.text: I ordered egg and tomato noodles, it is really authentic! Super good, will come back again

Everything we ordered was delicious, but I definitely recommend the hand shaved noodle and the chow mein!  PS- if you like chili oil, this is the place for you!

uSFfP6WG-0hG2vzPRTsMrQ.text: I was here for a soft opening night.  I am so happy that the real noodle house is opening around Johns and flamingo where right next to the McDonalds. Just like their name "Shang Mian" a real noodle house serving hand made noodle from scratch . I tried their vegetable noodle, even after a long after I was down talking, the noodle was still stay the same way fresh. If you like noodle and know about noodle, I strongly recommend this place!

SVJBL4JTw0zHzTR-QTbTCA.text: This is an American Chinese style noodle shop. I ordered the beef noodle with the taste is pretty good! The soup is very strong, but I think they put the bok choy is very raw and cold. Don't expect the the portion is big enough if you are hungry. Still feeling hungry after one noodle soup, one spicy wonton and one beef pancake.

nAVzhLW6RyJ3OtXGhXpCUQ.text: the restaurant is kind a small but the food is delicious,the employee very polite and nice. It's deserve to get an A +.

1Ht2CzKHFVTXFkdIlNlkfw.text: Stopped by day after Christmas and this place was packed. The place is small so it's not very good for large parties. Our wait for party of 4 during the lunch rush hour was about 45 minutes. Bigger groups waited longer and by the time we left the wait was 1-1.5 hours.  On normal days they say the wait goes up to 30 minutes during their lunch and dinner rush hours. The noodles come out quick so they move people out quickly. Still there was a lot of people waiting so our wait was longer than normal.   Was it worth the wait? Heck yeah!  It was one of the best Chinese beef noodle soup we have had and we come from the 626 which has many options. The broth flavor was perfect and hand made noodles was a plus.  Pricing for the noodles soups were decent around $8-$10 a bowl. We also ordered pork dumplings and spicy wontons. They were good too...not amazing like the beef noodle soup but just right. This place is worth a try and definitely better than some of the Chinese beef noodle places in the 626.

J8kckt9MQU4oQ_pB13usxQ.text: I saw Shang Artisan Noodle featured in one of those free weekly magazines and had to bookmark it. My boyfriend and I finally made it here and we thought it was amazing. I told my boyfriend that this is one of the most authentic Beijing-style meals I have had since I lived in China. I had the spicy wonton and although they are not that spicy, the flavors were amazing. The beef and onion dumplings were juicy and delicious. I had the Beijing zhajiang mian, and it was very good. My boyfriend got the Shang beef noodle and it really tasted like Beijing style beef noodle soup (niuroumian). It transported me back to the soup I used to eat all the time there.   The atmosphere is nice, it's clean, and it's cool to have a different choice of noodles. They were making some noodles while we were there (you can watch them make it) and overall it was a great experience. I am looking forward to trying the dan dan noodles.

0HQ90xn39xJOWVS220-dlg.text: The handmade noodles are great, they r chewy and u could see them doing right in the kitchen.  We also love the potsticker.  They made it crispy while inside still very juicy.

xXXj_U0BYXazqAJbKWZKmA.text: This place is a hidden gem off the strip!! Try wonton appetizer, Chicken and mushroom, and Dan Dan noodles.

t7cD1NJ51mqcwRQ-nPyfQw.text: Tried this noodle house for the first time. Went there with my brother at dinner time, and the restaurant were full. And yesss, of course i expect that the foods are delicious. We waited for about 15 mins to be seated and i love how the noodles taste! Love the soup, love the service. Loveeee everything there!

Ejt-tvo4oFKbb-2gQyY9Qw.text: Stumbled upon this and LOVE IT!  Started with the Spicy Wonton and the Pork Potstickers...both were amazing and packed with flavor.  Next, we had the Shangs Beef Soup with hand pulled noodles and the pork rib soupe with knife shaved noodles. Both were delicious but I was loving the Beef soup better...because of the broth, noodles, and meat. The ribs didn't have as much flavor as the beef. I liked the texture of the hand pulled noodles better. However, I like the knifed shaved more after they spent some time in the broth.  I brought home chow mein for my boyfriend and he loved it. Overall, great experience.

AbMqCieknQlkP-OImEKSig.text: Amazing hand pulled noodles! We came on a weekday for lunch, and the restaurant is a small spot with only a few seats. The restaurant is super modern looking, and the chefs are seen making noodles from the window. That afternoon, we had to wait around 30 minutes for a table of four, but the line moved really fast.   When seated, we ordered two Shang beef noodles, with knife cut and hand pulled noodles, pork rib noodles, and pork belly noodles. The beef stew was super tender, and I loved the slightly spicy flavor of the soup. The noodles were chewy, and you could taste the hand-pulled consistency. It was a pretty good serving size, and I couldn't even finish all of my noodles.   We also ordered the beef and onion potstickers and the pork and cabbage potstickers. I preferred the beef potstickers, but both were deliciously crispy and had a layer of crispy dough on the bottom. They provided a sweet and sour-like soy sauce for dipping, which complimented the potstickers well.   I would highly recommend this place if you're in Las Vegas, even though it is a bit of a distance off the strip, but for the reasonable prices and quality of food, I would definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork and cabbage and beef and onion potstickers
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang beef noodle

E_VqE_-rGqg2EjOpqGBKqQ.text: Just wanted to give a fair warning and say finding a parking spot close to the restaurant is luck of the draw and you might have to walk a short distance.  There's a sign in sheet when you enter, but I was seated right away as I was solo. I recommend if you're going with a group of friends you keep the party at 4. 5 at the most. You can go with a bigger party then I recommend, but you may end up split as it's a small dining area.   Service was fast and received my food pretty fast. About 10 mins passed and food was served.   I ordered the beef noddle bowl with hand pulled noodles. The bowl also has bok choy and green onions. Lots of flavor with a small kick, but very filling. There's also a soy sauce bottle and a spicy seasoner you can use to add more flavor.   Would definitely eat here again on a cold or rainy day!

uyypYLMfQXq9so9FbnCl5A.text: Pull that noodle!  Twist it, flip it, yank on it and oh yeah, hand pull it!  GMonkey do:  HAND-PULLED BEEF NOODLE SOUP- Perfect for that oncoming cold.  Hot, tender beef with freshly pulled noodles.  Hurry with the pictures, as these noodles are softening in soup.    KNIFE-SHAVED PORK BELLY NOODLE- it is everything you expect it to be.  THiCK uneven cuts of noodles, braised pork belly, bok choy in savory pork & chicken broth.  It's all Monkey need, but caved and did  BEEF PANCAKE- 4 (hockey puck style) come out HOT & JUICY accompanied with knife, to cut first.  If you bite into it immediately, steaming hot juices may squirt and burn. Once cooled, bite and inherit all the juice from within.    Everything delicious and filling.  Great for lunch, great for dinner.  Shared parking lot can be challenging at peak times.  Service is friendly and on the spot.  Clean, modern setting and plenty of opportunity to watch them pull noodle.

D1bHG5voMTw-h9iaGuxzpg.text: I felt a craving for soup noodle today.  By Checking on yelp, I found this place having a lot of good reviews.  I was so excited to give it a try.  I ordered their most popular dish " Shang beef noodle " and my friend ordered " pork rib noodle soup".  They turned out sooooo salty!!!  I couldn't drink the soup.  The noodle was in good texture, but the beef was not in good quality. All in all, quite a disappointing experience, given such a high rating.

vKTN_F12jjsughgpMB28cw.text: My friends and I wanted to try something different from what we usually eat on the strip. We yelped several places, and Shang looked really good and interesting. Plus, it was hot & new!  Very nice modern restaurant. It's not really big. Probably seats 20-25 people. We got there right when it opened, so we were the first ones there. Service was great! The waitress gave us great recommendations. She really knew what she was talking about because everything was really good.   We felt like we ordered the entire menu: Cucumber salad Spicy wonton Potsticker Beef pancake Beef brisket noodles soup w/ knife sliced noodles Pork rib noodle soup w/ hand pulled noodles Dan Dan noodles w/ hand pulled noodles Chicken chow mein w/ plain noodles  The only thing we didn't like was the cucumber salad because of the peanut sauce that was on top. The cucumber itself was good, but it was too peanuty. Also, the pork ribs in the noodle soup was not tender to my liking. I like it fall off the bone, but that could just be me.

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wwMoItR4ZwmtPQCpb-pQwg.text: This place is awesome.  Get a taste of what noodles are supposed to taste like.  A hidden gem. Hand made noodles in front of you.  Don't get any fresher than that.

KaJ0JaGSwTxeYJOnPJhAug.text: Shang beef noodle, very delicious. The beef, soup and noodle are just cooked right and taste naturally without any strange taste. Highly recommend it. I liked the Cucumber salad as well. Taste crispy and fresh. Sesame dressing makes the salad perfect.

TzkWJM3CJYd_TX2KVIFYhA.text: First off I love eating at this place.  So why am I rating it so low? Because the last two times I went it was very packed and I had to eat elsewhere so -2 stars for that.  I'm Californian so I don't go to Vegas that often but when I do go I want to be able to eat when I can.  The place is very small so if it's busy then you won't be able to eat.  :( maybe next time... because I love the food.

seK-1NU-h0mMABKIgr9Img.text: I really, really love this restaurant. The service was amazing, and the space was so cool. I loved being able to watch people twist and turn the noodles.  My friends and I got the Shang Beef Noodle, along with the Spicy Wonton and we LOVED both dishes.   The Spicy Wontons were a bit oily, but so worth it!! I decided a long time ago that good food over health (which is probably why my doctor always yells at me but oh well). My friend thought that they were a bit too spicy but honestly he thinks that everything is spicy so I wouldn't trust his opinion. They were perfectly delicious, and perfectly spicy. Highly recommend!  The flavors in the soup were delicious - I think something I'm always very concerned about when I get beef broth soups is whether or not the flavors are concentrated enough and if the meat is tender. At this spot, the meat is so soft and tender and the beef broth is just the right flavor. The soup was not too salty and not too bland, and such a delight to drink on a cold winter day.  The noodles were especially wonderful. They were so chewy and light, and they paired perfectly with the light broth.   All in all, I would whole-heartedly recommend coming to this place and trying it out. The prices are great, the customer service is spectacular, and the food is INCREDIBLE

qK2px4SklELleNm6CDxt5A.text: Take a minimalist approach, refined the quality and you've got Shang Artisan Noodles.  I came here in the middle of the afternoon looking for a hearty meal and thanks to my LV buddies Nelson Q., Philip T., Chris V. and Rod U. (HI), I trusted my gut to them and explored this highly sought after venue.    The menu was simple: appetizers, noodle soup, noodle sauce, fried rice and chow mein. But come here for the show stopper - the homemade noodles.  Since I was eating alone, I chose the "Chicken and Mushroom Noodle" with knife shaved noodles ($8.49). This bowl was filled with four kinds of earthy mushrooms, shredded chicken and four mini bok choy stalks with a brown gravy mixed into the toppings. Underneath, the knife shaved noodles was a thick and wavy long noodle which had a perfect al dente bite. After a quick mix of the toppings and noodles, it soon became a bowl of unami flavor which I couldn't put my chopsticks down. Each bite had the sauce completely coated onto the noodle which made the experience intoxicating and pleasurable. Be sure to ask for their chili which adds a great kick of spice.  Quick tip: I highly suggest ordering the knife shaved noodles with the "sauces" while saving the hand pulled noodles for the soups.   This restaurant is small and has a more contemporary feel. I sat in front of the kitchen as the chef was meticulously folding the dumplings for the dinner crowd. The service was extremely fast and friendly.   I'd love to come back to try their beef pancakes and other noodle dishes! Want to join?

A neighboring guest suggested we poke the sides to release the juices, cut it, and let it sit in the wonton sauce. We took his advice and was was sooooo worth it.

cExWibDBn_Bm1SYNagcamw.text: Good taste and price. Small interior but clean and very responsive staff. I recommend the cold noodle.

cnogKTSdMNrgVbQqPGUeAw.text: I LOVE hand pulled noodles so definitely wanted to check this place out. It is a pretty small place with 6-8 tables depending on how big the groups are and about as many seats at the "bar". You can see the guy making the noodles! So plan for a bit of a wait. I ordered the spicy wontons and chicken lo mein. My boyfriend got the beef noodle soup. It was all pretty good. I wish the lo mein had some spice. I didn't like the chili paste at the table, way too much chinese five spice in it but the noodles are pretty awesome. The spicy wontons were pretty good. I feel like the sauce was more chili oil than a sauce but not bad. I would definitely go back!

lDPZWmxdt2iDYQW5pRFapw.text: I Yelped this place when I came to Vegas last year and was staying at Tuscany Suites. It is in a tiny strip with 3-4 businesses. Fresh hand pulled noodles. We tried a different noodle soup, the spicy wontons and one more fried app. They were very good and tasty. It was definitely a good option for lunch. Very clean and new as they opened not too long ago when we went.

CqajCRZG4U45urX5JtyfaA.text: Hold Up. You mean my grandma wasn't in the kitchen when our meal was being prepped? B/c it SURRRE tasted like it!!   Homestyle, flavorful, vibrant colors, noodles were perfecto and it made me miss my grandma. I expected to walk out like "Meh, at least we are full"....but I exited like "Daaaaayymm! How can we come back in 24 hrs?!"   The knife shaved noodles with tomato egg was so mesmerizing. The bak choy was a little raw but the overall dish was BOMB. The DanDan noodles were spicy but very good too. And for kicks, we ordered the beef pancake---and hallelujah, they were juuuuicehhh!  Coming from the Bay Area, the prices here were so cheap (less than $10/bowl), I felt like we robbed the place when the check came. What a steal for some incredible food!  Thank you Shang Artisan Noodle! We are soooo coming back and bringing a squad next time!

wOdpajnXuSW1x48O46YNoA.text: Delicious food, fast and friendly service, and affordable options. What more can you ask for??

4x8Z3Ahneb0oqUeG2D_Cnw.text: First time. I can say I am pleasantly surprised and pleased. Small restaurant, came in exactly at 7pm just beating that dinner rush, then the line got extremely long. Shang beef noodle hands down. Hits the spot, right amount of savory. Pork belly noodle was more on the salty side, the broth was not as savory. Beef pancake are okay, be careful when you cut into them, a bit explosive with the juices. Definitely be returning to try the Beef Shank Noodle and the knife shaved noodles. Spicy wonton, not really spicy, more oily. Appetizers came after the entree's but its understandable since the noodles are ready to go!! Went with the hand pulled noodles, loved the inconsistency in noodle sizes, tells me it was made with love.

OxxUeWoYDqH56aRc2jj1lg.text: Came to try this place out after helping.  Given the myriad of choices for Chinese food in the vegas proper, this one looked good on the pics   Ordered the beef noodle soup, beef  pancake , dumplings, and the spicy wonton.  The awesome tasty ones were the beef noodle and the spicy wonton.   Beef noodles flavor was very delicious. Authentic.  And the noodle was freshly made.  Love the chewiness.  Soup flavor was absolutely amazing.  Reminds me of my moms beef noodle soup.   Spicy wonton was awesome. A good spicy without the after taste spicy.  Subtle sweetness was truly savoring.    I thought the beef pancake was ok.  Most beef pancakes contain good amount of soup juice when you bite into it.  The ones here weren't as juicy as expected.  Dumplings had good wraps.  But the stuffing lacked a little sweetness that I had hoped.   Overall it was an impressive experience.  Would definitely be back should we visit LV again. It's a must try for those that crave authentic beef noodles.

ZYG-UZf8pPzjXpQa7zPFZg.text: My original review was 3 months ago. I've been here at least 10 times since then. It's just ridiculously fabulous. I typically get the Dan Dan noodles, but this time I got the Chow Mein. We always get the bean pancakes, so good!

UoEbTpG22trw2ayuIIiRww.text: We thoroughly enjoyed this little gem off the strip so much we came here 3 times during our 5 day trip. Favorite menu items were the beef noodle soup, beef pancakes and pot stickers. Also, tried chicken chow mein, dan-dan, and spicy wonton (not spicy enough for us though).  Friendly and fast service was a plus. Definitely on our list for next trip! Would highly recommend this restaurant.

yg4QvVie5L-UfzaZPdkI3g.text: Great small shop about a 10 minute Uber off the strip.  Hand pulled noodles, soups, dumplings anchor the small but tasty menu.  Service was very attentive and friendly.  Absolutely worth the trip away from the crazies to enjoy a great meal.

XY_im7C2HS8fz9dL9GZ05A.text: Stayed off the strip for the first time in Vegas and decided to stay away and look up some local places. We went the hand pulled noodles! We had the Shang beef noodle soup bowl , shared a bunch of appetizers spicy won ton (so good!) pot stickers , dumplings, pancake all really really flavorful and one of the best I have had ever!!! If we had more time we would have come here every day we were in Vegas! Shared 5 dishes and my hubby had 2 beers and our late lunch came in less than 40 dollars!! Highly recommend and will be back!!! I even sent pics to some local friends!!!

uT3N8SUL8cPS5dqjgUIpog.text: I've been to Shang twice already and I've enjoyed it every time.   The really cool and unique thing about this place is that they make their noodles fresh! They actually showcase themselves hand pull and cutting their noodles it's pretty awesome.   The very first time I came we had a party of 4 and ordered the beef noodle soup, the dan dan noodles and the seafood noodle soup. Of all of them my favorite was the beef noodle soup. They had a really flavorful but not overly salty broth. My dad ordered the knife cut noodles and I got the hand pulled one. I personally prefer the hand pulled noodles because they're thinner and are better at soaking up the broth but if you're into thick cut noodles I'd recommend the knife cut. Back to the soup: their beef is so tender it almost melts in your mouth but it just has enough texture to it. My mom got the dan dan noodles which she said was just okay and my girlfriend tried their seafood soup. She really enjoyed her seafood soup along with all the actual seafood in the soup. They're generous with what they give so order appropriately!

nTT2kxmJNQ62SLy8vAaP_g.text: Wait time was moderate since I did go around dinner. The servers seemed like they were lost in the midst of the chaos and had to be waved down. The food was good and that's the only reason why I gave 4 stars. If their food wasn't good I'd probably give a 1-2 in service.

Y3vYH-ZoFFVg8jWPzjLiqA.text: Wow.  Ordered the Shang house pulled noodles.  Brisket, broth and noodles were 100% legit.  Spicy wontons were decent.  Menu here is small, but they do everything well and prices are super reasonable.  This place is worth the short trip from the strip.

cfKtWB6libCx05z1mRBpQw.text: Ambiance is small but very clean. Food is average. The reviews sound borderline fake. I would take Yelp with a grain of salt. When we find that ultimate Chinese restaurant I will let you know.

h-DxjJ7OFtpu92sdYV-2zA.text: As a chef I don't tend to write reviews, but this restaurant made me want to write one. Never did I imagine that i would come across such a delicious noodle shop in Vegas. When ever I want good Asian food I visit NY, but after eating here I can't wait for my next visit. So, we had the spicy wontons, and it was so good that we had to order a second one. The shang beef noodle was packed with flavor and the noodles were perfect. The only thing that I wasn't a fan of was the sliced beef, but everything else was delicious.

f6Z_i4p8euVH7oXcFvR1yA.text: Absolutely an amazing place, and best noodles in the city. Hand pulled to order or chipped, either way the quality of the noodle is unmatched and it makes the dish really pop. Love love love Shang!!!

VNZjwa8CRf2oiv1nyX7QhQ.text: This place probably should get 3 star because I actually like the service, but due to the hype and previous reviews, our expectation was high and our whole family was let down big time by the taste. The beef shank noodle tasted too salty. No, that's not the way to cook it.  On the other hand, the chow mein is lacking taste. The sesame cold noodle had too much vegetable, ratio between noodle and veggie is not right and the peanut sauce is completely lacking. I tried to add some more and it saves the taste a little bit but I still had to force myself eating it.    The beef pancake is actually really good. However, overall from the perspective of an LA Cantonese who is experienced eating good noodle dumpling dishes like this, sorry to say, these were off the mark.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sesame Cold Noodle

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shank Noodle

5xk99IuXSDHJYfBPZTmHfg.text: Location: The noodle place is located next to Yonaka on Flamingo. Easy to find, the sign is clear and simple. Love that it is close to the strip, about 10mins from the Bellagio.   Decor: An elegant simple and clean. Theme is modern, sleek and bright. I love the wood chopsticks and spoon provided. The water is infused with lemons or cucumbers. The place is not big but kept well. You can see how your noodle is being made from scratch which is the whole attraction itself. You can tell the cook keep clean and organized at all time.   Menu/ingredients: the menu is simple and easy to follow. You can pick and choose what you want off the menu by asking them. Everything is made in house. They have two kind of noodles: hand pulled and knife shaved. My favorite is hand pulled since it's on the softer side. The knife shaved is on the chewy side. Brooth is superb and tasty!   Service: they have good service. Sometimes they have a waiting line but usually it's fast.   Recommendation: would love to see more seats and comfortable seatings since sometimes they are busy and cannot accomodate large parties. Specials of the day would also be a good thing to add to their menu.   Overall, I highly recommens this place. Everything is fresh, clean and authentic!

MmH1uMeSZb29_dDjvwJ_Ew.text: The Shang Beef noodle soup had soft meat. Soup was good. Not 100% authentic Chinese soup but it was delicious. I liked the Bok Choi they had in it. Very delicious dish.   Dan Dan Mian had great textured knife cut noodles. Not much meat in it, so you would just be eating flavored noodles so just FYI. It is a bit spicy so beware.   Beef dumpling was good. Recommend as appetizer.   Price was very great. Good deal.   Fast service.   Open kitchen you can see the guys pulling the noodles.   Please open location in Southern California  #10

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PpG-c4HEFhFtq0ALG1_P3Q.text: Shang artisan noodle is the first meal we had in Vegas.  We had to wait for 45 to 55 mins but it is worth the wait even in 106 degree heat.  Everything we ordered was VERY GOOD from the beef pancake, spicy wonton, dandan noodle, beef shang noodle, and pork noodle.  I prefer the hand pulled noodle better than the hand shaved noodle.   While waiting for our food, we watched the chef make the noodles by hand. Amazing!!!!!

xLLOKQhHt-Fd7-h-Dy34Iw.text: Small place... sad that it became so popular because it's so good!  Wait is out the door.  Shang noodle and beef rib in white broth with hand pulled noodles is the standard for my wife and I... plus beef pancake or spicy wontons to split.  Great broth!

xJw0_lQD2roJ0ozcI_NkaA.text: My husband & I come to Vegas for work every 2 weeks out of the month. We truly love this place. So so consistent. It's been perfect & so delicious each time. The servers are very helpful if you're new at Shang. We can't visit Vegas without stopping by & eating here. Absolutely love the food. A++

Nty5D1JM65U1l3MA4s39Yg.text: Growing up having a lot of Northern-style noodles, I went to Shang's Artisan Noodle certainly with expectations. The truth is, nostalgia in the taste palate is hard to surpass, or even match. With that in mind, Shang's northern-style noodles come close to my childhood memories.  I got the knife-shaved Shang beef noodle. What I looked for were tender meat, chewy noodle, and flavorful broth. The meat knocks it out of the park--it was tender, flavorful, and required little effort to chew. The rich flavor gets even more potent when accompanied by a spoonful of the delicious soup. The only thing missing the mark were the knifed-shaved noodles; they were thick and chewy but lacked the beef flavor. I am not an expert but may be the noodles needed to be immersed in the broth a littler longer. Nevertheless, the experience was still a pleasant one.   We also got Pork & Cabbage Boiled Dumpling and Beef pancake. Both were quite good but short of amazing. To me, they tasted a little bland even when dipped in the sauce that is on every table. Also, I think both dishes use the same fillings because the tasted similarly. While each side dish can be a good complement to your noodle soup, you shouldn't get them both at the same time.   The service didn't comply with my childhood memory at all, which is certainly a good thing. Our server was very attentive and frequently checked on us to see if we were okay. Overall, Shang Artisan Noodle is definitely a place for a satisfying northern-noodle experience.

geerRIcX3CUlvR6t01EQhQ.text: I got the Beef Noodle Soup with shaved noodles...it was okay, drank gallons of water after though. I'm from Rowland Heights, CA so I definitely have had better. The cool thing there is that you can sit at the bar and watch them hand pull noodles.

O7dasvqmIWcVfFjvyH-ZWA.text: Beef pancake(They will warn you about the juice lol) and Dan Dan Noodles(nice lil kick of spicy)are out of this world. Service was great and look forward to next visit. You get to see the chefs prepping the food.

3AgC6lvOGB0rQiJskf-0OA.text: Great place! I had the Chicken Chow Mein and it was amazing. The service is great too. Also the best for last they make their own noodles right there!!!

aD7TWaYDilGR7j5g2M0F9w.text: Happened upon this restaurant by accident and coincidentally they were celebrating their 1 year anniversary. I really enjoyed their beef noodle soup- super tender meat and a good serving of it too. Their beef pancakes were also really good! Our server, Archer, was great and super nice! Great food, great service. Will be coming back for sure.

j9x_u9kJG-EMMqxvlNLsdw.text: This place is literally the best Chinese style noodle place I have ever been to. The noodles are the perfect texture and the soup is flavorful. In the past when I have had Chinese noodles, the broth lacked flavor so I needed extra soy sauce but here definitely not needed. We had the spicy wontons and the beef pancakes as an appetizer. Both were great! The beef pancakes are seriously addicting. I would eat them for breakfast everyday if I could. For my main dish I had the braised pork rib soup with the hand pulled noodles. It was amazing! My husband had the chicken and mushroom sauce noodles. When the portions came out my initial thought was that I might need another portion of noodles but ended up leaving full and happy. :)  The service is amazing. Steven gave us perfect details of the differences between all the noodle options (plain, hand pulled, or knife shaved.). He was very good at explaining the questions that we had. Lilianna was very friendly as well. Food came out in a timely manner. So when coming here, no need to worry about bad service. Can't wait to come back soon to try the other soups and other side dishes. *Drool.*

tDNsmcG_AdKBo8urOpDDPA.text: Great service. Great music. Fast and soooo yummy. The beef pancakes are so juicy. Dan dan noodles are very spicy.

yjZNPARJDgfq-GMAcCN1UQ.text: First time going in and it was amazing!!! The soup was so flavorful! The spicy wontons are delicious too. Service was great too! Definitely coming back

WXf0hl_m1jDI9sMGg__JBw.text: I really wanted to like this place since a few of my friends really enjoy the food here. But I think there are better noodle places in the area.   I have tried the dan-dan noodles, peking zha-jiang noodle, beef shank noodle, beef pancake, spicy wonton, and beef and onion pot stickers. The food is alright, I feel the food lacks flavor and is sorta bland. Presentation wise looks good though and it's pretty cool seeing them make the noodles, but other than that the food is just whatevers.

Jkf8_DIJqOA3AbNRqCDBBw.text: Really great hand crafted Asia noodle bowls  and appetizers served by a friendly staff for a good price.  We'll certainly return when we're in Vegas

VCfWT_Jfp6wi8xXey7nCtw.text: I didn't really wasn't expecting much, but man are these great noodles. I'm only stopping by Las Vegas for a few nights and this was within walking distance of my AirBnB.  Service: pretty standard imo. The 3 waiters I've seen work here are attentive and friendly. Water refills aren't an issue and they answered my questions with ease. Food comes super quick too, speaking of which....  Food: I can't give this more stars. I don't know what it is, but I haven't had noodles as good as these in a long time. I hope I'm not hyping it up too much, but I REALLY enjoyed both bowls. I've gotten both the pork belly noodle soup and the shang beef noodle soup. Both were hand pulled noodles. The broths are absolutely delicious. It's super rich with flavor but isn't overpowering, salty or heavy. The shang beef noodle soup broth is a tad on the spicy side, but it's very manageable (plus they have chili sauce on the side if you want). The toppings that come standard are 2-3 cuts of bok choy and a small heap of spring onions. There's options to add extra toppings ($2.50, which is whatever the meat is), bean sprouts, extra noodles, extra broth, etc. The pork belly meat was pretty tender, but I think I enjoyed the shang beef so much more. It feels like it was braised for a long time; even the cuts of beef that had some sinew/connective tissue is still tender enough to easily bite through.  Honestly, I love this place. For under $10 a noodle bowl, I find it hard to beat with that price point. I seriously wish this place would move to San Diego. Or at the very least, if I ever come back to Vegas, I'm definitely eating here again.

ljHqWOn1RNN3R-mvJ_psWw.text: Nice decor and very courteous service. Why three stars? Because I didn't eat there! I don't eat pig products, and therefore cannot have pork broth. XKfqotqflJZ9WeI54nKAKw.text: I was vacationing in Vegas and was looking for a good place to grab a quick lunch. I searched and decided to come here based on the reviews from Yelp. Lunch time was busy but I was seated right away at the counter. It was a great view to watch the guy hand pulled the dough into strands of noodles. I ordered the hand pulled pork rib noodles. The soup was very flavorful and the meat from the ribs practically fell from the bones. I also like that it had a type of leafy veggies that looks like bok choy. I would definitely come back here next time I visit Vegas again.

Host comes out and announces that they have 10 to go order and we will have to wait another 45-60mins. He told us the people who are already seated haven't received their order. So the to go orders come first and the people who have waited in the sun and are seated inside get their food whenever they are done. Screw this place

EImXZyAfrgHbiWCApRvnJg.text: Amazing noodles! Loved this place. Exactly what my wife and I were looking for while we were in town for a work trip. The hand pulled noodles are you something I definitely thought the trip off the strip was worth taking an Uber for. The prices for the entire menu were great compared to the inflated pricing of everything on the strip. Love the fast casual concept but the execution of a True authentic Chinese flavors and food.   I ordered the Dan Dan noodles with minced pork and added some of the super tender beef. My wife ordered the same Dan Dan noodles without the beef add on. The noodles were cooked perfectly and the flavors were so good. I've been to Taiwan, HK and mainland China and I will say these are definitely some of the best noodles I've had.   Will definitely come back here next time in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HG8TxTfwb5149SCfIc-L8A.text: Oh how I love this place! The noodles are fantastic, but what I really love are the beef dumplings and the spicy wontons! The wrappers on the wonton's are so light and fluffy, and the chili oil is just the right amount of heat. I prefer to sit at the bar and watch the noodle masters do their thing. Pay a visit! You won't be disappointed

bR0BQ6fpl_uEO1PTA-npqA.text: Seriously the chicken chow mein is incredible! Get it with the hand-crafted noodles. The wanton soup was really good, but wasn't a fan of the potstickers. The cucumber salad is a MUST! And their water is infused with cucumber which made it a very refreshing experience. Went with the most picky person ever and he approves ! Prices are definitely good. Generally $8.95 for a plate. Good sizes. Staff is incredibly nice and funny!

UEIWqlzyPKbvlyWPWHfi8Q.text: If you can get over the oddly hipster vibe of the place, this is a really good spot for Chinese noodle soup and small plates. I also love that staff are always making noodles by hand in the open kitchen.  On this visit I opted for the seafood noodle soup, which came with a couple shrimp, squid rings, and surimi-style fish slices as well as bok choy (note that the "seafood" nomenclature just refers to the meats - broth is still a pork-chicken combo). The seafood was all tasty, but I would have preferred the bok choy to have been cooked a little more. The noodles were the highlight as they were fantastic.  I'll admit that I'm a tonkotsu ramen junkie who prefers strong/aggressive broth flavors over the more subdued style typical of Chinese noodle soup, but I still found the pork/chicken combo broth satisfactory.  My group also split a beef pancake (this is more of the xian bing style) and a yang chow fried rice. The beef pancake was super juicy, and while the yang chow fried rice was a tad "artisan-y" and on the small side, it was still tasty.

4aVw_xXYhg2ne85XeZZAaQ.text: OH MY GOD... This was the best food experience while in Vegas.  The food was amazing and the staff was so helpful and friendly.  The artistry of making the noodles was incredible.  The neighborhood around Shang wasn't much to speak of, but upon entering the restaurant, the surroundings were on point, and i'm pretty sure I could have eaten off of the floor it was so clean.

sp4fUDerWevZxDKgddmHyQ.text: This once was my go-to spot.   It has since become very popular, however the good quality has been significantly reduced. I've found hair in the food, food improperly prepared. Service deteriorate with the new staff.   Overall just very disappointing.  I used to go 2-3 times a week and bring guests.   Not what was when it opened. :(

FjNZnZyg8Q56l_zJVio94A.text: Really happy with this place. Found it on yelp and was anxious to try it. Stopped in late (9:15p) on a Friday and had a small wait for a table for two; the restaurant was still full. The menu isn't too elaborate but has enough options to find something to be excited about. Service was great. Ordered the Shang Beef Noodle (hand shaved) and the Beef Pancakes, she ordered the Veggie Chow Mien. The soup was fantastic, deep in flavor and the beef pancakes were likewise delightful. The chow mien may not have been the most flavorful I'd ever had but the elegance of the noodle texture leads me to wanting to try more of the menu.

9eXCMMQaoXvaHRH7AvGldg.text: We love this place so much. If you love ramen but also love Chinese food and wish there was a strange wonderful combination of the two that somehow manages to be better than than the sum of its parts, look no further!  The soups are so fantastically spiced. The noodles are texturally enthralling. The dumplings, and rest is the appetizers can do no wrong. The service is wonderful.   Plus - the decor is beautiful and the artistry of the noodle making/dumpling making in front of your eyes makes for an added authenticity.

LIWvNcU7ESZ3-zGQSK8dow.text: excellent service. and wonderful food. certainly one of the best shanghainese style dining I have experienced in USA.

fmiGlk9E6sjBqqIM-ssVOw.text: Amazing food at the best prices!! I loved it so much! I tried 3 different noodles bowls and they were all fantastic!

JrUbWdMyckT3cEhf16IRGg.text: Every detail is in such good taste. The food, decor, atmosphere, service. The handmade noodles are great. Perfect texture, consistency. A lovely experience.

WjpKzKV3Lc-qE6NHTDQd1A.text: I will NEVER eat noodles anywhere else! The only place I have gotten the right amount of noodles and meat! The broth was savory as well.. no complaints here! Must must must try!

o7xJF1y09PSsiV9DNMbnLA.text: Went the other day for a noodle craving fix and Shang Artisan Noodle came through!! Had the beef and onion potstickers for an appetizer and they were crispy and delicious. For dinner we got the chicken chow mein, which has big pieces of chicken and those amazing thick hand pulled noodles, and the Dan Dan noodles with beef and were the perfect spicy kick. Sharing both was perfection. We kinda wanted dessert but we were never offered and instead just given the bill, but I was so satisfied I didn't even mind. The place itself is fairly small and by the time we left there were several people hanging outside, who I'm guessing were waiting to be sat. Overall it was an excellent meal at an excellent price. Only $30 for everything.

vTGBdrfO0xU3kwEmjS9vaQ.text: I got the Chow Mein and the Shrimp/Ham Fried Rice when I visited this awesome place! I usually would be able to take a picture but it looked so good I just dove right in! I basically inhaled the delicious fried rice and the sweet chow mein along with it!!! It's usually a hit or miss when I visit Chinese places but wow, this place exceeded my expectations! The flavors in the fried rice was just so perfect to me. I was craving fried rice all day today too! I'm so happy I came across this place. The customer service is also great! They were nice and everything came out fast and easy! The server actually made the suggestion when I asked what the best ones are and he described everything perfectly to where  could easily make my choices!  I'm definitely visiting again.... and again and again and again!

The Peking wonton was okay.  I find it too much sesame oil.  The place was small but the service was fast. We sat at the bar and it was entertaining to see the guy hand pulled the noodle.  My 8yr old was definitely enjoyed the show.

zb93-1KTUhZ8ETSXNq3uvQ.text: Yup, I'm gonna be that one person that doesn't like this place ... ~_~  Came here with 2 Chinese friends (1 lived in China for 10 years and 1 from San Francisco) and they didn't think it was "amazing" either. Not the best noodles in town for sure, even if they are hand-made. Cool concept though but nothing new.   I specifically ordered the Dan Dan Noodles because I LOVE Dan Dan Noodles. However, this dish left so much to be desired. (Shhhh .... Yunnan Tasty Garden on Spring Mountain has the best Dan Dan Noodles that I've had in LV. Trust. Their sauce is ah-mazing!)  The Wonton Noodle Soup was probably the best thing we ordered but not so great that I want to come back for it.   We also ordered the cucumber salad and it was drenched in a thick peanut sauce, I think. Yuck, I didn't like it at all.   I was really excited to try this place based on reviews but I won't be coming back. The place is super cute though and you can see them beating and twisting the noodle in front of you but I'm not here to watch a show.  I'm not being harsh. I just have high standards and Vegas being a major tourist attraction with millions of visitors a year should deliver nothing but the best.

d0lo8pmQitnZEd26MoFlrA.text: I've been patiently waiting to visit this restaurant. It was one of my first stop when I visited Las Vegas last week.  Hand made noodles is an art and it's usually difficult to find a perfect match of excellent noodles, broth, and meat. If you're looking for that perfection then look no further...you'll find it here.  Pros- 1- Sliced Beef Shank- it's served cold with a semi-sweet sauce. It's delicious even without the sauce. The meat is perfectly sliced. It's tender with the right amount of tendons. 2- Spicy Wontons- is a must have. Note that I can handle spicy and I would rate the spiciness level 6 out of 10. My friend who attempted to eat it would rate it level 9. 3- Beef & Onion Potstickers- made in house and has a great presentation. 4- Shang Beef Noodles- Delicious large chunks of tender beef. It's the most generous amount of beef I've had in this type of soup. The broth has a great balance of herbs and meaty taste. 5- Pork Belly Noodle- It's not the pork belly that you would expect at a American restaurant. They use a traditional pork belly flavoring that includes Chinese 5 spices and other flavoring. Its is delicious and my friend who normally eats pork belly from American restaurants loved this style. 6- Easy parking. 7- Excellent service. Friendly and efficient. 8- Menu is simple and just the right amount of choices to not be overwhelmed.  9- Convenient location that is only a 10 minute drive from the strip. 10- Oh the noodles! Last but not least. Hand pulled noodles were nicely chewy and not too thick. The knife shaved noodles were excellent and with just the right amount of chewiness. Their portion were very generous.  Cons- 1- The potstickers had a bit too much dough. I like them thinner.  2- No locations in San Diego :(

QVDKCbc1lPxUD_YkX8fGXw.text: Delicious. Hand pulled noodles made the dish. Dumplings where crispy ate two plates. Everyone that works there is kind and very attentive. Love it yummy

m16P_pNNMdUqQ-xR6qWJ_A.text: I gotta say, for the amount of people waiting for Shang Artisan Noodles, this place was as average as it gets. Service was decent though.  I got the Dan Dan noodles with hand pulled noodles and the pork and cabbage potstickers. The issue with the Dan Dan is the sauce was not as peanut-y as I would have liked; the flavor lacked depth to it. It seemed like straight up soy sauce and chili oil, and the preserved veggies were not very pleasant with the noodles. Because of the flatness in flavor of the veggies sitting in the sauce, the veggies didn't add anything to the dish and tasted exactly like the sauce in which it was sitting. The dish would benefit greatly from a touch of sweetness or even vinegar. I think that would balance it out a lot more. That being said, maybe the soup noodles fare better than the dry.  The potstickers were also only ok. The skin was a little thick for my preference and almost seemed slightly undercooked. I don't think I'll be back.

4V8rlLUTi9ktno9lykhYPA.text: Awesome place!  Friendly service (we came a bit early before lunch - no wait!).  Food is out of this world.  We ordered cucumber salad (good), pork and cabbage boiled dumplings (good), Shang beef noodles -hand pulled (awesome) and chicken and mushroom knife-shaved noodles (awesome X2!).  And the food came very quickly!  And we have 2 kids 6 and under and they both inhaled everything!  I wish this place is not 5hrs away from us.  I would've come at least 3x a week!    Oh and it's also v affordable.  Less than $10 a bowl.

MXdfigUSpf_JGvEqon5qPQ.text: This place blows my mind with how good it is. Everything is good, from dan dan noodles to wontons, to braised beef noodles. The hand pulled noodles to even knife cut are all so good. All under $10. It's insane. If you ever go to las vegas you have to go to this place. The only con is the limited seating, but you can order delivery as well and I've heard the delivery is really good as well. This is now added to my must have place every time I go to Las Vegas.

xu5etzSKkuyQNUt7y09vOw.text: It is always a good thing to know that you are eating freshly made, and it is entertaining to watch them make them as well.   The noodles were very good and the dishes were very tasty.   I preferred the hand cut noodles add they tend to have a bit more body than the hand pulled noodles.     We waited twenty minutes before we were seated.   We didn't mind as the place was packed,  and more people were coming in.   Apparently this is a popular place.   Servers were very busy scrambling to keep customers satisfied and drinks filled.   My only complaint was the cucumber water.   I prefer lemon.   Minor complaint,  I know,  but a very worthy restaurant,  with vey good food.

OTONAYIPW8dlsRRs0i6Qvg.text: If there's anything worthy of five stars, it's good food, service, ambiance and price. This restaurant had a rating of five star across the board for me. Mind you, me and my girlfriend are not a fan of Chinese food so it takes a lot of me to say that this restaurant won us over. Let me go over as to why:   Food: we shared an order of chow mein, beef noodle soup, and beef cakes. Very flavorful to say the least. When you're there, I highly subject to order soup since this is their highlighting meals. Regardless, I don't really think you can go wrong with any of the dishes.   Service: The noodles are handmade as you see attendants stretching the and kneading the dough. That was one of the most memorable parts of the visit and I love how transparent they are about cooking your food. You know you're eating quality dishes to the highest standard. Also the waiters were on point about their service. I love how friendly they were and always asked if we need anything else. The food was also quick to deliver with only the beef cakes that experienced a bit of a hiccup.   Ambiance: beautiful and modern. It's modest in size but very intimate for dinner with friends. Its brightly lit with adorable sets of utensils along with them. Every elements in the restaurant flowed with the design from the colors of the wall to the soup spoons.   Prices: amazing. It really shows that good food doesn't have to be expensive. And to be honest, I wouldn't be surprised if they bumped up the prices just a tad bit more but the fact that they keep their prices low with large portions is admirable. They're definitely consumer-friendly in all aspects.   A must try when you're in the area! Oh and after your meal, save room for dessert which is found right next door!

hUioO-0LPP5jutA1x88FDw.text: Located about 5 minutes from the Orleans Hotel, Shang Artisan Noodle is a very good place to go on a cold day.  We tried to go the day the day before when the temperature outside was approaching 30 degrees F but as expected the place was packed, so we went when they opened the next day.  We ordered the spicy won ton and the beef and onion pot stickers as appetizers.  The spicy won ton wasn't that spicy but they gave quite a bit of them and they were good.  The beef and onion pot stickers were just okay no different than those I have tasted.  My friend had the seafood noodle and I had the Dan-Dan noodle.  When I ordered the Dan-Dan noodle the waitress asked what level of spiciness.  I did not know so I ordered the sauce on the side.  When the order came, I put half the sauce in the noodles and started to eat.  I think I put too much but it was okay just a little embarrassing sweating so much.  My friend said his didn't have taste so he decided to dump the rest of my sauce into his soup which made it too spicy.  And all of this at an affordable price, it is a shame this place wasn't bigger to seat more people.

qz-1tfHmcbxdv2adJlZarQ.text: A quaint newer noodle spot that seems to be growing in popularity! My good friend told me he was dying to check out this place and after glancing at the reviews I was happy to meet him for a late lunch.  The inside is small but bright and inviting. Light wooden decor in every direction and a few tables and bar seating where you're able to watch the art of handmade noodles in action.  The menu is small (a two sided menu) but there are solid choices all at decent prices:  - Cucumber Salad ($4.95) Cucumbers sliced vertically with a heaping mound of thick sesame sauce on top. The sauce was a bit much for me, although flavorful taste wise. I would prefer a light sauce/dressing on cucumbers but this sauce was too heavy and creamy. My friend didn't seem to mind, he thought there was a hint of peanut in it  - Spicy Wontons ($5.49) Heavenly. Silky Pork wontons doused in a spicy oil, topped with sesame seeds, black pepper, and chopped green onions. I thoroughly enjoyed the heat and taste of the spicy oil. Easily the best dish we ordered!  - Shang Beef Noodle ($8.95) Savory, piping hot bowl of noodle soup. Very hearty broth - you can tell that meat has been simmering in their broth for quite some time. I got the knife shaved noodles which was a great decision! Totally can taste the difference in the noodles and it's 100% fresh. So delicious! The braised beef brisket had some extra fatty parts but the non fatty parts were both tender and flavorful   There were two ladies working as servers and they were both polite and filled our waters when empty. Food came out at reasonable times and service was pretty decent. Nothing over the top spectacular but no complaints either.   My friend got the Pork Belly Noodle and he loved it. He said he personally was a fan of the flavor of the broth and the texture of the noodles! I could really tell that he enjoyed every bite of his noodle soup.  I will definitely come back and look forward to trying another noodle dish. I'll be sure to order the Spicy Wontons again!!

For the entree I ordered the shang beef noodle and my friend ordered the chicken and mushroom noodle.   shang beef noodle: is a soup based noodle. The soup is very light and slightly spicy and the beef was tender and flavorful. The chicken and mushroom noodle   Chicken and mushroom noodle: sauce based noodles. The sauce was delicious and incredibly flavorful. I actually liked the dish the most. The noodles were chewy and the chicken was cooked perfectly

hTxwy7TneORDd-ffUXdRFg.text: Luckily it was inexpensive. I am truly amazed at all the raving reviews because besides the fact that they make amazing noodles right in front of you it seems they don't know what to do with them after! The beef pancake that is so highly recommended by nearly every review needs flavor. ANY kind of flavor! It's just hot and oily and without the little pitcher of potsticker sauce to let it soak in it's just something to chew on. The pork potstickers came 6 on a plate and 5.5 were still on the plate when we left. They tasted like the peanut oil they were fried in and ONLY oil! The chicken chow mein was barely flavored and the chicken looked as if it was purchased already sliced and cooked. We had one bite of it and pushed it to the side. Finally the beef noodle soup left a lot to be desired. The knife shaved noodles were thick and chewy which was awesome, but the beef was so fatty and gristly it was spat into a balled up napkin and left on the counter for the busser to dispose of. The flavor of the soup was so confusing, almost as if it was a mix of a few different leftovers and thrown together with whole unsliced bok choy. My favorite part of the meal was the sprite in a bottle and the delicious complimentary water. We were expecting a crowded restaurant, but there were no more than 6 other patrons in there the whole time. When we finished the server asked if we wanted to take it home and when we said no he seemed as if he already knew. I assume it's an acquired taste, but I have eaten a LOT of noodles in a lot of parts of the world and I can't think of a time when I was more disappointed. Being an executive chef myself I would think to say it was an off night in the kitchen, but you could clearly see that this food was the norm. 1 Star for the attentive and smiling servers, 1 Star for the delicious water.

1-fJnC1-XdQvWknS6DGshg.text: Really nice hand pulled noodles. First time here. Some noodles don't match with soup but that's just me. Over all 4 stars. Noodles are great but not the best for me. I had better ones. Because I went around china.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QIYFKFElDn8-fBNtX2awbw.text: Amazing noodle soups.  The spicy dumplings are great as well.  The shop is very clean and modern as well.  They offer the soups to go as well and they package the soup separate from the noodles so the noodles don't get too soggy on the trip home.

bMiEaPCCoSdGg-CZo5NlqQ.text: Honestly, one of the most satisfying meals I've had in a while. From service to taste to watching the chefs hand pull the noodles, I give this place a full seal of approval. The restaurant is clean and designed nicely.   We had green tea to drink, which came in quaint glass cups with cork coasters. We feasted on the spicy wontons, dan dan noodle, and beef shank noodle. I literally walked out of the door with a smile on my face. The food here is delicious! 10/10 recommend.   Thank you for the lovely dining experience Shang Artisan Noodle!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green Tea. Dan Dan Noodle. Beef Shank Noodle.
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Wonton

-YV7AH1kfgCs3ATLCVwlyA.text: I managed to drag my starving girlfriends here after driving over from California and I must tell you they were so much less hangry and so so happy after we left. We definitely were not expecting to have such BOMB noodle soup right before going out on the town.   FOOD: Shang beef noodle soup: I was very impressed with the hand cut noodles and the broth!! I live near San Gabriel Valley which has pretty good noodle soup places and I think Shang noodle does it much better! Flavorful broth and so delicious.  Spicy wonton: This surpassed my expectations. My all time favorite place to get spicy wontons was Din Tai Fung, but it's actually fantastic here if not better! If you are familiar with Mama Lu's dumpling house in CA, just know that these wontons are about 50x better and have a nice amount of spice. I'd recommend this as an appetizer for anyone!  Overall: We had to wait about 15 minutes for a party of 5 on a Friday night around 8:00. I'm assuming the earlier you go the better! I would say that Shang Noodle is definitely worth the wait as I haven't found any better noodle place in Vegas. If you are craving noodz I would say Shang noodle is worth leaving the strip for!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Shang beef noodle. So worth getting off the strip for a nood break (-:

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Noodle pull game strong!!

ykplcoHMtls6jivkOOiRQA.text: OMG...and absolute must try... I ordered the short rib handpulled noodles and the beef and onion dumplings... The pork/chicken broth is delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib noodles...   yummy
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican coke and a fresh cucumber water.....Very inexpensive... soup and non soup dishes.

N6PnYGnVZZHFNicaimJn4Q.text: It's edible, ordinary, and small...  The kitchen takes up most of the dining area.  I guess their motive for that is to show off how the noodles are made and prepped... its noodles y'all , at least for me I don't really care.  The food looked great when I was served but the taste (which is let's face it, the most important thing) was very underwhelming.  It didn't taste bad, but it also didn't taste good enough to get 5 stars from me.

MHDpSGWMR5iKxKC3hHQENA.text: Sooooo good! Like oodles if noodles good ! Shang's has the authentic knife cut beef noodles and the most consistent, friendly and nicest staff !  B is for the beef noodle soup! This place is a small drive from the strip but it is worth every tummy grumble and hangover cry!  U is for the uniform staff and consistency. I always get greeted, tended too and the nicest people. Forgive me for not asking and knowing your names but to the owner of Shang's if you're reading this, five stars to the team, the food and the good music - the cucumber water is so refreshing too !  Z is for the zealousness of the quality in food. Every time I'm in Vegas I always at least visit once !   Z is for the zzzs after the food coma of deliciousness. Seriously you have to eat here !   Thank you again Shang noodle and staff! Real treasure here in Vegas !

mC7gfgukAErPwMw2DNB5IQ.text: Best dinner spot in Las Vegas but atmosphere the customer service and it's one of the servers there he has a admirable warming personality generous. Kitchen staff is very genuine as well they allow you to video record and take pictures of them making the noodles by hand for entertainment for kids or other individuals that are there special place to be special if you're taking somebody out or just going out for a night out on the town highly recommended.. 4STMdRaAPiftAGrrBQ60XA.text: Discovered this place on Yelp. I had the Dan Dan Noodles and cucumber salad. Both were delicious. The staff were very friendly. Food was ready in a snap. The reasons are clear why the locals are eating here.

rBYHKz8vAUxOdJ1UkqNQQQ.text: The beef shank noodle was good. The broth had a little kick to it, was not too salty but a little on the thicker side. The beef shank was flavorful and the bok choy had a nice crunch and added a great balance to the soup. The hand cut noodles were fresh and we enjoyed watching the guy prepare them through the window!  The spicy wonton was drenched in a spicy soy sauce and tasted heavy and oily overall. Would have liked it better if there was less sauce so that I can enjoy the wontons :)  The pork & cabbage boiled dumping was nice and light and perfect to dip in your chili sauce. The beef pancakes were amazing, nicely browned on each side and not too oily.   Place is a bit small and there can be a wait depending on the time you go. There is mostly 4 person seating and individual seats at the counter.  Server was friendly and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef pancake

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Shank Noodle

zjCA9k7di7hrjTyTiulLzw.text: The perfect balance of great tasting food, value for dollar, great service, and theater in the kitchen   Dan dan noodles had cut were perfectly aldente QQ and the sauce was full strength not watered down and full of ground meat.   The beef noodle soup had lots of beef chunks perfectly stewed and tender. Could use a little more 8 spice but it was almost perfect.   The pork dumplings are a modified Taiwanese style but closed off. Amazing flavor as they used just enough sesame oil to flavor the meat. Must use the sauce   Overall this is the best place in Vegas and probably San Francisco Bay Area. Seattle.  Only a few places on OC can top this

3A-rh-OQPCgOmvoTNosMmQ.text: We were passing through Vegas and checked this spot out. We are very pleased with their delicious hand pulled noodles, pork belly noodle dish, and chicken chow mein. We liked it so much we had to order some more to go for dinner!  We'll definitely be back.

nBwHj_JRMa4WYq4lp_ZjHg.text: Cute little spot! We had spicy wontons, pork belly w/ hand pulled noodles and Shang beef noodle w/ knife shaved noodles. I felt like the pork belly soup was a little too sweet for my liking. The beef had good flavoring but was a little salty. The noodles could have been cooked a little more.  Braised beef was really tender all around The pork belly was tender but some pork chunks weren't as tender.

ju-wKdVkQ0emxl4U6noXgg.text: Came here on a Sunday afternoon and it was busy! I could smell the food from the outside and it instantly made me more hungry. We waited for about 20 minutes so it wasn't too bad. We sat at the bar so was able to see the kitchen and the noodle pulling show! We ordered the beef pancakes, signature beef noodle, and chicken chow mien. My favorites were the beef pancakes and chicken chow mien. The beef noodle soup was flavorful, however, the broth was too salty for my liking. Our entrees came out quick! I'd say within 5 minutes. Our beef pancakes took a while to come out. We were almost done with our entrees when the beef pancakes came out. Overall, the dishes were tasty (minus the beef soup) and I would come back and try the other items on their menu. Come give them a try!

YfVhi96mYhvu7tQjQNSITQ.text: Definitely JUST OK. Maybe it's because I live in the SF Bay Area and have access to what may be the best Asian cuisine, but this place was unimpressive.  It wasn't bad in any way, and the folks were nice and the place was clean and comfortable, but the food wasn't anything to go back for. I ordered the beef pancakes.  The shell was too thick and the meat was too bland.  I ordered the beef noodle soup.  The brisket was cooked nicely and the hand-pulled noodles were fresh as can be...but just not much flavor.  My friend ordered the cucumber salad (cukes in a peanut sauce) and the mushroom chicken noodles but neither were exceptional.   Place is busy but I don't see what the fuzz is about. If you've been to any din tai fung and had their soup dumplings and love them, don't expect the food at this place to rival that.

NmI3U2q67fDj2L_MT0J54w.text: Great noodles, amazing texture. Don't be afraid to try different things on the menu!   Perfect for a post Vegas trip.

Yq1PFjhCz-Gauxbu4selPg.text: Cool place where you can eat and watch pulled noodles!!!  Place is small so it can get packed!!  Ordered the pork potstickers, Shang Beef Noodle, Pork Belly Noodle soup, and cucumber salad.  Noodles were delish and broth for both soups had great flavor!!!  PotSticker looked really cool!!!!  Tasted great too!!!  Service was A+

As1W_ekGfTfjv33WpxwMog.text: On our visit to Sin City, we decides to venture off the strip and try this hand pulled noodle restaurant. We were not disappointed. The chili dumplings were delicious as were the noddle dishes we ordered. I had enough leftover for another meal.   We didn't have a car so we utilized the transit system and let me tell you, that was the best money we spent on the trip as we were able to go up and down the strip without suffering (much) from the over 105 degree dry heat (if you can't tell, I don't tolerate extreme heat well). Super easy to download the RideRTC app, buy day passes on your phone, and scan your pass from the phone once you get on the bus. Anyways, I digress...I meant to point out that the RTC stops caddy corner from this restaurant (coming from the strip) so it was fairly easy to get to.   The one minor downside to this eatery is the size of the restaurant; what you see in the picture is the exact size. We had to wait a little before we were seated as all the tables were full. But the service was good and they brought us what we asked for right away. I would go back again next time I visit.

gRbJo2YAm8Ni8SdaZeKR3Q.text: Super busy, good staff and made to order noodles. All dishes were very good. Heavy chinese population in restuarant is always a good sign.
