bT37qzs3vu4p3KFX509HZQ.text: My coworkers and I wanted to try this place when we were in Vegas for work. We were stuck in meetings and couldn't get out -- so we doordashed the delivery to us (yeap ...we can be persistent when it comes to our food bucket-list).   The food was cold by the time it got to us. But it was still tasty!!... so I can only imagine how good it is when it's hot.   We had (in order of preference) -  the  spicy wontons (the sauce and spices on it were yummyy)   - the peking wonton soup with knife shaved noodles (the broth was satisfying...and the noodles are a great combination of soaked in broth yet firm)   - the hand-pulled dan dan noodles (I liked the texture of the noodles)   The price is very reasonable for the quantity.   Another bucket list item - check!! Yayy!

7bFdy8krrEi4J_S5TQcDhw.text: Loved this place! Great find. We had two different noodle soups and the fried rice. Everything was delicious. The hand cut noodles were our favorite.

a3qA-TnHQMwDppPiAOUvLA.text: This is small place, but with big favored food! I love that you can see them making fresh noodles right in front of you. You can sit at a table or bar. Everything was amazing, including a cucumber salad, Spicy Wonton, Shang Beef Noodle, Dan-Dan Noodle,  I'm definitely going back there!

c-MQPZVe2vlYTMbp3K_Wbg.text: I love coming to this place. The Shang fried rice is always perfect and the service is quick. There is usually a wait but if you go before 7:30 then you don't have to wait long.

iZBKEwr3ggCI7HZbezNkOg.text: The place is small but has cozy feel. You can see the noodles being tossed right in front of you. We ordered Shang Beef noodle soup (1 hand pulled and 1 knife shaved), pork pot sticker and beef pancake. They were all very delicious, but the noodles...they were chewy and perfect texture. I'm so glad we found this place. I know there's ton of food options in Vegas, but if you enjoy Asian noodles, this is something you should definitely try.

BPDDdV_HYuZRoA3gcSrBMw.text: Love that place ! One of the only places that I like the vegetarian noodles! Tomato and egg drop are perfect for me . Fast service for pick up not more then 15 min wait !

LPuMuwcShRge8Psy3iPvsA.text: The first time I heard of Shang Artisan Noodle was on an Eater article some time ago. I had completely forgotten about this place until we saw it one night while going to the cafe next door. So what did we do? We came back the next day for dinner!   It was a Saturday night and it turns out to be their third day in business! Whoa! We have such good timing then! We love trying new places out! The food that Shang Artisan Noodle offers, as well as their seating placements, reminded us a lot of Noodle Man (located on Rainbow and I-215.) They even have a guy that's showcasing how he hand pulls the noodles in the open kitchen!   Shang Artisan Noodle offered four different types of soup noodles: beef noodle, pork belly noodle, pork rib noodles, and seafood noodles. Of those, you get to choose what KIND of noodles you want: knife cut noodles, hand pulled noodles, or regular noodles. My boyfriend and I got their beef noodle with hand pulled noodles. My friend got their beef noodle with knife cut noodles and my other friend got their pork rib with hand pulled noodles.  You can absolutely tell that the noodles were hand pulled because they were all different widths! The noodles that I had in my bowl were a good texture and somewhat al dente, however, my boyfriend stated that his noodles were a little mushy. I'm not sure if that's because his was sitting in his bowl a bit longer or it came that way. His bowl and my friend's bowl with knife cut noodles were served first so they waited for us to get our food before digging in. The beef were really really tender, which is really good! That means they braised it long enough!!! My friend's pork ribs were pretty yummy as well -- it as a really good and familiar flavor to it! Tastes like mom's braising!   The soup base, on the other hand, was a little on the light side. I mean, it can be seen as a good thing or bad thing. To me, I felt as though it was missing something. To other people, it may seem to be the perfect balance. It's not like I'm going to drink the whole bowl of soup so it's fine.   Towards the end of our meal, they gave us a complimentary dish of celery salad! It was a cold salad with celery, peanuts, and carrots! I love celery! And the sauce that they used was really yummy :)! Would definitely get this dish again.   Also! They serve you watermelon infused water, which is really unique. I can't say I liked it though haha. I'm not a watermelon fan so watermelon infused water doesn't do much to me. You are able to just ask for regular water!  Overall, decent food and decent prices. I loveeee hand pulled noodles! So glad that the Chinatown area finally has something like this hear by. Would definitely recommend people in trying this place :)

6kdZjFX3yjFyGi-I47Jpwg.text: Be prepared for a wait, not too many seats inside. We waited about 20 min. The broth was really good, but the noodles was alright. They gave way too much noodles and barely any meat. The noodles soaked up all my soup. You don't want this happening when you're a slow eater like me.

nK6S-ZZlJ6CQXaLf9WKDIw.text: Our new must visit when we come to LV!!! Everything we ordered was DELISH. 6LenYjV8RZO95qlWwZGeag.text: Loves this! Great noodles. Great vibes.  Love hand pulled noodles and there's are excellent. Great spoons too!

cDL26alIYvAf4-hZkGDGmQ.text: Absolutely amazing!  We got a seat at the corner of the bar so we could watch the noodles be made. The staff was very friendly and the noodle guy was a ham when it came to photos and videos.   I ordered the Shang's beef brisket with hand pulled noodles. The broth was dark, rich and flavorful, the brisket was tender, the bok choy was crisp, and the hand pulled noodles were cooked perfectly. Everyone else ordered won ton with noodles hand pulled and knife shaved. They all enjoyed it. We also ordered beef pancake and potstickers. I must say the potstickers were some of the best I've ever had. Nice chew, perfect crunch on one side, and the filled was seasoned to perfection. The beef pancakes was good, not spectacular just good. I think I'd rather order two potstickers instead next time.  The entire staff was very professional and outstanding. The restaurant was clean and so was the restroom, big plus. I'll definitely come back again. Two thumbs up!

ZYjiWg0LR-ukJ1be_3sfgQ.text: We loved this place! We got the beef and onion pot stickers, the beef pancakes and the chicken chow mein with knife shaped noodles. All the noodles are made fresh right in front of you and it shows, they were all delicious. The pot stickers are all fried together in a star shape and you pull them apart from each other. They were really juicy and had a great flavor. The chow mein was good with the knife shaped noodles which was recommended by our waiter. CHYwVhTlOvEdzCUbOlAsPA.text: This place is legit. Hand made noodles, flavorful broth and what a good idea to put soup in their potstickers and dumplings just like siao lung bao.  Customer service was great and the place is well kept. Prices are very reasonable too. This is like a ramen spot for Chinese food.

VC4HNQBVoUhGQACw65jZdw.text: The food and service here is amazing.. we oreded Shang beef noodle with hands pulled noodle and Pekin zha-jjang noodle with hand pulled noodle..

RhyD6ZAlEH22obZQI-2z0g.text: Tasty! Came in and was immediately sat at the bar for a table for two. We ordered the beef hand pulled noodles, spicy wontons and the beef pancakes.   Service was prompt and everything was served quickly and fresh!   Noodle soup--I tend to prefer flat noodles, but this was delicious regardless! Definitely a must if you're a fan of the five spice flavor. I like a little heat so definitely added some of the hot paste that's available.  Spicy wontons--so delicious. Love the subtle Sichuan base, sesame seeds, and white pepper.  Beef pancake--you've got to be careful with these guys! They come out piping out and can surprise squirt you! Thankfully our server warned us so no surprises there, lol. Delicious filling inside and exterior was crispy yet chewy.   Yum!

X4pTf89Gsw4wRjYS8e9QTw.text: the place is very small so the wait would be skittle more if you have a big party... their water is infused with cucumber.. good customers service

NWWpy4ZRbdYpcYLo2HfC6g.text: My group and I were looking for a local place to eat at and this one caught our eye. We don't go to Vegas often, but this is a place I would go back to and tell my friends to go to.  The restaurant has a comfy feel; minimalistic look that I love. You can have a table or sit at the "bar" and where you can see the noodles/food is made.   We started with Spicy Wontons, Beef Pancakes and Sliced Beef Shank. In my opinion, I really liked the pancake and the wontons. The shank wasn't something I liked :( for my taste buds, but my group liked it. The spicy wontons reminded me of Ding Tai Fung's, but a little more spicy, which I like. 2 out of 3 of the appetizers that I recommend :)!   The main dish that I got was Peking Wonton Soup w/ Knife-Shaved Noodles and Bok Choy. It was amazing! But I think if I got the Hand-Pulled Noodles with it instead, it would have been less filling. And the amount of green onion they put on top... is mouth watering. One of my friends got the Dan-Dan Noodles... Those are.. just too spicy for me; the Spicy Wontons are my perfect type of spicy.. but Dan-Dan was too spicy, BUT very good!   Definitely would recommend this place! 10/10 would go again!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peking Wonton Soup w/ Knife-Shaved Noodles and Bok Choy

53utEuj-D52mtORYfeWLkw.text: Good food and good service.  It is in a strip mall with about 9 tables and bar stools at a long counter.  Very basic. There are a lot of excellent noodle places in Vegas at all different price ranges.  At $20 for the bowl, drink, tax and tip it is pricey with just average quality.  When I write these reviews I usually ask myself "would I go back?".  The answer is probably not.

AY6is7KRInEALg0rzUcOLA.text: So as I'm writing this review I'm literally finishing up my meal here at Shang Artisan Noodle. All I can say is this is the most delicious place ever!! My boyfriend and I walked in and the first thing we noticed was how packed this place was and now we know why. The staff here was extremely efficient, friendly, and all had a smile on their face! We sat the bar, which I think is the best seating in the house. From the bar you can see the noodles being freshly hand pulled as well as the dumplings being made fresh. We ordered the dan dan noodles with hand pulled noodles, beef noodle soup with the knife shaved noodles, spicy wontons, and pork pan fried potstickers. Everything was amazing, the noodles had a great texture and everything was full of flavor! the best part was that everything tasted wonderfully fresh and clean! Like it wasn't gonna make you feel heavy afterwards! Overall this place was a delicious find!   Lastly, if you come after 3pm it might not be as packed; but it's definitely worth the wait!

ghYyLx6Mb-i06ODXiZD4PA.text: The food was very good . I enjoyed every part of it especially the pho. But it was a while to be seated considering how small the place .

y2ICb8BTJPRFFe28dVcbCg.text: Despite how many times I've been to Vegas over the years (read: quite a few), my friends and I would never stray far from The Strip. A couple of trips to Fremont St and the outlets, but that was about it. Which always bummed me out since I knew there were plenty of interesting places to try. So, with my conference over and nowhere else to be, this was the perfect time to check out something new! Something like...a nice, hot bowl of beef noodle soup! After hearing so many great things about Shang Artisan Noodle, I almost immediately put them at the top of my list of Vegas bookmarks. Once I stepped inside and took a look at the menu though, it's easy to see why folks like them so much. Not only did all of their noodle dishes look really good, but so did all of their different types of dumplings and potstickers! Fortunately, I was able to make my way back on another stop in town before I could get to writing this, so I got to try even more for my review! -- BEEF PANCAKE (4 pieces)...$5.49 (yelp.com/biz_photos/shan...) More dumpling than "pancake", but this was pretty interesting! In a way, this is essentially like a sheng jian bao (fried pork soup dumpling) with its pan-fried skin and soupy broth. That said, while the broth is flavorful, I'd still prefer the variety over this beef one. -- SHANG BEEF NOODLE SOUP - Beef Broth, Braised Beef Brisket, Veggies, and Choice of Noodles (Hand-pulled, Knife-shaved, Plain)...$8.95 (yelp.com/biz_photos/shan...) As tempting as their other noodle dishes looked, I knew I had to get this one the first time I came here. Thankfully, it didn't disappoint! Each piece of beef was both meaty and tender, the noodles had the perfect bite, and I loved the broth - so deep and robust! -- PORK & CABBAGE POT STICKER (6 pieces)...$5.49 (yelp.com/biz_photos/shan...) I may not have expected much out of this dish, but this was pretty good! The potstickers were pleasantly plump, the skins were tender and only slightly thick, and the filling itself was rather tasty. Plus, it had a good ratio of meat to cabbage. Not bad! -- PORK BELLY NOODLE - Pork & Chicken Broth, Braised Pork Belly. Veggies, and Choice of Noodles (Hand-pulled, Knife-shaved, Plain)...$8.95 (yelp.com/biz_photos/shan...) Despite how the hand-pulled noodles seemed a little off this time around (knew I should've tried the knife-shaved one!), this was solid. This broth wasn't quite as rich, but I LOVED the pork belly! Not only was the portion quite generous, but every piece was huge and only slightly fatty. Delish! Even though my second trip here wasn't quite as amazing, I should also point out we were a bit tired of noodle soups when we came here (our two meals before this one were ramen). For me, Shang is a fantastic spot and their beef noodle soup is well worth checking out. With so many bookmarks to work my way through, I may not necessarily make it a point to come back. But if the opportunity presented itself? I'd never say no to that! FOUR AND A HALF STARS rounded down for now.

eKJsrCVjyd_0tXk54Wqo_Q.text: We spent 4 days in Las Vegas deciding go to this place twice. So except those buffets that are "mandatory" to try, we basically went here. And if we stay longer, we are going to go here more. Wish we"lol have one in Boston:(  The Shang beef noodle is the best. We choose knife- carve noodle. Probably hand pulled noodle is also good, but my personal preference would always go with the knife-carve. The poem&cabbage fried dumplings is so good. Not only the meat and vegetables are fresh, but the taste and the soup within the dumplings is astonishing. They also have a self-made soy source to go with the dumplings.   Last but not least, the cleaness, the service are super.

iwW_9Z3EHfI3jQVWUuQkfw.text: Tried this place a few days ago and it was great! Our waiter was outstanding and made sure everything was amazing. He told us what to order because it was our first time eating. We got a beef and pork belly soup and it had outstanding taste. The pork belly was amazing! Also got the pancakes and they were really good. Definitely plenty of food for a low price

TVr1q8RM3gMTLsDpSxPlPw.text: Great place for noodles in LV. Hand pulled noodles are thin builders and the knife cut is the thicker noodle with more chew. Both are great and you can choose based on your soup/style to eat the noodles. I prefer the thick noodle as. Stir fry or as a soup and the hand pulled are good in all applications.   the potstickers and a really good bottom with the crispies, however the skin was thicker and more boiled or steamed dumpling like so it was closer to a Zheng jian bao. It was still tasty!   The space is not too large and does get packed at busy times but there are seats also at the bar where you can see the noodles being made! Parking in the lot is free!

SVrAkddYmulnE8kBLZp4lg.text: Shang Artisan Noodle is one of a few places in town offers hand-pulled noodle. The venue is small and with bar seats and couple of small table. Obviously this is not your fancy dinner place. What's make up for the small foot print is the amazing noodle. The beef broth is thick and delicious. Food can be very spicy here so make sure you ask your server if you can't handle the spices.  Not all items are great. I have tried the tan tan noodle and it was so salty and pricy. So if you are not familiar with Chinese cuisines, avoid fermented or oily/spicy item

zvT8WkKujJKcNWLeFH7nZg.text: This is a gem in Vegas! While visiting the city on the weekend, my friend and I decided to save our wallet and see if there were any restaurants that we're too expensive. We found this place via Yelp and this was our favorite restaurant we went to! We got the beef & onion pot stickers and although it was a made-to-order dish, it was so worth it! I got the beef shank noodles with the hand-pulled noodles and it was soooo decadent! Definitely worth going to next time I come back to Vegas.

CQkAelm5PXC04HxjyJskMQ.text: It's Chinese new year today and I have been told by several chefs that this place is a must go to. First we started with the cucumber salad with peanut sauce, excellent! Then the pork pot stickers came out and it was like nothing I have experience yet, it was a 15 minute lead time by now I know why, it's made fresh to order and they make it with a slightly thicker dough then normal. We also got the steam white rice with tomatoes and scramble eggs. Then we got 2 soups with the hand cut noddles which you can watch them make on site.   Everything was great I can see how to make anything better, if this place was in the Wynn they could charge 3x the price but because they are in a strip mall I think it limits their pricing, this place is awesome!!!

JIEAMSeYOUGZhbwtHIkexw.text: This was a lovely find on our way to the strip. The food was fresh and delicious! The restaurant was clean and the service was fast. I highly recommend this place.

v_xllj4VoHqe57mRJk9A4A.text: I'm. It really sure how to start except - Wow!!!!  We tried five different things:  Spicey Wontons - good kick great flavor   Beef pancakes - tender and flavorfull meat / crisp outside soft inside Greta flavor   Beef & Onion dumplings - these were pretty good but a put on the over steamed side to me.   Shang Beef noodle (hand pulled)- I've had handpulled before at $$$ and these were so much better the broth has so much flavor and the meat is very soft and tender   Chicken chow mein (shaved noodles) - great great just great loved the full body flavor a tender Noddles and the chicken was perfect / Lee loved how the veggies are warm but crisp.   Service was great and we got lucky at 6 pm no wait to sit.   Worth the drive from the strip

Ncb3RoBC1EtLrKzCw2GaSw.text: I finally got around to trying this place. It's located in a small strip mall near the intersection of Flamingo and Decatur. Parking may be a bare because of limited spaces out front.  I came in the early afternoon and did not wait too long. The place is small but very quaint. There is table seating as well as bar seating. I sat at the bar which is directly in from the is the kitchen area. While you sit you can watch all these wonderful masterpieces come to life, especially as they make fresh hand pulled noodles.  The menu is simple and attacks just about every taste bud. I ordered the Dan Dan Noodles and Beef Pancakes. The Dan Dan was a good portion, but I should have order extra noodles (optional).  Very flavorful and spicy. It's not an immediate spice, I would call it a creeper. It gets you when you least expect it. The pancake was awesome, but be very careful, it's hot (temp).  And you have the potential of squirting juice (hot broth) everywhere. So I poked it first and let the juice run out into my spoon.   If you crave some fresh made noodles and a cozy atmosphere, I recommend you give this spot a try!  Happy eats.

EmmMqG56AApB_jrgzPqmZQ.text: I've been labeled a "bad Asian" for not eating rice regularly and instead choose to love noodles in its many forms. This place came highly recommended by my bestie. Perhaps it was that and the Yelp hype that is contributing to the a-ok review. Sorry bestie!  I will say that the service is extra friendly and complete with lots of smiles. This is appreciated as we were hungry and couldn't wait to be seated. There was a wait-list close to 9 pm but we were quickly seated in within 5-10 minutes.  We ordered the cucumber salad and the beef noodle soup with both hand-pulled noodles and knife-shaved noodles. - cucumber salad: cut-up cucumber with sesame sauce on top; doesn't require a lot of preparation and not what you'd typically expect. - beef noodle soup: the beef was tough and broth was salty. The noodles have a good texture but didn't integrate well with the broth. To me a critical component was missing from this dish, which is pickled sour mustard. It could be that this place is going for a "modern interpretation" but I wasn't a fan.

BVwqiyuiX9YfmXDiR3RHKQ.text: Beef noodle soup was amazing. The broth was so rich and perfect to taste - not too salty. Dandan is a bit spicy but not saucy at all. More like seasoning for noodles, almost tasted a bit bland. Very interesting since it was my first time trying such a dish. I don't know if I would get it again. Beef pancakes were disappointing. Came out steaming hot so be careful if you're biting into it. It's very juicy however which was great. It would be good if the outer skin was a bit thinner.

buhj10BG0bkDVzDTX2PMHQ.text: The most delicious bowl of Beef Noodles I've had so far in America. It was so great my boyfriend and I  came two days in a row to get our fill before leaving LV. The noodles were perfectly cooked with the right chewiness--I loved both hand pulled and shaved, though if I HAD to pick, I'd go with shaved. The beef was very tender, stewed in the broth so long that it soaked up all the incredible flavor.

6Pxfu7jGsKitloKh2niTVg.text: Was craving noodles on our last day in Vegas before our flight and came across this place on yelp. There was a good amount of People and luckily, we got the last table before a line started forming.   I ordered the Shang beef noodle soup and my bf ordered the tomato egg noodle. We also shared the spicy wontons for an appetizer. The Shang beef noodle was pretty good, I really enjoyed the soup. The meat was also pretty tender as well. The egg and tomato sauce noodle was just OK, it was a little bland to me and I also felt like I could've made it myself. The spicy wontons were pretty good as well, but I prefer my spicy wontons to have a bit of a peanut sauce/oil taste to it, so these were not the best spicy wontons I've had, in my opinion.  Overall the I enjoyed my Shang beef noodle soup the most. The service was also great. They refilled our water and tea and made sure that we were doing ok. They also helped store some of our luggage which was very nice of them!

snJwN3AjIDvC3-Gk_rIf1A.text: Service. Noodles. Ambiance. Price Point.  Bravo Shang Artisan Noodle Team. This is exceptional! What an experience! & Yes an experience. Watching The guys make the noodle 'to order' the flavors & spices are definitely nothing like I have ever had before.   Wonton Noodle Soup (Pork), Potstickers like I've never seen before (or taste), & an authentic chicken chow mein with knife shaved noodles. I wish I had a stomach of 10 to feed. Id continue to order. Glad there isn't any dessert otherwise I might have had to try it out; of course for everyone else's benefit. Lol  My server Lindsay; so sweet and so professional. More impressive was the fact she was so well versed in the food & the authenticity of it. You can see that it's a passion she has in the way she was speaking about it.   Again, you will see me back here again. I can't wait until they open back up tomorrow.

ysAB3qwKxFogzarn02q7KQ.text: Shang's Artisan Noodle is a wonderful noodle shop that has an american twist on Asian cuisine. It's an incredibly clean, brightly lit, and cute shop with a good bit of seating. The best part of this place is that you can sit at the bar and watch them hand pull and make all the food in front of you! So cool and such a smart touch. They have ample choices from appetizers, noodles, and sauce noodles. I had the cucumber and beef shank as appetizers, shang's beef noodle soup and the pork belly noodles. They were all spot on and absolutely delicious. Their adaptation of childhood favorite dishes is a solid win. You can't go wrong with anything you order here and I'm excited to go back and try more of their food in the future.

60KHbE_Oy95XJMA3Hvo6Lw.text: Loved my meal here! This is a legit spot for amazing noodles. It's a small place, and service is great. The water is scented with cucumber and feels ~fancy~ The noodle soup portions are quite large so consider sharing if you have a smaller appetite.    Spicy wontons - delicious spicy sauce. The wontons themselves are quite sweet.   Beef noodle with hand pulled noodles - the depth of flavor in this broth is unbelievable. So savory and an almost creamy texture! The hand pulled noodles are perfectly chewy and delicious.   Seafood soup with knife cut noodles - there are a TON of noodles in here, and since they are the knife cut variety, they are quite thick and filling. The broth is quite light, and there is a good amount of shrimp/squid/fish cake in here.   Highly recommend Shang noodle for a legit experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood noodles
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef noodles

9PtrimCG7DogNvMN88RefQ.text: The wait was exciting and it makes its feel fun.  Live environment.  Watching the noodle be made was an experience.  Cucumber salad the dressing made that dish.  You have to get the handmade noodles. I got beef soup.  I will try the noodles with sauce next time to see if there is more then 1 note of flavor.  Overall it was good.  Not crazy great.  But good.

KQCVV3B1OT9o6e8aIXj3LA.text: Really good noodle dishes. I tired the Dan Dan noodles with pork which provided the perfect hint of spiciness. The beer at 3.75 a bottle is really affordable, the noodles were less then 10. If you want good chinese noodle dishes and great prices then come to shang.

jeo3VryL_Jg-cHQf1ZE1sA.text: Atmosphere 5/5 it's a cute bustling little noodle shop when it's busy, and a serene time to yourself with it's not. You have a view of the kitchen staff pulling and methodically cutting noodles, and the sound of garlic being thrown into a wok. As long as there isn't some snotty kid running and screaming around, it's a fantastic small place. Beware of wait times, but it's a quick eats restaurant, so you shouldn't need to wait too long.  Service 5/5 nothing to complain about, nothing to laud about. It was just quick, short service. It's a type of customer service that especially matches the atmosphere of this noodle shop. Keep it up!   Food 4/5 so this is where the restaurant drops a star. The beef noodle soup with hand cut noodles is the best you'll get here. I've tried the black bean noodles, Dan Dan noodles, and more, but the beef noodle soup broth just can't be beat! The beef is also super tender. But the dropped star is mainly due to all the other menu items. The appetizers are nothing special, although it is nice that they're fairly priced. I feel like if they change up the way it's presented or change a bit of the recipe, the appetizers would be so much more delicious! This also applies for all the fried rices. Could be so much better but it's not "bad." I would still order it but it just doesn't have that "omg YUMM" moment like the noodles or amazing dishes from other restaurants. But Shang has so much potential! It's so delicious, and I'd love to keep coming to see their improvements!!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp fried rice + beef noodle soup

B4PLpi6sbS_Ql5GVTDluhQ.text: A little taste of home on the other side of the world.  Shang nails it with flavor, texture, and authenticity.   I was feverish and recovering from a cold and this was the only thing I could stomach during the peak of my infection. I got their house special beef noodle soup while the SO got the dry noodle.   The quality of the hand cut noodle is absolutely unparalleled. This will be a bookmark and must try whenever i'm back in Nevada.

X3RveuDp_18hazV-JIgzbQ.text: I dragged my sister here because a) who doesn't love homemade noodles b) was tired of the Strip and their overpriced offerings. This place was a pleasant and tasty surprise. It's a small place located in a strip mall, but it's clean and bright. We got there right when it opened at 11 and it quickly filled up.   We started with the cucumber with peanut sauce. So crunchy and peanut sauce was not cloying sweet. I saw spicy homemade wontons and knew I had to get those. They were also very good, juicy little pillows of flavor in a spicy sauce. Our Shang beef noodle soup came out shortly. You can get your noodles three way: hand pulled, knife shaved and plain (vermicelli) style. I opted for the knife shaved as I love chewy al dente and noodles of different size and slight shape. The broth to the soup was rich with a beefy and slight tomato flavor. The crunchy baby bok choy was a good way to break up the slipperiness of the noodles. And the beef brisket was beyond tender. I liked their homemade hot chili sauce that I would dip my beef in.   The staff is very efficient, kind and helpful. If I lived in Vegas, I would come here probably once a week.

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cucumber in peanut sauce

S77FaAvyWPhgvxREVtESiA.text: Yusi and I started w/ an order of the Spicy Wontons and for the main meal ordered the Shang Special Beef Brisket Soup w/ Hand-Pulled Noodles and the Chicken Mushroom w/ Hand-Shaven Noodles.  The Spicy Wonton sauce was a delicious balance of the soy base w/ vinegar tartness, fragrant sesame oil, and a good spicy back kick. We prevented our server from taking the bowl away and saved the remaining sauce for later.  I really love a good bowl of Beef Brisket Noodles, and count myself lucky there are several good varieties to be found in Seattle. But little did I expect to find this gem of a noodlery in Las Vegas with an amazing savory broth, tender morsels of beef brisket, and excellent noodles freshly hand-pulled on the spot. They had just the right firmness and girth with the slight random crookedness that confirmed their handmade nature with every slurp of the strands.  Yusi was craving chicken for some reason, and the Chicken Mushroom Noodles did not disappoint! I'm glad for her choice because it was a delicious counter point to the Shang Special: it was a dry "lo mien", loaded with chicken and two kinds of mushroom with a touch of scrambled egg in a delectable brown sauce. Folks who are familiar with Indonesian "bak mie ayam" would find this bowl tasting surprisingly familiar. Yusi ordered it with hand-shaven noodles, which was good, but I would have preferred it with the hand-pulled noodles instead.  Now for a surprise "fourth" dish we accidentally discovered: I pulled some of my hand-pulled noodles into the remaining bowl of Spicy Wonton sauce to let Yusi try the noodles, and she exclaimed with glee at how good that tasted! I took a slurp and enthusiastically agreed, adding more noodles into the Spicy Wonton bowl. They should consider adding a new menu item of Spicy Wonton Lo Mien Noodles! I'd fly back to Vegas just for that!  Leave some tummy time for after the spicy noodle goodness, to hop over next door to Sweet Boba for Boba milk tea or their Honey Toast dessert. I felt complete.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Mushroom (and egg) Hand-Shaven Noodles
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang Special Beef Brisket Hand-Pulled Noodles

REN_vH1ZN7d_qWFokz4XDA.text: Middle afternoon and hardly a wait. Sat at the counter and ordered hand pulled noodles with the pork ribs soup. Order some steamed dumpling and potstickers for appetizers. Everything was so good! Great flavor and the noodles had great texture, and a solid chew to them. We watched them pull their noodles by hand and even do knife cut noodles. We wish we had time to go back and get some of the stir fry noodle dishes. Service was solid and friendly even with a full house. Definitely will be coming back and bringing others with me.

Owcjg2-lR5uYVgSS3bFEQw.text: Visiting Las Vegas and after a few days eating American food i was craving for some authentic Chinese food! Where to go? Ofcourse China town!but with so many restaurants, I relied on yelp looking for a good place with great reviews so I end up here. However I was kinda disappointed. Why? This is not traditional Chinese food. It looks like it but it isn't. Let me say that the service was great! The noodle it self was good too but the over all cold noodle dish was not good.  Beef noodles soup was a weird bone white broth with slices of braised beef shank. Pot stickers fillings tasted weird...   So the overall experience is that this place seems to be an Americanized Chinese noodle place... it was not appealing to me but hey ... they got great reviews ... so give it a try and let me know! Enjoy!

7cELZ1INJwb4cB7uu2QoBg.text: Delicious noodles!!!  Fresh handmade noodle beats packaged any day. Cute clean place and so reasonable!! I will go back anytime I'm in Vegas.

NU-2s--ASt1mVGLwmK-KKQ.text: The bomb. The dan dan noodles and the Shang soup has such depth in their food - no reason that there is a line to get in each night. It is very quick - so stick around. The place does not disappoint at all

MHEGYKNgXeXLKFF_LWhNRw.text: I came here three days in a row on my last Vegas trip. I never thought I could get such authentic Chinese food outside of NYC and east LA. But this place has probably the best noodles you can get in the U.S. What a gem! They are known for the beef noodles but try other dishes too, everything my friends and I ordered was delicious!

8JHDbLx0HldQGVr9UtQ-7Q.text: We ate here for the first time and it was great! We tried the spicy wonton(not that spicy), beef and onion potstickers, chicken chowmein, and Shang beef noodle. The noodles were great. The broth on the noodle has so much flavor. Our server Steven was so helpful. He refilled our water as soon as it got low and boxed up our soup for us so we didn't spill it. The noodles are enough to share with two people. Also if you do hot tea they give you free refills. They have beer but not a full bar. The pot stickers were good but the wontons were better. Will definitely try it again.

-feEB_BTF4ePvv5MAXGXaQ.text: I ordered cold sesame chicken noodles and wanton soup.  Sesame sauce for the noodles was too salty and the wanton skin could not stay with the wanton filling.

hjIYeaeWv7Sd_aJObReB0A.text: Came here Wednesday a little before lunch time and were the 2nd party in the restaurant. Sarah, the server was very helpful on the recommendations and describing the types of noodles they had. We ordered the Spicy Wonton, the beef brisket with hand pulled noodles, and the chicken and mushroom with hand pulled noodles. The spicy wontons were not that spicy, more on the mild side with just a kick and actually ends on a sweet note. There were about 10 small wontons that came in an order. I thought they would be a bit bigger, judging from the pictures posted on Yelp, but still good as a appetizer. Next up, the beef brisket was so tender and the broth was so flavorful. It was definately one of the best I've ever had. The chicken and mushroom did not have as much flavor as the beef brisket did but I just think it's because of the fact that mushrooms does not have a strong flavor. My dining experience here was great and would definitely come back the next time I'm in Vegas. YUM!

akKheC6mQaTce3B5QzcomQ.text: Let me begin by saying that this restaurant is great. We had two excellent waitresses that really took care of us. One was Miranda and The other was Lupita. Their excellent customer service skills made our dining experience wonderful. The food were all very yummy. I ordered the Shang Beef Noodle and Pot stickers. I highly recommend them. The food prices are very reasonable and the restaurant itself is clean.   I rate this place a SOLID FIVE STAR.

y6P0nmQ-YiVQXYDBY6bq3Q.text: Good traditional Chinese noodle place. The quality of food is comparable to the Noodles Man. I had the chicken chow mien with pulled noodles.

sA3N8BHtn60NywZNX_h4Tw.text: Sierra was a really nice server and came to check up occasionally. The service was quick and the food seemed fresh and were very reasonably priced. There is a good  amount of variety here!

nDlh5y5zmN7WBlG7ZWq3Pg.text: I love the noodle here! Fresh and good texture.  Awesome beef noodle soup. And our waitress was good, always refilling our water and tea. We will be back. Definitely a must try if you haven't been there yet.

yhL3S3p9tr6wQV6w1m_Ewg.text: Perfect, great, just what I wanted.  The Shang Artisan Noodle Shop (I added the "Shop") is the perfect fast-casual restaurant.  It is tasty, clean, bright, open, and engaging.  I've been to many restaurants in China and this brings the best of the region into one menu.  The food is fresh and flavorful.  The noodles are everything one would hope for--especially the Knife Cut noodles.  Most everyone eating there had a connection to China--they all loved this place and were talking about it.  Even though several of the cooks were Mexican, they were well trained and fully committed to providing an authentic bowl of noodles--and really nice guys.  The cooks of Chinese decent "owned" it--you could tell they loved their work and had developed their skills over many many years.  The tea was great and had a unique twist.  I'm always looking at the details--the water was gently infused with lemon and cucumbers-delish!  And finally, the most important component of all--the broth--perfect!  Not too salty, not too strong, full flavor.  I wanted to jump in and swim around a bit, but that wouldn't hav'been appropriate although justified.

FvS_dBpuiWFWOsduJRYYNQ.text: really nice ,home sick,I found the taste of hometown.I think this is the best noodle that I have in las  vegas

s3F20h82CIqo4kTDxZD0Aw.text: I won't change my ratings because I still think the food is great but I recently came back and they had a waitress that was obviously wasted. She knocked over 2 glasses of water on some customers then proceeded to spill my glass on another customer but gave it to me anyway. Then messed up every customers order and took her time too. I saw at least three groups of customers walk out because they waited too long. She also gave my credit card and bill back to another customer which luckily both the other and I were paying attention so I got it back from the other customer right away. It was so bad it was actually amusing to watch.  My point of updating is to help the management out. The manager came in about an hour later and tried to help her waitress (yes she was the only one). But what he should've done was let her go home or fire her because she kept making the situation worse. First impressions and service is super important and you can't afford to lose one customer over a stumbling drunk waitress. You already are understaffed I know but a bad waitress is worse than mediocre food. Your food is not mediocre so ditch the bad waitress and hire better people. Also there were three chefs in the back staring at her because she messed up all the orders. Some customer had to correct her 3 times and then finally just went and told the chef their order. Maybe you don't need 3 chefs when the one waitress they have can't take orders? Seriously they would've done better passing the iPad around and having the customers order their own food. Management, message me if you need more ideas. I want this restaurant to succeed because I do think you guys have a great concept going on.

0v2VhF2P_1qu2DpaLHuHow.text: Ordered the Shang Beef Noodle with hand pulled noodles and spicy wontons. Overall I thought it was good but not great. The bowl came out with the noodles nestled nicely in the bowl with nice big chunks of beef sticking out and three perfectly blanched pieces of baby bok choy. The noodles were nice and chewy with a bite to them, this was the most enjoyable part. The soup was okay, I've had better broth. I expect beef noodle soup to be a bit spicy but there's was not so I had to add a scoop of the chili oil. There could've been more depth to the flavor of the broth too but it was good with nice beef flavor. The spicy wontons were good but nothing very exciting.Several pieces of smallish wontons in a nice briny soy sauce with chili oil and sesame seeds sprinkled on top. I left feeling satisfied so no complaints about the food. Only con would be that they have $10 minimum for credit cards. We were in a group and that made splitting the check a little difficult as we all paid with cards so some items were shifted around to meet their requirements.

wrk6XSu9e4d3iq0_X3GtjA.text: The food is pretty tasty brown or white both are good.  YUMZ X!  The servers are extremely SLOW maybe they need more training ?  Maybe not the menu is pretty short and simple... I think we will get an order to go next time the seating area is small 8 tables and a singles bar top.... Also parking is limited as well... JK KUHL Approved

N7M3DUkh0PYMo_HpIktzuQ.text: The food is authentic and top notch. Flavorful but balanced, with very fresh noodles. During our recent stay we ate here several times, never once disappointed.

9KCTmRl7Q39Sdql5i22fnQ.text: Because of trade show in town, used to eat Yonaka next door, saw this noodle house, then decided to give a try.  Love their beef noodle and spicy wanton.   Tender beef soup with crafted noodle makes excellent combination.  Very Chinese style.  Even the spicy wanton but not very spicy so you can feel the juice within it.

ZTAuefCDRdSxTR9lS-lAeQ.text: Great new find. Very delicious noodle dish, great prices and healthy portion of food. Had the chicken & mushrooms and it was very tasty. I will be back soon to try some of the other dishes.

DJgYbjRhWOh3sL3y_hC9jQ.text: I love it so much that I wish they can open a chain in Boston where I live. a bit far out from the strip if you are in vegas for a vaca (about 10 min taxi ride), but dont let this stop you from hopping on an uber and get yourself there for a nice handmade heart warming noodle soup, you wont disappoint!

xZi00x_wVZn0-a9tEMxTnw.text: Shang noodles were delish! My friend from Shenzhen confirmed that the flavor was spot on. The steamed pork buns were very good too. Glad I was able to stop by.

9-RZ_Tbx21oz6NwtcZUvqg.text: Shang's is a great addition to the Vegas food scene.  I've had the shang beef soup, pork belly soup, beef pancakes and dan dan noodles on multiple visits.  All are very enjoyable.  The staff are very friendly and efficient. At times they are overwhelmed with lots of customers and they do a great job.  Kudos to them.  Overall Shang's is my new favorite Chinese restaurant in Vegas.

WvGFPHFdPDfocU_gW9toVg.text: After reading the reviews, I was excited to try this restaurant.  We ordered the wontons in chili oil, beef noodle soup with hand pulled noodles and the Dan Dan noodles with hand pulled noodles.  The wontons were good but fairly small.  The sauce was great and I added it to the Dan Dan noodles because it was a little bland.  The beef noodle soup was just okay.  The broth was one dimensional and didn't leave a good, warm feeling that I usually get if the broth tastes rich and has been simmering for a long time.  We probably won't return since there are other noodle soup restaurants that are better.

HqA6tMjCJb2pFej1U-BHZQ.text: Their interior decor is really cute and they try to be fancy by giving you cucumber infused water. However, I was not impressed with their dandan mien at all. It did not taste anything like the dandan mien I'm used to and love. At first I thought maybe the server brought me the wrong dish. I asked her if it was dandan mien since it didn't have any peanut taste and she said that it was. Maybe they make dandan mien differently where they came from but I'm not a fan. I also tried some of their Shang beef noodle and it's pretty good but it also tasted a lot like a Taiwanese instant beef noodle cup ramen that I used to have when I was young. They also flipped the potstickers upside down for presentation I suppose but all the precious juices inside flowed out since they either didn't seal them well or punctured them in the flipping process. Other than the dandan mien the food is not bad but I don't think I'll be back.

NWtlyXnMRRfL2CzCK-t6MA.text: Like sheep I watched everyone order the beef pancake becuase it was hyped on Yelp. Me included. Originally I had another noodle place in mind but my invited guest researched and came up with this one instead.  She had the cold chicken noodle ( $8) , I had the Peking Zha-Jiang hand tossed ( 8.50) We got there before the "rush"  and were served sporoctic but not long.  The noodle dishes arrived before the app. Mine was good, a mix of finely chopped veggies lay on top of the noodle. To be honest it was OK, there is a Pho place not far away and the Bon Thit Nuong , a similar dish, is far better, more grilled pork, more flavours and hot and cold in the dish.. My dinner friend added heaping spoons of hot sauce to get hers to the right temp. I have not been to many noodle houses so not much to compare to. My biggest beef is the beef pancakes. They were fat, like mini sliders and full of grease fat inside. 5 hours later I am still burping up the tatste of beef fat.  It is almost a dumpling, but poor executrion filling.  While I was there I watched sevral parties go on Yelp to determine what to order... I find that so wrong. There were a few other items on the menu I would have tried.

LwaMHo5ix_xRGvUu2XkSwA.text: So good! Very attentive wait staff, they make their own noodles in house. For sure my favorite noodle place I've been to. Highly suggest.

gqnsfA-X3Eb8XR6LpZimuQ.text: Okay, 4 star by American standard, 2 star by Chinese standard. So it comes to 3 star. The beef noodles are the best in the restaurant. Don't order pork rib noodles. The ribs are not good, too tough and the soup is too sweet.

8bZMHd0HSMmVpWyhNSa56g.text: I know a great hand shaved noodle, and this place is fantastic on all fronts!  High recommendation!

mEcOJdeiKKXMVYRjF14YkA.text: Great service, reasonable price and really good noodles and wonton soup! Better than LA!

V3bsNfv0kIQIuk8If5M7gg.text: Had a random recommendation from a couple when waiting in a buffet line. Decided to try it late night which was great because there wasn't a long line. The food was sooooo good!  The food is fresh and simple. We ordered extra just to try everything and took some back to our hotel room since we had a kitchenette in our suite. The service was also fantastic. We will return the next time we are back in Vegas.

HdY7qyErprKl0IaBW7VCsg.text: Got the pork rib noodle with hand pulled and the Shang beef with knife cut noodles. Both style noodles were delicious and cooked perfectly. It all depends on preference. I liked the knife cut ones a little better but my mom loves the hand pulled ones. The broth to both dishes was great! Didn't think to ask for chili paste until the table next to us did and it made everything all the better!

zuuB0D-H_wAWpBkrNnhvuQ.text: Decided to try something different and we are so glad we did.  Our waitress was so helpful and made some great suggestions, onion pancakes, chicken & mushrooms and wonton soup and it was delicious.  Very clean restaurant and bathroom was nicely painted. Will go back for sure.

PMnlJ-ttQrt9BTWBr-Wkug.text: Place was nice and decent. We ordered the beef shank hand pulled noodles and Dan Dan  plain noodle, there's really no difference between the 2 noodles in terms of texture. I was expecting the Dan Dan noodles to be thinner. I also ordered the Shang fried rice and it's pretty decent, nothing special about the taste but good enough. Prices are reasonable. Staff were nice and friendly. Make sure to check your bill. We were charged extra for an order that we had cancel right from the start but somehow it wasn't cancel on the bill, we handed our card without checking, after we signed the bill we noticed the extra item on it. It took them awhile to process the refund back. We haven't seen the credit on our statement so far, so hopefully it should be ok.

8rSiDtc7eei2IV-hz53RDQ.text: One word...yum! First visit here and we weren't disappointed. We ordered the Dan Dan with hand pulled noodles and the Chicken and Mushroom, also with hand pulled noodles. Both dishes were fantastic. Excellent service...including bringing this non-chopstick user a fork. Another place on our must go to again list.

B0Lso0aUMyXqn9Lzh9CHMA.text: Best noodles in Vegas. We took the shuttle from the Caesar to the palm and walked here. Totally worth it.

5YGJ2V02BmckcQnVBDnV8g.text: Came here right after going to the day clubs and it was a perfect meal! I got the dan dan noodles and it was a lot spicier than expected. The spice was bearable and a good touch to the noodles but wish I knew before ordering it. Recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dan dan noodle and beef noodle soup

09EIyEJL1AlVHw2RDcZbSA.text: This place has set my noodle standards high! The place is clean, cozy and has some friendly staff.   Spicy wontons were THE BEST! Spicy enough but not too spicy to burn and not enjoy.  Their dan dan noodles were perfect! The flavors complimented each other, the noodles were soft, tender and had just the right enough chewiness to them.

qrcQKhgjJp8q-8jHB70Ymg.text: I am a noodle lover, having hand pulled noodle in Vegas seems like a trend coming from LA area.  This one is no different. However, the taste here are better than the ones that I had in LA area.  Beef noodle is definitely the best dish in house in my opinion.  Tender stewed beef and hand pulled noodle.  Their Jia Jiang noodle is more on salty side but I like it when they serve with edamame.  Spicy wonton is really spicy! be careful.  Beef pancake is tasty too but not salty enough, need to add soy sauce for more flavor.  Great customer services, hope they will keep up the good quality!

Tmgw7UMTJuy50VKyMmSEHQ.text: Shang Artisan Noodle was a very small restaurant and the wait is not too long but there are very, very limited seats.   I went there on a holiday so I knew what to expect. There was a pretty long wait in a small space. So having to stand inside because it is so cold outside is pretty uncomfortable.   We ordered Shang Beef Noodle soup with hand-pulled noodles and Boiled Beef dumplings. The soup was alright, but not the best. I wasn't really jumping out of my seat for the hand-pulled noodles.  I do have to give a shoutout for the homemade dumplings, though. They were amazing and are probably the best thing on the menu.   All in all, I think I would basically only go back for the dumplings. They are awesome and are the one thing that is worth your money.

DfCxhEvpuqDilo6avao0Dg.text: This place is crazy busy but they get the food out quick.. I pre selected what to order before arriving. Put your name on the list, I suggest circling either to the option of table or bar. Doesn't really matter where you sit as the kitchen area is open & you can see the guy pulling the noodles from any seat.   You'll have to control yourself on how much you order because the noodle dishes are big enough to share.   Pork rib noodle soup had great flavor & the meat falls off the bone.. caution should be taken with the ribs as little bone fragments could break a tooth.   Dan-dan noodle dish was spicy.. a spicy level that sneaks up on you.. yet great flavor   Beef pancakes take 15 minutes but is worth the wait and you'll be served your noodle dish in the meantime so no big deal.. hot and juicy   They have bottled beverages and have hot water ready to serve for those who don't want iced.   Last night was freezing in Vegas and due to the lack of enough waiting area space was a bit overcrowded, blocking the doorway in or out..   If this place moved to a different location, it would be ideal to accommodate the many people who want to try it.. perhaps the empty restaurant next door ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Affordable prices
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fall off the bone rib
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork rib noodle soup/ hand pulled noodle

1FNVyJrms01LTCrpAUfyOQ.text: 30 minute wait Xmas Eve Sunday arrived 11:30am and seated at 12pm.   10-15 minute wait Saturday around 1pm. Hand torn noodles are thicker and wider than knife cut noodles. The boiled dumplings and spicy wontons are a great sharable appetizer. Id skip the cold sesame chicken noodles next time and go for their most popular noodle soups. The pork is Rich and fatty and the meat is soft and tender, almost gelatinous. The beef is soothing with a slightly spicy kick. I'll order the pork noodle soup next time cuz I enioyed the texture of the pork belly and just add hot chili from the condiment jar to combat the rich flavor. Clean and modern ambience. A new favorite to nurse hangovers! I still prefer the beef noodle soup at Noodle Pot for the tendon but the dumplings here were better along with the service.

RF8jBSaOXNWsixRnZXcy7w.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Vegas. The waiter are very nice and professional. I grew up with Beef Noodles and this has really lived up to my expectations. The noodles are all handmade and I am able to see one of the chefs making the noodles. The knife shaved noodles are amazing, very chewy and my favorite. The soup is really good and very heart warming. It's a really good comfort food. The Spicy Wonton is delicious too. The skin is really thin and it's pretty much just cooked to perfection. The sauce is good and gives the Wonton a good ting to it. Lastly, the Beef Pancakes are amazing. The soup that's inside is very good and the meat is very juicy. I have been here many times last year, and I came back this year specifically for this restaurant. I will definitely be coming back to this restaurant over the years!

Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Pancakes
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Wonton

UBnuh7Lo_TkoqrV51FTkYQ.text: Shang Artisan Noodle is located in a plaza that is near McDonald's, specifically next door to Sweet Box with parking available.   My husband and I decided to grab a late lunch on Monday, Christmas Eve around 3:45 pm. I walked in and saw a sign in sheet and placed my name on it. Wait time for a table was about 10 minutes and then were seated at a 4 seated table by the window. After looking over the menu, we ended up ordering:  Cucumber Salad, $4.99 prior to tax- refreshing pieces of cucumber pieces, ample amount to share with 2 people. A savory peanut sauce adores the fresh cucumber pieces.   Pork Belly Noodle, $9.95 prior to tax- My husband ordered this, with hand pulled noodles. There was a good amount of tender pieces of beef in this, but he would have liked more. Since my husband was sick I only got a little bit of his food before he took a bite. I thought the hand pulled noodles had a good chew to it and the broth was good. The small bite of pork I got was good.   Chicken Sesame Cold Noodles, $8.75 prior to tax- This large dish is a great portion for 2 people to share. This came with shredded chicken, carrots, cucumber and bean sprouts. The sauce this entree comes with is the same savory peanut sauce that was on the cucumber salad. I picked the noodles to be knife cut because I like really chewy noodles. Mix all the elements together, makes for a very satisfying meal.  Hot Tea, $1.95, prior to tax- For the sick husband. Comes with free refills. ---------------------- (Total= $27.76 after tax, prior to tip)  Overall, a pretty tasty meal. Really could feed another person or 2 so the price is fair with the large portions. This restaurant reminds me of a noodle house back at home called Noodle St (Monrovia and Fullerton, in Southern California) where you can pick your preference of thickness for the noodles.   Great meal options, would come here again.  By the way, there is free WiFi at this restaurant and the employees here speak English and Mandarin. So ordering shouldn't be a problem.  Also the ladies restroom (single toilet) was clean and adequately stocked with the essentials upon this visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Belly Noodle, $9.95 prior to tax

rP4zeSDcujdjEZKA0dLScA.text: I'm a huge fan of hand pulled noodles so I was really excited to try this place out.  We stopped by around 7pm with a party of 7 and was seated after about a 20 minute wait.   The decore was basic, clean, and very typical of decent noodle places. You can see into the kitchen and watch them make noodles, which is always fun.  We got spicy wontons and beef pancakes as appetizers. I strongly recommend the beef pancakes. They were juicy and flavorful. I would get the spicy wontons again if I go back, they were good but unmemorable.  I ordered the seafood knife cut noodles and I tasted all the food the rest of my party ordered so I got a good sense of what I liked here.  As much as I love hand pulled noodles, the knife cut noodles were definitely better. I prefer my noodles chewier and thicker (which is why I ordered hand cut in the first place -- after looking at the noodles on other tables). The hand pulled noodles were okay, I didn't think they were chewy enough and were over cooked for my taste. Someone in my group did find my hand cut noodles too al dente for his preference but conceded that they were overall better.  The seafood noodle broth was plainer than I like, you can taste the pepper but that's about it. I ended up pouring the left over chili oil from the spicy wontons into my soup and that made it way better.  A lot of the noodle dishes tasted fusion instead of authentic but the quality of the hand cut noodles definitely make up for it. I particularly enjoyed the chicken and mushroom noodles because the sauce was very different from the rest of the dishes.  Over all this place definitely satisfied my noodle craving. They use quality ingredients to create a taste that was just a tad bit more Americanized than I expected from an authentic looking Asian noodle place.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Knife cut seafood noodles

ugvWa2l9fIzvCSX2epVRvg.text: Hands down, best hand-pulled noodle I've ever had so far!! Noodle was chewy, sauce was on point, and everything came in together nicely in a bowl of greatness.   Spicy lovers.... brace yourself for a HOT Dan Dan noodle that will indulge your taste buds while rising your spice tolerance to the next level. I'd suggest adding the Spicy Wonton appetizer on top of thay as well. Yes, they are both spicy.   Non-spicy lovers... the pork belly noodle soup is a great option. Be prepared for an awesome broth to accompany your juicy pork belly and amazing hand-pulled noodle.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy wonton
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dan dan noodle
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly noodle

vE4qO-cEa-vm_EaOgT1gLg.text: The best beef noodle soup I've had thus far in my life.   Shang noodle soup ($9.95) - please do yourself a favor and order it with knife shaved noodles!!! So so good. The noodles are chewy, perfectly cooked, and go so well with the soup. The soup was also very delicious. The broth was very flavorful and not too salty or oily. The meat was the only downfall as it was very chewy and hard to get through. But seriously get this!!  Dan Dan noodles ($8.95) - I got these with hand pulled noodles. I really liked the texture of the noodles. They were also cooked to perfection. However the sauce was a little disappointing and lacked flavor. It was very low key.   Spicy wontons ($5.95) - just ok. Don't think I'd order it again.   Service - was awesome!!! Everyone is super nice   There is a waitlist but the wait isn't too bad (at least not when I went on Thursday around 4ish)

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef noodle soup with knife shaved noodles

rMFuq5gJ69l0SIxj9uOcAg.text: A random Lyft driver recommended Shang Artisan Noodle to me while I was in town, and I was not disappointed. When I walked in, I was greeted by a view of one of their chefs animatedly working on preparing hand-pulled noodles, a show that would repeat in the background throughout the visit. It was quite mesmerizing to watch, and provided some entertainment for the wait (which in my case wasn't too bad, but I think my party got there just on time because as soon as we were seated, a line began to form outside).  I ordered their signature dish, the Shang Beef Noodle with hand-pulled noodles--I didn't want waste the chef's efforts--and it easily lived up to the hype! The noodles were perfect, and the beef and broth were both delicious. But my favorite part of the experience was a side order of spicy wontons! These were really special; the flavor was incredible, and the level of spiciness was just right for my tastes. I also got to try the cucumber salad, which was flavored with a pleasant sesame sauce.  All in all, the food was wonderful, and unlike many of the usual options in Las Vegas, Shang Artisan Noodle is not overpriced. To the contrary, their prices are downright reasonable! It ended up being the least expensive and most enjoyable meal of my entire Vegas trip! It just goes to show that you don't have to spend a ton of money to have an amazing dining experience in Las Vegas if you know where to go. Give Shang Artisan Noodle a try!

COLR2XjJxe9WiS0-Mtnlog.text: There is something so special about hand pulled noodles.  YUM.  Found this gem off the strip in Las Vegas.  It was nice to have a car so we can try a few new spots.  Be prepared for a wait, because obviously this place is delicious.  We got there around 11 and probably didn't get sat til 12, but it was also because of our large party.  I felt like I ordered everything I possibly could bc everything looked so good.  Spicy noodles, Dan Dan noodles, and also their signature Shang Beef noodles with knife cut noodles.  Keep in mind, there's definitely a spice kick if you see that pepper sign on there.  I have quite a tolerance, so it was a bit on the spicier side for me, but still SO SO GOOD.  Definitely a must stop when I'm in Vegas now.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yuEQyeXCgfgz_mueF74ZYA.text: My first meal in Vegas and it was on point.  I'm a sucker for good bowl of beef noodle soup and this one was delicious. Hand pulled noodles with a super rich beef broth.   Also, had the spicy won tons which were also delish.   Will return soon.

To8z5Jl-K4vuqtBFpXbKVA.text: Love this place! Visiting Vegas from Florida and we unfortunately don't have a restaurant like this in my area. Upon walking in, you're welcomed into an average-sized seating area with a bar where you can watch the chefs hand pull the noodles. Definitely try to sit near the bar because it's very amusing watching them hand pull the noodles they make for you!  My boyfriend and I ordered the spicy wontons and hand-pulled shang beef noodle. The wontons were so delicious and were nice to snack on while we waited for our noodles. We each ordered a bowl of the shang beef noodles, but my boyfriend ordered and extra side of noodles. In retrospect, we probably wouldn't have ordered the extra noodles because the serving they give you is more than enough.  Our waitress was excellent and food was amazing! Definitely satisfied my soup cravings for the day.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hand-pulled Shang beef noodles!
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy wontons

P5AYvs3lEwfiNxu0ibll-w.text: A very authentic Chinese cuisine that make you feel you are dining in a quaint little eatery in Beijing, surrounded by the towns people.

Tx_f8VtHmdFw1aH2Iiw-Iw.text: First of all, the hostess who takes names should be praised indefinitely for her ability to handle customers. :) she was so graceful and truthful to everyone about times and waits and EXTREMELY accommodating to this rowdy group of 13. I went on a Friday night around 7:30 and it was packed. The waiting list was long. Waited for about an hour but it was worth it!   It's a small shop where you can watch the people make the noodles. So it's a fun date area if you go off peak hours where the wait time is shorter.   For an appetizer, I ordered the beef pancake. I ordered Dan dan noodles with knife shaved noodles and also the Shang beef noodle soup with hand pulled noodles.   I definitely recommend the hand pulled noodles unless you like very thick noodles (like knife shaved).  The portions and prices were fitting.   For the beef pancakes, learn from my mistake and use the knife to cut it into halves before you eat it lol. Or you will get an explosion on the opposite end of where you Bit into. I obviously didn't learn my lesson because it exploded twice on me but I smelled deliciously like soup after.   I preferred the Shang beef soup noodle over the Dan Dan noodles, which I felt were a little dry. The Shang beef was delicious!!!!! So flavorful and rich.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shang beef noodle with hand pulled noodle
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef pancakes (comes in 4)
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dan Dan noodles with knife shaved noodles

8JlHzdOJPc9U5QkAjXORXA.text: Artisan noodles you will have here and you can select to have them hand-pulled, knife-shaved, or plain. I think the hand-pulled noodles are definitely their specialty and is a must here. The kitchen is open and you can see someone hand-pulling them near a viewing window situated right at the bar seating.  I came for an early dinner at 5pm, so I experienced absolutely no wait. I ordered a *Beef Shank Noodle* soup with hand-pulled noodles and added some wontons to the soup along with *pork and cabbage boiled dumplings* on the side. Broth to the soup was quite hearty, not too oily, and maybe a little too salty for my liking. Still enjoyable nonetheless! Noodles were perfection and they give you SO much of it. Beef shank pieces were also plentiful and ultra tender. The bok choy that comes in the soup were crunchy and well cooked. Wontons were larger than I was expecting for this type of establishment and were so well wrapped. The dumplings surprisingly stayed together pretty well even though they were boiled. Yummy and scrumptious especially with the vinegary soy sauce they recommend to have them with.   This certainly was a delicious, hassle-free meal to have off the Strip. I was traveling solo, so I appreciate that Vegas has other good eats that are more accessible.

photos.caption: Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boiled pork dumplings ($5.99)
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hand pulled noodles, yuuum
Photo of Shang Artisan Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wontons are decently sized

XlkggzMx0Uyne9Vir-RnWQ.text: It was so good! Beyond my expectations!  My husband and I came here for lunch. I had the pork rib and knife-cut noodle soup, and he had the pork belly noodle soup. The texture of my noodles was perfect - a tad chewy. I LOVED the broth, it wasn't greasy. We also had panfried dumplings.   We would come back again.

I also ordered the spicy wontons and these were definitely my favorite nice and spicy not over the top hot and great flavor I even added the sauce to my Dan  Dan noodles and it made it that much better. Very cool spot I will definitely be back wish they had a spot like this in San Diego! Very friendly, small but cool spot. I highly suggest this spot to anyone looking for authentic flavors.

-uINTBYmN0m1U920VIE_Bg.text: First time at Shang and I thought it was a good experience. I went with some friends in the afternoon lunch time and it was fairly busy, but we got a seat at the bar so we weren't sad about that. Personally, I like bar seats especially if I get to see the chef at work. It's like a little show while you enjoy your meal. Since I was feeling a bit under the weather the day I came in, I decided to order something clean and light. I order the wonton soup and added extra wontons ($2) and bok choy and no noodles. The service was fairly quick and portions were sufficient. I definitely was full from my soup!   The wonton soup broth was clean and delicious. Very flavorful. The wontons had good enough filling and seasoned well. I will come again to try their other soup noodle dishes.

IuLjW3VZbXMrxZt9GE4tmw.text: I just discovered this noodle place near my house. I decided to try it for a casual birthday dinner, and it was delicious! The service was great (very friendly waiters) and the atmospehere was welcoming and tranquil with modern decor. It's rather small inside (maybe 4 or 5 small tables and a row of stools at the counter), so it's not ideal for large groups. I got the spicy wontons as a starter and the chicken and mishroom noodles as my main meal. Both were excellent! Everyone in my family enjoyed their meal. I especially loved the chicken and mushroom dish  The portions were great (everyone took a doggy bag!), and the prices were low. I'll definitely go back! The only reason behind the "4" score is because I've had some outstanding noodles elsewhere (especially in NYC) that really nailed it on flavor. But this is a great spot in Vegas!

3WNlRGPStfj9SSubWB7pEQ.text: For my quick stint in Vegas, this was the place I was most excited to try.  A handmade noodle place in Vegas serving beef noodle soup?  I couldn't wait!  We arrived at around 11:30am and waited for 15 minutes for seats at the bar.  We had a perfect view for the noodles being made and the potstickers being wrapped.  We started with the spicy wontons, which were pretty average.  They're exactly as you'd expect them to be.  I actually would have preferred if they were a bit more spicy.  We also got the beef pancakes, which are essentially "sheng jian bao", except a little flatter.  An order comes with four and each one was generous in filling.  They were fried to a nice golden brown.  The strange thing was that the order came with a knife and the waitress said to cut them in half to let the juice out since otherwise it'll squirt out as you bite it.  I disagree.  The whole point is to eat this juicy pan-fried bun and not let the greasy goodness end up on the plate.  Eat these like you would a xiao long bao.  Hold it in your spoon, bite the top open, suck out the broth, and keep eating.  For noodles, we went with the Shang's beef noodle and the pork belly noodle, both with knife-shaved noodles.  Both were good, but the beef noodle was the better of the two.  The broth was so complex and rich, with a great beefy flavor.  The braised beef brisket was tender and plentiful.  The pork belly noodle broth was a bit muddled and required some hot oil to "brighten" it up a bit.  The noodles were delicious, with a really nice texture to them.  We also got the zha-jiang noodle which was, surprisingly, my favorite dish today.  It came with carrots, cucumber, and edamame to mix with the nice rich sauce.  We went with the hand-pulled noodles this time and they were so perfectly "QQ".  The staff were all really friendly.  There was a huge line waiting outside, but you never felt rushed.  They were attentive and often asked how we were doing or if we needed more hot water for our tea.  The MVP of this place was the guy making the noodle.  He's a beast in the kitchen.  He went between pulling noodles, shaving noodles, warming up bowls, portioning noodles, and helping on the finishing line.  He was constantly busy and was the reason food was coming out of the kitchen so quickly and consistently.  Why 4 stars instead of 5?  I'd like the knife-shaved noodles to be a bit broader and a bit thicker.  The noodles were great at the start, but quickly got a bit soggy.  I usually prefer knife-shaved noodles to hand-pulled because knife-shaved noodles are thick enough to not get soggy.  Unfortunately that wasn't the case here.

Not sure if I mentioned the chow mien....#onpoint.

qkzd5gC-ytITpinHA-oexw.text: Came on a Saturday night and this small restaurant was rightfully packed. We didn't have to wait an unreasonably long time and plus there's a boba place next door so there was something to do while we waited. When we put our name on the waitlist, another customer overheard us talking about the food and let us know we absolutely HAD to order the spicy wontons. Once we were sat, we ordered those, beef and onion pot stickers, cucumber salad, pork belly noodles, and beef shank noodles. I did not personally try the spicy wontons but everyone else absolutely loved them. Another definite standout was the cucumber salad; I would absolutely come back to order this again. The noodles were good but very filling and I wish it had something other than just meat and bok choy, maybe some other vegetables or an egg? Overall our meal was good and it was very modestly priced especially considering the noodles and the portion we got.

NYprlGBQHW9xN1O1BZIbZA.text: Solid tasty but nothing super amazing. Another reviewer said it's like noodle street in LA/OC. Id agree with that. Got the spicy wontons (happy we did), Shang beef noodle soup with knife shaved noodles (ok/good/solid), and beef pancakes (ok)..

QJJYQrMZXn4z4dvSqcyxrQ.text: Went for a late lunch with my wife. The wait was about 30 minutes at about 1:30 on a Saturday afternoon.   The menu is pretty straightforward. The hard choice is determine what you want as it all seems good.   Our food came out in just a few minutes, but it was obviously made to order. The portion sizes are generous so we had a bit to take home.   It was our first time here and we will be back. The reviews on this place are dead on v

4JsN_st3pZxLlHiSSJ3LOA.text: What a perfect little noodle resturant gem! Its pretty small in here,but that doesnt stop people from cramming in to get on the waiting list for delicious noodles! I came here on a Sunday afternoon with a friend right when they opened and it was already packed! It slowed down after 1pm. They have a cool set up with a L-shaped bar where you can watch the chefs cook and hand make the noodles behind the glass.  We ordered the popular meat cakes and it did not disappoint! The breading was just right, with juicy meat inside, very filling. Totally worth it to order! Ordered the pork dumplings, and it had a thick dough exterior. The pork inside was good but the dumpling could of been hotter (as in heat). This was the only miss for me. Beef noodle soup was great! Tasty broth, and very tender beef that was just as flavorful. I will be again to try the other noodle soups!

78BtxPPQx2DAU2QECT_fQw.text: Loved this place! My friends and I went after an event we traveled for was cancelled so we decided to drown our sorrows in noodles. So glad we did! I got the Shang Noodles and it was everything I could have hoped for. The broth was rich and flavorful, the noodles delicious, and the meat nice and tender. It was also so large I couldn't finish it (sadly) and I couldn't take it with me because I was flying out early the next day. But I still crave it and will definitely go back next time I'm in town.   My other friend got the Dan Dan noodles, which he demolished but the rest of us couldn't handle the spice. So be warned, it definitely brings the heat!

yWhIer0rMyzZVPMAPQVRSg.text: Overall: Shang Artisan Noodle doesn't make noodle dishes any better than the next restaurant over, but I definitely recommend coming here if you want to see noodle-making in action.  Food: 4  Pork Rib Noodles with Knife Shaved Noodles: The ribs were cooked perfectly. They had the right amount of seasoning and were super tender. I wasn't a fan of the broth. Because it's supposed to be a chicken and pork based broth, I thought it would be lighter, but it was as dark and heavy as traditional beef noodle soup.  Chicken Chow Mein with Hand Pulled Noodles: The dish was a tad too oily and salty, but it was pretty tasty. The chicken wasn't dry and it had great flavors.  * Note: Knife shaved noodles are thicker and chewier than hand pulled noodles.  Service: 4  The servers were really nice, attentive, and super patient with all of our questions. Food came out pretty fast too.  Ambiance: 5  The restaurant is located in a small strip mall, and there's plenty of parking. Although the strip mall is not the nicest looking, the restaurant is very nice on the inside. It's modern, well-lit, and clean. Customers have the choice to sit at the counter or table, but all seats will afford some view of the open kitchen. If you really want to see the cooks in action and noodles being made, I definitely recommend sitting at the counter!

uA7abHnxZa3J1jANXPhutA.text: I have to say, this place really exceeded my expectations. I saw the pictures and read some reviews, but didn't expect it to be this nice inside and the food to be as good as it was.  Decor-first off, the location is away from the strip, which is nice and mellow. The restaurant is very insignificant looking from the outside, but inside it's very clean and modern. You can see into the kitchen to watch your meal being prepared and watch the chef make the noodles by hand, which is pretty cool.  Service-very good service, you keep your drinks full and continually ask if you need anything else. All they're employees seem to like working there, I guess that's why it's so good.  Food-It was fantastic! The pot stickers were amazing to start with, become of this flower shaped looking thing with crispiness on the bottom and nice to see me on the inside. The spicy Won Ton's were also very good and very well-made. They had just the right amount of spice and acidity, and the meat and the inside was awesome perfectly seasoned and cooked. Shang's Beef Noodle really hit the spot for me. I wasn't feeling too well and the hot broth with beef and noodle really hit the spot.   I really enjoy dining here, and look forward to coming back.
